"[106-isabella]

" Betray [you]77-catherine ! What do [you]77-catherine mean ? "[106-isabella]

" Nay , do not distress [me]106-isabella . [I]106-isabella believe [I]106-isabella have said too much . Let [us]2270-us drop the subject . "[106-isabella]

[Catherine]77-catherine , in some amazement , complied , and after remaining a few moments silent , was on the point of reverting to what interested [her]77-catherine at that time rather more than anything else in [the world]197-the world , [[Laurentina]114-laurentina s skeleton]519-laurentina s skeleton , when [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend prevented [her]77-catherine , by saying , " For heaven s sake ! [They]2272-two odious young men will hardly follow [us]2270-us there . "[313-her friend]

Away [they]521-they walked to the book ; and while [Isabella]106-isabella examined the names , it was [Catherine]77-catherine s employment to watch the proceedings of [these alarming young men]522-these alarming young men .

" [They]2272-two odious young men are not coming this way , are [they]2272-two odious young men ? "[522-these alarming young men]

In a few moments [Catherine]77-catherine , with unaffected pleasure , assured [her]106-isabella that [she]77-catherine need not be longer uneasy , as [the gentlemen]2130-the gentlemen had just left [the pump - room]364-the pump - room .

" And which way are [they]2272-two odious young men gone ? "[106-isabella] said [Isabella]106-isabella , turning hastily round . " [One]2210-one was [a very good - looking young man]2275-a very good - looking young man . "[106-isabella]

" [They]2272-two odious young men went towards [the church - yard]2276-the church - yard . "[77-catherine]

" Well , [I]106-isabella am amazingly glad [I]106-isabella have got rid of [them]2272-two odious young men ! And now , what say [you]77-catherine to going to [Edgar s Buildings]2277-edgar s buildings with [me]106-isabella , and looking at [my]106-isabella new hat ? [Catherine]77-catherine readily agreed . " Only , "[77-catherine] [she]77-catherine added , " perhaps [we]2278-we may overtake [the two young men]357-the two young men . "[77-catherine]

" Oh ! Never mind that . If [we]2278-we make haste , [we]2278-we shall pass by [them]357-the two young men presently , and [I]106-isabella am dying to show [you]77-catherine [my]106-isabella hat . "[106-isabella]

" But if [we]2278-we only wait a few minutes , there will be no danger of [our]2278-we seeing [them]357-the two young men at all . "[77-catherine]

" [I]106-isabella shall not pay [them]357-the two young men any such compliment , [I]106-isabella assure [you]77-catherine . [I]106-isabella have no notion of treating [men]2187-men with such respect . _ That _ is the way to spoil [them]357-the two young men . "[106-isabella]

[Catherine]77-catherine had nothing to oppose against such reasoning ; and therefore , to show the independence of [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe , and [her]101-miss thorpe resolution of humbling [the sex]525-the sex , [they]526-they set off immediately as fast as [they]526-they could walk , in pursuit of [the two young men]357-the two young men .

CHAPTER 7

Half a minute conducted [them]526-they through [the pump - yard]528-the pump - yard to the archway , opposite [Union Passage]23-union passage ; but here [they]526-they were stopped . [Everybody acquainted with Bath]529-everybody acquainted with bath may remember the difficulties of crossing [Cheap Street]24-cheap street at this point ; it is indeed [a street of so impertinent a nature]530-a street of so impertinent a nature , so unfortunately connected with the great [London]12-london and [Oxford]10-oxford roads , and [the principal inn of [the city]532-the city]531-the principal inn of the city , that a day never passes in which parties of [ladies]2179-ladies , however important [their]526-they business , whether in quest of pastry , millinery , or even ( as in the present case ) of [young men]534-young men , are not detained on one side or other by [carriages]535-carriages , [horsemen]536-horsemen , or [carts]537-carts . This evil had been felt and lamented , at least three times a day , by [Isabella]106-isabella since [[her]106-isabella residence in [Bath]5-bath]538-her residence in bath ; and [she]106-isabella was now fated to feel and lament it once more , for at the very moment of coming opposite to [Union Passage]23-union passage , and within view of [the two gentlemen who were proceeding through the crowds]539-the two gentlemen who were proceeding through the crowds , and threading the gutters of [that interesting alley]540-that interesting alley , [they]539-the two gentlemen who were proceeding through the crowds were prevented crossing by the approach of [a gig]541-a gig , driven along on bad pavement by [a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of [himself]542-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse , [[his]542-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse companion]543-his companion , and [his]542-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse horse]542-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse .

" Oh , [these odious gigs]2281-these odious gigs ! "[106-isabella] said [Isabella]106-isabella , looking up . " How [I]106-isabella detest them . "[106-isabella] But this detestation , though so just , was of short duration , for [she]106-isabella looked again and exclaimed , " Delightful ! [Mr. Morland]108-james and [[my]106-isabella brother]2282-my brother ! "[106-isabella]

" Good heaven ! Tis [James]108-james ! "[106-isabella] was uttered at the same moment by [Catherine]77-catherine ; and , on catching [the young men]544-the young men s eyes , the horse was immediately checked with a violence which almost threw [him]542-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse on [his]542-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse haunches , and [the servant]545-the servant having now scampered up , [the gentlemen]2130-the gentlemen jumped out , and the equipage was delivered to [his]542-a most knowing - looking coachman with all the vehemence that could most fitly endanger the lives of himself , his companion , and his horse care .

[Catherine]77-catherine , by whom this meeting was wholly unexpected , received [[her]77-catherine brother]2221-her brother with the liveliest pleasure ; and [he]2221-her brother , being of a very amiable disposition , and sincerely attached to [her]77-catherine , gave every proof on [his]2221-her brother side of equal satisfaction , which [he]2221-her brother could have leisure to do , while the bright eyes of [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe were incessantly challenging [his]2221-her brother notice ; and to [her]77-catherine [his]2221-her brother devoirs were speedily paid , with a mixture of joy and embarrassment which might have informed [Catherine]77-catherine , had [she]77-catherine been more expert in the development of [other people]229-other people s feelings , and less simply engrossed by [her]77-catherine own , that [[her]77-catherine brother]2221-her brother thought [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend quite as pretty as [she]77-catherine could do [herself]77-catherine .

[John Thorpe]103-john , who in the meantime had been giving orders about the horses , soon joined [them]551-them , and from [him]2221-her brother [she]77-catherine directly received the amends which were [her]77-catherine due ; for while [he]2221-her brother slightly and carelessly touched the hand of [Isabella]106-isabella , on [her]77-catherine [he]2221-her brother bestowed a whole scrape and half a short bow . [He]2221-her brother was [a stout young man of middling height , who , with a plain face and ungraceful form]552-a stout young man of middling height , who , with a plain face and ungraceful form , seemed fearful of being too handsome unless [he]2221-her brother wore the dress of [a groom]553-a groom , and too much like [a gentleman]389-a gentleman unless [he]2221-her brother were easy where [he]2221-her brother ought to be civil , and impudent where [he]2221-her brother might be allowed to be easy . [He]2221-her brother took out [his]2221-her brother watch : " How long do [you]77-catherine think [we]2283-we have been running it from [Tetbury]25-tetbury , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland ? "[2221-her brother]

" [I]2221-her brother do not know the distance . "[2221-her brother] [[Her]77-catherine brother]2221-her brother told [her]77-catherine that it was twenty - three miles .

" _ Three_-and - twenty ! "[101-miss thorpe] cried [Thorpe]101-miss thorpe , " five - and - twenty if it is an inch . "[101-miss thorpe] [Morland]90-miss morland remonstrated , pleaded the authority of road - books , [innkeepers]556-innkeepers , and milestones ; but [[his]2221-her brother friend]557-his friend disregarded them all ; [he]2221-her brother had a surer test of distance . " [I]2221-her brother know it must be five - and - twenty , "[2221-her brother] said [he]2221-her brother , " by the time [we]2283-we have been doing it . It is now half after one ; [we]2283-we drove out of [the inn - yard]2284-the inn - yard at [Tetbury]25-tetbury as the town clock struck eleven ; and [I]2221-her brother defy [any man in [England]2-england]2285-any man in england to make [my]2221-her brother horse go less than ten miles an hour in harness ; that makes it exactly twenty - five . "[2221-her brother]

" [You]90-miss morland have lost an hour , "[90-miss morland] said [Morland]90-miss morland ; " it was only ten o clock when [we]2283-we came from [Tetbury]25-tetbury . "[90-miss morland]

" Ten o clock ! It was eleven , upon [my]2221-her brother soul ! [I]2221-her brother counted every stroke . [This brother of yours]2286-this brother of yours would persuade [me]2221-her brother out of [my]2221-her brother senses , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland ; do but look at [my]2221-her brother horse ; did [you]90-miss morland ever see an animal so made for speed in [your]90-miss morland life ? "[2221-her brother] ( [The servant]545-the servant had just mounted [the carriage]559-the carriage and was driving off . ) " Such true blood ! Three hours and and a half indeed coming only three and twenty miles ! Look at that creature , and suppose it possible if [you]90-miss morland can . "[2221-her brother]

" [He]2287-he _ does _ look very hot , to be sure . "[2221-her brother]

" Hot ! [He]2287-he had not turned a hair till [we]2283-we came to [Walcot Church]26-walcot church ; but look at [his]2287-he forehand ; look at [his]2287-he loins ; only see how [he]2287-he moves ; [that horse _]2288-that horse _ can not _ go less than ten miles an hour : tie [his]2287-he legs and [he]2287-he will get on . What do [you]90-miss morland think of [my]2221-her brother gig , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland ? A neat one , is not it ? Well hung ; [town - built]2289-town - built ; [I]2221-her brother have not had it a month . [It]2287-he was built for [a Christchurch man]2290-a christchurch man , [a friend of [mine]2221-her brother]2291-a friend of mine , [a very good sort of fellow]2292-a very good sort of fellow ; [he]2290-a christchurch man ran [it]2287-he a few weeks , till , [I]2221-her brother believe , it was convenient to have done with it . [I]2221-her brother happened just then to be looking out for some light thing of the kind , though [I]2221-her brother had pretty well determined on a curricle too ; but [I]2221-her brother chanced to meet [him]2290-a christchurch man on [Magdalen Bridge]27-magdalen bridge , as [he]2290-a christchurch man was driving into [Oxford]10-oxford , last term : Ah ! [D]118-d , said [I]2221-her brother ; [I]2221-her brother am [[your]118-d man]2293-your man ; what do [you]118-d ask ? " [I]2221-her brother am sure [I]2221-her brother can not guess at all . "[2221-her brother]

" [Curricle]119-curricle - hung , [you]118-d see ; seat , trunk , sword - case , splashing - board , lamps , silver moulding , all [you]118-d see complete ; the iron - work as good as new , or better . [He]2290-a christchurch man asked fifty guineas ; [I]2221-her brother closed with [him]2290-a christchurch man directly , threw down the money , and [the carriage]559-the carriage was [mine]2221-her brother . "[2221-her brother]

" And [I]77-catherine am sure , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , " [I]77-catherine know so little of such things that [I]77-catherine can not judge whether it was cheap or dear . "[77-catherine]

" Neither one nor [t other]2295-t other ; [I]560-the young ladies might have got it for less , [I]560-the young ladies dare say ; but [I]560-the young ladies hate haggling , and poor [Freeman]120-freeman wanted cash . "[560-the young ladies]

" That was very good - natured of [you]560-the young ladies , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , quite pleased .

" Oh ! D it , when [one]2210-one has the means of doing a kind thing by [a friend]449-a friend , [I]560-the young ladies hate to be pitiful . "[560-the young ladies]

An inquiry now took place into the intended movements of [the young ladies]560-the young ladies ; and , on finding whither [they]560-the young ladies were going , it was decided that [the gentlemen]2130-the gentlemen should accompany [them]560-the young ladies to [Edgar s Buildings]28-edgar s buildings , and pay [their]2130-the gentlemen respects to [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe . [James]108-james and [Isabella]106-isabella led the way ; and so well satisfied was [the latter]562-the latter with [her]102-mrs. thorpe lot , so contentedly was [she]102-mrs. thorpe endeavouring to ensure a pleasant walk to [him]563-him who brought the double recommendation of being [[her]102-mrs. thorpe brother s friend]564-her brother s friend , and [[her]102-mrs. thorpe friend s brother]565-her friend s brother , so pure and uncoquettish were [her]102-mrs. thorpe feelings , that , though [they]560-the young ladies overtook and passed [the two offending young men]566-the two offending young men in [Milsom Street]15-milsom street , [she]102-mrs. thorpe was so far from seeking to attract [their]566-the two offending young men notice , that [she]102-mrs. thorpe looked back at [them]566-the two offending young men only three times .

[John Thorpe]103-john kept of course with [Catherine]77-catherine , and , after a few minutes silence , renewed the conversation about [his]103-john gig . " [You]77-catherine will find , however , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , it would be reckoned a cheap thing by [some people]2298-some people , for [I]103-john might have sold it for ten guineas more the next day ; [Jackson]121-jackson , of [Oriel]29-oriel , bid [me]103-john sixty at once ; [Morland]90-miss morland was with [me]103-john at the time . "[103-john]

" Yes , "[90-miss morland] said [Morland]90-miss morland , who overheard this ; " but [you]77-catherine forget that [your]77-catherine horse was included . "[90-miss morland]

" [My]103-john horse ! Oh , d it ! [I]103-john would not sell [my]103-john horse for a hundred . Are [you]77-catherine fond of [an open carriage]2299-an open carriage , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland ? "[103-john]

" Yes , very ; [I]90-miss morland have hardly ever an opportunity of being in one ; but [I]90-miss morland am particularly fond of it . "[90-miss morland]

" [I]103-john am glad of it ; [I]103-john will drive [you]77-catherine out in [mine]103-john every day . "[103-john]

" Thank [you]77-catherine , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , in some distress , from a doubt of the propriety of accepting such an offer .

" [I]103-john will drive [you]77-catherine up [Lansdown Hill]30-lansdown hill tomorrow . "[103-john]

" Thank [you]77-catherine ; but will not [your]77-catherine horse want rest ? "[90-miss morland]

" Rest ! [He]2300-he has only come three and twenty miles today ; all nonsense ; nothing ruins horses so much as rest ; nothing knocks [them]2300-he up so soon . No , no ; [I]103-john shall exercise mine at the average of four hours every day while [I]103-john am [here]2128-here . "[103-john]

" Shall [you]77-catherine indeed ! "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine very seriously . " That will be forty miles a day . "[77-catherine]

" Forty ! Aye , fifty , for what [I]103-john care . Well , [I]103-john will drive [you]77-catherine up [Lansdown]31-lansdown tomorrow ; mind , [I]103-john am engaged . "[103-john]

" How delightful that will be ! "[106-isabella] cried [Isabella]106-isabella , turning round . " [[My]106-isabella dearest]2226-my dearest [Catherine]77-catherine , [I]106-isabella quite envy [you]77-catherine ; but [I]106-isabella am afraid , [brother]2303-brother , [you]77-catherine will not have room for a third . "[106-isabella]

" A third indeed ! No , no ; [I]567-the other two did not come to [Bath]5-bath to drive [[my]567-the other two sisters]2304-my sisters about ; that would be a good joke , faith ! [Morland]77-catherine must take care of [you]77-catherine . "[567-the other two]

This brought on a dialogue of civilities between [the other two]567-the other two ; but [Catherine]77-catherine heard neither the particulars nor the result . [Her]77-catherine companion s discourse now sunk from its hitherto animated pitch to nothing more than a short decisive sentence of praise or condemnation on the face of [every woman [they]569-they met]568-every woman they met ; and [Catherine]77-catherine , after listening and agreeing as long as [she]77-catherine could , with all the civility and deference of [the youthful female mind]570-the youthful female mind , fearful of hazarding an opinion of its own in opposition to that of [a self - assured man]571-a self - assured man , especially where the beauty of [her]77-catherine own sex is concerned , ventured at length to vary the subject by a question which had been long uppermost in [her]77-catherine thoughts ; it was , " Have [you]571-a self - assured man ever read [Udolpho]113-udolpho , [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe ? "[77-catherine]

" [Udolpho]113-udolpho ! Oh , [Lord]2305-lord ! Not [I]77-catherine ; [I]77-catherine never read novels ; [I]77-catherine have something else to do . "[77-catherine]

[Catherine]77-catherine , humbled and ashamed , was going to apologize for [her]77-catherine question , but [he]571-a self - assured man prevented [her]77-catherine by saying , " Novels are all so full of nonsense and stuff ; there has not been a tolerably decent one come out since [Tom Jones]123-tom jones , except [The Monk]124-the monk ; [I]571-a self - assured man read that t other day ; but as for all the others , they are the stupidest things in creation . "[571-a self - assured man]

" [I]77-catherine think [you]77-catherine must like [Udolpho]113-udolpho , if [you]77-catherine were to read it ; it is so very interesting . "[77-catherine]

" Not [I]571-a self - assured man , faith ! No , if [I]571-a self - assured man read any , it shall be [Mrs. Radcliffe]125-mrs. radcliffe s ; [her]125-mrs. radcliffe novels are amusing enough ; they are worth reading ; some fun and nature in _ them _ . "[571-a self - assured man]

" Udolpho was written by [Mrs. Radcliffe]125-mrs. radcliffe , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , with some hesitation , from the fear of mortifying [him]571-a self - assured man .

" No sure ; was it ? Aye , [I]571-a self - assured man remember , so it was ; [I]571-a self - assured man was thinking of that other stupid book , written by [that woman [they]2307-they make such a fuss about , [she]2306-that woman they make such a fuss about , she who married the french emigrant who married [the French emigrant]2308-the french emigrant]2306-that woman they make such a fuss about , she who married the french emigrant . "[571-a self - assured man]

" [I]571-a self - assured man suppose [you]571-a self - assured man mean [Camilla]111-camilla ? "[571-a self - assured man]

" Yes , that s the book ; such unnatural stuff ! [An old man playing at see - saw]2309-an old man playing at see - saw , [I]571-a self - assured man took up the first volume once and looked it over , but [I]571-a self - assured man soon found it would not do ; indeed [I]571-a self - assured man guessed what sort of stuff it must be before [I]571-a self - assured man saw it : as soon as [I]571-a self - assured man heard [she]125-mrs. radcliffe had married [an emigrant]2310-an emigrant , [I]571-a self - assured man was sure [I]571-a self - assured man should never be able to get through it . "[571-a self - assured man]

" [I]571-a self - assured man have never read it . "[571-a self - assured man]

" [You]77-catherine had no loss , [I]571-a self - assured man assure [you]77-catherine ; it is the horridest nonsense [you]77-catherine can imagine ; there is nothing in [the world]197-the world in it but [an old man]2312-an old man s playing at see - saw and learning Latin ; upon [my]571-a self - assured man soul there is not . "[571-a self - assured man]

This critique , the justness of which was unfortunately lost on poor [Catherine]77-catherine , brought [them]572-them to the door of [[Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe s lodgings]573-mrs. thorpe s lodgings , and the feelings of [the discerning and unprejudiced reader of [Camilla]111-camilla]574-the discerning and unprejudiced reader of camilla gave way to the feelings of [the dutiful and affectionate son]575-the dutiful and affectionate son , as [they]572-them met [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe , who had descried [them]572-them from above , in [the passage]576-the passage . " Ah , [Mother]126-mother ! How do [you]102-mrs. thorpe do ? "[577-he] said [he]577-he , giving [her]102-mrs. thorpe a hearty shake of the hand . " Where did [you]102-mrs. thorpe get that quiz of a hat ? It makes [you]102-mrs. thorpe look like [an old witch]2313-an old witch . Here is [Morland]77-catherine and [I]577-he come to stay a few days with [you]102-mrs. thorpe , so [you]102-mrs. thorpe must look out for a couple of good beds somewhere near . "[577-he] And this address seemed to satisfy all the fondest wishes of [the mother]425-the mother s heart , for [she]102-mrs. thorpe received [him]577-he with the most delighted and exulting affection . On [[his]577-he two younger sisters]579-his two younger sisters [he]577-he then bestowed an equal portion of [his]577-he fraternal tenderness , for [he]577-he asked each of [them]579-his two younger sisters how [they]579-his two younger sisters did , and observed that [they]579-his two younger sisters both looked very ugly .

These manners did not please [Catherine]77-catherine ; but [he]577-he was [[James]108-james s friend]580-james s friend and [[Isabella]106-isabella s brother]581-isabella s brother ; and [her]77-catherine judgment was further bought off by [Isabella]106-isabella s assuring [her]77-catherine , when [they]582-they withdrew to see the new hat , that [John]103-john thought [her]77-catherine [the most charming girl in [the world]197-the world]583-the most charming girl in the world , and by [John]103-john s engaging [her]77-catherine before [they]582-they parted to dance with [him]103-john that evening . Had [she]77-catherine been older or vainer , such attacks might have done little ; but , where youth and diffidence are united , it requires uncommon steadiness of reason to resist the attraction of being called [the most charming girl in [the world]197-the world]583-the most charming girl in the world , and of being so very early engaged as [a partner]2125-a partner ; and the consequence was that , when [the two Morlands]588-the two morlands , after sitting an hour with [the Thorpes]107-the thorpes , set off to walk together to [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen s , and [James]108-james , as the door was closed on [them]588-the two morlands , said , " Well , [Catherine]77-catherine , how do [you]77-catherine like [[my]108-james friend]2314-my friend [Thorpe]103-john ? "[108-james] instead of answering , as [she]77-catherine probably would have done , had there been no friendship and no flattery in the case , " [I]77-catherine do not like [him]103-john at all , "[77-catherine] [she]77-catherine directly replied , " [I]77-catherine like [him]103-john very much ; [he]103-john seems very agreeable . "[77-catherine]

" [He]103-john is as good - natured [a fellow as ever lived]2315-a fellow as ever lived ; a little of a rattle ; but that will recommend [him]103-john to [your]77-catherine sex , [I]77-catherine believe : and how do [you]77-catherine like [the rest of [the family]457-the family]2316-the rest of the family ? "[77-catherine]

" Very , very much indeed : [Isabella]106-isabella particularly . "[77-catherine]

" [I]77-catherine am very glad to hear [you]77-catherine say so ; [she]106-isabella is just [the kind of young woman [I]77-catherine could wish to see [you]77-catherine attached to]2318-the kind of young woman i could wish to see you attached to ; [she]106-isabella has so much good sense , and is so thoroughly unaffected and amiable ; [I]77-catherine always wanted [you]77-catherine to know [her]106-isabella ; and [she]106-isabella seems very fond of [you]77-catherine . "[77-catherine]

" Indeed [I]589-i am , "[589-i] [she]589-i replied ; " [I]589-i love [her]106-isabella exceedingly , and am delighted to find that [you]77-catherine like [her]106-isabella too . [You]77-catherine hardly mentioned anything of [her]106-isabella when [you]77-catherine wrote to [me]589-i after [your]77-catherine visit [there]336-there . "[589-i]

" Because [I]77-catherine thought [I]77-catherine should soon see [you]77-catherine [myself]77-catherine . [She]106-isabella is [a most amiable girl]2321-a most amiable girl ; such a superior understanding ! "[77-catherine]

" Yes , very much indeed , [I]589-i fancy ; [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen thinks [her]106-isabella [the prettiest girl in [Bath]5-bath]2323-the prettiest girl in bath . "[589-i]

" [I]77-catherine dare say [he]89-mr. allen does ; and [I]77-catherine do not know [any man who is [a better judge of beauty]2325-a better judge of beauty than [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen]2324-any man who is a better judge of beauty than mr. allen . [I]77-catherine need not ask [you]2326-you whether [you]2326-you are happy here , [[my]77-catherine dear]2124-my dear [Catherine]77-catherine ; with such a companion and friend as [Isabella Thorpe]106-isabella , it would be impossible for [you]2326-you to be otherwise ; and [the Allens]109-the allens , [I]77-catherine am sure , are very kind to [you]2326-you ? "[77-catherine]

" Yes , very kind ; [I]589-i never was so happy before ; and now [you]2326-you are come it will be more delightful than ever ; how good it is of [you]2326-you to come so far on purpose to see _ [me]589-i _ . "[589-i]

[James]108-james accepted this tribute of gratitude , and qualified [his]108-james conscience for accepting it too , by saying with perfect sincerity , " Indeed , [Catherine]77-catherine , [I]108-james love [you]77-catherine dearly . "[108-james]

Inquiries and communications concerning [brothers]590-brothers and [sisters]411-sisters , the situation of some , the growth of the rest , and other family matters now passed between [them]592-them , and continued , with only one small digression on [James]108-james s part , in praise of [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe , till [they]592-them reached [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street , where [he]108-james was welcomed with great kindness by [Mr.]593-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , invited by [the former]594-the former to dine with [them]592-them , and summoned by [the latter]562-the latter to guess the price and weigh the merits of a new muff and tippet . A pre - engagement in [Edgar s Buildings]28-edgar s buildings prevented [his]108-james accepting the invitation of [one friend]596-one friend , and obliged [him]108-james to hurry away as soon as [he]108-james had satisfied the demands of [the other]413-the other . The time of [the two parties]598-the two parties uniting in [the Octagon Room]599-the octagon room being correctly adjusted , [Catherine]77-catherine was then left to the luxury of a raised , restless , and frightened imagination over the pages of [Udolpho]113-udolpho , lost from all worldly concerns of dressing and dinner , incapable of soothing [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen s fears on the delay of [an expected dressmaker]600-an expected dressmaker , and having only one minute in sixty to bestow even on the reflection of [her]77-catherine own felicity , in being already engaged for the evening .

CHAPTER 8

In spite of [Udolpho]113-udolpho and [the dressmaker]601-the dressmaker , however , [the party from [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street]602-the party from pulteney street reached [the Upper Rooms]303-the upper rooms in very good time . [The Thorpes]107-the thorpes and [James Morland]108-james were there only two minutes before [them]602-the party from pulteney street ; and [Isabella]106-isabella having gone through the usual ceremonial of meeting [[her]106-isabella friend]313-her friend with the most smiling and affectionate haste , of admiring the set of [her]106-isabella gown , and envying the curl of [her]106-isabella hair , [they]598-the two parties followed [[their]598-the two parties chaperones]605-their chaperones , arm in arm , into [the ballroom]307-the ballroom , whispering to [each other]338-each other whenever a thought occurred , and supplying the place of many ideas by a squeeze of the hand or a smile of affection .

The dancing began within a few minutes after [they]598-the two parties were seated ; and [James]108-james , who had been engaged quite as long as [[his]108-james sister]2222-his sister , was very importunate with [Isabella]106-isabella to stand up ; but [John]103-john was gone into [the card - room]310-the card - room to speak to [a friend]449-a friend , and nothing , [she]449-a friend declared , should induce [her]449-a friend to join the set before [[her]449-a friend dear]479-her dear [Catherine]77-catherine could join it too . " [I]449-a friend assure [you]77-catherine , "[449-a friend] said [she]449-a friend , " [I]449-a friend would not stand up without [[your]77-catherine dear sister]2328-your dear sister for [all the world]2329-all the world ; for if [I]449-a friend did [we]612-they should certainly be separated the whole evening . "[449-a friend] [Catherine]77-catherine accepted this kindness with gratitude , and [they]612-they continued as [they]612-they were for three minutes longer , when [Isabella]106-isabella , who had been talking to [James]108-james on the other side of [her]106-isabella , turned again to [[his]108-james sister]2222-his sister and whispered , " [[My]2222-his sister dear creature]2330-my dear creature , [I]2222-his sister am afraid [I]2222-his sister must leave [you]2330-my dear creature , [[your]2330-my dear creature brother]2331-your brother is so amazingly impatient to begin ; [I]2222-his sister know [you]2330-my dear creature will not mind [my]2222-his sister going away , and [I]2222-his sister dare say [John]103-john will be back in a moment , and then [you]2330-my dear creature may easily find [me]2222-his sister out . "[2222-his sister] [Catherine]77-catherine , though a little disappointed , had too much good nature to make any opposition , and [the others]2220-the others rising up , [Isabella]106-isabella had only time to press [[her]106-isabella friend]313-her friend s hand and say , " Good - bye , [[my]313-her friend dear love]2332-my dear love , "[313-her friend] before [they]616-they hurried off . [The younger Miss Thorpes]107-the thorpes being also dancing , [Catherine]77-catherine was left to the mercy of [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , between whom [she]77-catherine now remained . [She]77-catherine could not help being vexed at the non - appearance of [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe , for [she]77-catherine not only longed to be dancing , but was likewise aware that , as the real dignity of [her]77-catherine situation could not be known , [she]77-catherine was sharing with the scores of [other young ladies]617-other young ladies still sitting down all the discredit of wanting [a partner]2125-a partner . To be disgraced in the eye of [the world]197-the world , to wear the appearance of infamy while [her]77-catherine heart is all purity , [her]77-catherine actions all innocence , and the misconduct of another the true source of [her]77-catherine debasement , is one of those circumstances which peculiarly belong to [the heroine]620-the heroine s life , and [her]77-catherine fortitude under it what particularly dignifies [her]77-catherine character . [Catherine]77-catherine had fortitude too ; [she]77-catherine suffered , but no murmur passed [her]77-catherine lips .

From this state of humiliation , [she]77-catherine was roused , at the end of ten minutes , to a pleasanter feeling , by seeing , not [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe , but [Mr. Tilney]98-henry , within three yards of the place where [they]621-they sat ; [he]98-henry seemed to be moving that way , but [he]98-henry did not see [her]77-catherine , and therefore the smile and the blush , which [his]98-henry sudden reappearance raised in [Catherine]77-catherine , passed away without sullying [her]77-catherine heroic importance . [He]98-henry looked as handsome and as lively as ever , and was talking with interest to [a fashionable and pleasing - looking young woman]622-a fashionable and pleasing - looking young woman , who leant on [his]98-henry arm , and whom [Catherine]77-catherine immediately guessed to be [[his]98-henry sister]2222-his sister ; thus unthinkingly throwing away a fair opportunity of considering [him]98-henry lost to [her]77-catherine forever , by being married already . But guided only by what was simple and probable , it had never entered [her]77-catherine head that [Mr. Tilney]98-henry could be married ; [he]98-henry had not behaved , [he]98-henry had not talked , like [the married men to whom [she]77-catherine had been used]624-the married men to whom she had been used ; [he]98-henry had never mentioned [a wife]625-a wife , and [he]98-henry had acknowledged [a sister]626-a sister . From these circumstances sprang the instant conclusion of [[his]98-henry sister]2222-his sister s now being by [his]98-henry side ; and therefore , instead of turning of a deathlike paleness and falling in a fit on [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen s bosom , [Catherine]77-catherine sat erect , in the perfect use of [her]77-catherine senses , and with cheeks only a little redder than usual .

[Mr. Tilney]98-henry and [[his]98-henry companion]543-his companion , who continued , though slowly , to approach , were immediately preceded by [a lady]629-a lady , [an acquaintance of [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe]630-an acquaintance of mrs. thorpe ; and [this lady]631-this lady stopping to speak to [her]77-catherine , [they]632-they , as belonging to [her]631-this lady , stopped likewise , and [Catherine]77-catherine , catching [Mr. Tilney]98-henry s eye , instantly received from [him]98-henry the smiling tribute of recognition . [She]77-catherine returned it with pleasure , and then advancing still nearer , [he]98-henry spoke both to [her]77-catherine and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , by whom [he]98-henry was very civilly acknowledged . " [I]98-henry am very happy to see [you]77-catherine again , [sir]2153-sir , indeed ; [I]98-henry was afraid [you]77-catherine had left [Bath]5-bath . "[98-henry] [He]98-henry thanked [her]77-catherine for [her]77-catherine fears , and said that [he]98-henry had quitted [it]633-it for a week , on the very morning after [his]98-henry having had the pleasure of seeing [her]77-catherine .

" Well , [sir]2153-sir , and [I]98-henry dare say [you]2153-sir are not sorry to be back again , for it is just the place for [young people]2335-young people and indeed for [everybody else]2336-everybody else too . [I]98-henry tell [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen , when [he]89-mr. allen talks of being sick of [it]633-it , that [I]98-henry am sure [he]89-mr. allen should not complain , for it is so very agreeable [a place]2337-a place , that it is much better to be [here]2128-here than at [home]2339-home at this dull time of year . [I]98-henry tell [him]89-mr. allen [he]89-mr. allen is quite in luck to be sent [here]2128-here for [his]89-mr. allen health . "[98-henry]

" And [I]102-mrs. thorpe hope , [madam]2147-madam , that [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen will be obliged to like [the place]2152-the place , from finding [it]2152-the place of service to [him]89-mr. allen . "[102-mrs. thorpe]

" Thank [you]102-mrs. thorpe , [sir]2153-sir . [I]98-henry have no doubt that [he]89-mr. allen will . [A neighbour of [ours]2345-ours]2344-a neighbour of ours , [Dr. Skinner]127-dr. skinner , was here for [his]127-dr. skinner health last winter , and came away quite stout . "[98-henry]

" That circumstance must give great encouragement . "[102-mrs. thorpe]

" Yes , [sir]2153-sir and [Dr. Skinner]127-dr. skinner and [[his]127-dr. skinner family]430-his family were here three months ; so [I]98-henry tell [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen [he]127-dr. skinner must not be in a hurry to get away . "[98-henry]

Here [they]634-they were interrupted by a request from [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe to [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , that [she]102-mrs. thorpe would move a little to accommodate [Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes and [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney with seats , as [they]634-they had agreed to join [[their]634-they party]635-their party . This was accordingly done , [Mr. Tilney]98-henry still continuing standing before [them]634-they ; and after a few minutes consideration , [he]98-henry asked [Catherine]77-catherine to dance with [him]98-henry . This compliment , delightful as it was , produced severe mortification to [the lady]383-the lady ; and in giving [her]383-the lady denial , [she]383-the lady expressed [her]383-the lady sorrow on the occasion so very much as if [she]383-the lady really felt it , that had [Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe , who joined [her]383-the lady just afterwards , been half a minute earlier , [he]98-henry might have thought [her]383-the lady sufferings rather too acute . The very easy manner in which [he]98-henry then told [her]383-the lady that [he]98-henry had kept [her]383-the lady waiting did not by any means reconcile [her]383-the lady more to [her]383-the lady lot ; nor did the particulars which [he]98-henry entered into while [they]634-they were standing up , of the horses and dogs of [the friend whom [he]98-henry had just left , and of a proposed exchange of terriers between [them]634-they]637-the friend whom he had just left , and of a proposed exchange of terriers between them , interest [her]383-the lady so much as to prevent [her]383-the lady looking very often towards that part of [the room where [she]383-the lady had left [Mr. Tilney]98-henry]638-the room where she had left mr. tilney . Of [[her]383-the lady dear]479-her dear Isabella , to whom [she]383-the lady particularly longed to point out [that gentleman]640-that gentleman , [she]383-the lady could see nothing . [They]641-they were in different sets . [She]383-the lady was separated from all [her]383-the lady party , and away from all [her]383-the lady acquaintance ; one mortification succeeded another , and from the whole [she]383-the lady deduced this useful lesson , that to go previously engaged to a ball does not necessarily increase either the dignity or enjoyment of [a young lady]245-a young lady . From such a moralizing strain as this , [she]383-the lady was suddenly roused by a touch on the shoulder , and turning round , perceived [Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes directly behind [her]383-the lady , attended by [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney and [a gentleman]389-a gentleman . " [I]383-the lady beg [your]640-that gentleman pardon , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , "[383-the lady] said [she]383-the lady , " for this liberty but [I]383-the lady can not anyhow get to [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe , and [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe said [she]102-mrs. thorpe was sure [you]640-that gentleman would not have the least objection to letting in [this young lady]2348-this young lady by [you]640-that gentleman . "[383-the lady] [Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes could not have applied to any creature in [the room]308-the room more happy to oblige [her]128-mrs. hughes than [Catherine]77-catherine . [The young ladies]560-the young ladies were introduced to [each other]338-each other , [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney expressing a proper sense of such goodness , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland with the real delicacy of a generous mind making light of the obligation ; and [Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes , satisfied with having so respectably settled [[her]128-mrs. hughes young charge]488-her young charge , returned to [her]128-mrs. hughes party .

[Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney had a good figure , a pretty face , and a very agreeable countenance ; and [her]95-miss tilney air , though it had not all the decided pretension , the resolute stylishness of [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe s , had more real elegance . [Her]95-miss tilney manners showed good sense and good breeding ; they were neither shy nor affectedly open ; and [she]95-miss tilney seemed capable of being young , attractive , and at a ball without wanting to fix the attention of [every man near [her]95-miss tilney]648-every man near her , and without exaggerated feelings of ecstatic delight or inconceivable vexation on every little trifling occurrence . [Catherine]77-catherine , interested at once by [her]95-miss tilney appearance and [her]77-catherine relationship to [Mr. Tilney]98-henry , was desirous of being acquainted with [her]95-miss tilney , and readily talked therefore whenever [she]77-catherine could think of anything to say , and had courage and leisure for saying it . But the hindrance thrown in the way of a very speedy intimacy , by the frequent want of one or more of these requisites , prevented [their]649-their doing more than going through the first rudiments of [an acquaintance]650-an acquaintance , by informing [themselves]649-their how well the other liked [Bath]5-bath , how much [she]95-miss tilney admired [[its]5-bath buildings]651-its buildings and [surrounding country]652-surrounding country , whether [she]95-miss tilney drew , or played , or sang , and whether [she]95-miss tilney was fond of riding on horseback .

The two dances were scarcely concluded before [Catherine]77-catherine found [her]77-catherine arm gently seized by [her]77-catherine faithful Isabella , who in great spirits exclaimed , " At last [I]95-miss tilney have got [you]77-catherine . [[My]95-miss tilney dearest]2226-my dearest creature , [I]95-miss tilney have been looking for [you]77-catherine this hour . What could induce [you]77-catherine to come into this set , when [you]77-catherine knew [I]95-miss tilney was in the other ? [I]95-miss tilney have been quite wretched without [you]77-catherine . "[95-miss tilney]

" [[My]95-miss tilney dear]2124-my dear [Isabella]106-isabella , how was it possible for [me]95-miss tilney to get at [you]77-catherine ? [I]95-miss tilney could not even see where [you]77-catherine were . "[95-miss tilney]

" So [I]95-miss tilney told [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother all the time but [he]2331-your brother would not believe [me]95-miss tilney . Do go and see for [her]106-isabella , [Mr. Morland]108-james , said [I]95-miss tilney but all in vain [he]2331-your brother would not stir an inch . Was not it so , [Mr. Morland]108-james ? But [[you]108-james men]2352-you men are all so immoderately lazy ! [I]95-miss tilney have been scolding [him]2331-your brother to such a degree , [[my]95-miss tilney dear]2124-my dear [Catherine]77-catherine , [you]77-catherine would be quite amazed . [You]77-catherine know [I]95-miss tilney never stand upon ceremony with [such people]2354-such people . "[95-miss tilney]

" Look at [that young lady with the white beads round [her]2355-that young lady with the white beads round her head head]2355-that young lady with the white beads round her head , "[77-catherine] whispered [Catherine]77-catherine , detaching [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend from [James]108-james . " It is [[Mr. Tilney]98-henry s sister]2356-mr. tilney s sister . "[77-catherine]

" Oh ! [Heavens]130-heavens ! [You]108-james don t say so ! Let [me]95-miss tilney look at [her]2355-that young lady with the white beads round her head this moment . " But what is all this whispering about ? What is going on ? "[77-catherine]

" There now , [I]95-miss tilney knew how it would be . [[You]108-james men]2352-you men have such restless curiosity ! Talk of the curiosity of [women]2184-women , indeed ! Tis nothing . But be satisfied , for [you]108-james are not to know anything at all of the matter . "[95-miss tilney]

" And is that likely to satisfy [me]77-catherine , do [you]108-james think ? "[77-catherine]

" Well , [I]95-miss tilney declare [I]95-miss tilney never knew anything like [you]108-james . What can it signify to [you]108-james , what [we]2360-we are talking of . Perhaps [we]2360-we are talking about [you]108-james ; therefore [I]95-miss tilney would advise [you]108-james not to listen , or [you]108-james may happen to hear something not very agreeable . "[95-miss tilney]

In this commonplace chatter , which lasted some time , the original subject seemed entirely forgotten ; and though [Catherine]77-catherine was very well pleased to have it dropped for a while , [she]77-catherine could not avoid a little suspicion at the total suspension of all [Isabella]106-isabella s impatient desire to see [Mr. Tilney]98-henry . When [the orchestra]654-the orchestra struck up a fresh dance , [James]108-james would have led [[his]108-james fair partner]655-his fair partner away , but [she]77-catherine resisted . " [I]77-catherine tell [you]108-james , [Mr. Morland]108-james , "[77-catherine] [she]77-catherine cried , " [I]77-catherine would not do such a thing for all [the world]197-the world . How can [you]108-james be so teasing ; only conceive , [[my]77-catherine dear]2124-my dear [Catherine]77-catherine , what [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother wants [me]77-catherine to do . [He]2331-your brother wants [me]77-catherine to dance with [him]2331-your brother again , though [I]77-catherine tell [him]2331-your brother that it is a most improper thing , and entirely against the rules . It would make [us]2366-us the talk of [the place]2152-the place , if [we]2366-us were not to change [partners]2368-partners . "[77-catherine]

" Upon [my]108-james honour , "[108-james] said [James]108-james , " in these public assemblies , it is as often done as not . "[108-james]

" Nonsense , how can [you]108-james say so ? But when [[you]108-james [men]2187-men]2352-you men have a point to carry , [you]108-james never stick at anything . [My]77-catherine sweet [Catherine]77-catherine , do support [me]77-catherine ; persuade [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother how impossible it is . " No , not at all ; but if [you]77-catherine think it wrong , [you]77-catherine had much better change . "[108-james]

" There , "[106-isabella] cried [Isabella]106-isabella , " [you]77-catherine hear what [[your]77-catherine sister]2195-your sister says , and yet [you]77-catherine will not mind [her]2195-your sister .
