"[106-isabella] And off [they]656-we went , to regain [their]656-we former place . [John Thorpe]103-john , in the meanwhile , had walked away ; and [Catherine]77-catherine , ever willing to give [Mr. Tilney]98-henry an opportunity of repeating the agreeable request which had already flattered [her]77-catherine once , made [her]77-catherine way to [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen and [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe as fast as [she]77-catherine could , in the hope of finding [him]103-john still with [them]656-we a hope which , when it proved to be fruitless , [she]77-catherine felt to have been highly unreasonable . " Well , [[my]102-mrs. thorpe dear]2124-my dear , "[102-mrs. thorpe] said [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe , impatient for praise of [[her]102-mrs. thorpe son]657-her son , " [I]102-mrs. thorpe hope [you]2124-my dear have had [an agreeable partner]2376-an agreeable partner . "[102-mrs. thorpe]

" Very agreeable , [madam]2147-madam . "[77-catherine]

" [I]102-mrs. thorpe am glad of it . [John]103-john has charming spirits , has not [he]103-john ? "[102-mrs. thorpe]

" Did [you]2124-my dear meet [Mr. Tilney]98-henry , [[my]91-mrs. allen dear]2124-my dear ? "[91-mrs. allen] said [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen .

" No , where is [he]103-john ? "[102-mrs. thorpe]

" [He]103-john was with [us]2379-us just now , and said [he]103-john was so tired of lounging about , that [he]103-john was resolved to go and dance ; so [I]102-mrs. thorpe thought perhaps [he]103-john would ask [you]2124-my dear , if [he]103-john met with [you]2124-my dear . "[102-mrs. thorpe]

" Where can [he]103-john be ? "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , looking round ; but [she]77-catherine had not looked round long before [she]77-catherine saw [him]658-him leading [a young lady]245-a young lady to the dance .

" Ah ! [He]103-john has got [a partner]2125-a partner ; [I]91-mrs. allen wish [he]103-john had asked _ [you]2124-my dear _ , "[91-mrs. allen] said [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen ; and after a short silence , [she]91-mrs. allen added , " [he]103-john is [a very agreeable young man]2171-a very agreeable young man . "[91-mrs. allen]

" Indeed [he]103-john is , [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , "[102-mrs. thorpe] said [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe , smiling complacently ; " [I]102-mrs. thorpe must say it , though [I]102-mrs. thorpe _ am _ [[his]103-john mother]2382-his mother , that there is not [a more agreeable young man in [the world]197-the world]2383-a more agreeable young man in the world . "[102-mrs. thorpe]

This inapplicable answer might have been too much for the comprehension of many ; but it did not puzzle [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , for after only a moment s consideration , [she]91-mrs. allen said , in a whisper to [Catherine]77-catherine , " [I]91-mrs. allen dare say [she]102-mrs. thorpe thought [I]91-mrs. allen was speaking of [[her]102-mrs. thorpe son]657-her son . "[91-mrs. allen]

[Catherine]77-catherine was disappointed and vexed . [She]77-catherine seemed to have missed by so little the very object [she]77-catherine had had in view ; and this persuasion did not incline [her]77-catherine to a very gracious reply , when [John Thorpe]103-john came up to [her]77-catherine soon afterwards and said , " Well , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , [I]103-john suppose [you]77-catherine and [I]103-john are to stand up and jig it together again . "[103-john]

" Oh , no ; [I]103-john am much obliged to [you]77-catherine , [our]2386-our two dances are over ; and , besides , [I]103-john am tired , and do not mean to dance any more . "[103-john]

" Do not [you]77-catherine ? Then let [us]2386-our walk about and quiz [people]328-people . Come along with [me]77-catherine , and [I]77-catherine will show [you]77-catherine [the four greatest quizzers in [the room]308-the room]2388-the four greatest quizzers in the room ; [[my]77-catherine two younger sisters]2390-my two younger sisters and [[their]2390-my two younger sisters partners]2391-their partners . [I]77-catherine have been laughing at [them]2388-the four greatest quizzers in the room this half hour . "[77-catherine]

Again [Catherine]77-catherine excused [herself]77-catherine ; and at last [he]660-he walked off to quiz [[his]660-he sisters]661-his sisters by [himself]660-he . The rest of the evening [she]77-catherine found very dull ; [Mr. Tilney]98-henry was drawn away from [their]662-their party at tea , to attend that of [[his]98-henry partner]663-his partner ; [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , though belonging to [it]664-it , did not sit near [her]77-catherine , and [James]108-james and [Isabella]106-isabella were so much engaged in conversing together that [the latter]562-the latter had no leisure to bestow more on [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend than one smile , one squeeze , and one " dearest [Catherine]77-catherine . "[562-the latter]

CHAPTER 9

The progress of [Catherine]77-catherine s unhappiness from the events of the evening was as follows . It appeared first in a general dissatisfaction with everybody about [her]77-catherine , while [she]77-catherine remained in [the rooms]2123-the rooms , which speedily brought on considerable weariness and a violent desire to go [home]2339-home . This , on arriving in [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street , took the direction of extraordinary hunger , and when that was appeased , changed into an earnest longing to be in bed ; such was the extreme point of [her]77-catherine distress ; for when there [she]77-catherine immediately fell into a sound sleep which lasted nine hours , and from which [she]77-catherine awoke perfectly revived , in excellent spirits , with fresh hopes and fresh schemes . The first wish of [her]77-catherine heart was to improve [her]77-catherine acquaintance with [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , and almost [her]77-catherine first resolution , to seek [her]77-catherine for that purpose , in [the pump - room]364-the pump - room at noon . In [the pump - room]364-the pump - room , one so newly arrived in [Bath]5-bath must be met with , and that building [she]77-catherine had already found so favourable for the discovery of female excellence , and the completion of female intimacy , so admirably adapted for secret discourses and unlimited confidence , that [she]77-catherine was most reasonably encouraged to expect [another friend]671-another friend from within [its]364-the pump - room walls . [Her]77-catherine plan for the morning thus settled , [she]77-catherine sat quietly down to [her]77-catherine book after breakfast , resolving to remain in the same place and the same employment till the clock struck one ; and from habitude very little incommoded by the remarks and ejaculations of [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , whose vacancy of mind and incapacity for thinking were such , that as [she]77-catherine never talked a great deal , so [she]77-catherine could never be entirely silent ; and , therefore , while [she]77-catherine sat at [her]77-catherine work , if [she]77-catherine lost [her]77-catherine needle or broke [her]77-catherine thread , if [she]77-catherine heard [a carriage]672-a carriage in [the street]447-the street , or saw a speck upon [her]77-catherine gown , [she]77-catherine must observe it aloud , whether there were anyone at leisure to answer [her]77-catherine or not . At about half past twelve , a remarkably loud rap drew [her]77-catherine in haste to the window , and scarcely had [she]77-catherine time to inform [Catherine]77-catherine of there being two open carriages at the door , in the first only [a servant]674-a servant , [[her]77-catherine brother]2221-her brother driving [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe in the second , before [John Thorpe]103-john came running [upstairs]446-upstairs , calling out , " Well , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , here [I]103-john am . Have [you]77-catherine been waiting long ? [We]2392-we could not come before ; [the old devil of a coachmaker]2393-the old devil of a coachmaker was such an eternity finding out a thing fit to be got into , and now it is ten thousand to one but [they]2394-they break down before [we]2392-we are out of [the street]447-the street . How do [you]77-catherine do , [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen ? A famous ball last night , was not it ? Come , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , be quick , for [the others]2220-the others are in a confounded hurry to be off . [They]2220-the others want to get [their]2220-the others tumble over . "[103-john]

" What do [you]77-catherine mean ? "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine . " Where are [you]77-catherine all going to ? "[77-catherine]

" Going to ? Why , [you]77-catherine have not forgot [our]2392-we engagement ! Did not [we]2392-we agree together to take a drive this morning ? What a head [you]77-catherine have ! [We]2392-we are going up [Claverton]33-claverton Down . "[103-john]

" Something was said about it , [I]77-catherine remember , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , looking at [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen for [her]77-catherine opinion ; " but really [I]77-catherine did not expect [you]77-catherine . "[77-catherine]

" Not expect [me]91-mrs. allen ! That s a good one ! And what a dust [you]77-catherine would have made , if [I]91-mrs. allen had not come . "[91-mrs. allen]

[Catherine]77-catherine s silent appeal to [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend , meanwhile , was entirely thrown away , for [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , not being at all in the habit of conveying any expression [herself]91-mrs. allen by a look , was not aware of its being ever intended by [anybody else]2258-anybody else ; and [Catherine]77-catherine , whose desire of seeing [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney again could at that moment bear a short delay in favour of a drive , and who thought there could be no impropriety in [her]77-catherine going with [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe , as [Isabella]106-isabella was going at the same time with [James]108-james , was therefore obliged to speak plainer . " Well , [ma am]2397-ma am , what do [you]77-catherine say to it ? Can [you]77-catherine spare [me]122-mr. thorpe for an hour or two ? Shall [I]122-mr. thorpe go ? "[122-mr. thorpe]

" Do just as [you]77-catherine please , [[my]91-mrs. allen dear]2124-my dear , "[91-mrs. allen] replied [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , with the most placid indifference . [Catherine]77-catherine took the advice , and ran off to get ready . In a very few minutes [she]77-catherine reappeared , having scarcely allowed [the two others]679-the two others time enough to get through a few short sentences in [her]77-catherine praise , after [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe had procured [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen s admiration of [his]122-mr. thorpe gig ; and then receiving [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend s parting good wishes , [they]679-the two others both hurried [downstairs]681-downstairs . " [[My]106-isabella dearest]2226-my dearest creature , "[106-isabella] cried [Isabella]106-isabella , to whom the duty of friendship immediately called [her]106-isabella before [she]106-isabella could get into [the carriage]559-the carriage , " [you]2226-my dearest have been at least three hours getting ready . [I]106-isabella was afraid [you]2226-my dearest were ill . What a delightful ball [we]679-the two others had last night . [I]106-isabella have a thousand things to say to [you]2226-my dearest ; but make haste and get in , for [I]106-isabella long to be off . "[106-isabella]

[Catherine]77-catherine followed [her]106-isabella orders and turned away , but not too soon to hear [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend exclaim aloud to [James]108-james , " What [a sweet girl]2240-a sweet girl [she]2240-a sweet girl is ! [I]313-her friend quite dote on [her]2240-a sweet girl . "[313-her friend]

" [You]77-catherine will not be frightened , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , "[122-mr. thorpe] said [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe , as [he]122-mr. thorpe handed [her]77-catherine in , " if [my]122-mr. thorpe horse should dance about a little at first setting off . [He]122-mr. thorpe will , most likely , give a plunge or two , and perhaps take the rest for a minute ; but [he]122-mr. thorpe will soon know [[his]122-mr. thorpe master]2401-his master . [He]122-mr. thorpe is full of spirits , playful as can be , but there is no vice in [him]122-mr. thorpe . "[122-mr. thorpe]

[Catherine]77-catherine did not think the portrait a very inviting one , but it was too late to retreat , and [she]77-catherine was too young to own [herself]77-catherine frightened ; so , resigning [herself]77-catherine to [her]77-catherine fate , and trusting to the animal s boasted knowledge of [its owner]684-its owner , [she]77-catherine sat peaceably down , and saw [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe sit down by [her]77-catherine . Everything being then arranged , [the servant who stood at the horse s head]685-the servant who stood at the horse s head was bid in an important voice " to let [him]122-mr. thorpe go , "[685-the servant who stood at the horse s head] and off [they]686-they went in the quietest manner imaginable , without a plunge or a caper , or anything like one . [Catherine]77-catherine , delighted at so happy an escape , spoke [her]77-catherine pleasure aloud with grateful surprise ; and [[her]77-catherine companion]687-her companion immediately made the matter perfectly simple by assuring [her]77-catherine that it was entirely owing to the peculiarly judicious manner in which [he]122-mr. thorpe had then held the reins , and the singular discernment and dexterity with which [he]122-mr. thorpe had directed [his]122-mr. thorpe whip . [Catherine]77-catherine , though [she]77-catherine could not help wondering that with such perfect command of [his]122-mr. thorpe horse , [he]122-mr. thorpe should think it necessary to alarm [her]77-catherine with a relation of [its]688-its tricks , congratulated [herself]77-catherine sincerely on being under the care of so excellent [a coachman]689-a coachman ; and perceiving that the animal continued to go on in the same quiet manner , without showing the smallest propensity towards any unpleasant vivacity , and ( considering its inevitable pace was ten miles an hour ) by no means alarmingly fast , gave [herself]77-catherine up to all the enjoyment of air and exercise of the most invigorating kind , in a fine mild day of February , with the consciousness of safety . A silence of several minutes succeeded [their]686-they first short dialogue ; it was broken by [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe s saying very abruptly , " [Old Allen]131-old allen is as rich as [a Jew]2402-a jew is not [he]131-old allen ? "[122-mr. thorpe] [Catherine]77-catherine did not understand [him]122-mr. thorpe and [he]122-mr. thorpe repeated [his]122-mr. thorpe question , adding in explanation , " [Old Allen]131-old allen , [the man [you]77-catherine are with]2403-the man you are with . "[122-mr. thorpe]

" Oh ! [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen , [you]122-mr. thorpe mean . Yes , [I]122-mr. thorpe believe , [he]131-old allen is very rich . "[122-mr. thorpe]

" And [no children]2404-no children at all ? "[122-mr. thorpe]

" No not any . "[122-mr. thorpe]

" A famous thing for [[his]131-old allen next heirs]2405-his next heirs . [He]131-old allen is _ [[your]77-catherine _ godfather]2406-your _ godfather , is not [he]131-old allen ? "[122-mr. thorpe]

" [[My]122-mr. thorpe godfather]2407-my godfather ! No . "[122-mr. thorpe]

" But [you]122-mr. thorpe are always very much with [them]2405-his next heirs . "[122-mr. thorpe]

" Yes , very much . "[122-mr. thorpe]

" Aye , that is what [I]122-mr. thorpe meant . [He]131-old allen seems a good kind of old fellow enough , and has lived very well in [his]131-old allen time , [I]122-mr. thorpe dare say ; [he]131-old allen is not gouty for nothing . Does [he]131-old allen drink [his]131-old allen bottle a day now ? "[122-mr. thorpe]

" [His]131-old allen bottle a day ! No . Why should [you]122-mr. thorpe think of such a thing ? [He]131-old allen is [a very temperate man]2408-a very temperate man , and [you]122-mr. thorpe could not fancy [him]131-old allen in liquor last night ? "[122-mr. thorpe]

" [Lord]2409-lord help [you]122-mr. thorpe ! [[You]122-mr. thorpe women]2410-you women are always thinking of [men]2187-men s being in liquor . Why , [you]122-mr. thorpe do not suppose [a man]2268-a man is overset by a bottle ? [I]122-mr. thorpe am sure of _ this _ that if [everybody]326-everybody was to drink [their]326-everybody bottle a day , there would not be half the disorders in [the world]197-the world there are now . It would be a famous good thing for [us]2415-us all . "[122-mr. thorpe]

" [I]122-mr. thorpe can not believe it . "[122-mr. thorpe]

" Oh ! Lord , it would be the saving of thousands . There is not the hundredth part of the wine consumed in [this kingdom]2416-this kingdom that there ought to be . [Our]2415-us foggy climate wants help . "[122-mr. thorpe]

" And yet [I]122-mr. thorpe have heard that there is a great deal of wine drunk in [Oxford]10-oxford . "[122-mr. thorpe]

" [Oxford]10-oxford ! There is no drinking at [Oxford]10-oxford now , [I]122-mr. thorpe assure [you]122-mr. thorpe . [Nobody]2139-nobody drinks [there]336-there . [You]122-mr. thorpe would hardly meet with [a man who goes beyond [his]2419-a man who goes beyond his four pints at the utmost four pints at the utmost]2419-a man who goes beyond his four pints at the utmost . Now , for instance , it was reckoned a remarkable thing , at the last party in [[my]122-mr. thorpe rooms]2420-my rooms , that upon an average [we]2415-us cleared about five pints a head . It was looked upon as something out of the common way . _ [Mine]122-mr. thorpe _ is famous good stuff , to be sure . [You]122-mr. thorpe would not often meet with anything like it in [Oxford]10-oxford and that may account for it . But this will just give [you]122-mr. thorpe a notion of the general rate of drinking there . "[122-mr. thorpe]

" Yes , it does give a notion , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine warmly , " and that is , that [you]122-mr. thorpe all drink a great deal more wine than [I]77-catherine thought [you]122-mr. thorpe did . However , [I]77-catherine am sure [James]108-james does not drink so much . "[77-catherine]

This declaration brought on a loud and overpowering reply , of which no part was very distinct , except the frequent exclamations , amounting almost to oaths , which adorned it , and [Catherine]77-catherine was left , when it ended , with rather a strengthened belief of there being a great deal of wine drunk in [Oxford]10-oxford , and the same happy conviction of [[her]77-catherine brother]2221-her brother s comparative sobriety .

[Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe s ideas then all reverted to the merits of [his]122-mr. thorpe own equipage , and [she]77-catherine was called on to admire the spirit and freedom with which [his]122-mr. thorpe horse moved along , and the ease which [his]122-mr. thorpe paces , as well as the excellence of the springs , gave the motion of [the carriage]559-the carriage . [She]77-catherine followed [him]122-mr. thorpe in all [his]122-mr. thorpe admiration as well as [she]77-catherine could . To go before or beyond [him]122-mr. thorpe was impossible . [His]122-mr. thorpe knowledge and [her]77-catherine ignorance of the subject , [his]122-mr. thorpe rapidity of expression , and [her]77-catherine diffidence of [herself]77-catherine put that out of [her]77-catherine power ; [she]77-catherine could strike out nothing new in commendation , but [she]77-catherine readily echoed whatever [he]122-mr. thorpe chose to assert , and it was finally settled between [them]692-we without any difficulty that [his]122-mr. thorpe equipage was altogether the most complete of its kind in [England]2-england , [[his]122-mr. thorpe carriage]693-his carriage the neatest , [his]122-mr. thorpe horse the best goer , and [himself]122-mr. thorpe the best coachman . " [You]122-mr. thorpe do not really think , [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , venturing after some time to consider the matter as entirely decided , and to offer some little variation on the subject , " that [James]108-james s gig will break down ? "[77-catherine]

" Break down ! Oh ! [Lord]2421-lord ! Did [you]122-mr. thorpe ever see such a little tittuppy thing in [your]122-mr. thorpe life ? There is not a sound piece of iron about it . The wheels have been fairly worn out these ten years at least and as for the body ! Upon [my]77-catherine soul , [you]122-mr. thorpe might shake it to pieces [yourself]122-mr. thorpe with a touch . It is the most devilish little rickety business [I]77-catherine ever beheld ! Thank [God]132-god ! [we]692-we have got a better . [I]77-catherine would not be bound to go two miles in it for fifty thousand pounds . "[77-catherine]

" Good heavens ! "[77-catherine] cried [Catherine]77-catherine , quite frightened . " Then pray let [us]692-we turn back ; [they]2422-they will certainly meet with an accident if [we]692-we go on . Do let [us]692-we turn back , [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe ; stop and speak to [[my]77-catherine brother]2282-my brother , and tell [him]2282-my brother how very unsafe it is . "[77-catherine]

" Unsafe ! Oh , [lord]2424-lord ! What is there in that ? [They]2422-they will only get a roll if it does break down ; and there is plenty of dirt ; it will be excellent falling . Oh , curse it ! [The carriage]559-the carriage is safe enough , if [a man]2268-a man knows how to drive [it]559-the carriage ; a thing of that sort in good hands will last above twenty years after it is fairly worn out . Lord bless [you]122-mr. thorpe ! [I]77-catherine would undertake for five pounds to drive [it]559-the carriage to [York]34-york and back again , without losing a nail . "[77-catherine]

[Catherine]77-catherine listened with astonishment ; [she]77-catherine knew not how to reconcile two such very different accounts of the same thing ; for [she]77-catherine had not been brought up to understand the propensities of a rattle , nor to know to how many idle assertions and impudent falsehoods the excess of vanity will lead . [[Her]77-catherine own family]694-her own family were [plain , matter - of - fact people who seldom aimed at wit of any kind]695-plain , matter - of - fact people who seldom aimed at wit of any kind ; [[her]77-catherine father]188-her father , at the utmost , being contented with a pun , and [[her]77-catherine mother]194-her mother with a proverb ; [they]694-her own family were not in the habit therefore of telling lies to increase [their]694-her own family importance , or of asserting at one moment what [they]694-her own family would contradict the next . [She]77-catherine reflected on the affair for some time in much perplexity , and was more than once on the point of requesting from [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe a clearer insight into [his]122-mr. thorpe real opinion on the subject ; but [she]77-catherine checked [herself]77-catherine , because it appeared to [her]77-catherine that [he]122-mr. thorpe did not excel in giving those clearer insights , in making those things plain which [he]122-mr. thorpe had before made ambiguous ; and , joining to this , the consideration that [he]122-mr. thorpe would not really suffer [[his]122-mr. thorpe sister]2222-his sister and [[his]122-mr. thorpe friend]557-his friend to be exposed to a danger from which [he]122-mr. thorpe might easily preserve [them]700-them , [she]77-catherine concluded at last that [he]122-mr. thorpe must know [the carriage]559-the carriage to be in fact perfectly safe , and therefore would alarm [herself]77-catherine no longer . By [him]122-mr. thorpe the whole matter seemed entirely forgotten ; and all the rest of [his]122-mr. thorpe conversation , or rather talk , began and ended with [himself]122-mr. thorpe and [his]122-mr. thorpe own concerns . [He]122-mr. thorpe told [her]77-catherine of horses which [he]122-mr. thorpe had bought for a trifle and sold for incredible sums ; of racing matches , in which [his]122-mr. thorpe judgment had infallibly foretold [the winner]702-the winner ; of shooting parties , in which [he]122-mr. thorpe had killed more birds ( though without having one good shot ) than all [[his]122-mr. thorpe companions]703-his companions together ; and described to [her]77-catherine some famous day s sport , with the fox - hounds , in which [his]122-mr. thorpe foresight and skill in directing the dogs had repaired the mistakes of [the most experienced huntsman]704-the most experienced huntsman , and in which the boldness of [his]122-mr. thorpe riding , though it had never endangered [his]122-mr. thorpe own life for a moment , had been constantly leading [others]705-others into difficulties , which [he]122-mr. thorpe calmly concluded had broken the necks of [many]706-many .

Little as [Catherine]77-catherine was in the habit of judging for [herself]77-catherine , and unfixed as were [her]77-catherine general notions of what [men]2187-men ought to be , [she]77-catherine could not entirely repress a doubt , while [she]77-catherine bore with the effusions of [his]122-mr. thorpe endless conceit , of [his]122-mr. thorpe being altogether completely agreeable . It was a bold surmise , for [he]122-mr. thorpe was [[Isabella]106-isabella s brother]581-isabella s brother ; and [she]77-catherine had been assured by [James]108-james that [his]122-mr. thorpe manners would recommend [him]122-mr. thorpe to all [her]77-catherine sex ; but in spite of this , the extreme weariness of [his]122-mr. thorpe company , which crept over [her]77-catherine before [they]709-they had been out an hour , and which continued unceasingly to increase till [they]709-they stopped in [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street again , induced [her]77-catherine , in some small degree , to resist such high authority , and to distrust [his]122-mr. thorpe powers of giving universal pleasure .

When [they]709-they arrived at [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen s door , the astonishment of [Isabella]106-isabella was hardly to be expressed , on finding that it was too late in the day for [them]709-they to attend [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend into [the house]216-the house : " Past three o clock ! "[313-her friend] It was inconceivable , incredible , impossible ! And [she]77-catherine would neither believe [her]77-catherine own watch , nor [[her]77-catherine brother]2221-her brother s , nor [the servant]545-the servant s ; [she]77-catherine would believe no assurance of it founded on reason or reality , till [Morland]108-james produced [his]108-james watch , and ascertained the fact ; to have doubted a moment longer _ then _ , would have been equally inconceivable , incredible , and impossible ; and [she]77-catherine could only protest , over and over again , that no two hours and a half had ever gone off so swiftly before , as [Catherine]77-catherine was called on to confirm ; [Catherine]77-catherine could not tell a falsehood even to please [Isabella]106-isabella ; but [the latter]562-the latter was spared the misery of [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend s dissenting voice , by not waiting for [her]77-catherine answer . [Her]77-catherine own feelings entirely engrossed [her]77-catherine ; [her]77-catherine wretchedness was most acute on finding [herself]77-catherine obliged to go directly [home]2339-home . It was ages since [she]77-catherine had had a moment s conversation with [[her]77-catherine dearest]717-her dearest [Catherine]77-catherine ; and , though [she]77-catherine had such thousands of things to say to [her]77-catherine , it appeared as if [they]718-they were never to be together again ; so , with smiles of most exquisite misery , and the laughing eye of utter despondency , [she]77-catherine bade [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend adieu and went on .

[Catherine]77-catherine found [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen just returned from all the busy idleness of the morning , and was immediately greeted with , " Well , [[my]77-catherine dear]2124-my dear , here [you]2124-my dear are , "[77-catherine] a truth which [she]77-catherine had no greater inclination than power to dispute ; " and [I]77-catherine hope [you]2124-my dear have had a pleasant airing ? "[77-catherine]

" Yes , [ma am]2397-ma am , [I]77-catherine thank [you]2124-my dear ; [we]2429-we could not have had a nicer day . "[77-catherine]

" So [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe said ; [she]102-mrs. thorpe was vastly pleased at [your]2124-my dear all going . "[77-catherine]

" [You]2124-my dear have seen [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe , then ? "[77-catherine]

" Yes , [I]77-catherine went to [the pump - room]364-the pump - room as soon as [you]2124-my dear were gone , and there [I]77-catherine met [her]102-mrs. thorpe , and [we]2429-we had a great deal of talk together . [She]102-mrs. thorpe says there was hardly any veal to be got at market this morning , it is so uncommonly scarce . "[77-catherine]

" Did [you]2124-my dear see [anybody else of [our]2429-we acquaintance]2431-anybody else of our acquaintance ? "[77-catherine]

" Yes ; [we]2429-we agreed to take a turn in [the Crescent]2432-the crescent , and there [we]2429-we met [Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes , and [Mr.]2433-mr. and [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney walking with [her]102-mrs. thorpe . "[77-catherine]

" Did [you]2124-my dear indeed ? And did [they]2434-they speak to [you]2124-my dear ? "[77-catherine]

" Yes , [we]2429-we walked along [the Crescent]2432-the crescent together for half an hour . [They]2434-they seem [very agreeable people]2436-very agreeable people . [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney was in a very pretty spotted muslin , and [I]77-catherine fancy , by what [I]77-catherine can learn , that [she]95-miss tilney always dresses very handsomely . [Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes talked to [me]77-catherine a great deal about [the family]457-the family . "[77-catherine]

" And what did [she]128-mrs. hughes tell [you]2124-my dear of [them]457-the family ? "[77-catherine]

" Oh ! A vast deal indeed ; [she]128-mrs. hughes hardly talked of anything else . "[77-catherine]

" Did [she]128-mrs. hughes tell [you]2124-my dear what part of [Gloucestershire]9-gloucestershire [they]457-the family come from ? "[77-catherine]

" Yes , [she]128-mrs. hughes did ; but [I]77-catherine can not recollect now . But [they]457-the family are [very good kind of people]2438-very good kind of people , and very rich . [Mrs. Tilney]133-mrs. tilney was [a Miss Drummond]134-a miss drummond , and [she]133-mrs. tilney and [Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes were [schoolfellows]2439-schoolfellows ; and [Miss Drummond]134-a miss drummond had a very large fortune ; and , when [she]134-a miss drummond married , [[her]134-a miss drummond father]188-her father gave [her]134-a miss drummond twenty thousand pounds , and five hundred to buy wedding - clothes . [Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes saw all the clothes after [they]457-the family came from [the warehouse]2441-the warehouse . "[77-catherine]

" And are [Mr.]2442-mr. and [Mrs. Tilney]133-mrs. tilney in [Bath]5-bath ? "[77-catherine]

" Yes , [I]77-catherine fancy [they]457-the family are , but [I]77-catherine am not quite certain . Upon recollection , however , [I]77-catherine have a notion [they]457-the family are both dead ; at least [the mother]425-the mother is ; yes , [I]77-catherine am sure [Mrs. Tilney]133-mrs. tilney is dead , because [Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes told [me]77-catherine there was a very beautiful set of pearls that [Mr. Drummond]135-mr. drummond gave [[his]135-mr. drummond daughter]2444-his daughter on [her]2444-his daughter wedding - day and that [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney has got now , for [they]457-the family were put by for [her]2444-his daughter when [[her]2444-his daughter mother]194-her mother died . "[77-catherine]

" And is [Mr. Tilney]98-henry , [[my]77-catherine partner]2446-my partner , [the only son]2447-the only son ? "[77-catherine]

" [I]77-catherine can not be quite positive about that , [[my]77-catherine dear]2124-my dear ; [I]77-catherine have some idea [he]98-henry is ; but , however , [he]98-henry is [a very fine young man]2449-a very fine young man , [Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes says , and likely to do very well . "[77-catherine]

[Catherine]77-catherine inquired no further ; [she]77-catherine had heard enough to feel that [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen had no real intelligence to give , and that [she]77-catherine was most particularly unfortunate [herself]77-catherine in having missed such a meeting with [both brother]720-both brother and [sister]721-sister . Could [she]77-catherine have foreseen such a circumstance , nothing should have persuaded [her]77-catherine to go out with [the others]2220-the others ; and , as it was , [she]77-catherine could only lament [her]77-catherine ill luck , and think over what [she]77-catherine had lost , till it was clear to [her]77-catherine that the drive had by no means been very pleasant and that [John Thorpe]103-john [himself]103-john was quite disagreeable .

CHAPTER 10

[The Allens]109-the allens , [Thorpes]107-the thorpes , and [Morlands]79-the morlands all met in the evening at [the theatre]2151-the theatre ; and , as [Catherine]77-catherine and [Isabella]106-isabella sat together , there was then an opportunity for [the latter]562-the latter to utter some few of the many thousand things which had been collecting within [her]562-the latter for communication in the immeasurable length of time which had divided [them]725-them . " Oh , heavens ! [[My]562-the latter beloved]2450-my beloved [Catherine]77-catherine , have [I]562-the latter got [you]77-catherine at last ? "[562-the latter] was [her]562-the latter address on [Catherine]77-catherine s entering the box and sitting by [her]77-catherine . " Now , [Mr. Morland]108-james , "[726-i] for [he]726-i was close to [her]77-catherine on the other side , " [I]726-i shall not speak another word to [you]77-catherine all the rest of the evening ; so [I]726-i charge [you]77-catherine not to expect it . [My]726-i sweetest [Catherine]77-catherine , how have [you]77-catherine been this long age ? But [I]726-i need not ask [you]77-catherine , for [you]77-catherine look delightfully . [You]77-catherine really have done [your]77-catherine hair in a more heavenly style than ever ; [you]77-catherine mischievous creature , do [you]77-catherine want to attract [everybody]326-everybody ? [I]726-i assure [you]77-catherine , [[my]726-i brother]2282-my brother is quite in love with [you]77-catherine already ; and as for [Mr. Tilney]98-henry but _ that _ is a settled thing even _ [your]77-catherine _ modesty can not doubt [his]98-henry attachment now ; [his]98-henry coming back to [Bath]5-bath makes it too plain . Oh ! What would not [I]726-i give to see [him]98-henry ! [I]726-i really am quite wild with impatience . [[My]726-i mother]2453-my mother says [he]98-henry is [the most delightful young man in [the world]197-the world]2454-the most delightful young man in the world ; [she]2453-my mother saw [him]98-henry this morning , [you]77-catherine know ; [you]77-catherine must introduce [him]98-henry to [me]726-i . Is [he]98-henry in [the house]216-the house now ? Look about , for heaven s sake ! [I]726-i assure [you]77-catherine , [I]726-i can hardly exist till [I]726-i see [him]98-henry . "[726-i]

" No , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , " [he]98-henry is not [here]2128-here ; [I]77-catherine can not see [him]98-henry anywhere . "[77-catherine]

" Oh , horrid ! Am [I]726-i never to be acquainted with [him]98-henry ? How do [you]77-catherine like [my]726-i gown ? [I]726-i think it does not look amiss ; the sleeves were entirely [my]726-i own thought . Do [you]77-catherine know , [I]726-i get so immoderately sick of Bath ; [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother and [I]726-i were agreeing this morning that , though it is vastly well to be [here]2128-here for a few weeks , [we]2460-we would not live [here]2128-here for millions . [We]2460-we soon found out that [our]2460-we tastes were exactly alike in preferring [the country]224-the country to [every other place]2463-every other place ; really , [our]2460-we opinions were so exactly the same , it was quite ridiculous ! There was not a single point in which [we]2460-we differed ; [I]726-i would not have had [you]77-catherine by for [the world]197-the world ; [you]77-catherine are such a sly thing , [I]726-i am sure [you]77-catherine would have made some droll remark or other about it . "[726-i]

" No , indeed [I]77-catherine should not . "[77-catherine]

" Oh , yes [you]77-catherine would indeed ; [I]726-i know [you]77-catherine better than [you]77-catherine know [yourself]77-catherine . [You]77-catherine would have told [us]2460-we that [we]2460-we seemed born for [each other]338-each other , or some nonsense of that kind , which would have distressed [me]726-i beyond conception ; [my]726-i cheeks would have been as red as [your]77-catherine roses ; [I]726-i would not have had [you]77-catherine by for [the world]197-the world . "[726-i]

" Indeed [you]77-catherine do [me]77-catherine injustice ; [I]77-catherine would not have made so improper a remark upon any account ; and besides , [I]77-catherine am sure it would never have entered [my]77-catherine head . "[77-catherine]

[Isabella]106-isabella smiled incredulously and talked the rest of the evening to [James]108-james .

[Catherine]77-catherine s resolution of endeavouring to meet [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney again continued in full force the next morning ; and till the usual moment of going to [the pump - room]364-the pump - room , [she]77-catherine felt some alarm from the dread of a second prevention . But nothing of that kind occurred , [no visitors]728-no visitors appeared to delay [them]729-their , and [they]729-their all three set off in good time for [the pump - room]364-the pump - room , where the ordinary course of events and conversation took place ; [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen , after drinking [his]89-mr. allen glass of water , joined [some gentlemen]731-some gentlemen to talk over the politics of the day and compare the accounts of [their]731-some gentlemen newspapers ; and [the ladies]320-the ladies walked about together , noticing every new face , and almost every new bonnet in [the room]308-the room . [The female part of [the Thorpe family]735-the thorpe family]734-the female part of the thorpe family , attended by [James Morland]108-james , appeared among [the crowd]305-the crowd in less than a quarter of an hour , and [Catherine]77-catherine immediately took [her]77-catherine usual place by the side of [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend . [James]108-james , who was now in constant attendance , maintained a similar position , and separating [themselves]729-their from the rest of [[their]729-their party]635-their party , [they]729-their walked in that manner for some time , till [Catherine]77-catherine began to doubt the happiness of a situation which , confining [her]77-catherine entirely to [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend and [brother]2303-brother , gave [her]77-catherine very little share in the notice of either . [They]729-their were always engaged in some sentimental discussion or lively dispute , but [their]729-their sentiment was conveyed in such whispering voices , and [their]729-their vivacity attended with so much laughter , that though [Catherine]77-catherine s supporting opinion was not unfrequently called for by one or [the other]413-the other , [she]77-catherine was never able to give any , from not having heard a word of the subject . At length however [she]77-catherine was empowered to disengage [herself]77-catherine from [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend , by the avowed necessity of speaking to [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , whom [she]77-catherine most joyfully saw just entering [the room]308-the room with [Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes , and whom [she]77-catherine instantly joined , with a firmer determination to be acquainted , than [she]77-catherine might have had courage to command , had [she]77-catherine not been urged by the disappointment of the day before . [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney met [her]77-catherine with great civility , returned [her]77-catherine advances with equal goodwill , and [they]729-their continued talking together as long as [both parties]744-both parties remained in [the room]308-the room ; and though in all probability not an observation was made , nor an expression used by either which had not been made and used some thousands of times before , under that roof , in every Bath season , yet the merit of [their]729-their being spoken with simplicity and truth , and without personal conceit , might be something uncommon .

" How well [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother dances ! "[77-catherine] was an artless exclamation of [Catherine]77-catherine s towards the close of [their]729-their conversation , which at once surprised and amused [[her]77-catherine companion]687-her companion .

" [Henry]98-henry ! "[77-catherine] [she]77-catherine replied with a smile . " Yes , [he]98-henry does dance very well . "[77-catherine]

" [He]98-henry must have thought it very odd to hear [me]95-miss tilney say [I]95-miss tilney was engaged the other evening , when [he]98-henry saw [me]95-miss tilney sitting down . But [I]95-miss tilney really had been engaged the whole day to [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe . "[95-miss tilney] [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney could only bow . " [You]687-her companion can not think , "[77-catherine] added [Catherine]77-catherine after a moment s silence , " how surprised [I]77-catherine was to see [him]98-henry again . [I]77-catherine felt so sure of [his]98-henry being quite gone away . "[77-catherine]

" When [Henry]98-henry had the pleasure of seeing [you]77-catherine before , [he]98-henry was in [Bath]2155-bath but for a couple of days . [He]98-henry came only to engage lodgings for [us]2469-us . "[77-catherine]

" _ That _ never occurred to [me]77-catherine ; and of course , not seeing [him]98-henry anywhere , [I]77-catherine thought [he]98-henry must be gone . Was not [the young lady [he]98-henry danced with]2470-the young lady he danced with on Monday a [Miss Smith]136-miss smith ? "[77-catherine]

" Yes , [an acquaintance of [Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes]2471-an acquaintance of mrs. hughes . "[77-catherine]

" [I]77-catherine dare say [she]2470-the young lady he danced with was very glad to dance . Do [you]77-catherine think [her]2470-the young lady he danced with pretty ? "[77-catherine]

" Not very . "[77-catherine]

" [He]98-henry never comes to [the pump - room]364-the pump - room , [I]77-catherine suppose ? "[77-catherine]

" Yes , sometimes ; but [he]98-henry has rid out this morning with [[my]77-catherine father]2473-my father . "[77-catherine]

[Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes now joined [them]747-we , and asked [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney if [she]95-miss tilney was ready to go . " [I]77-catherine hope [I]77-catherine shall have the pleasure of seeing [you]77-catherine again soon , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine . " Shall [you]77-catherine be at the cotillion ball tomorrow ? "[77-catherine]

" Perhaps [we]747-we Yes , [I]747-we think [we]747-we certainly shall . "[747-we]

" [I]77-catherine am glad of it , for [we]747-we shall all be there . "[77-catherine] This civility was duly returned ; and [they]747-we parted on [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney s side with some knowledge of [her]95-miss tilney new acquaintance s feelings , and on [Catherine]77-catherine s , without the smallest consciousness of having explained [them]747-we .

[She]77-catherine went [home]2339-home very happy . The morning had answered all [her]77-catherine hopes , and the evening of the following day was now the object of expectation , the future good . What gown and what head - dress [she]77-catherine should wear on the occasion became [her]77-catherine chief concern . [She]77-catherine can not be justified in it . Dress is at all times a frivolous distinction , and excessive solicitude about it often destroys its own aim . [Catherine]77-catherine knew all this very well ; [[her]77-catherine great aunt]749-her great aunt had read [her]77-catherine a lecture on the subject only the Christmas before ; and yet [she]77-catherine lay awake ten minutes on Wednesday night debating between [her]77-catherine spotted and [her]77-catherine tamboured muslin , and nothing but the shortness of the time prevented [her]77-catherine buying a new one for the evening . This would have been an error in judgment , great though not uncommon , from which one of the other sex rather than [her]77-catherine own , [a brother]750-a brother rather than [a great aunt]751-a great aunt , might have warned [her]77-catherine , for [man]752-man only can be aware of the insensibility of [man]752-man towards a new gown . It would be mortifying to the feelings of [many ladies]754-many ladies , could [they]754-many ladies be made to understand how little the heart of [man]752-man is affected by what is costly or new in [their]754-many ladies attire ; how little it is biased by the texture of [their]754-many ladies muslin , and how unsusceptible of peculiar tenderness towards the spotted , the sprigged , the mull , or the jackonet . [Woman]756-woman is fine for [her]756-woman own satisfaction alone . [No man]757-no man will admire [her]756-woman the more , [no woman]758-no woman will like [her]756-woman the better for it . Neatness and fashion are enough for the former , and a something of shabbiness or impropriety will be most endearing to [the latter]562-the latter . But not one of these grave reflections troubled the tranquillity of [Catherine]77-catherine .

[She]77-catherine entered [the rooms]2123-the rooms on Thursday evening with feelings very different from what had attended [her]77-catherine thither the Monday before . [She]77-catherine had then been exulting in [her]77-catherine engagement to [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe , and was now chiefly anxious to avoid [his]122-mr. thorpe sight , lest [he]122-mr. thorpe should engage [her]77-catherine again ; for though [she]77-catherine could not , dared not expect that [Mr. Tilney]98-henry should ask [her]77-catherine a third time to dance , [her]77-catherine wishes , hopes , and plans all centred in nothing less . [Every young lady]761-every young lady may feel for [[my]0-i heroine]762-my heroine in this critical moment , for [every young lady]761-every young lady has at some time or other known the same agitation . All have been , or at least all have believed [themselves]764-they to be , in danger from the pursuit of [someone whom [they]764-they wished to avoid]765-someone whom they wished to avoid ; and all have been anxious for the attentions of [someone whom [they]764-they wished to please]766-someone whom they wished to please . As soon as [they]764-they were joined by [the Thorpes]107-the thorpes , [Catherine]77-catherine s agony began ; [she]77-catherine fidgeted about if [John Thorpe]103-john came towards [her]77-catherine , hid [herself]77-catherine as much as possible from [his]98-henry view , and when [he]98-henry spoke to [her]77-catherine pretended not to hear [him]98-henry . The cotillions were over , the country - dancing beginning , and [she]77-catherine saw nothing of [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys .

" Do not be frightened , [[my]106-isabella dear]2124-my dear [Catherine]77-catherine , "[106-isabella] whispered [Isabella]106-isabella , " but [I]106-isabella am really going to dance with [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother again . [I]106-isabella declare positively it is quite shocking . [I]106-isabella tell [him]2331-your brother [he]2331-your brother ought to be ashamed of [himself]2331-your brother , but [you]77-catherine and [John]103-john must keep [us]2476-us in countenance . Make haste , [[my]106-isabella dear creature]2330-my dear creature , and come to [us]2476-us . [John]103-john is just walked off , but [he]2331-your brother will be back in a moment . "[106-isabella]

[Catherine]77-catherine had neither time nor inclination to answer . [The others]2220-the others walked away , [John Thorpe]103-john was still in view , and [she]77-catherine gave [herself]77-catherine up for lost . That [she]77-catherine might not appear , however , to observe or expect [him]103-john , [she]77-catherine kept [her]77-catherine eyes intently fixed on [her]77-catherine fan ; and a self - condemnation for [her]77-catherine folly , in supposing that among [such a crowd]2136-such a crowd [they]769-they should even meet with [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys in any reasonable time , had just passed through [her]77-catherine mind , when [she]77-catherine suddenly found [herself]77-catherine addressed and again solicited to dance , by [Mr. Tilney]98-henry [himself]98-henry . With what sparkling eyes and ready motion [she]77-catherine granted [his]98-henry request , and with how pleasing a flutter of heart [she]77-catherine went with [him]98-henry to the set , may be easily imagined . To escape , and , as [she]77-catherine believed , so narrowly escape [John Thorpe]103-john , and to be asked , so immediately on [his]103-john joining [her]77-catherine , asked by [Mr. Tilney]98-henry , as if [he]98-henry had sought [her]77-catherine on purpose ! it did not appear to [her]77-catherine that life could supply any greater felicity .

Scarcely had [they]769-they worked [themselves]769-they into the quiet possession of [a place]2337-a place , however , when [her]77-catherine attention was claimed by [John Thorpe]103-john , who stood behind [her]77-catherine . " Heyday , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland ! "[103-john] said [he]103-john . " What is the meaning of this ? [I]103-john thought [you]90-miss morland and [I]103-john were to dance together . "[103-john]

" [I]77-catherine wonder [you]103-john should think so , for [you]103-john never asked [me]77-catherine . "[77-catherine]

" That is a good one , by [Jove]138-jove ! [I]103-john asked [you]90-miss morland as soon as [I]103-john came into [the room]308-the room , and [I]103-john was just going to ask [you]90-miss morland again , but when [I]103-john turned round , [you]90-miss morland were gone ! This is a cursed shabby trick ! [I]103-john only came for the sake of dancing with _ [you]90-miss morland _ , and [I]103-john firmly believe [you]90-miss morland were engaged to [me]103-john ever since Monday . Yes ; [I]103-john remember , [I]103-john asked [you]90-miss morland while [you]90-miss morland were waiting in [the lobby]2479-the lobby for [your]90-miss morland cloak . And here have [I]103-john been telling all [my]103-john acquaintance that [I]103-john was going to dance with [the prettiest girl in [the room]308-the room]2480-the prettiest girl in the room ; and when [they]2482-they see [you]90-miss morland standing up with [somebody else]2483-somebody else , [they]2482-they will quiz [me]103-john famously . "[103-john]

" Oh , no ; [they]2482-they will never think of _ [me]77-catherine _ , after such a description as that . "[77-catherine]

"[77-catherine] [Catherine]77-catherine satisfied [his]771-i curiosity . " [Tilney]98-henry , "[771-i] [he]771-i repeated . " [Hum]139-hum [I]771-i do not know [him]98-henry . [A good figure of a man]2485-a good figure of a man ; well put together . Does [he]98-henry want a horse ? Here is [a friend of [mine]77-catherine]2291-a friend of mine , [Sam Fletcher]140-sam fletcher , has got one to sell that would suit [anybody]198-anybody . A famous clever animal for [the road]2488-the road only forty guineas . [I]771-i had fifty minds to buy it [myself]771-i , for it is one of [my]771-i maxims always to buy a good horse when [I]771-i meet with [one]2210-one ; but it would not answer [my]771-i purpose , it would not do for the field . [I]771-i would give any money for [a real good hunter]2490-a real good hunter . [I]771-i have three now , the best that ever were backed . [I]771-i would not take eight hundred guineas for [them]2491-them . [Fletcher]140-sam fletcher and [I]771-i mean to get [a house in [Leicestershire]35-leicestershire]2492-a house in leicestershire , against the next season . It is so d uncomfortable , living at [an inn]286-an inn . "[771-i]

This was the last sentence by which [he]772-he could weary [Catherine]77-catherine s attention , for [he]772-he was just then borne off by the resistless pressure of a long string of [passing ladies]773-passing ladies . [[Her]77-catherine partner]393-her partner now drew near , and said , " [That gentleman]640-that gentleman would have put [me]393-her partner out of patience , had [he]640-that gentleman stayed with [you]77-catherine half a minute longer . [He]640-that gentleman has no business to withdraw the attention of [[my]393-her partner partner]2446-my partner from [me]393-her partner . [We]2496-we have entered into a contract of mutual agreeableness for the space of an evening , and all [our]2496-we agreeableness belongs solely to [each other]338-each other for that time . [Nobody]2139-nobody can fasten [themselves]2139-nobody on the notice of one , without injuring the rights of the other . [I]393-her partner consider a country - dance as an emblem of marriage . Fidelity and complaisance are the principal duties of both ; and [those men who do not choose to dance or marry]2499-those men who do not choose to dance or marry [themselves]2499-those men who do not choose to dance or marry , have no business with [the partners or wives of [[their]2499-those men who do not choose to dance or marry neighbours]341-their neighbours]2500-the partners or wives of their neighbours . "[393-her partner]

" But [they]2502-their are such very different things ! "[393-her partner]

" That [you]393-her partner think [they]2502-their can not be compared together . "[393-her partner]

" To be sure not . [People that marry]2503-people that marry can never part , but must go and keep [house]2504-house together . [People that dance]2505-people that dance only stand opposite each other in [a long room]2506-a long room for half an hour . "[393-her partner]

" And such is [your]393-her partner definition of matrimony and dancing . Taken in that light certainly , [their]2502-their resemblance is not striking ; but [I]393-her partner think [I]393-her partner could place [them]2502-their in such a view . [You]393-her partner will allow , that in both , [man]752-man has the advantage of choice , [woman]756-woman only the power of refusal ; that in both , it is an engagement between [man]752-man and [woman]756-woman , formed for the advantage of each ; and that when once entered into , [they]2502-their belong exclusively to [each other]338-each other till the moment of its dissolution ; that it is [their]2502-their duty , each to endeavour to give [the other]413-the other no cause for wishing that [he]752-man or [she]2513-she had bestowed [themselves]2502-their elsewhere , and [their]2502-their best interest to keep [their]2502-their own imaginations from wandering towards the perfections of [[their]2502-their neighbours]341-their neighbours , or fancying that [they]2502-their should have been better off with [anyone else]2515-anyone else . [You]393-her partner will allow all this ? "[393-her partner]

" Yes , to be sure , as [you]393-her partner state it , all this sounds very well ; but still they are so very different . [I]393-her partner can not look upon [them]2502-their at all in the same light , nor think the same duties belong to [them]2502-their . "[393-her partner]

" In one respect , there certainly is a difference . In marriage , [the man]2516-the man is supposed to provide for the support of [the woman]2517-the woman , [the woman]2517-the woman to make [the home]2519-the home agreeable to [the man]2516-the man ; [he]2516-the man is to purvey , and [she]2517-the woman is to smile . But in dancing , [their]2502-their duties are exactly changed ; the agreeableness , the compliance are expected from [him]2516-the man , while [she]2517-the woman furnishes the fan and the lavender water . _ That _ , [I]393-her partner suppose , was the difference of duties which struck [you]393-her partner , as rendering the conditions incapable of comparison . "[393-her partner]

" No , indeed , [I]393-her partner never thought of that . "[393-her partner]

" Then [I]393-her partner am quite at a loss . One thing , however , [I]393-her partner must observe . This disposition on [your]393-her partner side is rather alarming . [You]393-her partner totally disallow any similarity in the obligations ; and may [I]393-her partner not thence infer that [your]393-her partner notions of the duties of the dancing state are not so strict as [[your]393-her partner partner]2211-your partner might wish ? Have [I]393-her partner not reason to fear that if [the gentleman who spoke to [you]393-her partner just now were to return , or if [any other gentleman]2523-any other gentleman were to address [you]393-her partner]2522-the gentleman who spoke to you just now were to return , or if any other gentleman were to address you , there would be nothing to restrain [you]393-her partner from conversing with [him]2516-the man as long as [you]393-her partner chose ? "[393-her partner]

" [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe is such [a very particular friend of [[my]393-her partner brother]2282-my brother s]2524-a very particular friend of my brother s , that if [he]122-mr. thorpe talks to [me]393-her partner , [I]393-her partner must talk to [him]122-mr. thorpe again ; but there are [hardly three young men in [the room]308-the room besides [him]122-mr. thorpe that [I]393-her partner have any acquaintance with]2526-hardly three young men in the room besides him that i have any acquaintance with . "[393-her partner]

" And is that to be [my]393-her partner only security ? Alas , alas ! "[393-her partner]

"[393-her partner]

" Now [you]393-her partner have given [me]393-her partner a security worth having ; and [I]393-her partner shall proceed with courage . Do [you]393-her partner find [Bath]5-bath as agreeable as when [I]393-her partner had the honour of making the inquiry before ? "[393-her partner]

" Yes , quite more so , indeed . "[393-her partner]

" More so ! Take care , or [you]393-her partner will forget to be tired of it at the proper time . [You]393-her partner ought to be tired at the end of six weeks . "[393-her partner]

" [Bath]2155-bath , compared with [London]12-london , has little variety , and so [everybody]326-everybody finds out every year . "[393-her partner]

" Well , [other people]229-other people must judge for [themselves]229-other people , and [those who go to [London]12-london]2536-those who go to london may think nothing of [Bath]5-bath . But [I]393-her partner , who live in [a small retired village in [the country]224-the country]2537-a small retired village in the country , can never find greater sameness in such a place as this than in [[my]393-her partner own home]2539-my own home ; for here are a variety of amusements , a variety of things to be seen and done all day long , which [I]393-her partner can know nothing of there . "[393-her partner]

" [You]393-her partner are not fond of [the country]224-the country . "[393-her partner]

" But then [you]393-her partner spend [your]393-her partner time so much more rationally in [the country]224-the country . "[393-her partner]

" And so [I]393-her partner am at [home]2339-home only [I]393-her partner do not find so much of it . "[393-her partner]

[Mr. Tilney]98-henry was very much amused .

" Oh ! Yes . [I]777-the lookers - on shall never be in want of something to talk of again to [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , or anybody else . [James]108-james s coming ( [[my]777-the lookers - on eldest brother]2552-my eldest brother ) is quite delightful and especially as it turns out that [the very family [we]2554-we are just got so intimate with]2553-the very family we are just got so intimate with are [[his]108-james intimate friends]2555-his intimate friends already . " Not those who bring such fresh feelings of every sort to it as [you]77-catherine do . "[98-henry] Here [their]775-their conversation closed , the demands of the dance becoming now too importunate for a divided attention .

Soon after [their]775-their reaching the bottom of the set , [Catherine]77-catherine perceived [herself]77-catherine to be earnestly regarded by [a gentleman who stood among [the lookers - on]777-the lookers - on , immediately behind [[her]77-catherine partner]393-her partner]776-a gentleman who stood among the lookers - on , immediately behind her partner . Confused by [his]776-a gentleman who stood among the lookers - on , immediately behind her partner notice , and blushing from the fear of its being excited by something wrong in [her]77-catherine appearance , [she]77-catherine turned away [her]77-catherine head . But while [she]77-catherine did so , [the gentleman]387-the gentleman retreated , and [[her]77-catherine partner]393-her partner , coming nearer , said , " [I]393-her partner see that [you]77-catherine guess what [I]393-her partner have just been asked . [That gentleman]640-that gentleman knows [your]77-catherine name , and [you]77-catherine have a right to know [his]640-that gentleman . It is [General Tilney]143-general tilney , [[my]393-her partner father]2473-my father . "[393-her partner]

[Catherine]77-catherine s answer was only " Oh ! "[77-catherine] but it was an " Oh ! "[783-the general] expressing everything needful : attention to [his]776-a gentleman who stood among the lookers - on , immediately behind her partner words , and perfect reliance on [their]782-their truth . With real interest and strong admiration did [her]77-catherine eye now follow [the general]783-the general , as [he]783-the general moved through [the crowd]305-the crowd , and " How handsome [a family]2563-a family [they]785-the commonly frequented environs are ! "[783-the general] was [her]77-catherine secret remark .

In chatting with [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney before the evening concluded , a new source of felicity arose to [her]77-catherine . [She]77-catherine had never taken a country walk since [her]77-catherine arrival in [Bath]5-bath . [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , to whom all [the commonly frequented environs]785-the commonly frequented environs were familiar , spoke of [them]785-the commonly frequented environs in terms which made [her]77-catherine all eagerness to know [them]785-the commonly frequented environs too ; and on [her]77-catherine openly fearing that [she]77-catherine might find [nobody]2139-nobody to go with [her]77-catherine , it was proposed by [the brother and sister]787-the brother and sister that [they]787-the brother and sister should join in a walk , some morning or other . " [I]77-catherine shall like it , "[77-catherine] [she]77-catherine cried , " beyond anything in [the world]197-the world ; and do not let [us]787-the brother and sister put it off let [us]787-the brother and sister go tomorrow . "[77-catherine] This was readily agreed to , with only a proviso of [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney s , that it did not rain , which [Catherine]77-catherine was sure it would not . At twelve o clock , [they]787-the brother and sister were to call for [her]77-catherine in [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street ; and " Remember twelve o clock , "[787-the brother and sister] was [her]77-catherine parting speech to [[her]77-catherine new friend]436-her new friend . Of [her]77-catherine other , [her]77-catherine older , [[her]77-catherine more established friend]789-her more established friend , [Isabella]106-isabella , of whose fidelity and worth [she]77-catherine had enjoyed a fortnight s experience , [she]77-catherine scarcely saw anything during the evening . Yet , though longing to make [her]77-catherine acquainted with [her]77-catherine happiness , [she]77-catherine cheerfully submitted to the wish of [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen , which took [them]787-the brother and sister rather early away , and [her]77-catherine spirits danced within [her]77-catherine , as [she]77-catherine danced in [her]77-catherine chair all the way [home]2339-home .

CHAPTER 11

The morrow brought a very sober - looking morning , the sun making only a few efforts to appear , and [Catherine]77-catherine augured from it everything most favourable to [her]77-catherine wishes . A bright morning so early in the year , [she]77-catherine allowed , would generally turn to rain , but a cloudy one foretold improvement as the day advanced . [She]77-catherine applied to [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen for confirmation of [her]77-catherine hopes , but [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen , not having [his]89-mr. allen own skies and barometer about [him]89-mr. allen , declined giving any absolute promise of sunshine . [She]77-catherine applied to [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen s opinion was more positive . " [She]77-catherine had no doubt in [the world]197-the world of its being a very fine day , if the clouds would only go off , and the sun keep out . "[91-mrs. allen]

At about eleven o clock , however , a few specks of small rain upon the windows caught [Catherine]77-catherine s watchful eye , and " Oh ! dear , [I]77-catherine do believe it will be wet , "[77-catherine] broke from [her]77-catherine in a most desponding tone .

" [I]91-mrs. allen thought how it would be , "[91-mrs. allen] said [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen .

" No walk for [me]77-catherine today , "[77-catherine] sighed [Catherine]77-catherine ; " but perhaps it may come to nothing , or it may hold up before twelve . "[77-catherine]

" Perhaps it may , but then , [[my]77-catherine dear]2124-my dear , it will be so dirty . "[77-catherine]

" Oh ! That will not signify ; [I]77-catherine never mind dirt . "[77-catherine]

" No , "[313-her friend] replied [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend very placidly , " [I]313-her friend know [you]77-catherine never mind dirt . "[313-her friend]

After a short pause , " It comes on faster and faster ! "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , as [she]77-catherine stood watching at a window .

" So it does indeed . If it keeps raining , [the streets]2567-the streets will be very wet . "[77-catherine]

" There are four umbrellas up already . How [I]77-catherine hate the sight of an umbrella ! "[77-catherine]

" They are disagreeable things to carry . [I]77-catherine would much rather take a chair at any time . "[77-catherine]

" It was such a nice - looking morning ! [I]77-catherine felt so convinced it would be dry ! "[77-catherine]

" [Anybody]198-anybody would have thought so indeed . There will be [very few people]2569-very few people in [the pump - room]364-the pump - room , if it rains all the morning . [I]77-catherine hope [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen will put on [his]89-mr. allen greatcoat when [he]89-mr. allen goes , but [I]77-catherine dare say [he]89-mr. allen will not , for [he]89-mr. allen had rather do anything in [the world]197-the world than walk out in a greatcoat ; [I]77-catherine wonder [he]89-mr. allen should dislike it , it must be so comfortable . "[77-catherine]

The rain continued fast , though not heavy . [Catherine]77-catherine went every five minutes to the clock , threatening on each return that , if it still kept on raining another five minutes , [she]77-catherine would give up the matter as hopeless . The clock struck twelve , and it still rained . " [You]77-catherine will not be able to go , [[my]77-catherine dear]2124-my dear . "[77-catherine]

" [I]77-catherine do not quite despair yet . [I]77-catherine shall not give it up till a quarter after twelve . This is just the time of day for it to clear up , and [I]77-catherine do think it looks a little lighter . There , it is twenty minutes after twelve , and now [I]77-catherine _ shall _ give it up entirely . Oh ! That [we]2573-we had such weather here as [they]2574-they had at [Udolpho]113-udolpho , or at least in [Tuscany]37-tuscany and [the south of [France]38-france]2575-the south of france ! the night that [poor St. Aubin]144-poor st. aubin died ! such beautiful weather ! "[77-catherine]

At half past twelve , when [Catherine]77-catherine s anxious attention to the weather was over and [she]77-catherine could no longer claim any merit from its amendment , the sky began voluntarily to clear . A gleam of sunshine took [her]77-catherine quite by surprise ; [she]77-catherine looked round ; the clouds were parting , and [she]77-catherine instantly returned to the window to watch over and encourage the happy appearance . Ten minutes more made it certain that a bright afternoon would succeed , and justified the opinion of [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , who had " always thought it would clear up . "[91-mrs. allen] But whether [Catherine]77-catherine might still expect [[her]77-catherine friends]792-her friends , whether there had not been too much rain for [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney to venture , must yet be a question .

It was too dirty for [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen to accompany [[her]91-mrs. allen husband]793-her husband to [the pump - room]364-the pump - room ; [he]793-her husband accordingly set off by [himself]793-her husband , and [Catherine]77-catherine had barely watched [him]793-her husband down [the street]447-the street when [her]77-catherine notice was claimed by the approach of [the same two open carriages]796-the same two open carriages , containing [the same three people that had surprised [her]77-catherine so much a few mornings back]797-the same three people that had surprised her so much a few mornings back .

" [Isabella]106-isabella , [[my]91-mrs. allen brother]2282-my brother , and [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe , [I]91-mrs. allen declare ! [They]798-we are coming for [me]91-mrs. allen perhaps but [I]91-mrs. allen shall not go [I]91-mrs. allen can not go indeed , for [you]91-mrs. allen know [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney may still call . "[91-mrs. allen] [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen agreed to it . [John Thorpe]103-john was soon with [them]798-we , and [his]103-john voice was with [them]798-we yet sooner , for on the stairs [he]103-john was calling out to [Miss Morland]90-miss morland to be quick . " Make haste ! Make haste ! "[103-john] as [he]103-john threw open the door . " Put on [your]91-mrs. allen hat this moment there is no time to be lost [we]798-we are going to [Bristol]39-bristol . How d [ye]91-mrs. allen do , [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen ? "[103-john]

" To [Bristol]39-bristol ! Is not that a great way off ? But , however , [I]103-john can not go with [you]91-mrs. allen today , because [I]103-john am engaged ; [I]103-john expect [some friends]2577-some friends every moment . "[103-john] This was of course vehemently talked down as no reason at all ; [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen was called on to second [him]103-john , and [the two others]679-the two others walked in , to give [their]679-the two others assistance . " [My]679-the two others sweetest [Catherine]77-catherine , is not this delightful ? [We]798-we shall have a most heavenly drive . [You]91-mrs. allen are to thank [[your]91-mrs. allen brother]2331-your brother and [me]679-the two others for the scheme ; it darted into [our]798-we heads at breakfast - time , [I]679-the two others verily believe at the same instant ; and [we]798-we should have been off two hours ago if it had not been for this detestable rain . But it does not signify , the nights are moonlight , and [we]798-we shall do delightfully . Oh ! [I]679-the two others am in such ecstasies at the thoughts of a little country air and quiet ! So much better than going to [the Lower Rooms]369-the lower rooms . [We]798-we shall drive directly to [Clifton]40-clifton and dine [there]336-there ; and , as soon as dinner is over , if there is time for it , go on to [Kingsweston]41-kingsweston . "[679-the two others]

" [I]77-catherine doubt [our]798-we being able to do so much , "[77-catherine] said [Morland]77-catherine .

"[122-mr. thorpe]

"[106-isabella]

" [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , [you]77-catherine must persuade [her]95-miss tilney to go , "[91-mrs. allen] was the general cry . "[91-mrs. allen] And in two minutes [they]800-they were off .

[Catherine]77-catherine s feelings , as [she]77-catherine got into [the carriage]559-the carriage , were in a very unsettled state ; divided between regret for the loss of one great pleasure , and the hope of soon enjoying another , almost its equal in degree , however unlike in kind . [She]77-catherine could not think [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys had acted quite well by [her]77-catherine , in so readily giving up [their]137-the tilneys engagement , without sending [her]77-catherine any message of excuse . It was now but an hour later than the time fixed on for the beginning of [their]800-they walk ; and , in spite of what [she]77-catherine had heard of the prodigious accumulation of dirt in the course of that hour , [she]77-catherine could not from [her]77-catherine own observation help thinking that [they]800-they might have gone with very little inconvenience . To feel [herself]77-catherine slighted by [them]800-they was very painful . On the other hand , the delight of exploring [an edifice like [Udolpho]113-udolpho]802-an edifice like udolpho , as [her]77-catherine fancy represented [Blaize Castle]42-blaize castle to be , was such a counterpoise of good as might console [her]77-catherine for almost anything .

[They]800-they passed briskly down [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street , and through [Laura Place]46-laura place , without the exchange of many words . [Thorpe]106-isabella talked to [his]803-his horse , and [she]77-catherine meditated , by turns , on broken promises and broken arches , phaetons and false hangings , Tilneys and trap - doors . As [they]800-they entered [Argyle Buildings]47-argyle buildings , however , [she]77-catherine was roused by this address from [[her]77-catherine companion]687-her companion , " Who is [that girl who looked at [you]106-isabella so hard as [she]2605-that girl who looked at you so hard as she went by went by]2605-that girl who looked at you so hard as she went by ? "[77-catherine]

" Who ? Where ? "[800-they]

" On [the right - hand pavement]2606-the right - hand pavement [she]2605-that girl who looked at you so hard as she went by must be almost out of sight now . "[77-catherine] [Catherine]77-catherine looked round and saw [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney leaning on [[her]95-miss tilney brother]2221-her brother s arm , walking slowly down [the street]447-the street . [She]77-catherine saw [them]800-they both looking back at [her]77-catherine . " Stop , stop , [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe , "[77-catherine] [she]77-catherine impatiently cried ; " it is [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney ; it is indeed . How could [you]122-mr. thorpe tell [me]77-catherine [they]800-they were gone ? Stop , stop , [I]77-catherine will get out this moment and go to [them]800-they . "[77-catherine] But to what purpose did [she]77-catherine speak ? [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe only lashed [his]122-mr. thorpe horse into a brisker trot ; [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys , who had soon ceased to look after [her]77-catherine , were in a moment out of sight round [the corner of [Laura Place]46-laura place]807-the corner of laura place , and in another moment [she]77-catherine was [herself]77-catherine whisked into [the marketplace]808-the marketplace . Still , however , and during the length of [another street]809-another street , [she]77-catherine entreated [him]122-mr. thorpe to stop . " Pray , pray stop , [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe . [I]77-catherine can not go on . [I]77-catherine will not go on . [I]77-catherine must go back to [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney . "[77-catherine] But [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe only laughed , smacked [his]122-mr. thorpe whip , encouraged [his]122-mr. thorpe horse , made odd noises , and drove on ; and [Catherine]77-catherine , angry and vexed as [she]77-catherine was , having no power of getting away , was obliged to give up the point and submit . [Her]77-catherine reproaches , however , were not spared . " How could [you]122-mr. thorpe deceive [me]122-mr. thorpe so , [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe ? How could [you]122-mr. thorpe say that [you]122-mr. thorpe saw [them]2607-them driving up [the Lansdown Road]44-the lansdown road ? [I]122-mr. thorpe would not have had it happen so for [the world]197-the world . [They]2607-them must think it so strange , so rude of [me]122-mr. thorpe ! To go by [them]2607-them , too , without saying a word ! [You]122-mr. thorpe do not know how vexed [I]122-mr. thorpe am ; [I]122-mr. thorpe shall have no pleasure at [Clifton]40-clifton , nor in anything else . [I]122-mr. thorpe had rather , ten thousand times rather , get out now , and walk back to [them]2607-them . How could [you]122-mr. thorpe say [you]122-mr. thorpe saw [them]2607-them driving out in a phaeton ? "[122-mr. thorpe] [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe defended [himself]122-mr. thorpe very stoutly , declared [he]122-mr. thorpe had never seen [two men]810-two men so much alike in [his]122-mr. thorpe life , and would hardly give up the point of its having been [Tilney]95-miss tilney [himself]95-miss tilney .

[Their]810-two men drive , even when this subject was over , was not likely to be very agreeable . [Catherine]77-catherine s complaisance was no longer what it had been in [their]810-two men former airing . [She]77-catherine listened reluctantly , and [her]77-catherine replies were short . [Blaize Castle]42-blaize castle remained [her]77-catherine only comfort ; towards _ that _ , [she]77-catherine still looked at intervals with pleasure ; though rather than be disappointed of the promised walk , and especially rather than be thought ill of by [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys , [she]77-catherine would willingly have given up all the happiness which [its]42-blaize castle walls could supply the happiness of a progress through [a long suite of lofty rooms]811-a long suite of lofty rooms , exhibiting the remains of magnificent furniture , though now for many years deserted the happiness of being stopped in [their]810-two men way along [narrow , winding vaults]812-narrow , winding vaults , by a low , grated door ; or even of having [their]810-two men lamp , [their]810-two men only lamp , extinguished by a sudden gust of wind , and of being left in total darkness . In the meanwhile , [they]810-two men proceeded on [their]810-two men journey without any mischance , and were within view of [the town of Keynsham]813-the town of keynsham , when a halloo from [Morland]77-catherine , who was behind [them]810-two men , made [[his]814-his friend]557-his friend pull up , to know what was the matter . [The others]2220-the others then came close enough for conversation , and [Morland]77-catherine said , " [We]810-two men had better go back , [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe ; it is too late to go on today ; [[your]122-mr. thorpe sister]2195-your sister thinks so as well as [I.]77-catherine [We]810-two men have been exactly an hour coming from [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street , very little more than seven miles ; and , [I]77-catherine suppose , [we]810-two men have at least eight more to go . It will never do . [We]810-two men set out a great deal too late . [We]810-two men had much better put it off till another day , and turn round . "[77-catherine]

" It is all one to [me]122-mr. thorpe , "[122-mr. thorpe] replied [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe rather angrily ; and instantly turning [his]122-mr. thorpe horse , [they]810-two men were on [their]810-two men way back to [Bath]5-bath .

" If [[your]122-mr. thorpe brother]2331-your brother had not got such a d beast to drive , "[122-mr. thorpe] said [he]122-mr. thorpe soon afterwards , " [we]810-two men might have done it very well .
