[My]122-mr. thorpe horse would have trotted to [Clifton]40-clifton within the hour , if left to [himself]2331-your brother , and [I]122-mr. thorpe have almost broke [my]122-mr. thorpe arm with pulling [him]2331-your brother in to that cursed broken - winded jade s pace . [Morland]77-catherine is a fool for not keeping a horse and gig of [his]2331-your brother own . "[122-mr. thorpe]

" No , [he]2331-your brother is not , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine warmly , " for [I]77-catherine am sure [he]2331-your brother could not afford it . "[77-catherine]

" And why can not [he]2331-your brother afford it ? "[817-people who rolled in money]

" Because [he]2331-your brother has not money enough . "[77-catherine]

" And whose fault is that ? "[817-people who rolled in money]

" [Nobody]2139-nobody s , that [I]77-catherine know of . "[77-catherine] [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe then said something in the loud , incoherent way to which [he]122-mr. thorpe had often recourse , about its being a d thing to be miserly ; and that if [people who rolled in money]817-people who rolled in money could not afford things , [he]122-mr. thorpe did not know who could , which [Catherine]77-catherine did not even endeavour to understand . Disappointed of what was to have been the consolation for [her]77-catherine first disappointment , [she]77-catherine was less and less disposed either to be agreeable [herself]77-catherine or to find [[her]77-catherine companion]687-her companion so ; and [they]819-they returned to [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street without [her]77-catherine speaking twenty words .

As [she]77-catherine entered [the house]216-the house , [the footman]821-the footman told [her]77-catherine that [a gentleman]389-a gentleman and [lady]823-lady had called and inquired for [her]77-catherine a few minutes after [her]77-catherine setting off ; that , when [he]821-the footman told [them]819-they [she]77-catherine was gone out with [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe , [the lady]383-the lady had asked whether any message had been left for [her]77-catherine ; and on [his]821-the footman saying no , had felt for a card , but said [she]77-catherine had none about [her]77-catherine , and went away . Pondering over these heart - rending tidings , [Catherine]77-catherine walked slowly [upstairs]446-upstairs . At the head of [them]819-they [she]77-catherine was met by [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen , who , on hearing the reason of [their]819-they speedy return , said , " [I]89-mr. allen am glad [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother had so much sense ; [I]89-mr. allen am glad [you]77-catherine are come back . It was a strange , wild scheme . "[89-mr. allen]

[They]819-they all spent the evening together at [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe s. [Catherine]77-catherine was disturbed and out of spirits ; but [Isabella]106-isabella seemed to find a pool of commerce , in the fate of which [she]106-isabella shared , by private partnership with [Morland]77-catherine , a very good equivalent for the quiet and country air of [an inn at [Clifton]40-clifton]826-an inn at clifton . [Her]106-isabella satisfaction , too , in not being at [the Lower Rooms]369-the lower rooms was spoken more than once . " How [I]106-isabella pity [the poor creatures that are going there]2613-the poor creatures that are going there ! How glad [I]106-isabella am that [I]106-isabella am not amongst [them]2613-the poor creatures that are going there ! [I]106-isabella wonder whether it will be a full ball or not ! [They]2613-the poor creatures that are going there have not begun dancing yet . [I]106-isabella would not be there for [all the world]2329-all the world . It is so delightful to have an evening now and then to [oneself]2615-oneself . [I]106-isabella dare say it will not be a very good ball . [I]106-isabella know [the Mitchells]2616-the mitchells will not be [there]336-there . [I]106-isabella am sure [I]106-isabella pity [everybody]326-everybody that is . But [I]106-isabella dare say , [Mr. Morland]108-james , [you]108-james long to be at it , do not [you]108-james ? [I]106-isabella am sure [you]108-james do . Well , pray do not let [anybody here]2619-anybody here be a restraint on [you]108-james . [I]106-isabella dare say [we]2620-we could do very well without [you]108-james ; but [[you]108-james men]2352-you men think [yourselves]108-james of such consequence . "[106-isabella]

[Catherine]77-catherine could almost have accused [Isabella]106-isabella of being wanting in tenderness towards [herself]106-isabella and [her]106-isabella sorrows , so very little did [they]828-they appear to dwell on [her]106-isabella mind , and so very inadequate was the comfort [she]106-isabella offered . " Do not be so dull , [[my]77-catherine dearest]2226-my dearest creature , "[77-catherine] [she]77-catherine whispered . " [You]108-james will quite break [my]77-catherine heart . It was amazingly shocking , to be sure ; but [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys were entirely to blame . Why were not [they]137-the tilneys more punctual ? It was dirty , indeed , but what did that signify ? [I]77-catherine am sure [John]103-john and [I]77-catherine should not have minded it . [I]77-catherine never mind going through anything , where [a friend]449-a friend is concerned ; that is [my]77-catherine disposition , and [John]103-john is just the same ; [he]103-john has amazing strong feelings . Good heavens ! What a delightful hand [you]108-james have got ! [Kings]2624-kings , [I]77-catherine vow ! [I]77-catherine never was so happy in [my]77-catherine life ! [I]77-catherine would fifty times rather [you]108-james should have them than [myself]77-catherine . "[77-catherine]

And now [I]0-i may dismiss [[my]0-i heroine]762-my heroine to the sleepless couch , which is [the true heroine]830-the true heroine s portion ; to a pillow strewed with thorns and wet with tears . And lucky may [she]762-my heroine think [herself]762-my heroine , if [she]762-my heroine get another good night s rest in the course of the next three months .

CHAPTER 12

" [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine the next morning , " will there be any harm in [my]77-catherine calling on [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney today ? [I]77-catherine shall not be easy till [I]77-catherine have explained everything . "[77-catherine]

" Go , by all means , [[my]762-my heroine dear]2124-my dear ; only put on a white gown ; [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney always wears white . "[762-my heroine]

[Catherine]77-catherine cheerfully complied , and being properly equipped , was more impatient than ever to be at [the pump - room]364-the pump - room , that [she]77-catherine might inform [herself]77-catherine of [[General Tilney]143-general tilney s lodgings]832-general tilney s lodgings , for though [she]77-catherine believed they were in [Milsom Street]15-milsom street , [she]77-catherine was not certain of [the house]216-the house , and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen s wavering convictions only made it more doubtful . To [Milsom Street]834-milsom street [she]77-catherine was directed , and having made [herself]77-catherine perfect in the number , hastened away with eager steps and a beating heart to pay [her]77-catherine visit , explain [her]77-catherine conduct , and be forgiven ; tripping lightly through [the church - yard]2276-the church - yard , and resolutely turning away [her]77-catherine eyes , that [she]77-catherine might not be obliged to see [[her]77-catherine beloved [Isabella]106-isabella and [[her]77-catherine dear family]837-her dear family , who , [she]77-catherine had reason to believe , were in [a shop hard by]838-a shop hard by]836-her beloved isabella and her dear family , who , she had reason to believe , were in a shop hard by . [She]77-catherine reached [the house]216-the house without any impediment , looked at the number , knocked at the door , and inquired for [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney . [The man]2516-the man believed [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney to be at [home]2339-home , but was not quite certain . Would [she]77-catherine be pleased to send up [her]77-catherine name ? [She]77-catherine gave [her]77-catherine card . In a few minutes [the servant]545-the servant returned , and with a look which did not quite confirm [his]545-the servant words , said [he]545-the servant had been mistaken , for that [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney was walked out . [Catherine]77-catherine , with a blush of mortification , left [the house]216-the house . [She]77-catherine felt almost persuaded that [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney _ was _ at [home]2339-home , and too much offended to admit [her]95-miss tilney ; and as [she]77-catherine retired down [the street]447-the street , could not withhold one glance at the drawing - room windows , in expectation of seeing [her]95-miss tilney [there]336-there , but [no one]366-no one appeared at them . At the bottom of [the street]447-the street , however , [she]77-catherine looked back again , and then , not at a window , but issuing from the door , [she]77-catherine saw [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney [herself]95-miss tilney . [She]77-catherine was followed by [a gentleman , whom [Catherine]77-catherine believed to be [[her]77-catherine father]188-her father , and [they]851-they turned up towards [Edgar s Buildings]28-edgar s buildings]849-a gentleman , whom catherine believed to be her father , and they turned up towards edgar s buildings . [Catherine]77-catherine , in deep mortification , proceeded on [her]77-catherine way . [She]77-catherine could almost be angry [herself]77-catherine at such angry incivility ; but [she]77-catherine checked the resentful sensation ; [she]77-catherine remembered [her]77-catherine own ignorance . [She]77-catherine knew not how such an offence as [hers]77-catherine might be classed by the laws of worldly politeness , to what a degree of unforgivingness it might with propriety lead , nor to what rigours of rudeness in return it might justly make [her]77-catherine amenable .

Dejected and humbled , [she]77-catherine had even some thoughts of not going with [the others]2220-the others to [the theatre]2151-the theatre that night ; but it must be confessed that [they]851-they were not of long continuance , for [she]77-catherine soon recollected , in the first place , that [she]77-catherine was without any excuse for staying at [home]2339-home ; and , in the second , that it was a play [she]77-catherine wanted very much to see . To [the theatre]2151-the theatre accordingly [they]2220-the others all went ; [no Tilneys]856-no tilneys appeared to plague or please [her]77-catherine ; [she]77-catherine feared that , amongst the many perfections of [the family]457-the family , a fondness for plays was not to be ranked ; but perhaps it was because [they]2220-the others were habituated to the finer performances of the [London]12-london stage , which [she]77-catherine knew , on [Isabella]106-isabella s authority , rendered everything else of the kind " quite horrid . "[366-no one] [She]77-catherine was not deceived in [her]77-catherine own expectation of pleasure ; the comedy so well suspended [her]77-catherine care that [no one]366-no one , observing [her]77-catherine during the first four acts , would have supposed [she]77-catherine had any wretchedness about [her]77-catherine . On the beginning of the fifth , however , the sudden view of [Mr. Henry Tilney]98-henry and [[his]98-henry father]859-his father , joining a party in the opposite box , recalled [her]77-catherine to anxiety and distress . [The stage]860-the stage could no longer excite genuine merriment no longer keep [her]77-catherine whole attention . Every other look upon [an average]861-an average was directed towards the opposite box ; and , for the space of two entire scenes , did [she]77-catherine thus watch [Henry Tilney]98-henry , without being once able to catch [his]98-henry eye . No longer could [he]98-henry be suspected of indifference for a play ; [his]98-henry notice was never withdrawn from the stage during two whole scenes . At length , however , [he]98-henry did look towards [her]77-catherine , and [he]98-henry bowed but such a bow ! No smile , no continued observance attended it ; [his]98-henry eyes were immediately returned to [their]862-their former direction . [Catherine]77-catherine was restlessly miserable ; [she]77-catherine could almost have run round to the box in which [he]98-henry sat and forced [him]98-henry to hear [her]77-catherine explanation . Feelings rather natural than heroic possessed [her]77-catherine ; instead of considering [her]77-catherine own dignity injured by this ready condemnation instead of proudly resolving , in conscious innocence , to show [her]77-catherine resentment towards [him]98-henry who could harbour a doubt of it , to leave to [him]98-henry all the trouble of seeking an explanation , and to enlighten [him]98-henry on the past only by avoiding [his]98-henry sight , or flirting with [somebody else]2483-somebody else [she]77-catherine took to [herself]77-catherine all the shame of misconduct , or at least of its appearance , and was only eager for an opportunity of explaining its cause .

The play concluded the curtain fell [Henry Tilney]98-henry was no longer to be seen where [he]98-henry had hitherto sat , but [[his]98-henry father]859-his father remained , and perhaps [he]98-henry might be now coming round to [[their]865-their box]866-their box . [She]77-catherine was right ; in a few minutes [he]98-henry appeared , and , making [his]98-henry way through the then thinning rows , spoke with like calm politeness to [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen and [[her]91-mrs. allen friend]313-her friend . Not with such calmness was [he]98-henry answered by [the latter]562-the latter : " Oh ! [Mr. Tilney]98-henry , [I]98-henry have been quite wild to speak to [you]98-henry , and make [my]98-henry apologies . [You]98-henry must have thought [me]98-henry so rude ; but indeed it was not [my]98-henry own fault , was it , [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen ? Did not [they]865-their tell [me]98-henry that [Mr. Tilney]98-henry and [[his]98-henry sister]2222-his sister were gone out in a phaeton together ? And then what could [I]98-henry do ? But [I]98-henry had ten thousand times rather have been with [you]98-henry ; now had not [I]98-henry , [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen ? "[98-henry]

" [[My]91-mrs. allen dear]2124-my dear , [you]2124-my dear tumble [my]91-mrs. allen gown , "[91-mrs. allen] was [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen s reply .

[Her]91-mrs. allen assurance , however , standing sole as it did , was not thrown away ; it brought a more cordial , more natural smile into [his]869-i countenance , and [he]869-i replied in a tone which retained only a little affected reserve : " [We]2628-we were much obliged to [you]2124-my dear at any rate for wishing [us]2628-we a pleasant walk after [our]2628-we passing [you]2124-my dear in [Argyle Street]49-argyle street : [you]2124-my dear were so kind as to look back on purpose . "[869-i]

" But indeed [I]869-i did not wish [you]2124-my dear a pleasant walk ; [I]869-i never thought of such a thing ; but [I]869-i begged [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe so earnestly to stop ; [I]869-i called out to [him]122-mr. thorpe as soon as ever [I]869-i saw [you]2124-my dear ; now , [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , did not Oh ! [You]2124-my dear were not [there]336-there ; but indeed [I]869-i did ; and , if [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe would only have stopped , [I]869-i would have jumped out and run after [you]2124-my dear . "[869-i]

Is there a Henry in [the world]197-the world who could be insensible to such a declaration ? [Henry Tilney]98-henry at least was not . With a yet sweeter smile , [he]98-henry said everything that need be said of [[his]98-henry sister]2222-his sister s concern , regret , and dependence on [Catherine]77-catherine s honour . " Oh ! Do not say [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney was not angry , "[77-catherine] cried [Catherine]77-catherine , " because [I]77-catherine know [she]95-miss tilney was ; for [she]95-miss tilney would not see [me]77-catherine this morning when [I]77-catherine called ; [I]77-catherine saw [her]95-miss tilney walk out of [the house]216-the house the next minute after [my]77-catherine leaving [it]216-the house ; [I]77-catherine was hurt , but [I]77-catherine was not affronted . Perhaps [you]98-henry did not know [I]77-catherine had been [there]336-there . "[77-catherine]

" [I]98-henry was not within at the time ; but [I]98-henry heard of it from [Eleanor]145-eleanor , and [she]145-eleanor has been wishing ever since to see [you]98-henry , to explain the reason of such incivility ; but perhaps [I]98-henry can do it as well . It was nothing more than that [[my]98-henry father]2473-my father [they]2633-they were just preparing to walk out , and [he]2473-my father being hurried for time , and not caring to have it put off made a point of [her]145-eleanor being denied . That was all , [I]98-henry do assure [you]98-henry . [She]145-eleanor was very much vexed , and meant to make [her]145-eleanor apology as soon as possible . "[98-henry]

[Catherine]77-catherine s mind was greatly eased by this information , yet a something of solicitude remained , from which sprang the following question , thoroughly artless in itself , though rather distressing to [the gentleman]387-the gentleman : " But , [Mr. Tilney]98-henry , why were _ [you]98-henry _ less generous than [[your]98-henry sister]2195-your sister ? If [she]145-eleanor felt such confidence in [my]98-henry good intentions , and could suppose it to be only a mistake , why should _ [you]98-henry _ be so ready to take offence ? "[98-henry]

" [Me]77-catherine ! [I]77-catherine take offence ! "[77-catherine]

" Nay , [I]98-henry am sure by [your]98-henry look , when [you]98-henry came into the box , [you]98-henry were angry . "[98-henry]

" [I]77-catherine angry ! [I]77-catherine could have no right . "[77-catherine]

" Well , [nobody]2139-nobody would have thought [you]98-henry had no right who saw [your]98-henry face . "[98-henry] [He]387-the gentleman replied by asking [her]873-her to make room for [him]387-the gentleman , and talking of the play .

[He]387-the gentleman remained with [them]874-them some time , and was only too agreeable for [Catherine]77-catherine to be contented when [he]387-the gentleman went away . Before [they]874-them parted , however , it was agreed that the projected walk should be taken as soon as possible ; and , setting aside the misery of [his]387-the gentleman quitting [[their]874-them box]866-their box , [she]77-catherine was , upon the whole , left [one of the happiest creatures in [the world]197-the world]876-one of the happiest creatures in the world .

While talking to [each other]338-each other , [she]77-catherine had observed with some surprise that [John Thorpe]103-john , who was never in the same part of [the house]216-the house for ten minutes together , was engaged in conversation with [General Tilney]143-general tilney ; and [she]77-catherine felt something more than surprise when [she]77-catherine thought [she]77-catherine could perceive [herself]77-catherine the object of [their]874-them attention and discourse . What could [they]874-them have to say of [her]77-catherine ? [She]77-catherine feared [General Tilney]143-general tilney did not like [her]77-catherine appearance : [she]77-catherine found it was implied in [his]143-general tilney preventing [her]77-catherine admittance to [[his]143-general tilney daughter]2444-his daughter , rather than postpone [his]143-general tilney own walk a few minutes . " How came [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe to know [[your]687-her companion father]2636-your father ? "[77-catherine] was [her]77-catherine anxious inquiry , as [she]77-catherine pointed [them]874-them out to [[her]77-catherine companion]687-her companion . [He]687-her companion knew nothing about it ; but [[his]687-her companion father]859-his father , like [every military man]883-every military man , had a very large acquaintance .

When the entertainment was over , [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe came to assist [them]874-them in getting out . [Catherine]77-catherine was the immediate object of [his]122-mr. thorpe gallantry ; and , while [they]874-them waited in [the lobby]2479-the lobby for a chair , [he]122-mr. thorpe prevented the inquiry which had travelled from [her]77-catherine heart almost to the tip of [her]77-catherine tongue , by asking , in a consequential manner , whether [she]77-catherine had seen [him]122-mr. thorpe talking with [General Tilney]143-general tilney : " [He]122-mr. thorpe is [a fine old fellow]2637-a fine old fellow , upon [my]77-catherine soul ! Stout , active looks as young as [[his]122-mr. thorpe son]2638-his son . [I]77-catherine have a great regard for [him]122-mr. thorpe , [I]77-catherine assure [you]77-catherine : [a gentleman - like , good sort of fellow as ever lived]2639-a gentleman - like , good sort of fellow as ever lived . "[77-catherine]

" But how came [you]77-catherine to know [him]122-mr. thorpe ? "[122-mr. thorpe]

" Know [him]122-mr. thorpe ! There are [few people much about [town]2641-town that [I]77-catherine do not know]2640-few people much about town that i do not know . [I]77-catherine have met [him]122-mr. thorpe forever at [the Bedford]50-the bedford ; and [I]77-catherine knew [his]122-mr. thorpe face again today the moment [he]122-mr. thorpe came into [the billiard - room]2642-the billiard - room . [One of the best players [we]2644-we have]2643-one of the best players we have , by the by ; and [we]2644-we had a little touch together , though [I]77-catherine was almost afraid of [him]122-mr. thorpe at first : the odds were five to four against [me]77-catherine ; and , if [I]77-catherine had not made one of the cleanest strokes that perhaps ever was made in [this world]2645-this world [I]77-catherine took [his]122-mr. thorpe ball exactly but [I]77-catherine could not make [you]2646-you understand it without a table ; however , [I]77-catherine _ did _ beat [him]122-mr. thorpe . [A very fine fellow]2647-a very fine fellow ; as rich as [a Jew]2402-a jew . [I]77-catherine should like to dine with [him]122-mr. thorpe ; [I]77-catherine dare say [he]122-mr. thorpe gives famous dinners . But what do [you]2646-you think [we]2644-we have been talking of ? [You]2646-you . Yes , by heavens ! And [the general]783-the general thinks [you]2646-you [the finest girl in [Bath]5-bath]2650-the finest girl in bath . "[77-catherine]

" Oh ! Nonsense ! How can [you]2646-you say so ? "[885-i]

" And what do [you]2646-you think [I]885-i said ? "[885-i] lowering [his]885-i voice " well done , [general]2651-general , said [I]885-i ; [I]885-i am quite of [your]2651-general mind . "[885-i]

Here [Catherine]77-catherine , who was much less gratified by [his]885-i admiration than by [General Tilney]143-general tilney s , was not sorry to be called away by [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen . [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe , however , would see [her]77-catherine to [her]77-catherine chair , and , till [she]77-catherine entered it , continued the same kind of delicate flattery , in spite of [her]77-catherine entreating [him]122-mr. thorpe to have done .

That [General Tilney]143-general tilney , instead of disliking , should admire [her]77-catherine , was very delightful ; and [she]77-catherine joyfully thought that there was not one of [the family whom [she]77-catherine need now fear to meet]886-the family whom she need now fear to meet . The evening had done more , much more , for [her]77-catherine than could have been expected .

CHAPTER 13

Monday , Tuesday , Wednesday , Thursday , Friday , and Saturday have now passed in review before [the reader]260-the reader ; the events of each day , its hopes and fears , mortifications and pleasures , have been separately stated , and the pangs of Sunday only now remain to be described , and close the week . The [Clifton]40-clifton scheme had been deferred , not relinquished , and on the afternoon s Crescent of this day , it was brought forward again . In a private consultation between [Isabella]106-isabella and [James]108-james , the former of whom had particularly set [her]106-isabella heart upon going , and [the latter]562-the latter no less anxiously placed [his]562-the latter upon pleasing [her]77-catherine , it was agreed that , provided the weather were fair , the party should take place on the following morning ; and [they]889-they were to set off very early , in order to be at [home]2339-home in good time . The affair thus determined , and [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe s approbation secured , [Catherine]77-catherine only remained to be apprised of it . [She]77-catherine had left [them]889-they for a few minutes to speak to [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney . In that interval the plan was completed , and as soon as [she]77-catherine came again , [her]77-catherine agreement was demanded ; but instead of the gay acquiescence expected by [Isabella]106-isabella , [Catherine]77-catherine looked grave , was very sorry , but could not go . The engagement which ought to have kept [her]77-catherine from joining in the former attempt would make it impossible for [her]77-catherine to accompany [them]889-they now . [She]77-catherine had that moment settled with [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney to take [their]889-they proposed walk tomorrow ; it was quite determined , and [she]77-catherine would not , upon any account , retract . But that [she]77-catherine _ must _ and _ should _ retract , was instantly the eager cry of both [the Thorpes]107-the thorpes ; [they]889-they must go to [Clifton]40-clifton tomorrow , [they]889-they would not go without [her]106-isabella , it would be nothing to put off a mere walk for one day longer , and [they]889-they would not hear of a refusal . [Catherine]77-catherine was distressed , but not subdued . " Do not urge [me]77-catherine , [Isabella]106-isabella . [I]77-catherine am engaged to [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney . [I]77-catherine can not go . "[77-catherine] This availed nothing . The same arguments assailed [her]77-catherine again ; [she]77-catherine must go , [she]77-catherine should go , and [they]889-they would not hear of a refusal . " It would be so easy to tell [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney that [you]77-catherine had just been reminded of a prior engagement , and must only beg to put off the walk till Tuesday . "[77-catherine]

" No , it would not be easy . [I]891-a friend who loved her so dearly could not do it . There has been no prior engagement . "[891-a friend who loved her so dearly] But [Isabella]106-isabella became only more and more urgent , calling on [her]106-isabella in the most affectionate manner , addressing [her]106-isabella by the most endearing names . [She]106-isabella was sure [her]106-isabella dearest , sweetest [Catherine]77-catherine would not seriously refuse such a trifling request to [a friend who loved [her]77-catherine so dearly]891-a friend who loved her so dearly . [She]106-isabella knew [her]106-isabella beloved [Catherine]77-catherine to have so feeling a heart , so sweet a temper , to be so easily persuaded by those [she]106-isabella loved . But all in vain ; [Catherine]77-catherine felt [herself]77-catherine to be in the right , and though pained by such tender , such flattering supplication , could not allow it to influence [her]77-catherine . [Isabella]106-isabella then tried another method . [She]106-isabella reproached [her]106-isabella with having more affection for [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , though [she]106-isabella had known [her]106-isabella so little a while , than for [[her]106-isabella best and oldest friends]892-her best and oldest friends , with being grown cold and indifferent , in short , towards [herself]106-isabella . " [I]106-isabella can not help being jealous , [Catherine]77-catherine , when [I]106-isabella see [myself]106-isabella slighted for [strangers]2652-strangers , [I]106-isabella , who love [you]77-catherine so excessively ! When once [my]106-isabella affections are placed , it is not in the power of anything to change them . But [I]106-isabella believe [my]106-isabella feelings are stronger than anybody s ; [I]106-isabella am sure they are too strong for [my]106-isabella own peace ; and to see [myself]106-isabella supplanted in [your]77-catherine friendship by [strangers]2652-strangers does cut [me]106-isabella to the quick , [I]106-isabella own . [These Tilneys]2654-these tilneys seem to swallow up everything else . "[106-isabella]

[Catherine]77-catherine thought this reproach equally strange and unkind . Was it the part of [a friend]449-a friend thus to expose [her]449-a friend feelings to the notice of [others]705-others ? [Isabella]106-isabella appeared to [her]77-catherine ungenerous and selfish , regardless of everything but [her]106-isabella own gratification . These painful ideas crossed [her]106-isabella mind , though [she]106-isabella said nothing . [Isabella]106-isabella , in the meanwhile , had applied [her]106-isabella handkerchief to [her]106-isabella eyes ; and [Morland]77-catherine , miserable at such a sight , could not help saying , " Nay , [Catherine]77-catherine . [I]77-catherine think [you]77-catherine can not stand out any longer now . The sacrifice is not much ; and to oblige [such a friend]2655-such a friend [I]77-catherine shall think [you]77-catherine quite unkind , if [you]77-catherine still refuse . "[77-catherine]

This was the first time of [[her]106-isabella brother]2221-her brother s openly siding against [her]106-isabella , and anxious to avoid [his]2221-her brother displeasure , [she]106-isabella proposed a compromise . If [they]896-they would only put off [their]896-they scheme till Tuesday , which [they]896-they might easily do , as it depended only on [themselves]896-they , [she]106-isabella could go with [them]896-they , and [everybody]326-everybody might then be satisfied . But " No , no , no ! "[106-isabella] was the immediate answer ; " that could not be , for [Thorpe]106-isabella did not know that [he]2221-her brother might not go to [town]2641-town on Tuesday . "[77-catherine] [Catherine]77-catherine was sorry , but could do no more ; and a short silence ensued , which was broken by [Isabella]106-isabella , who in a voice of cold resentment said , " Very well , then there is an end of the party . If [Catherine]77-catherine does not go , [I]106-isabella can not . [I]106-isabella can not be [the only woman]2657-the only woman . [I]106-isabella would not , upon any account in [the world]197-the world , do so improper a thing . "[106-isabella]

" [Catherine]77-catherine , [you]77-catherine must go , "[108-james] said [James]108-james .

" But why can not [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe drive [one of [[his]122-mr. thorpe other sisters]2660-his other sisters]2659-one of his other sisters ? [I]106-isabella dare say either of [them]2660-his other sisters would like to go . "[106-isabella]

" Thank [ye]77-catherine , "[122-mr. thorpe] cried [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe , " but [I]122-mr. thorpe did not come to [Bath]5-bath to drive [[my]122-mr. thorpe sisters]2304-my sisters about , and look like [a fool]2662-a fool . No , if [you]77-catherine do not go , d [me]122-mr. thorpe if [I]122-mr. thorpe do . [I]122-mr. thorpe only go for the sake of driving [you]77-catherine . "[122-mr. thorpe]

" That is a compliment which gives [me]898-me no pleasure . "[898-me] But [her]898-me words were lost on [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe , who had turned abruptly away .

[The three others]899-the three others still continued together , walking in a most uncomfortable manner to [poor [Catherine]77-catherine]900-poor catherine ; sometimes not a word was said , sometimes [she]77-catherine was again attacked with supplications or reproaches , and [her]77-catherine arm was still linked within [Isabella]106-isabella s , though [their]901-their hearts were at war . At one moment [she]77-catherine was softened , at another irritated ; always distressed , but always steady .

" [I]108-james did not think [you]77-catherine had been so obstinate , [Catherine]77-catherine , "[108-james] said [James]108-james ; " [you]77-catherine were not used to be so hard to persuade ; [you]77-catherine once were [the kindest , best - tempered of [[my]108-james sisters]2304-my sisters]2663-the kindest , best - tempered of my sisters . "[108-james]

" [I]77-catherine hope [I]77-catherine am not less so now , "[77-catherine] [she]77-catherine replied , very feelingly ; " but indeed [I]77-catherine can not go . If [I]77-catherine am wrong , [I]77-catherine am doing what [I]77-catherine believe to be right . "[77-catherine]

" [I]106-isabella suspect , "[106-isabella] said [Isabella]106-isabella , in a low voice , " there is no great struggle . "[106-isabella]

[Catherine]77-catherine s heart swelled ; [she]77-catherine drew away [her]77-catherine arm , and [Isabella]106-isabella made no opposition . Thus passed a long ten minutes , till [they]902-we were again joined by [Thorpe]106-isabella , who , coming to [them]902-we with a gayer look , said , " Well , [I]106-isabella have settled the matter , and now [we]902-we may all go tomorrow with a safe conscience . [I]106-isabella have been to [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , and made [your]95-miss tilney excuses . "[106-isabella]

" [You]106-isabella have not ! "[77-catherine] cried [Catherine]77-catherine .

" [I]106-isabella have , upon [my]106-isabella soul . Left [her]95-miss tilney this moment . Told [her]95-miss tilney [you]95-miss tilney had sent [me]106-isabella to say that , having just recollected a prior engagement of going to [Clifton]40-clifton with [us]902-we tomorrow , [you]95-miss tilney could not have the pleasure of walking with [her]95-miss tilney till [Tuesday]146-tuesday . [She]95-miss tilney said very well , Tuesday was just as convenient to [her]95-miss tilney ; so there is an end of all [our]902-we difficulties . A pretty good thought of [mine]106-isabella hey ? "[106-isabella]

[Isabella]106-isabella s countenance was once more all smiles and good humour , and [James]108-james too looked happy again .

" A most heavenly thought indeed ! Now , [[my]106-isabella sweet [Catherine]77-catherine]2665-my sweet catherine , all [our]902-we distresses are over ; [you]77-catherine are honourably acquitted , and [we]902-we shall have a most delightful party . "[106-isabella]

" This will not do , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine ; " [I]77-catherine can not submit to this . [I]77-catherine must run after [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney directly and set [her]95-miss tilney right . "[77-catherine]

[Isabella]106-isabella , however , caught hold of one hand , [Thorpe]106-isabella of the other , and remonstrances poured in from all three . Even [James]108-james was quite angry . When everything was settled , when [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney [herself]95-miss tilney said that Tuesday would suit [her]95-miss tilney as well , it was quite ridiculous , quite absurd , to make any further objection .

" [I]95-miss tilney do not care . [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe had no business to invent any such message . If [I]95-miss tilney had thought it right to put it off , [I]95-miss tilney could have spoken to [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney [myself]95-miss tilney . This is only doing it in a ruder way ; and how do [I]95-miss tilney know that [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe has [He]122-mr. thorpe may be mistaken again perhaps ; [he]122-mr. thorpe led [me]95-miss tilney into one act of rudeness by [his]122-mr. thorpe mistake on Friday . Let [me]95-miss tilney go , [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe ; [Isabella]106-isabella , do not hold [me]95-miss tilney . "[95-miss tilney]

[Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe told [her]95-miss tilney it would be in vain to go after [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys ; [they]137-the tilneys were turning the corner into [Brock Street]51-brock street , when [he]122-mr. thorpe had overtaken [them]137-the tilneys , and were at [home]2339-home by this time .

" Then [I]77-catherine will go after [them]137-the tilneys , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine ; " wherever [they]137-the tilneys are [I]95-miss tilney will go after [them]137-the tilneys . It does not signify talking . If [I]95-miss tilney could not be persuaded into doing what [I]95-miss tilney thought wrong , [I]95-miss tilney never will be tricked into it . "[95-miss tilney] And with these words [she]95-miss tilney broke away and hurried off . [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe would have darted after [her]95-miss tilney , but [Morland]77-catherine withheld [him]122-mr. thorpe . " Let [her]95-miss tilney go , let [her]95-miss tilney go , if [she]95-miss tilney will go . "[77-catherine]

" [She]95-miss tilney is as obstinate as "[95-miss tilney]

[Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe never finished the simile , for it could hardly have been a proper one .

Away walked [Catherine]77-catherine in great agitation , as fast as the crowd would permit [her]95-miss tilney , fearful of being pursued , yet determined to persevere . As [she]95-miss tilney walked , [she]95-miss tilney reflected on what had passed . It was painful to [her]95-miss tilney to disappoint and displease [them]904-them , particularly to displease [[her]95-miss tilney brother]2221-her brother ; but [she]95-miss tilney could not repent [her]95-miss tilney resistance . Setting [her]95-miss tilney own inclination apart , to have failed a second time in [her]95-miss tilney engagement to [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , to have retracted a promise voluntarily made only five minutes before , and on a false pretence too , must have been wrong . [She]95-miss tilney had not been withstanding [them]904-them on selfish principles alone , [she]95-miss tilney had not consulted merely [her]95-miss tilney own gratification ; _ that _ might have been ensured in some degree by the excursion itself , by seeing [Blaize Castle]42-blaize castle ; no , [she]95-miss tilney had attended to what was due to [others]705-others , and to [her]95-miss tilney own character in [their]705-others opinion . [Her]95-miss tilney conviction of being right , however , was not enough to restore [her]95-miss tilney composure ; till [she]95-miss tilney had spoken to [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney [she]95-miss tilney could not be at ease ; and quickening [her]95-miss tilney pace when [she]95-miss tilney got clear of [the Crescent]14-the crescent , [she]95-miss tilney almost ran over the remaining ground till [she]95-miss tilney gained [the top of [Milsom Street]15-milsom street]907-the top of milsom street . So rapid had been [her]95-miss tilney movements that in spite of [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys advantage in the outset , [they]137-the tilneys were but just turning into [[their]137-the tilneys lodgings]908-their lodgings as [she]95-miss tilney came within view of [them]137-the tilneys ; and [the servant still remaining at the open door]909-the servant still remaining at the open door , [she]95-miss tilney used only the ceremony of saying that [she]95-miss tilney must speak with [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney that moment , and hurrying by [him]910-him proceeded [upstairs]446-upstairs . Then , opening the first door before [her]95-miss tilney , which happened to be the right , [she]95-miss tilney immediately found [herself]95-miss tilney in [the drawing - room]448-the drawing - room with [General Tilney]143-general tilney , [[his]143-general tilney son]2638-his son , and [daughter]914-daughter . [Her]95-miss tilney explanation , defective only in being from [her]95-miss tilney irritation of nerves and shortness of breath no explanation at all , was instantly given . " [I]95-miss tilney am come in a great hurry It was all a mistake [I]95-miss tilney never promised to go [I]95-miss tilney told [them]2666-them from the first [I]95-miss tilney could not go . [I]95-miss tilney ran away in a great hurry to explain it . [I]95-miss tilney did not care what [you]2666-them thought of [me]95-miss tilney . [I]95-miss tilney would not stay for [the servant]545-the servant . "[95-miss tilney]

The business , however , though not perfectly elucidated by this speech , soon ceased to be a puzzle . [Catherine]77-catherine found that [John Thorpe]103-john _ had _ given the message ; and [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney had no scruple in owning [herself]95-miss tilney greatly surprised by it . But whether [[her]95-miss tilney brother]2221-her brother had still exceeded [her]95-miss tilney in resentment , [Catherine]77-catherine , though [she]77-catherine instinctively addressed [herself]77-catherine as much to one as to [the other]413-the other in [her]77-catherine vindication , had no means of knowing . Whatever might have been felt before [her]77-catherine arrival , [her]77-catherine eager declarations immediately made every look and sentence as friendly as [she]77-catherine could desire .

The affair thus happily settled , [she]77-catherine was introduced by [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney to [[her]77-catherine father]188-her father , and received by [him]188-her father with such ready , such solicitous politeness as recalled [Thorpe]103-john s information to [her]77-catherine mind , and made [her]77-catherine think with pleasure that [he]188-her father might be sometimes depended on . To such anxious attention was [the general]783-the general s civility carried , that not aware of [her]77-catherine extraordinary swiftness in entering [the house]216-the house , [he]783-the general was quite angry with [the servant whose neglect had reduced [her]77-catherine to open the door of [the apartment]921-the apartment [herself]77-catherine]920-the servant whose neglect had reduced her to open the door of the apartment herself . " What did [William]105-william mean by it ? [He]105-william should make a point of inquiring into the matter . "[783-the general] And if [Catherine]77-catherine had not most warmly asserted [his]188-her father innocence , it seemed likely that [William]105-william would lose the favour of [[his]105-william master]2401-his master forever , if not [his]105-william place , by [her]77-catherine rapidity .

After sitting with [them]923-they a quarter of an hour , [she]77-catherine rose to take leave , and was then most agreeably surprised by [General Tilney]143-general tilney s asking [her]77-catherine if [she]77-catherine would do [[his]143-general tilney daughter]2444-his daughter the honour of dining and spending the rest of the day with [her]2444-his daughter . [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney added [her]95-miss tilney own wishes . [Catherine]77-catherine was greatly obliged ; but it was quite out of [her]77-catherine power . [Mr.]925-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen would expect [her]77-catherine back every moment . [The general]783-the general declared [he]783-the general could say no more ; the claims of [Mr.]927-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen were not to be superseded ; but on some other day [he]783-the general trusted , when longer notice could be given , [they]923-they would not refuse to spare [her]77-catherine to [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend . " Oh , no ; [Catherine]77-catherine was sure [they]923-they would not have the least objection , and [she]77-catherine should have great pleasure in coming . "[783-the general] [The general]783-the general attended [her]77-catherine [himself]783-the general to [the street]447-the street - door , saying everything gallant as [they]931-they went [downstairs]681-downstairs , admiring the elasticity of [her]77-catherine walk , which corresponded exactly with the spirit of [her]77-catherine dancing , and making [her]77-catherine one of the most graceful bows [she]77-catherine had ever beheld , when [they]931-they parted .

[Catherine]77-catherine , delighted by all that had passed , proceeded gaily to [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street , walking , as [she]77-catherine concluded , with great elasticity , though [she]77-catherine had never thought of it before . [She]77-catherine reached [home]2339-home without seeing anything more of [the offended party]934-the offended party ; and now that [she]77-catherine had been triumphant throughout , had carried [her]77-catherine point , and was secure of [her]77-catherine walk , [she]77-catherine began ( as the flutter of [her]77-catherine spirits subsided ) to doubt whether [she]77-catherine had been perfectly right . A sacrifice was always noble ; and if [she]77-catherine had given way to [their]931-they entreaties , [she]77-catherine should have been spared the distressing idea of [a friend]449-a friend displeased , [a brother]750-a brother angry , and a scheme of great happiness to both destroyed , perhaps through [her]77-catherine means . To ease [her]77-catherine mind , and ascertain by the opinion of [an unprejudiced person]937-an unprejudiced person what [her]77-catherine own conduct had really been , [she]77-catherine took occasion to mention before [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen the half - settled scheme of [[her]77-catherine brother]2221-her brother and [the Thorpes]107-the thorpes for the following day . [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen caught at it directly . " Well , "[89-mr. allen] said [he]89-mr. allen , " and do [you]77-catherine think of going too ? "[89-mr. allen]

" No ; [I]77-catherine had just engaged [myself]77-catherine to walk with [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney before [they]931-they told [me]77-catherine of it ; and therefore [you]89-mr. allen know [I]77-catherine could not go with [them]931-they , could [I]77-catherine ? "[77-catherine]

" No , certainly not ; and [I]89-mr. allen am glad [you]77-catherine do not think of it . These schemes are not at all the thing . [Young men]534-young men and women driving about [the country]224-the country in [open carriages]2670-open carriages ! Now and then it is very well ; but going to [inns]2671-inns and [public places]2672-public places together ! It is not right ; and [I]89-mr. allen wonder [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe should allow it . [I]89-mr. allen am glad [you]77-catherine do not think of going ; [I]89-mr. allen am sure [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland would not be pleased . [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , are not [you]77-catherine of [my]89-mr. allen way of thinking ? Do not [you]77-catherine think these kind of projects objectionable ? "[89-mr. allen]

" Yes , very much so indeed . [Open carriages]2670-open carriages are nasty things . A clean gown is not five minutes wear in them . [You]77-catherine are splashed getting in and getting out ; and the wind takes [your]77-catherine hair and [your]77-catherine bonnet in every direction . [I]77-catherine hate [an open carriage]2299-an open carriage [myself]77-catherine . "[77-catherine]

" [I]89-mr. allen know [you]77-catherine do ; but that is not the question . Do not [you]77-catherine think it has an odd appearance , if [young ladies]268-young ladies are frequently driven about in [them]2670-open carriages by [young men]534-young men , to whom [they]268-young ladies are not even related ? "[89-mr. allen]

" Yes , [[my]77-catherine dear]2124-my dear , a very odd appearance indeed . [I]77-catherine can not bear to see it . "[77-catherine]

" [Dear madam]2678-dear madam , "[77-catherine] cried [Catherine]77-catherine , " then why did not [you]77-catherine tell [me]77-catherine so before ? [I]77-catherine am sure if [I]77-catherine had known it to be improper , [I]77-catherine would not have gone with [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe at all ; but [I]77-catherine always hoped [you]77-catherine would tell [me]77-catherine , if [you]77-catherine thought [I]77-catherine was doing wrong . "[77-catherine]

" And so [I]77-catherine should , [[my]77-catherine dear]2124-my dear , [you]2124-my dear may depend on it ; for as [I]77-catherine told [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland at parting , [I]77-catherine would always do the best for [you]2124-my dear in [my]77-catherine power . But one must not be over particular . [Young people]2335-young people _ will _ be [young people]2335-young people , as [[your]2124-my dear good mother]2682-your good mother says [herself]2682-your good mother . [You]2124-my dear know [I]77-catherine wanted [you]2124-my dear , when [we]2683-we first came , not to buy that sprigged muslin , but [you]2124-my dear would . [Young people]2335-young people do not like to be always thwarted . "[77-catherine]

" But this was something of real consequence ; and [I]77-catherine do not think [you]2124-my dear would have found [me]77-catherine hard to persuade . "[77-catherine]

" As far as it has gone hitherto , there is no harm done , "[89-mr. allen] said [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen ; " and [I]89-mr. allen would only advise [you]2124-my dear , [[my]89-mr. allen dear]2124-my dear , not to go out with [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe any more . "[89-mr. allen]

" That is just what [I]345-his wife was going to say , "[345-his wife] added [[his]89-mr. allen wife]345-his wife .

[Catherine]77-catherine , relieved for [herself]77-catherine , felt uneasy for [Isabella]106-isabella , and after a moment s thought , asked [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen whether it would not be both proper and kind in [her]77-catherine to write to [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe , and explain the indecorum of which [she]77-catherine must be as insensible as [herself]77-catherine ; for [she]77-catherine considered that [Isabella]106-isabella might otherwise perhaps be going to [Clifton]40-clifton the next day , in spite of what had passed . [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen , however , discouraged [her]77-catherine from doing any such thing . " [You]2124-my dear had better leave [her]106-isabella alone , [[my]89-mr. allen dear]2124-my dear ; [she]106-isabella is old enough to know what [she]106-isabella is about , and if not , has [a mother]2687-a mother to advise [her]106-isabella . [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe is too indulgent beyond a doubt ; but , however , [you]2124-my dear had better not interfere . [She]106-isabella and [[your]2124-my dear brother]2331-your brother choose to go , and [you]2124-my dear will be only getting ill will . "[89-mr. allen]

[Catherine]77-catherine submitted , and though sorry to think that [Isabella]106-isabella should be doing wrong , felt greatly relieved by [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen s approbation of [her]77-catherine own conduct , and truly rejoiced to be preserved by [his]89-mr. allen advice from the danger of falling into such an error [herself]77-catherine . [Her]77-catherine escape from being [one of [the party to [Clifton]40-clifton]941-the party to clifton]940-one of the party to clifton was now an escape indeed ; for what would [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys have thought of [her]77-catherine , if [she]77-catherine had broken [her]77-catherine promise to [them]137-the tilneys in order to do what was wrong in [itself]942-itself , if [she]77-catherine had been guilty of one breach of propriety , only to enable [her]77-catherine to be guilty of another ?

CHAPTER 14

The next morning was fair , and [Catherine]77-catherine almost expected another attack from [the assembled party]943-the assembled party . With [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen to support [her]77-catherine , [she]77-catherine felt no dread of the event : but [she]77-catherine would gladly be spared a contest , where victory itself was painful , and was heartily rejoiced therefore at neither seeing nor hearing anything of [them]137-the tilneys . [The Tilneys]137-the tilneys called for [her]77-catherine at the appointed time ; and no new difficulty arising , no sudden recollection , no unexpected summons , no impertinent intrusion to disconcert [their]137-the tilneys measures , [[my]0-i heroine]762-my heroine was most unnaturally able to fulfil [her]77-catherine engagement , though it was made with [the hero]285-the hero [himself]285-the hero . [They]137-the tilneys determined on walking round [Beechen Cliff]52-beechen cliff , [that noble hill whose beautiful verdure and hanging coppice]946-that noble hill whose beautiful verdure and hanging coppice render it so striking an object from [almost every opening in [Bath]5-bath]947-almost every opening in bath .

" [I]77-catherine never look at it , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , as [they]137-the tilneys walked along [the side of [the river]949-the river]948-the side of the river , " without thinking of [the south of [France]38-france]2575-the south of france . "[77-catherine]

" [You]98-henry have been abroad then ? "[98-henry] said [Henry]98-henry , a little surprised .

" Oh ! No , [I]77-catherine only mean what [I]77-catherine have read about . It always puts [me]77-catherine in mind of [the country that [Emily]147-emily and [[her]147-emily father]188-her father travelled through]2690-the country that emily and her father travelled through , in The Mysteries of [Udolpho]113-udolpho . But [you]98-henry never read novels , [I]77-catherine dare say ? "[77-catherine]

" Why not ? "[77-catherine]

" Because [they]2692-they are not clever enough for [you]98-henry gentlemen read better books . "[77-catherine]

" [The person]2693-the person , be it [gentleman]2694-gentleman or [lady]823-lady , who has not pleasure in a good novel , must be intolerably stupid . [I]77-catherine have read all [Mrs. Radcliffe]125-mrs. radcliffe s works , and most of them with great pleasure . The Mysteries of [Udolpho]113-udolpho , when [I]77-catherine had once begun it , [I]77-catherine could not lay down again ; [I]77-catherine remember finishing it in two days [my]77-catherine hair standing on end the whole time . "[77-catherine]

" Yes , "[95-miss tilney] added [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , " and [I]95-miss tilney remember that [you]98-henry undertook to read it aloud to [me]95-miss tilney , and that when [I]95-miss tilney was called away for only five minutes to answer a note , instead of waiting for [me]95-miss tilney , [you]98-henry took the volume into [the Hermitage Walk]2696-the hermitage walk , and [I]95-miss tilney was obliged to stay till [you]98-henry had finished it . "[95-miss tilney]

" Thank [you]98-henry , [Eleanor]2697-eleanor a most honourable testimony . [You]98-henry see , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , the injustice of [your]98-henry suspicions . Here was [I]77-catherine , in [my]77-catherine eagerness to get on , refusing to wait only five minutes for [[my]77-catherine sister]2192-my sister , breaking the promise [I]77-catherine had made of reading it aloud , and keeping [her]2192-my sister in suspense at a most interesting part , by running away with the volume , which , [you]98-henry are to observe , was [her]2192-my sister own , particularly [her]2192-my sister own . [I]77-catherine am proud when [I]77-catherine reflect on it , and [I]77-catherine think it must establish [me]77-catherine in [your]98-henry good opinion . "[77-catherine]

" [I]95-miss tilney am very glad to hear it indeed , and now [I]95-miss tilney shall never be ashamed of liking [Udolpho]113-udolpho [myself]95-miss tilney . But [I]95-miss tilney really thought before , [young men]534-young men despised novels amazingly . "[95-miss tilney]

" It is _ amazingly ; _ it may well suggest _ amazement _ if [they]534-young men do for [they]534-young men read nearly as many as [women]2184-women . [I]77-catherine [myself]77-catherine have read hundreds and hundreds . Do not imagine that [you]98-henry can cope with [me]77-catherine in a knowledge of [Julias]148-julias and [Louisas]149-louisas . If [we]2701-we proceed to particulars , and engage in the never - ceasing inquiry of Have [you]98-henry read this ? and Have [you]98-henry read that ? [I]77-catherine shall soon leave [you]98-henry as far behind [me]77-catherine as what shall [I]77-catherine say ? [I]77-catherine want an appropriate simile . as far as [[your]98-henry friend]2702-your friend [Emily]147-emily [herself]147-emily left poor [Valancourt]53-valancourt when [she]147-emily went with [[her]147-emily aunt]2703-her aunt into [Italy]54-italy . Consider how many years [I]77-catherine have had the start of [you]98-henry . [I]77-catherine had entered on [my]77-catherine studies at [Oxford]10-oxford , while [you]98-henry were [a good little girl]2704-a good little girl working [your]98-henry sampler at [home]2339-home ! "[77-catherine]

" Not very good , [I]95-miss tilney am afraid . But now really , do not [you]98-henry think [Udolpho]113-udolpho the nicest book in [the world]197-the world ? "[95-miss tilney]

" The nicest by which [I]77-catherine suppose [you]98-henry mean the neatest . That must depend upon the binding . "[77-catherine]

" [Henry]98-henry , "[95-miss tilney] said [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , " [you]98-henry are very impertinent . [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , [he]98-henry is treating [you]98-henry exactly as [he]98-henry does [[his]98-henry sister]2222-his sister . [He]98-henry is forever finding fault with [me]95-miss tilney , for some incorrectness of language , and now [he]98-henry is taking the same liberty with [you]98-henry . The word nicest , as [you]98-henry used it , did not suit [him]98-henry ; and [you]98-henry had better change it as soon as [you]98-henry can , or [we]2708-we shall be overpowered with [Johnson]150-johnson and [Blair]151-blair all the rest of the way . "[95-miss tilney]

" [I]77-catherine am sure , "[77-catherine] cried [Catherine]77-catherine , " [I]77-catherine did not mean to say anything wrong ; but it _ is _ a nice book , and why should not [I]77-catherine call it so ? "[77-catherine]

" Very true , "[98-henry] said [Henry]98-henry , " and this is a very nice day , and [we]2708-we are taking a very nice walk , and [you]98-henry are [two very nice young ladies]2709-two very nice young ladies . Oh ! It is a very nice word indeed ! It does for everything . Originally perhaps it was applied only to express neatness , propriety , delicacy , or refinement [people]328-people were nice in [their]328-people dress , in [their]328-people sentiments , or [their]328-people choice . But now every commendation on every subject is comprised in that one word . "[98-henry]

" While , in fact , "[2222-his sister] cried [[his]98-henry sister]2222-his sister , " it ought only to be applied to [you]98-henry , without any commendation at all . [You]98-henry are more nice than wise . Come , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , let [us]2708-we leave [him]98-henry to meditate over [our]2708-we faults in the utmost propriety of diction , while [we]2708-we praise [Udolpho]113-udolpho in whatever terms [we]2708-we like best . It is a most interesting work . [You]98-henry are fond of that kind of reading ? "[2222-his sister]

" To say the truth , [I]77-catherine do not much like any other . "[77-catherine]

" Indeed ! "[2222-his sister]

" That is , [I]77-catherine can read poetry and plays , and things of that sort , and do not dislike travels . But history , real solemn history , [I]77-catherine can not be interested in . Can [you]98-henry ? "[77-catherine]

" Yes , [I]2222-his sister am fond of history . "[2222-his sister]

" [I]77-catherine wish [I]77-catherine were too . [I]77-catherine read it a little as a duty , but it tells [me]77-catherine nothing that does not either vex or weary [me]77-catherine . The quarrels of [popes]2711-popes and [kings]2624-kings , with wars or pestilences , in every page ; [the men]2243-the men all so good for nothing , and [hardly any women]2714-hardly any women at all it is very tiresome : and yet [I]77-catherine often think it odd that it should be so dull , for a great deal of it must be invention . The speeches that are put into [the heroes]2715-the heroes mouths , [their]2715-the heroes thoughts and designs the chief of all this must be invention , and invention is what delights [me]77-catherine in other books . "[77-catherine]

" [Historians]2716-historians , [you]98-henry think , "[95-miss tilney] said [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , " are not happy in [their]2716-historians flights of fancy . [They]2716-historians display imagination without raising interest . [I]95-miss tilney am fond of history and am very well contented to take the false with the true . In the principal facts [they]2716-historians have sources of intelligence in former histories and records , which may be as much depended on , [I]95-miss tilney conclude , as anything that does not actually pass under one s own observation ; and as for the little embellishments [you]98-henry speak of , they are embellishments , and [I]95-miss tilney like them as such . If a speech be well drawn up , [I]95-miss tilney read it with pleasure , by whomsoever it may be made and probably with much greater , if the production of [Mr. Hume]152-mr. hume or [Mr. Robertson]153-mr. robertson , than if the genuine words of [Caractacus]154-caractacus , [Agricola]155-agricola , or [Alfred the Great]156-alfred the great . "[95-miss tilney]

" [You]98-henry are fond of history ! And so are [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen and [[my]77-catherine father]2473-my father ; and [I]77-catherine have [two brothers]2718-two brothers who do not dislike it . So many instances within [[my]77-catherine small circle of [friends]2720-friends]2719-my small circle of friends is remarkable ! At this rate , [I]77-catherine shall not pity [the writers of history]2721-the writers of history any longer . If [people]328-people like to read [their]328-people books , it is all very well , but to be at so much trouble in filling great volumes , which , as [I]77-catherine used to think , [nobody]2139-nobody would willingly ever look into , to be labouring only for the torment of [little boys]2724-little boys and [girls]2725-girls , always struck [me]77-catherine as a hard fate ; and though [I]77-catherine know it is all very right and necessary , [I]77-catherine have often wondered at [the person]2693-the person s courage that could sit down on purpose to do it . "[77-catherine]

" That [little boys]2724-little boys and [girls]2725-girls should be tormented , "[98-henry] said [Henry]98-henry , " is what [no one at all acquainted with human nature in a civilized state]2729-no one at all acquainted with human nature in a civilized state can deny ; but in behalf of [[our]2730-our most distinguished historians]2731-our most distinguished historians , [I]98-henry must observe that [they]2731-our most distinguished historians might well be offended at being supposed to have no higher aim , and that by [their]2731-our most distinguished historians method and style , [they]2731-our most distinguished historians are perfectly well qualified to torment [readers of the most advanced reason and mature time of life]2732-readers of the most advanced reason and mature time of life . [I]98-henry use the verb to torment , as [I]98-henry observed to be [your]2733-you own method , instead of to instruct , supposing them to be now admitted as synonymous . "[98-henry]

" [You]2733-you think [me]77-catherine foolish to call instruction a torment , but if [you]2733-you had been as much used as [myself]77-catherine to hear [poor little children]2734-poor little children first learning [their]2734-poor little children letters and then learning to spell , if [you]2733-you had ever seen how stupid [they]2734-poor little children can be for a whole morning together , and how tired [[my]77-catherine poor mother]2735-my poor mother is at the end of it , as [I]77-catherine am in the habit of seeing almost every day of [my]77-catherine life at [home]2339-home , [you]2733-you would allow that to _ torment _ and to _ instruct _ might sometimes be used as synonymous words . "[77-catherine]

" Very probably . But [historians]2716-historians are not accountable for the difficulty of learning to read ; and even [you]2733-you [yourself]2733-you , who do not altogether seem particularly friendly to very severe , very intense application , may perhaps be brought to acknowledge that it is very well worth - while to be tormented for two or three years of one s life , for the sake of being able to read all the rest of it . Consider if reading had not been taught , [Mrs. Radcliffe]125-mrs. radcliffe would have written in vain or perhaps might not have written at all . "[98-henry]

[Catherine]77-catherine assented and a very warm panegyric from [her]77-catherine on [that lady]951-that lady s merits closed the subject . [The Tilneys]137-the tilneys were soon engaged in another on which [she]77-catherine had nothing to say . [They]137-the tilneys were viewing [the country]224-the country with the eyes of [persons accustomed to drawing]953-persons accustomed to drawing , and decided on its capability of being formed into pictures , with all the eagerness of real taste . Here [Catherine]77-catherine was quite lost . [She]77-catherine knew nothing of drawing nothing of taste : and [she]77-catherine listened to [them]137-the tilneys with an attention which brought [her]77-catherine little profit , for [they]137-the tilneys talked in phrases which conveyed scarcely any idea to [her]77-catherine . The little which [she]77-catherine could understand , however , appeared to contradict the very few notions [she]77-catherine had entertained on the matter before . It seemed as if a good view were no longer to be taken from [the top of [an high hill]955-an high hill]954-the top of an high hill , and that a clear blue sky was no longer a proof of a fine day . [She]77-catherine was heartily ashamed of [her]77-catherine ignorance . A misplaced shame . Where [people]328-people wish to attach , [they]328-people should always be ignorant . [To come with a well - informed mind]957-to come with a well - informed mind is to come with an inability of administering to the vanity of others , which [a sensible person]958-a sensible person would always wish to avoid . [A woman]959-a woman especially , if [she]959-a woman have the misfortune of knowing anything , should conceal it as well as [she]959-a woman can .

The advantages of natural folly in [a beautiful girl]960-a beautiful girl have been already set forth by the capital pen of [a sister author]961-a sister author ; and to [her]961-a sister author treatment of the subject [I]0-i will only add , in justice to [men]2187-men , that though to the larger and more trifling part of the sex , imbecility in [females]963-females is a great enhancement of [their]963-females personal charms , there is a portion of [them]963-females too reasonable and too well informed [themselves]963-females to desire anything more in [woman]756-woman than ignorance . But [Catherine]77-catherine did not know [her]77-catherine own advantages did not know that [a good - looking girl , with an affectionate heart and a very ignorant mind]965-a good - looking girl , with an affectionate heart and a very ignorant mind , can not fail of attracting [a clever young man]966-a clever young man , unless circumstances are particularly untoward . In the present instance , [she]77-catherine confessed and lamented [her]77-catherine want of knowledge , declared that [she]77-catherine would give anything in [the world]197-the world to be able to draw ; and a lecture on the picturesque immediately followed , in which [his]966-a clever young man instructions were so clear that [she]77-catherine soon began to see beauty in everything admired by [him]966-a clever young man , and [her]77-catherine attention was so earnest that [he]966-a clever young man became perfectly satisfied of [her]77-catherine having a great deal of natural taste . [He]966-a clever young man talked of foregrounds , distances , and second distances side - screens and perspectives lights and shades ; and [Catherine]77-catherine was so hopeful [a scholar]968-a scholar that when [they]969-they gained [the top of [Beechen Cliff]52-beechen cliff]970-the top of beechen cliff , [she]77-catherine voluntarily rejected [the whole city of]971-the whole city of [Bath]5-bath as unworthy to make part of [a landscape]972-a landscape . Delighted with [her]77-catherine progress , and fearful of wearying [her]77-catherine with too much wisdom at once , [Henry]98-henry suffered the subject to decline , and by an easy transition from a piece of rocky fragment and the withered oak which [he]98-henry had placed near [its]973-its summit , to oaks in general , to [forests]974-forests , the enclosure of [them]974-forests , [waste lands]975-waste lands , [crown lands]976-crown lands and government , [he]98-henry shortly found [himself]98-henry arrived at politics ; and from politics , it was an easy step to silence . The general pause which succeeded [his]98-henry short disquisition on the state of [the nation]977-the nation was put an end to by [Catherine]77-catherine , who , in rather a solemn tone of voice , uttered these words , " [I]77-catherine have heard that something very shocking indeed will soon come out in [London]12-london . "[77-catherine]

[Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , to whom this was chiefly addressed , was startled , and hastily replied , " Indeed ! And of what nature ? "[95-miss tilney]

" That [I]77-catherine do not know , nor who is [the author]2738-the author . [I]77-catherine have only heard that it is to be more horrible than anything [we]2739-we have met with yet . "[77-catherine]

" Good heaven ! Where could [you]77-catherine hear of such a thing ? "[95-miss tilney]

" [A particular friend of mine]2238-a particular friend of mine had an account of it in a letter from [London]12-london yesterday . It is to be uncommonly dreadful . [I]77-catherine shall expect murder and everything of the kind . "[77-catherine]

" [You]77-catherine speak with astonishing composure ! But [I]95-miss tilney hope [[your]77-catherine friend]2702-your friend s accounts have been exaggerated ; and if such a design is known beforehand , proper measures will undoubtedly be taken by [government]2742-government to prevent its coming to effect . "[95-miss tilney]

" Government , "[98-henry] said [Henry]98-henry , endeavouring not to smile , " neither desires nor dares to interfere in such matters . There must be murder ; and [government]2742-government cares not how much . "[98-henry]

[The ladies]320-the ladies stared . [He]98-henry laughed , and added , " Come , shall [I]98-henry make [you]320-the ladies understand [each other]338-each other , or leave [you]320-the ladies to puzzle out an explanation as [you]320-the ladies can ? No [I]98-henry will be noble . [I]98-henry will prove [myself]98-henry [a man]2268-a man , no less by the generosity of [my]98-henry soul than the clearness of [my]98-henry head . [I]98-henry have no patience with such of [my]98-henry sex as disdain to let [themselves]2746-themselves sometimes down to the comprehension of [yours]320-the ladies . Perhaps the abilities of [women]2184-women are neither sound nor acute neither vigorous nor keen . Perhaps [they]2184-women may want observation , discernment , judgment , fire , genius , and wit . "[98-henry]

" [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , do not mind what [he]98-henry says ; but have the goodness to satisfy [me]98-henry as to this dreadful riot . "[98-henry]

" Riot ! What riot ? "[98-henry]

" [[My]98-henry dear]2124-my dear [Eleanor]145-eleanor , the riot is only in [your]145-eleanor own brain . The confusion there is scandalous . [Miss Morland]90-miss morland has been talking of nothing more dreadful than a new publication which is shortly to come out , in three duodecimo volumes , two hundred and seventy - six pages in each , with a frontispiece to the first , of two tombstones and a lantern do [you]145-eleanor understand ? And [you]145-eleanor , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland [[my]98-henry stupid sister]2749-my stupid sister has mistaken all [your]145-eleanor clearest expressions . [You]145-eleanor talked of expected horrors in [London]12-london and instead of instantly conceiving , as [any rational creature]2750-any rational creature would have done , that such words could relate only to a circulating library , [she]90-miss morland immediately pictured to [herself]90-miss morland a mob of [three thousand men]2751-three thousand men assembling in [St. George s Fields]55-st. george s fields , [the Bank]2752-the bank attacked , [the Tower]2753-the tower threatened , [the streets of [London]12-london]2754-the streets of london flowing with blood , [a detachment of [the Twelfth Light Dragoons]2756-the twelfth light dragoons ( the hopes of [the nation]977-the nation]2755-a detachment of the twelfth light dragoons ( the hopes of the nation ) called up from [Northampton]56-northampton to quell [the insurgents]2758-the insurgents , and [the gallant Captain Frederick Tilney]78-captain tilney , in the moment of charging at the head of [[his]78-captain tilney troop]2759-his troop , knocked off [his]78-captain tilney horse by a brickbat from an upper window . Forgive [her]90-miss morland stupidity . The fears of [the sister]2760-the sister have added to the weakness of [the woman]2517-the woman ; but [she]2517-the woman is by no means [a simpleton in general]2762-a simpleton in general . "[98-henry]

[Catherine]77-catherine looked grave . " And now , [Henry]98-henry , "[95-miss tilney] said [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , " that [you]98-henry have made [us]2763-us understand [each other]338-each other , [you]98-henry may as well make [Miss Morland]90-miss morland understand [yourself]98-henry unless [you]98-henry mean to have [her]90-miss morland think [you]98-henry intolerably rude to [[your]98-henry sister]2195-your sister , and [a great brute in [your]98-henry opinion of [women in general]2767-women in general]2766-a great brute in your opinion of women in general . [Miss Morland]90-miss morland is not used to [your]98-henry odd ways . "[95-miss tilney]

" [I]98-henry shall be most happy to make [her]90-miss morland better acquainted with [them]2767-women in general . "[98-henry]

" No doubt ; but that is no explanation of the present . "[95-miss tilney]

" What am [I]98-henry to do ? "[98-henry]

" [You]98-henry know what [you]98-henry ought to do . Clear [your]98-henry character handsomely before [her]90-miss morland . Tell [her]90-miss morland that [you]98-henry think very highly of the understanding of [women]2184-women . "[95-miss tilney]

" [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , [I]98-henry think very highly of the understanding of [all the women in [the world]197-the world]2769-all the women in the world especially of [those whoever [they]2769-all the women in the world may be with whom [I]98-henry happen to be in company]2771-those whoever they may be with whom i happen to be in company . "[98-henry]

" That is not enough . Be more serious . "[95-miss tilney]

" [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , [no one]366-no one can think more highly of the understanding of [women]2184-women than [I]98-henry do . In [my]98-henry opinion , nature has given [them]2184-women so much that [they]2184-women never find it necessary to use more than half . "[98-henry]

" [We]2774-we shall get nothing more serious from [him]98-henry now , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland . [He]98-henry is not in a sober mood . But [I]95-miss tilney do assure [you]77-catherine that [he]98-henry must be entirely misunderstood , if [he]98-henry can ever appear to say an unjust thing of [any woman]2775-any woman at all , or an unkind one of [me]95-miss tilney . "[95-miss tilney]

It was no effort to [Catherine]77-catherine to believe that [Henry Tilney]98-henry could never be wrong . [His]98-henry manner might sometimes surprise , but [his]98-henry meaning must always be just : and what [she]77-catherine did not understand , [she]77-catherine was almost as ready to admire , as what [she]77-catherine did . The whole walk was delightful , and though it ended too soon , its conclusion was delightful too ; [[her]77-catherine friends]792-her friends attended [her]77-catherine into [the house]216-the house , and [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , before [they]792-her friends parted , addressing [herself]95-miss tilney with respectful form , as much to [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen as to [Catherine]77-catherine , petitioned for the pleasure of [her]95-miss tilney company to dinner on the day after the next . No difficulty was made on [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen s side , and the only difficulty on [Catherine]77-catherine s was in concealing the excess of [her]77-catherine pleasure .

The morning had passed away so charmingly as to banish all [her]77-catherine friendship and natural affection , for no thought of [Isabella]106-isabella or [James]108-james had crossed [her]77-catherine during [their]792-her friends walk . When [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys were gone , [she]77-catherine became amiable again , but [she]77-catherine was amiable for some time to little effect ; [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen had no intelligence to give that could relieve [her]77-catherine anxiety ; [she]77-catherine had heard nothing of [any of [them]137-the tilneys]981-any of them . Towards the end of the morning , however , [Catherine]77-catherine , having occasion for some indispensable yard of ribbon which must be bought without a moment s delay , walked out into [the town]363-the town , and in [Bond Street]57-bond street overtook the second [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe as [she]77-catherine was loitering towards [Edgar s Buildings]28-edgar s buildings between [two of [the sweetest girls in [the world]197-the world]984-the sweetest girls in the world , who had been [[her]77-catherine dear friends]986-her dear friends all the morning]983-two of the sweetest girls in the world , who had been her dear friends all the morning . From [her]77-catherine , [she]77-catherine soon learned that the party to [Clifton]40-clifton had taken place . " [They]137-the tilneys set off at eight this morning , "[157-anne] said [Miss Anne]157-anne , " and [I]157-anne am sure [I]157-anne do not envy [them]137-the tilneys [their]137-the tilneys drive . [I]157-anne think [you]77-catherine and [I]157-anne are very well off to be out of the scrape . It must be the dullest thing in [the world]197-the world , for there is not a soul at [Clifton]40-clifton at this time of year . [Belle]106-isabella went with [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother , and [John]103-john drove [Maria]158-maria . "[157-anne]

[Catherine]77-catherine spoke the pleasure [she]77-catherine really felt on hearing this part of the arrangement .

" Oh ! yes , "[413-the other] rejoined [the other]413-the other , " [Maria]158-maria is gone . [She]158-maria was quite wild to go . [She]158-maria thought it would be something very fine . [I]413-the other can not say [I]413-the other admire [her]158-maria taste ; and for [my]413-the other part , [I]413-the other was determined from the first not to go , if [they]2778-they pressed [me]413-the other ever so much . "[413-the other]

[Catherine]77-catherine , a little doubtful of this , could not help answering , " [I]77-catherine wish [you]413-the other could have gone too . It is a pity [you]413-the other could not all go . "[77-catherine]

" Thank [you]413-the other ; but it is quite a matter of indifference to [me]77-catherine . Indeed , [I]77-catherine would not have gone on any account . [I]77-catherine was saying so to [Emily]147-emily and [Sophia]159-sophia when [you]413-the other overtook [us]2779-us . "[77-catherine]

[Catherine]77-catherine was still unconvinced ; but glad that [Anne]157-anne should have the friendship of an [Emily]147-emily and [a Sophia]988-a sophia to console [her]77-catherine , [she]77-catherine bade [her]77-catherine adieu without much uneasiness , and returned [home]2339-home , pleased that the party had not been prevented by [her]77-catherine refusing to join it , and very heartily wishing that it might be too pleasant to allow either [James]108-james or [Isabella]106-isabella to resent [her]77-catherine resistance any longer .

CHAPTER 15
