Early the next day , a note from [Isabella]106-isabella , speaking peace and tenderness in every line , and entreating the immediate presence of [[her]106-isabella friend]313-her friend on a matter of the utmost importance , hastened [Catherine]77-catherine , in the happiest state of confidence and curiosity , to [[Edgar]160-edgar s Buildings]2277-edgar s buildings . [The two youngest Miss Thorpes]992-the two youngest miss thorpes were by [themselves]992-the two youngest miss thorpes in [the parlour]993-the parlour ; and , on [Anne]157-anne s quitting it to call [[her]157-anne sister]275-her sister , [Catherine]77-catherine took the opportunity of asking [the other]413-the other for some particulars of [their]992-the two youngest miss thorpes yesterday s party . [Maria]158-maria desired no greater pleasure than to speak of it ; and [Catherine]77-catherine immediately learnt that it had been altogether the most delightful scheme in [the world]197-the world , that [nobody]2139-nobody could imagine how charming it had been , and that it had been more delightful than [anybody]198-anybody could conceive . Such was the information of the first five minutes ; the second unfolded thus much in detail that [they]992-the two youngest miss thorpes had driven directly to [the York Hotel]999-the york hotel , ate some soup , and bespoke an early dinner , walked down to [the pump - room]364-the pump - room , tasted the water , and laid out some shillings in purses and spars ; thence adjourned to eat ice at [a pastry - cook s]1001-a pastry - cook s , and hurrying back to [the hotel]290-the hotel , swallowed [their]992-the two youngest miss thorpes dinner in haste , to prevent being in the dark ; and then had a delightful drive back , only the moon was not up , and it rained a little , and [Mr. Morland]108-james s horse was so tired [he]108-james could hardly get it along .

[Catherine]77-catherine listened with heartfelt satisfaction . It appeared that [Blaize Castle]42-blaize castle had never been thought of ; and , as for all the rest , there was nothing to regret for half an instant . [Maria]158-maria s intelligence concluded with a tender effusion of pity for [[her]158-maria sister]275-her sister [Anne]157-anne , whom [she]158-maria represented as insupportably cross , from being excluded the party .

" [She]158-maria will never forgive [me]158-maria , [I]158-maria am sure ; but , [you]77-catherine know , how could [I]158-maria help it ? [John]103-john would have [me]158-maria go , for [he]103-john vowed [he]103-john would not drive [her]158-maria , because [she]158-maria had such thick ankles . [I]158-maria dare say [she]158-maria will not be in good humour again this month ; but [I]158-maria am determined [I]158-maria will not be cross ; it is not a little matter that puts [me]158-maria out of temper . "[158-maria]

[Isabella]106-isabella now entered [the room]308-the room with so eager a step , and a look of such happy importance , as engaged all [[her]106-isabella friend]313-her friend s notice . [Maria]158-maria was without ceremony sent away , and [Isabella]106-isabella , embracing [Catherine]77-catherine , thus began : " Yes , [[my]106-isabella dear]2124-my dear [Catherine]77-catherine , it is so indeed ; [your]77-catherine penetration has not deceived [you]77-catherine . Oh ! That arch eye of [yours]77-catherine ! It sees through everything . "[106-isabella]

[Catherine]77-catherine replied only by a look of wondering ignorance .

" Nay , [[my]413-the other beloved]2450-my beloved , [sweetest friend]2782-sweetest friend , "[413-the other] continued [the other]413-the other , " compose [yourself]77-catherine . [I]413-the other am amazingly agitated , as [you]77-catherine perceive . Let [us]2783-us sit down and talk in comfort . Well , and so [you]77-catherine guessed it the moment [you]77-catherine had [my]413-the other note ? Sly creature ! Oh ! [[My]413-the other dear]2124-my dear [Catherine]77-catherine , [you]77-catherine alone , who know [my]413-the other heart , can judge of [my]413-the other present happiness . [[Your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother is [the most charming of [men]2187-men]2786-the most charming of men . [I]413-the other only wish [I]413-the other were more worthy of [him]2331-your brother . But what will [[your]77-catherine excellent father]2788-your excellent father and [mother]189-mother say ? Oh ! Heavens ! When [I]413-the other think of [them]2790-them [I]413-the other am so agitated ! "[413-the other]

[Catherine]77-catherine s understanding began to awake : an idea of the truth suddenly darted into [her]77-catherine mind ; and , with the natural blush of so new an emotion , [she]77-catherine cried out , " Good heaven ! [[My]77-catherine dear]2124-my dear [Isabella]106-isabella , what do [you]106-isabella mean ? Can [you]106-isabella can [you]106-isabella really be in love with [James]108-james ? "[77-catherine]

This bold surmise , however , [she]77-catherine soon learnt comprehended but half the fact . The anxious affection , which [she]77-catherine was accused of having continually watched in [Isabella]106-isabella s every look and action , had , in the course of [their]1007-their yesterday s party , received the delightful confession of an equal love . [Her]77-catherine heart and faith were alike engaged to [James]108-james . Never had [Catherine]77-catherine listened to anything so full of interest , wonder , and joy . [[Her]77-catherine brother]2221-her brother and [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend engaged ! New to such circumstances , the importance of it appeared unspeakably great , and [she]77-catherine contemplated it as one of those grand events , of which the ordinary course of life can hardly afford a return . The strength of [her]77-catherine feelings [she]77-catherine could not express ; the nature of them , however , contented [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend . The happiness of having [such a sister]1011-such a sister was [their]1007-their first effusion , and [the fair ladies]1012-the fair ladies mingled in embraces and tears of joy .

Delighting , however , as [Catherine]77-catherine sincerely did in the prospect of the connection , it must be acknowledged that [Isabella]106-isabella far surpassed [her]77-catherine in tender anticipations . " [You]77-catherine will be so infinitely dearer to [me]106-isabella , [[my]106-isabella Catherine]2792-my catherine , than either [Anne]157-anne or [Maria]158-maria : [I]106-isabella feel that [I]106-isabella shall be so much more attached to [[my]106-isabella dear [Morland]77-catherine s family]2793-my dear morland s family than to [my]106-isabella own . "[106-isabella]

This was a pitch of friendship beyond [Catherine]77-catherine .

" [You]77-catherine are so like [[your]77-catherine dear brother]2794-your dear brother , "[106-isabella] continued [Isabella]106-isabella , " that [I]106-isabella quite doted on [you]77-catherine the first moment [I]106-isabella saw [you]77-catherine . But so it always is with [me]106-isabella ; the first moment settles everything . The very first day that [Morland]77-catherine came to [us]2795-us last Christmas the very first moment [I]106-isabella beheld [him]2794-your dear brother [my]106-isabella heart was irrecoverably gone . [I]106-isabella remember [I]106-isabella wore [my]106-isabella yellow gown , with [my]106-isabella hair done up in braids ; and when [I]106-isabella came into [the drawing - room]448-the drawing - room , and [John]103-john introduced [him]2221-her brother , [I]106-isabella thought [I]106-isabella never saw [anybody so handsome]2797-anybody so handsome before . "[106-isabella]

Here [Catherine]77-catherine secretly acknowledged the power of love ; for , though exceedingly fond of [[her]77-catherine brother]2221-her brother , and partial to all [his]2221-her brother endowments , [she]77-catherine had never in [her]77-catherine life thought [him]2221-her brother handsome .

" [I]106-isabella remember too , [Miss Andrews]115-miss andrews drank tea with [us]2798-us that evening , and wore [her]115-miss andrews puce - coloured sarsenet ; and [she]115-miss andrews looked so heavenly that [I]106-isabella thought [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother must certainly fall in love with [her]115-miss andrews ; [I]106-isabella could not sleep a wink all night for thinking of it . Oh ! [Catherine]77-catherine , the many sleepless nights [I]106-isabella have had on [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother s account ! [I]106-isabella would not have [you]77-catherine suffer half what [I]106-isabella have done ! [I]106-isabella am grown wretchedly thin , [I]106-isabella know ; but [I]106-isabella will not pain [you]77-catherine by describing [my]106-isabella anxiety ; [you]77-catherine have seen enough of it . [I]106-isabella feel that [I]106-isabella have betrayed [myself]106-isabella perpetually so unguarded in speaking of [my]106-isabella partiality for [the church]2801-the church ! But [my]106-isabella secret [I]106-isabella was always sure would be safe with _ [you]77-catherine _ . "[106-isabella]

[Catherine]77-catherine felt that nothing could have been safer ; but ashamed of an ignorance little expected , [she]77-catherine dared no longer contest the point , nor refuse to have been as full of arch penetration and affectionate sympathy as [Isabella]106-isabella chose to consider [her]77-catherine . [[Her]77-catherine brother]2221-her brother , [she]77-catherine found , was preparing to set off with all speed to [Fullerton]3-fullerton , to make known [his]2221-her brother situation and ask consent ; and here was a source of some real agitation to the mind of [Isabella]106-isabella . [Catherine]77-catherine endeavoured to persuade [her]106-isabella , as [she]77-catherine was [herself]77-catherine persuaded , that [[her]77-catherine father]188-her father and [mother]189-mother would never oppose [[their]1017-their son]1018-their son s wishes . " It is impossible , "[77-catherine] said [she]77-catherine , " for [parents]2802-parents to be more kind , or more desirous of [[their]2802-parents children]2803-their children s happiness ; [I]77-catherine have no doubt of [their]2802-parents consenting immediately . "[77-catherine]

" [Morland]77-catherine says exactly the same , "[106-isabella] replied [Isabella]106-isabella ; " and yet [I]106-isabella dare not expect it ; [my]106-isabella fortune will be so small ; [they]2802-parents never can consent to it . [[Your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother , who might marry [anybody]198-anybody ! "[106-isabella]

Here [Catherine]77-catherine again discerned the force of love .

" Indeed , [Isabella]106-isabella , [you]106-isabella are too humble . The difference of fortune can be nothing to signify . "[1019-all the heroines of her acquaintance]

" Oh ! [My]1019-all the heroines of her acquaintance sweet [Catherine]77-catherine , in _ [your]77-catherine _ generous heart [I]1019-all the heroines of her acquaintance know it would signify nothing ; but [we]2806-we must not expect such disinterestedness in many . As for [myself]1019-all the heroines of her acquaintance , [I]1019-all the heroines of her acquaintance am sure [I]1019-all the heroines of her acquaintance only wish [our]2806-we situations were reversed . Had [I]1019-all the heroines of her acquaintance the command of [millions]2807-millions , were [[I]1019-all the heroines of her acquaintance mistress of [the whole world]2809-the whole world]2808-i mistress of the whole world , [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother would be [my]1019-all the heroines of her acquaintance only choice . "[1019-all the heroines of her acquaintance]

This charming sentiment , recommended as much by sense as novelty , gave [Catherine]77-catherine a most pleasing remembrance of [all the heroines of [her]77-catherine acquaintance]1019-all the heroines of her acquaintance ; and [she]77-catherine thought [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend never looked more lovely than in uttering the grand idea . " [I]77-catherine am sure [they]2811-they will consent , "[77-catherine] was [her]77-catherine frequent declaration ; " [I]77-catherine am sure [they]2811-they will be delighted with [you]77-catherine . "[77-catherine]

" For [my]106-isabella own part , "[106-isabella] said [Isabella]106-isabella , " [my]106-isabella wishes are so moderate that the smallest income in nature would be enough for [me]106-isabella . Where [people]328-people are really attached , poverty itself is wealth ; grandeur [I]106-isabella detest : [I]106-isabella would not settle in [London]12-london for the universe . [A cottage in [some retired village]2814-some retired village]2813-a cottage in some retired village would be ecstasy . There are [some charming little villas about [Richmond]58-richmond]2815-some charming little villas about richmond . "[106-isabella]

" [Richmond]58-richmond ! "[77-catherine] cried [Catherine]77-catherine . " [You]77-catherine must settle near [Fullerton]3-fullerton . [You]77-catherine must be near [us]2816-we . "[77-catherine]

" [I]1022-the anxious young lover himself , who came to breathe his parting sigh before he set off for wiltshire am sure [I]1022-the anxious young lover himself , who came to breathe his parting sigh before he set off for wiltshire shall be miserable if [we]2816-we do not . But this is idle talking ! [Morland]77-catherine says that by sending it tonight to [Salisbury]8-salisbury , [we]2816-we may have it tomorrow . Tomorrow ? "[1022-the anxious young lover himself , who came to breathe his parting sigh before he set off for wiltshire]

A reverie succeeded this conviction and when [Isabella]106-isabella spoke again , it was to resolve on the quality of [her]106-isabella wedding - gown .

[Their]1021-their conference was put an end to by [the anxious young lover [himself]1022-the anxious young lover himself , who came to breathe his parting sigh before he set off for wiltshire , who came to breathe [his]1022-the anxious young lover himself , who came to breathe his parting sigh before he set off for wiltshire parting sigh before [he]1022-the anxious young lover himself , who came to breathe his parting sigh before he set off for wiltshire set off for [Wiltshire]4-wiltshire]1022-the anxious young lover himself , who came to breathe his parting sigh before he set off for wiltshire . [Catherine]77-catherine wished to congratulate [him]1022-the anxious young lover himself , who came to breathe his parting sigh before he set off for wiltshire , but knew not what to say , and [her]77-catherine eloquence was only in [her]77-catherine eyes . From them , however , the eight parts of speech shone out most expressively , and [James]108-james could combine them with ease . Impatient for the realization of all that [he]108-james hoped at [home]2339-home , [his]108-james adieus were not long ; and they would have been yet shorter , had [he]108-james not been frequently detained by the urgent entreaties of [his]108-james fair one that [he]108-james would go . Twice was [he]108-james called almost from the door by [her]77-catherine eagerness to have [him]108-james gone . " Indeed , [Morland]108-james , [I]108-james must drive [you]108-james away . Consider how far [you]108-james have to ride . [I]108-james can not bear to see [you]108-james linger so . For heaven s sake , waste no more time . There , go , go [I]108-james insist on it . "[108-james]

[The two friends]514-the two friends , with hearts now more united than ever , were inseparable for the day ; and in schemes of sisterly happiness the hours flew along . [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe and [[her]102-mrs. thorpe son]657-her son , who were acquainted with everything , and who seemed only to want [Mr. Morland]108-james s consent , to consider [Isabella]106-isabella s engagement as the most fortunate circumstance imaginable for [[their]514-the two friends family]1026-their family , were allowed to join [their]514-the two friends counsels , and add [their]514-the two friends quota of significant looks and mysterious expressions to fill up the measure of curiosity to be raised in [the unprivileged younger sisters]1027-the unprivileged younger sisters . To [Catherine]77-catherine s simple feelings , this odd sort of reserve seemed neither kindly meant , nor consistently supported ; and its unkindness [she]77-catherine would hardly have forborne pointing out , had its inconsistency been less [[their]514-the two friends friend]1028-their friend ; but [Anne]157-anne and [Maria]158-maria soon set [her]77-catherine heart at ease by the sagacity of [their]514-the two friends " [I]313-her friend know what "[313-her friend] ; and the evening was spent in a sort of war of wit , a display of family ingenuity , on one side in the mystery of an affected secret , on the other of undefined discovery , all equally acute .

[Catherine]77-catherine was with [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend again the next day , endeavouring to support [her]77-catherine spirits and while away the many tedious hours before the delivery of the letters ; a needful exertion , for as the time of reasonable expectation drew near , [Isabella]106-isabella became more and more desponding , and before the letter arrived , had worked [herself]106-isabella into a state of real distress . But when it did come , where could distress be found ? " [I]106-isabella have had no difficulty in gaining the consent of [[my]106-isabella kind parents]2818-my kind parents , and am promised that everything in [their]2818-my kind parents power shall be done to forward [my]106-isabella happiness , "[106-isabella] were the first three lines , and in one moment all was joyful security . The brightest glow was instantly spread over [Isabella]106-isabella s features , all care and anxiety seemed removed , [her]106-isabella spirits became almost too high for control , and [she]106-isabella called [herself]106-isabella without scruple [the happiest of mortals]1030-the happiest of mortals .

[Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe , with tears of joy , embraced [[her]102-mrs. thorpe daughter]272-her daughter , [[her]102-mrs. thorpe son]657-her son , [[her]102-mrs. thorpe visitor]1033-her visitor , and could have embraced [half the inhabitants of [Bath]5-bath]1034-half the inhabitants of bath with satisfaction . [Her]102-mrs. thorpe heart was overflowing with tenderness . It was " [dear John]103-john "[2819-two " dears "] and " dear [Catherine]77-catherine "[2819-two " dears "] at every word ; " dear [Anne]157-anne and [dear Maria]158-maria "[1035-sharers] must immediately be made [sharers]1035-sharers in [their]1035-sharers felicity ; and [two " dears "]2819-two " dears "[2819-two " dears "] at once before the name of [Isabella]106-isabella were not more than [that beloved child]1036-that beloved child had now well earned . [John]103-john [himself]103-john was [no skulker in joy]1037-no skulker in joy . [He]103-john not only bestowed on [Mr. Morland]108-james the high commendation of being [one of the finest fellows in [the world]197-the world]1038-one of the finest fellows in the world , but swore off many sentences in [his]103-john praise .

The letter , whence sprang all this felicity , was short , containing little more than this assurance of success ; and every particular was deferred till [James]108-james could write again . But for particulars [Isabella]106-isabella could well afford to wait . The needful was comprised in [Mr. Morland]108-james s promise ; [his]108-james honour was pledged to make everything easy ; and by what means [their]1040-their income was to be formed , whether [landed property]1041-landed property were to be resigned , or funded money made over , was a matter in which [her]106-isabella disinterested spirit took no concern . [She]106-isabella knew enough to feel secure of an honourable and speedy establishment , and [her]106-isabella imagination took a rapid flight over its attendant felicities . [She]106-isabella saw [herself]106-isabella at the end of a few weeks , the gaze and admiration of [every new acquaintance at [Fullerton]3-fullerton]1042-every new acquaintance at fullerton , the envy of [every valued old friend in [Putney]59-putney]1043-every valued old friend in putney , with [a carriage]672-a carriage at [her]106-isabella command , a new name on [her]106-isabella tickets , and a brilliant exhibition of hoop rings on [her]106-isabella finger .

When the contents of the letter were ascertained , [John Thorpe]103-john , who had only waited [its]1045-its arrival to begin [his]103-john journey to [London]12-london , prepared to set off . " Well , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , "[103-john] said [he]103-john , on finding [her]106-isabella alone in [the parlour]993-the parlour , " [I]77-catherine am come to bid [you]106-isabella good - bye . "[77-catherine] [Catherine]77-catherine wished [him]103-john a good journey . Without appearing to hear [her]77-catherine , [he]103-john walked to the window , fidgeted about , hummed a tune , and seemed wholly self - occupied .

" Shall not [you]103-john be late at [Devizes]60-devizes ? "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine . [He]103-john made no answer ; but after a minute s silence burst out with , " A famous good thing this marrying scheme , upon [my]103-john soul ! A clever fancy of [Morland]77-catherine s and [Belle]106-isabella s. What do [you]103-john think of it , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland ? _ [I]103-john _ say it is no bad notion . "[103-john]

" [I]77-catherine am sure [I]77-catherine think it a very good one . "[77-catherine]

" Do [you]103-john ? That s honest , by heavens ! [I]103-john am glad [you]90-miss morland are [no enemy to matrimony]2820-no enemy to matrimony , however . Did [you]103-john ever hear the old song Going to One Wedding Brings on Another ? [I]103-john say , [you]103-john will come to [Belle]106-isabella s wedding , [I]103-john hope . "[103-john]

" Yes ; [I]77-catherine have promised [[your]103-john sister]2195-your sister to be with [her]2195-your sister , if possible . "[77-catherine]

" And then [you]103-john know "[103-john] twisting [himself]1047-himself about and forcing a foolish laugh " [I]103-john say , then [you]90-miss morland know , [we]2822-we may try the truth of this same old song . "[103-john]

" May [we]2822-we ? But [I]103-john never sing . Well , [I]103-john wish [you]90-miss morland a good journey . [I]103-john dine with [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney today , and must now be going [home]2339-home . "[103-john]

" Nay , but there is no such confounded hurry . Who knows when [we]2822-we may be together again ? Not but that [I]103-john shall be down again by the end of a fortnight , and a devilish long fortnight it will appear to [me]103-john . "[103-john]

" Then why do [you]1047-himself stay away so long ? "[77-catherine] replied [Catherine]77-catherine finding that [he]1047-himself waited for an answer .

" That is kind of [you]90-miss morland , however kind and good - natured . [I]103-john shall not forget it in a hurry . But [you]90-miss morland have more good nature and all that , than [anybody living]2824-anybody living , [I]103-john believe . "[103-john]

" Oh ! dear , there are [a great many people like [me]103-john]2826-a great many people like me , [I]103-john dare say , only a great deal better . Good morning to [you]90-miss morland . "[103-john]

" But [I]103-john say , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , [I]103-john shall come and pay [my]103-john respects at [Fullerton]3-fullerton before it is long , if not disagreeable . "[103-john]

" Pray do . [[My]103-john father]2473-my father and [mother]189-mother will be very glad to see [you]103-john . "[103-john]

" And [I]103-john hope [I]103-john hope , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , _ [you]90-miss morland _ will not be sorry to see [me]103-john . "[103-john]

" Oh ! dear , not at all . There are [very few people [I]103-john am sorry to see]2829-very few people i am sorry to see . [Company]2830-company is always cheerful . "[103-john]

" That is just [my]103-john way of thinking . Give [me]103-john but a little cheerful company , let [me]103-john only have the company of [the people [I]103-john love]2831-the people i love , let [me]103-john only be where [I]103-john like and with whom [I]103-john like , and [the devil take the rest]2832-the devil take the rest , say [I.]103-john And [I]103-john am heartily glad to hear [you]90-miss morland say the same . But [I]103-john have a notion , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , [you]90-miss morland and [I]103-john think pretty much alike upon most matters . "[103-john]

" Perhaps [we]2833-we may ; but it is more than [I]103-john ever thought of . And as to _ most matters _ , to say the truth , there are not many that [I]103-john know [my]103-john own mind about . "[103-john]

" By [Jove]138-jove , no more do [I.]103-john It is not [my]103-john way to bother [my]103-john brains with what does not concern [me]103-john . [My]103-john notion of things is simple enough . Let [me]103-john only have [the girl]2834-the girl [I]103-john like , say [I]103-john , with [a comfortable house over [my]103-john head]2835-a comfortable house over my head , and what care [I]103-john for all the rest ? Fortune is nothing . [I]103-john am sure of a good income of [my]103-john own ; and if [she]2834-the girl had not a penny , why , so much the better . "[103-john]

" Very true . [I]103-john think like [you]1048-her there . If there is a good fortune on one side , there can be no occasion for any on the other . No matter which has it , so that there is enough . [I]103-john hate the idea of one great fortune looking out for another . And to marry for money [I]103-john think the wickedest thing in existence . Good day . [We]2836-we shall be very glad to see [you]1048-her at [Fullerton]3-fullerton , whenever it is convenient . "[103-john] And away [she]1048-her went . It was not in the power of all [his]1049-his gallantry to detain [her]1048-her longer . With such news to communicate , and such a visit to prepare for , [her]1048-her departure was not to be delayed by anything in [his]1049-his nature to urge ; and [she]1048-her hurried away , leaving [him]1049-his to the undivided consciousness of [his]1049-his own happy address , and [her]1048-her explicit encouragement .

The agitation which [she]1048-her had [herself]1048-her experienced on first learning [[her]1048-her brother]2221-her brother s engagement made [her]1048-her expect to raise no inconsiderable emotion in [Mr.]1051-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , by the communication of the wonderful event . How great was [her]1048-her disappointment ! The important affair , which many words of preparation ushered in , had been foreseen by [them]1052-them both ever since [[her]1048-her brother]2221-her brother s arrival ; and all that [they]1052-them felt on the occasion was comprehended in a wish for [the young people]1054-the young people s happiness , with a remark , on [the gentleman]387-the gentleman s side , in favour of [Isabella]106-isabella s beauty , and on [the lady]383-the lady s , of [her]383-the lady great good luck . It was to [Catherine]77-catherine the most surprising insensibility . The disclosure , however , of the great secret of [James]108-james s going to [Fullerton]3-fullerton the day before , did raise some emotion in [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen . [She]1048-her could not listen to that with perfect calmness , but repeatedly regretted the necessity of its concealment , wished [she]1048-her could have known [his]108-james intention , wished [she]1048-her could have seen [him]108-james before [he]108-james went , as [she]1048-her should certainly have troubled [him]108-james with [her]1048-her best regards to [[his]108-james father]859-his father and [mother]189-mother , and [her]1048-her kind compliments to [all the Skinners]1059-all the skinners .

CHAPTER 16

[Catherine]77-catherine s expectations of pleasure from [her]77-catherine visit in [Milsom Street]15-milsom street were so very high that disappointment was inevitable ; and accordingly , though [she]77-catherine was most politely received by [General Tilney]143-general tilney , and kindly welcomed by [[his]143-general tilney daughter]2444-his daughter , though [Henry]98-henry was at [home]2339-home , and [no one else of the party]1062-no one else of the party , [she]77-catherine found , on [her]77-catherine return , without spending many hours in the examination of [her]77-catherine feelings , that [she]77-catherine had gone to [her]77-catherine appointment preparing for happiness which it had not afforded . Instead of finding [herself]77-catherine improved in acquaintance with [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , from the intercourse of the day , [she]77-catherine seemed hardly so intimate with [her]95-miss tilney as before ; instead of seeing [Henry Tilney]98-henry to greater advantage than ever , in the ease of a family party , [he]98-henry had never said so little , nor been so little agreeable ; and , in spite of [[their]1063-their father]1064-their father s great civilities to [her]77-catherine in spite of [his]98-henry thanks , invitations , and compliments it had been a release to get away from [him]98-henry . It puzzled [her]77-catherine to account for all this . It could not be [General Tilney]143-general tilney s fault . That [he]98-henry was perfectly agreeable and good - natured , and altogether [a very charming man]1065-a very charming man , did not admit of a doubt , for [he]98-henry was tall and handsome , and [[Henry]98-henry s father]1066-henry s father . _ [He]98-henry _ could not be accountable for [[his]98-henry children]1067-his children s want of spirits , or for [her]77-catherine want of enjoyment in [his]98-henry company . The former [she]77-catherine hoped at last might have been accidental , and the latter [she]77-catherine could only attribute to [her]77-catherine own stupidity . [Isabella]106-isabella , on hearing the particulars of the visit , gave a different explanation : " It was all pride , pride , insufferable haughtiness and pride ! [She]77-catherine had long suspected [the family]457-the family to be very high , and this made it certain . Such insolence of behaviour as [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney s [she]77-catherine had never heard of in [her]77-catherine life ! Not to do the honours of [[her]77-catherine house]2838-her house with common good breeding ! To behave to [[her]77-catherine guest]2839-her guest with such superciliousness ! Hardly even to speak to [her]77-catherine ! "[106-isabella]

" But it was not so bad as that , [Isabella]106-isabella ; there was no superciliousness ; [she]77-catherine was very civil . "[106-isabella]

" Oh ! Don t defend [her]77-catherine ! And then [the brother]2840-the brother , [he]2840-the brother , who had appeared so attached to [you]106-isabella ! Good heavens ! Well , [some people]2298-some people s feelings are incomprehensible . And so [he]2840-the brother hardly looked once at [you]106-isabella the whole day ? "[106-isabella]

" [I]106-isabella do not say so ; but [he]2840-the brother did not seem in good spirits . "[106-isabella]

" How contemptible ! Of all things in [the world]197-the world inconstancy is [my]106-isabella aversion . Let [me]106-isabella entreat [you]106-isabella never to think of [him]2840-the brother again , [[my]106-isabella dear]2124-my dear [Catherine]77-catherine ; indeed [he]2840-the brother is unworthy of [you]106-isabella . "[106-isabella]

" Unworthy ! [I]106-isabella do not suppose [he]2840-the brother ever thinks of [me]106-isabella . "[106-isabella]

" That is exactly what [I]106-isabella say ; [he]2840-the brother never thinks of [you]106-isabella . Such fickleness ! Oh ! How different to [[your]106-isabella brother]2331-your brother and to [mine]106-isabella ! [I]106-isabella really believe [John]103-john has the most constant heart . "[106-isabella]

" But as for [General Tilney]143-general tilney , [I]106-isabella assure [you]143-general tilney it would be impossible for [anybody]198-anybody to behave to [me]106-isabella with greater civility and attention ; it seemed to be [his]2840-the brother only care to entertain and make [me]106-isabella happy . "[106-isabella]

" Oh ! [I]106-isabella know no harm of [him]2840-the brother ; [I]106-isabella do not suspect [him]2840-the brother of pride . [I]106-isabella believe [he]2840-the brother is [a very gentleman - like man]2846-a very gentleman - like man . [John]103-john thinks very well of [him]2840-the brother , and [John]103-john s judgment "[106-isabella]

" Well , [I]106-isabella shall see how [they]2847-they behave to [me]106-isabella this evening ; [we]106-isabella shall meet [them]2847-they at [the rooms]2123-the rooms . "[106-isabella]

" And must [I]106-isabella go ? "[106-isabella]

" Do not [you]106-isabella intend it ? [I]106-isabella thought it was all settled . "[106-isabella]

" Nay , since [you]106-isabella make such a point of it , [I]106-isabella can refuse [you]106-isabella nothing . But do not insist upon [my]106-isabella being very agreeable , for [my]106-isabella heart , [you]106-isabella know , will be some forty miles off . And as for dancing , do not mention it , [I]106-isabella beg ; _ that _ is quite out of the question . [Charles Hodges]162-charles hodges will plague [me]106-isabella to death , [I]106-isabella dare say ; but [I]106-isabella shall cut [him]162-charles hodges very short . Ten to one but [he]162-charles hodges guesses the reason , and that is exactly what [I]106-isabella want to avoid , so [I]106-isabella shall insist on [his]162-charles hodges keeping [his]162-charles hodges conjecture to [himself]162-charles hodges . "[106-isabella]

[Isabella]106-isabella s opinion of [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys did not influence [[her]106-isabella friend]313-her friend ; [she]106-isabella was sure there had been no insolence in the manners either of [brother]2303-brother or [sister]721-sister ; and [she]106-isabella did not credit there being any pride in [their]137-the tilneys hearts . The evening rewarded [her]106-isabella confidence ; [she]106-isabella was met by one with the same kindness , and by [the other with the same attention]1071-the other with the same attention , as heretofore : [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney took pains to be near [her]106-isabella , and [Henry]98-henry asked [her]106-isabella to dance .

Having heard the day before in [Milsom Street]15-milsom street that [[their]137-the tilneys elder brother]1072-their elder brother , [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney , was expected almost every hour , [she]106-isabella was at no loss for the name of [a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom [she]106-isabella had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to [their]137-the tilneys party]1073-a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom she had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to their party . [She]106-isabella looked at [him]1073-a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom she had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to their party with great admiration , and even supposed it possible that [some people]2298-some people might think [him]1073-a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom she had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to their party handsomer than [[his]1073-a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom she had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to their party brother]1075-his brother , though , in [her]106-isabella eyes , [his]1073-a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom she had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to their party air was more assuming , and [his]1073-a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom she had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to their party countenance less prepossessing . [His]1073-a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom she had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to their party taste and manners were beyond a doubt decidedly inferior ; for , within [her]106-isabella hearing , [he]1073-a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom she had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to their party not only protested against every thought of dancing [himself]1073-a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom she had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to their party , but even laughed openly at [Henry]98-henry for finding it possible . From the latter circumstance it may be presumed that , whatever might be [our]1076-our heroine s opinion of [him]1073-a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom she had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to their party , [his]1073-a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom she had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to their party admiration of [her]106-isabella was not of a very dangerous kind ; not likely to produce animosities between [the brothers]1077-the brothers , nor persecutions to [the lady]383-the lady . _ [He]1073-a very fashionable - looking , handsome young man , whom she had never seen before , and who now evidently belonged to their party _ can not be [the instigator of the three villains in horsemen s greatcoats]1079-the instigator of the three villains in horsemen s greatcoats , by whom [she]106-isabella will hereafter be forced into a traveling - chaise and four , which will drive off with incredible speed . [Catherine]1080-catherine , meanwhile , undisturbed by presentiments of such an evil , or of any evil at all , except that of having but a short set to dance down , enjoyed [her]1080-catherine usual happiness with [Henry Tilney]98-henry , listening with sparkling eyes to everything [he]98-henry said ; and , in finding [him]98-henry irresistible , becoming so [herself]1080-catherine .

At the end of the first dance , [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney came towards [them]1081-them again , and , much to [Catherine]77-catherine s dissatisfaction , pulled [[his]78-captain tilney brother]1075-his brother away . [They]1081-them retired whispering together ; and , though [her]77-catherine delicate sensibility did not take immediate alarm , and lay it down as fact , that [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney must have heard some malevolent misrepresentation of [her]77-catherine , which [he]78-captain tilney now hastened to communicate to [[his]78-captain tilney brother]1075-his brother , in the hope of separating [them]1081-them forever , [she]77-catherine could not have [[her]77-catherine partner]393-her partner conveyed from [her]77-catherine sight without very uneasy sensations . [Her]77-catherine suspense was of full five minutes duration ; and [she]77-catherine was beginning to think it a very long quarter of an hour , when [they]1081-them both returned , and an explanation was given , by [Henry]98-henry s requesting to know if [she]77-catherine thought [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend , [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe , would have any objection to dancing , as [[his]78-captain tilney brother]1075-his brother would be most happy to be introduced to [her]77-catherine . [Catherine]77-catherine , without hesitation , replied that [she]77-catherine was very sure [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe did not mean to dance at all . The cruel reply was passed on to [the other]413-the other , and [he]1075-his brother immediately walked away .

" [[Your]98-henry brother]2331-your brother will not mind it , [I]77-catherine know , "[77-catherine] said [she]77-catherine , " because [I]77-catherine heard [him]2331-your brother say before that [he]2331-your brother hated dancing ; but it was very good - natured in [him]2331-your brother to think of it . [I]77-catherine suppose [he]2331-your brother saw [Isabella]106-isabella sitting down , and fancied [she]106-isabella might wish for [a partner]2125-a partner ; but [he]2331-your brother is quite mistaken , for [she]106-isabella would not dance upon any account in [the world]197-the world . "[77-catherine]

[Henry]98-henry smiled , and said , " How very little trouble it can give [you]77-catherine to understand the motive of [other people]229-other people s actions . "[98-henry]

" Why ? What do [you]77-catherine mean ? "[413-the other]

" With [you]77-catherine , it is not , How is such a one likely to be influenced , What is the inducement most likely to act upon [such a person]2853-such a person s feelings , age , situation , and probable habits of life considered but , How should _ [I]98-henry _ be influenced , What would be _ [my]98-henry _ inducement in acting so and so ? "[98-henry]

" [I]413-the other do not understand [you]77-catherine . "[413-the other]

" Then [we]2854-we are on very unequal terms , for [I]98-henry understand [you]77-catherine perfectly well . "[98-henry]

" [Me]413-the other ? Yes ; [I]413-the other can not speak well enough to be unintelligible . "[413-the other]

" Bravo ! An excellent satire on modern language . "[98-henry]

" But pray tell [me]413-the other what [you]77-catherine mean . "[413-the other]

" Shall [I]98-henry indeed ? Do [you]77-catherine really desire it ? But [you]77-catherine are not aware of the consequences ; it will involve [you]77-catherine in a very cruel embarrassment , and certainly bring on a disagreement between [us]2854-we . "[98-henry]

" No , no ; it shall not do either ; [I]413-the other am not afraid . "[413-the other]

" Well , then , [I]98-henry only meant that [your]77-catherine attributing [[my]98-henry brother]2282-my brother s wish of dancing with [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe to good nature alone convinced [me]98-henry of [your]77-catherine being superior in good nature [yourself]77-catherine to [all the rest of [the world]197-the world]2856-all the rest of the world . "[98-henry]

[Catherine]77-catherine blushed and disclaimed , and [the gentleman]387-the gentleman s predictions were verified . There was a something , however , in [his]387-the gentleman words which repaid [her]77-catherine for the pain of confusion ; and that something occupied [her]77-catherine mind so much that [she]77-catherine drew back for some time , forgetting to speak or to listen , and almost forgetting where [she]77-catherine was ; till , roused by the voice of [Isabella]106-isabella , [she]77-catherine looked up and saw [her]106-isabella with [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney preparing to give [them]1089-them hands across .

[Isabella]106-isabella shrugged [her]106-isabella shoulders and smiled , the only explanation of this extraordinary change which could at that time be given ; but as it was not quite enough for [Catherine]77-catherine s comprehension , [she]106-isabella spoke [her]106-isabella astonishment in very plain terms to [[her]106-isabella partner]393-her partner .

" [I]106-isabella can not think how it could happen ! [Isabella]106-isabella was so determined not to dance . "[106-isabella]

" And did [Isabella]106-isabella never change [her]106-isabella mind before ? "[106-isabella]

" Oh ! But , because And [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother ! After what [you]77-catherine told [him]2331-your brother from [me]106-isabella , how could [he]2331-your brother think of going to ask [her]106-isabella ? "[106-isabella]

" [I]106-isabella can not take surprise to [myself]106-isabella on that head . [You]77-catherine bid [me]106-isabella be surprised on [[your]77-catherine friend]2702-your friend s account , and therefore [I]106-isabella am ; but as for [[my]106-isabella brother]2282-my brother , [his]2331-your brother conduct in the business , [I]106-isabella must own , has been no more than [I]106-isabella believed [him]2331-your brother perfectly equal to . The fairness of [[your]77-catherine friend]2702-your friend was an open attraction ; [her]106-isabella firmness , [you]77-catherine know , could only be understood by [yourself]77-catherine . "[106-isabella]

" [You]77-catherine are laughing ; but , [I]106-isabella assure [you]77-catherine , [Isabella]106-isabella is very firm in general . "[106-isabella]

" It is as much as should be said of [anyone]2862-anyone . To be always firm must be to be often obstinate . When properly to relax is the trial of judgment ; and , without reference to [[my]106-isabella brother]2282-my brother , [I]106-isabella really think [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe has by no means chosen ill in fixing on the present hour . "[106-isabella]

[The friends]1091-the friends were not able to get together for any confidential discourse till all the dancing was over ; but then , as [they]1091-the friends walked about [the room]308-the room arm in arm , [Isabella]106-isabella thus explained [herself]106-isabella : " [I]106-isabella do not wonder at [your]77-catherine surprise ; and [I]106-isabella am really fatigued to death . [He]2282-my brother is such a rattle ! Amusing enough , if [my]106-isabella mind had been disengaged ; but [I]106-isabella would have given [the world]197-the world to sit still . "[106-isabella]

" Then why did not [you]106-isabella ? "[106-isabella]

" Oh ! [[My]106-isabella dear]2124-my dear ! It would have looked so particular ; and [you]2124-my dear know how [I]106-isabella abhor doing that . [I]106-isabella refused [him]2282-my brother as long as [I]106-isabella possibly could , but [he]2282-my brother would take no denial . [You]2124-my dear have no idea how [he]2282-my brother pressed [me]106-isabella . [I]106-isabella begged [him]2282-my brother to excuse [me]106-isabella , and get [some other partner]2866-some other partner but no , not [he]2282-my brother ; after aspiring to [my]106-isabella hand , there was [nobody else in [the room]308-the room [he]2282-my brother could bear to think of]2867-nobody else in the room he could bear to think of ; and it was not that [he]2282-my brother wanted merely to dance , [he]2282-my brother wanted to be with [me]106-isabella . Oh ! Such nonsense ! [I]106-isabella told [him]2282-my brother [he]2282-my brother had taken a very unlikely way to prevail upon [me]106-isabella ; for , of all things in [the world]197-the world , [I]106-isabella hated fine speeches and compliments ; and so and so then [I]106-isabella found there would be no peace if [I]106-isabella did not stand up . Besides , [I]106-isabella thought [Mrs. Hughes]128-mrs. hughes , who introduced [him]2282-my brother , might take it ill if [I]106-isabella did not : and [[your]2870-your dear brother]2794-your dear brother , [I]106-isabella am sure [he]2282-my brother would have been miserable if [I]106-isabella had sat down the whole evening . [I]106-isabella am so glad it is over ! [My]106-isabella spirits are quite jaded with listening to [his]2282-my brother nonsense : and then , being such [a smart young fellow]2872-a smart young fellow , [I]106-isabella saw every eye was upon [us]2873-us . "[106-isabella]

" [He]2282-my brother is very handsome indeed . "[106-isabella]

" Handsome ! Yes , [I]106-isabella suppose [he]2282-my brother may . [I]106-isabella dare say [people]328-people would admire [him]2282-my brother in general ; but [he]2282-my brother is not at all in [my]106-isabella style of beauty . [I]106-isabella hate a florid complexion and dark eyes in [a man]2268-a man . However , [he]2282-my brother is very well . Amazingly conceited , [I]106-isabella am sure . [I]106-isabella took [him]2282-my brother down several times , [you]2876-you know , in [my]106-isabella way . "[106-isabella]

When [the young ladies]560-the young ladies next met , [they]560-the young ladies had a far more interesting subject to discuss . [James Morland]108-james s second letter was then received , and the kind intentions of [[his]108-james father]859-his father fully explained . A living , of which [Mr. Morland]108-james was [himself]108-james [patron and incumbent]1095-patron and incumbent , of about four hundred pounds yearly value , was to be resigned to [[his]108-james son]2638-his son as soon as [he]2638-his son should be old enough to take it ; no trifling deduction from the family income , no niggardly assignment to [one of [ten children]1098-ten children]1097-one of ten children . An estate of at least equal value , moreover , was assured as [his]108-james future inheritance .

[James]108-james expressed [himself]108-james on the occasion with becoming gratitude ; and the necessity of waiting between two and three years before [they]560-the young ladies could marry , being , however unwelcome , no more than [he]108-james had expected , was borne by [him]108-james without discontent . [Catherine]77-catherine , whose expectations had been as unfixed as [her]77-catherine ideas of [[her]77-catherine father]188-her father s income , and whose judgment was now entirely led by [[her]77-catherine brother]2221-her brother , felt equally well satisfied , and heartily congratulated [Isabella]106-isabella on having everything so pleasantly settled .

" It is very charming indeed , "[106-isabella] said [Isabella]106-isabella , with a grave face . " [Mr. Morland]108-james has behaved vastly handsome indeed , "[102-mrs. thorpe] said [the gentle Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe , looking anxiously at [[her]102-mrs. thorpe daughter]272-her daughter . " [I]102-mrs. thorpe only wish [I]102-mrs. thorpe could do as much . [One]2210-one could not expect more from [him]108-james , [you]106-isabella know . If [he]108-james finds [he]108-james _ can _ do more by and by , [I]102-mrs. thorpe dare say [he]108-james will , for [I]102-mrs. thorpe am sure [he]108-james must be [an excellent good - hearted man]2878-an excellent good - hearted man . Four hundred is but a small income to begin on indeed , but [your]106-isabella wishes , [[my]102-mrs. thorpe dear]2124-my dear [Isabella]106-isabella , are so moderate , [you]106-isabella do not consider how little [you]106-isabella ever want , [[my]102-mrs. thorpe dear]2124-my dear . "[102-mrs. thorpe]

" It is not on [my]77-catherine own account [I]77-catherine wish for more ; but [I]77-catherine can not bear to be the means of injuring [[my]77-catherine dear]2124-my dear [Morland]108-james , making [him]108-james sit down upon an income hardly enough to find one in the common necessaries of life . For [myself]77-catherine , it is nothing ; [I]77-catherine never think of [myself]77-catherine . "[77-catherine]

" [I]102-mrs. thorpe know [you]106-isabella never do , [[my]102-mrs. thorpe dear]2124-my dear ; and [you]106-isabella will always find [your]106-isabella reward in the affection it makes [everybody]326-everybody feel for [you]106-isabella . There never was [a young woman so beloved as [you]106-isabella are by everybody that knows [you]106-isabella]2884-a young woman so beloved as you are by everybody that knows you ; and [I]102-mrs. thorpe dare say when [Mr. Morland]108-james sees [you]106-isabella , [[my]102-mrs. thorpe dear child]2885-my dear child but do not let [us]2886-us distress [[our]2886-us dear]2887-our dear [Catherine]77-catherine by talking of such things . [Mr. Morland]108-james has behaved so very handsome , [you]106-isabella know . [I]102-mrs. thorpe always heard [he]108-james was [a most excellent man]2888-a most excellent man ; and [you]106-isabella know , [[my]102-mrs. thorpe dear]2124-my dear , [we]2886-us are not to suppose but what , if [you]106-isabella had had a suitable fortune , [he]108-james would have come down with something more , for [I]102-mrs. thorpe am sure [he]108-james must be [a most liberal - minded man]2890-a most liberal - minded man . "[102-mrs. thorpe]

" [Nobody]2139-nobody can think better of [Mr. Morland]108-james than [I]77-catherine do , [I]77-catherine am sure . But [everybody]326-everybody has [their]326-everybody failing , [you]106-isabella know , and [everybody]326-everybody has a right to do what [they]326-everybody like with [their]326-everybody own money . "[77-catherine] [Catherine]77-catherine was hurt by these insinuations . " [I]77-catherine am very sure , "[77-catherine] said [she]77-catherine , " that [[my]77-catherine father]2473-my father has promised to do as much as [he]2473-my father can afford . "[77-catherine]

[Isabella]106-isabella recollected [herself]106-isabella . " As to that , [my]106-isabella sweet [Catherine]77-catherine , there can not be a doubt , and [you]106-isabella know [me]106-isabella well enough to be sure that a much smaller income would satisfy [me]106-isabella . It is not the want of more money that makes [me]106-isabella just at present a little out of spirits ; [I]106-isabella hate money ; and if [our]2895-we union could take place now upon only fifty pounds a year , [I]106-isabella should not have a wish unsatisfied . Ah ! [[my]106-isabella Catherine]2792-my catherine , [you]106-isabella have found [me]106-isabella out . There s the sting . The long , long , endless two years and half that are to pass before [[your]106-isabella brother]2331-your brother can hold the living . "[106-isabella]

" Yes , yes , [[my]102-mrs. thorpe darling]2898-my darling [Isabella]106-isabella , "[102-mrs. thorpe] said [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe , " [we]2895-we perfectly see into [your]77-catherine heart . [You]77-catherine have no disguise . [We]2895-we perfectly understand the present vexation ; and [everybody]326-everybody must love [you]77-catherine the better for such a noble honest affection . "[102-mrs. thorpe]

[Catherine]77-catherine s uncomfortable feelings began to lessen . [She]77-catherine endeavoured to believe that the delay of the marriage was the only source of [Isabella]106-isabella s regret ; and when [she]77-catherine saw [her]77-catherine at [their]1102-their next interview as cheerful and amiable as ever , endeavoured to forget that [she]77-catherine had for a minute thought otherwise . [James]108-james soon followed [his]108-james letter , and was received with the most gratifying kindness .

CHAPTER 17

[The Allens]1103-the allens had now entered on the sixth week of [their]1103-the allens stay in [Bath]5-bath ; and whether it should be the last was for some time a question , to which [Catherine]77-catherine listened with a beating heart . To have [her]77-catherine acquaintance with [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys end so soon was an evil which nothing could counterbalance . [Her]77-catherine whole happiness seemed at stake , while the affair was in suspense , and everything secured when it was determined that the lodgings should be taken for another fortnight . What this additional fortnight was to produce to [her]77-catherine beyond the pleasure of sometimes seeing [Henry Tilney]98-henry made but a small part of [Catherine]77-catherine s speculation . Once or twice indeed , since [James]108-james s engagement had taught [her]77-catherine what _ could _ be done , [she]77-catherine had got so far as to indulge in a secret " perhaps , "[77-catherine] but in general the felicity of being with [him]108-james for the present bounded [her]77-catherine views : the present was now comprised in another three weeks , and [her]77-catherine happiness being certain for that period , the rest of [her]77-catherine life was at such a distance as to excite but little interest . In the course of the morning which saw this business arranged , [she]77-catherine visited [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , and poured forth [her]77-catherine joyful feelings . It was doomed to be a day of trial . No sooner had [she]77-catherine expressed [her]77-catherine delight in [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen s lengthened stay than [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney told [her]77-catherine of [[her]95-miss tilney father]188-her father s having just determined upon quitting [Bath]5-bath by the end of another week . Here was a blow ! The past suspense of the morning had been ease and quiet to the present disappointment . [Catherine]77-catherine s countenance fell , and in a voice of most sincere concern [she]77-catherine echoed [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney s concluding words , " By the end of another week ! "[77-catherine]

" Yes , [[my]77-catherine father]2473-my father can seldom be prevailed on to give the waters what [I]77-catherine think a fair trial . [He]2473-my father has been disappointed of [some friends arrival whom [he]2473-my father expected to meet [here]2128-here]2901-some friends arrival whom he expected to meet here , and as [he]2473-my father is now pretty well , is in a hurry to get [home]2339-home . "[77-catherine]

" [I]77-catherine am very sorry for it , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine dejectedly ; " if [I]77-catherine had known this before "[77-catherine]

" Perhaps , "[95-miss tilney] said [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney in an embarrassed manner , " [you]77-catherine would be so good it would make [me]95-miss tilney very happy if "[95-miss tilney]

The entrance of [[her]77-catherine father]188-her father put a stop to the civility , which [Catherine]77-catherine was beginning to hope might introduce a desire of [[their]1106-their corresponding]1107-their corresponding . After addressing [her]77-catherine with [his]188-her father usual politeness , [he]188-her father turned to [[his]188-her father daughter]2444-his daughter and said , " Well , [Eleanor]145-eleanor , may [I]188-her father congratulate [you]145-eleanor on being successful in [your]145-eleanor application to [[your]145-eleanor fair friend]2904-your fair friend ? "[188-her father]

" [I]188-her father was just beginning to make the request , [sir]2153-sir , as [you]2153-sir came in . "[188-her father]

" Well , proceed by all means . [I]188-her father know how much [your]145-eleanor heart is in it . [[My]188-her father daughter]2906-my daughter , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , "[188-her father] [he]188-her father continued , without leaving [[his]188-her father daughter]2444-his daughter time to speak , " has been forming a very bold wish . [We]2907-we leave [Bath]5-bath , as [she]2904-your fair friend has perhaps told [you]145-eleanor , on Saturday se nnight . A letter from [[my]188-her father steward]2908-my steward tells [me]188-her father that [my]188-her father presence is wanted at [home]2339-home ; and being disappointed in [my]188-her father hope of seeing [the Marquis of [Longtown]61-longtown]2910-the marquis of longtown and General Courteney here , [some of [[my]188-her father very old friends]2912-my very old friends]2911-some of my very old friends , there is nothing to detain [me]188-her father longer in [Bath]5-bath . And could [we]2907-we carry [our]2907-we selfish point with [you]145-eleanor , [we]2907-we should leave it without a single regret . Can [you]145-eleanor , in short , be prevailed on to quit this scene of public triumph and oblige [[your]145-eleanor friend]2702-your friend [Eleanor]145-eleanor with [your]145-eleanor company in [Gloucestershire]9-gloucestershire ? [I]188-her father am almost ashamed to make the request , though its presumption would certainly appear greater to every creature in [Bath]5-bath than [yourself]145-eleanor . Modesty such as [yours]145-eleanor but not for [the world]197-the world would [I]188-her father pain it by open praise . If [you]145-eleanor can be induced to honour [us]2907-we with a visit , [you]145-eleanor will make [us]2907-we happy beyond expression . Tis true , [we]2907-we can offer [you]145-eleanor nothing like the gaieties of [this lively place]2915-this lively place ; [we]2907-we can tempt [you]145-eleanor neither by amusement nor splendour , for [our]2907-we mode of living , as [you]145-eleanor see , is plain and unpretending ; yet no endeavours shall be wanting on [our]2907-we side to make [Northanger Abbey]2916-northanger abbey not wholly disagreeable . "[188-her father]

[Northanger Abbey]1-northanger abbey ! These were thrilling words , and wound up [Catherine]77-catherine s feelings to the highest point of ecstasy . [Her]77-catherine grateful and gratified heart could hardly restrain its expressions within the language of tolerable calmness . To receive so flattering an invitation ! To have [her]77-catherine company so warmly solicited ! Everything honourable and soothing , every present enjoyment , and every future hope was contained in it ; and [her]77-catherine acceptance , with only the saving clause of [Papa]141-papa and [Mamma]142-mamma s approbation , was eagerly given . " [I]77-catherine will write [home]2339-home directly , "[77-catherine] said [she]77-catherine , " and if [they]1110-her excellent friends do not object , as [I]77-catherine dare say [they]1110-her excellent friends will not "[77-catherine]

[General Tilney]143-general tilney was not less sanguine , having already waited on [[her]77-catherine excellent friends]1110-her excellent friends in [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street , and obtained [their]1110-her excellent friends sanction of [his]143-general tilney wishes . " Since [they]1110-her excellent friends can consent to part with [you]77-catherine , "[143-general tilney] said [he]143-general tilney , " [we]2918-we may expect philosophy from [all the world]2329-all the world . "[143-general tilney]

[Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney was earnest , though gentle , in [her]95-miss tilney secondary civilities , and the affair became in a few minutes as nearly settled as this necessary reference to [Fullerton]3-fullerton would allow .

The circumstances of the morning had led [Catherine]77-catherine s feelings through the varieties of suspense , security , and disappointment ; but they were now safely lodged in perfect bliss ; and with spirits elated to rapture , with [Henry]98-henry at [her]77-catherine heart , and [Northanger Abbey]1-northanger abbey on [her]77-catherine lips , [she]77-catherine hurried [home]2339-home to write [her]77-catherine letter . [Mr.]1112-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland , relying on the discretion of [the friends to whom [they]1113-the friends to whom they had already entrusted their daughter had already entrusted [[their]1113-the friends to whom they had already entrusted their daughter daughter]1114-their daughter]1113-the friends to whom they had already entrusted their daughter , felt no doubt of the propriety of an acquaintance which had been formed under [their]1113-the friends to whom they had already entrusted their daughter eye , and sent therefore by return of post [their]1113-the friends to whom they had already entrusted their daughter ready consent to [her]77-catherine visit in [Gloucestershire]9-gloucestershire . This indulgence , though not more than [Catherine]77-catherine had hoped for , completed [her]77-catherine conviction of being favoured beyond [every other human creature]1115-every other human creature , in [friends]2720-friends and fortune , circumstance and chance . Everything seemed to cooperate for [her]77-catherine advantage . By the kindness of [[her]77-catherine first friends]1117-her first friends , [the Allens]109-the allens , [she]77-catherine had been introduced into scenes where pleasures of every kind had met [her]77-catherine . [Her]77-catherine feelings , [her]77-catherine preferences , had each known the happiness of a return . Wherever [she]77-catherine felt attachment , [she]77-catherine had been able to create it . The affection of [Isabella]106-isabella was to be secured to [her]77-catherine in [a sister]626-a sister . [The Tilneys]137-the tilneys , [they]137-the tilneys , by whom , above all , [she]77-catherine desired to be favourably thought of , outstripped even [her]77-catherine wishes in the flattering measures by which [their]137-the tilneys intimacy was to be continued . [She]77-catherine was to be [[their]137-the tilneys chosen visitor]1119-their chosen visitor , [she]77-catherine was to be for weeks under the same roof with [the person whose society [she]77-catherine mostly prized and , in addition to all the rest , this roof was to be the roof of [an abbey]1121-an abbey]1120-the person whose society she mostly prized and , in addition to all the rest , this roof was to be the roof of an abbey ! [Her]77-catherine passion for ancient edifices was next in degree to [her]77-catherine passion for [Henry Tilney]98-henry and [castles]1122-castles and [abbeys]1123-abbeys made usually the charm of those reveries which [his]98-henry image did not fill . To see and explore either the ramparts and keep of the one , or [the cloisters of the other]1124-the cloisters of the other , had been for many weeks a darling wish , though to be more than [the visitor of an hour]1125-the visitor of an hour had seemed too nearly impossible for desire . And yet , this was to happen . With all the chances against [her]77-catherine of [house]2504-house , [hall]1127-hall , [place]1128-place , [park]1129-park , [court]1130-court , and [cottage]1131-cottage , [Northanger]63-northanger turned up [an abbey]1121-an abbey , and [she]77-catherine was to be [[its]1121-an abbey inhabitant]1133-its inhabitant . [[Its]1121-an abbey long , damp passages]1134-its long , damp passages , [[its]1121-an abbey narrow cells and [ruined chapel]1136-ruined chapel]1135-its narrow cells and ruined chapel , were to be within [her]77-catherine daily reach , and [she]77-catherine could not entirely subdue the hope of some traditional legends , some awful memorials of [an injured and ill - fated nun]1137-an injured and ill - fated nun .

It was wonderful that [[her]77-catherine friends]792-her friends should seem so little elated by the possession of such a home , that the consciousness of [it]1121-an abbey should be so meekly borne . The power of early habit only could account for it . A distinction to which [they]792-her friends had been born gave no pride . [Their]792-her friends superiority of abode was no more to [them]792-her friends than [their]792-her friends superiority of [person]1139-person .

Many were the inquiries [she]77-catherine was eager to make of [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney ; but so active were [her]77-catherine thoughts , that when these inquiries were answered , [she]77-catherine was hardly more assured than before , of [Northanger Abbey]1-northanger abbey having been [a richly endowed convent]1140-a richly endowed convent at the time of the Reformation , of [its]1-northanger abbey having fallen into the hands of [an ancestor of [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys on [its]1-northanger abbey dissolution]1141-an ancestor of the tilneys on its dissolution , of a large portion of [the ancient building still making a part of [the present dwelling]1143-the present dwelling]1142-the ancient building still making a part of the present dwelling although the rest was decayed , or of [its]1-northanger abbey standing low in [a valley]1144-a valley , sheltered from [the north and east by rising woods of oak]1145-the north and east by rising woods of oak .

CHAPTER 18

With a mind thus full of happiness , [Catherine]77-catherine was hardly aware that two or three days had passed away , without [her]77-catherine seeing [Isabella]106-isabella for more than a few minutes together . [She]77-catherine began first to be sensible of this , and to sigh for [her]77-catherine conversation , as [she]77-catherine walked along [the pump - room]364-the pump - room one morning , by [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen s side , without anything to say or to hear ; and scarcely had [she]77-catherine felt a five minutes longing of friendship , before the object of it appeared , and inviting [her]77-catherine to a secret conference , led the way to a seat . " [This]2920-this is [[my]77-catherine favourite place]2921-my favourite place , "[77-catherine] said [she]77-catherine as [they]1147-they sat down on a bench between the doors , which commanded a tolerable view of [everybody entering at either]1148-everybody entering at either ; " it is so out of the way . "[77-catherine]

[Catherine]77-catherine , observing that [Isabella]106-isabella s eyes were continually bent towards one door or the other , as in eager expectation , and remembering how often [she]106-isabella had been falsely accused of being arch , thought the present a fine opportunity for being really so ; and therefore gaily said , " Do not be uneasy , [Isabella]106-isabella , [James]108-james will soon be here . "[106-isabella]

" Psha ! [[My]77-catherine dear creature]2330-my dear creature , "[77-catherine] [she]77-catherine replied , " do not think [me]77-catherine such a simpleton as to be always wanting to confine [him]108-james to [my]77-catherine elbow . It would be hideous to be always together ; [we]1147-they should be the jest of [the place]2152-the place . And so [you]106-isabella are going to [Northanger]63-northanger ! [I]77-catherine am amazingly glad of it . [It]63-northanger is [one of [the finest old places in [England]2-england]2925-the finest old places in england]2924-one of the finest old places in england , [I]77-catherine understand . [I]77-catherine shall depend upon a most particular description of [it]63-northanger . "[77-catherine]

" [You]106-isabella shall certainly have the best in [my]106-isabella power to give . But who are [you]106-isabella looking for ? Are [[your]106-isabella sisters]2926-your sisters coming ? "[106-isabella]

" [I]77-catherine am not looking for [anybody]198-anybody . [One]2210-one s eyes must be somewhere , and [you]106-isabella know what a foolish trick [I]77-catherine have of fixing [mine]77-catherine , when [my]77-catherine thoughts are an hundred miles off . [I]77-catherine am amazingly absent ; [I]77-catherine believe [I]77-catherine am the most absent creature in [the world]197-the world . [Tilney]95-miss tilney says it is always the case with [minds of a certain stamp]2930-minds of a certain stamp . "[77-catherine]

" But [I]106-isabella thought , [Isabella]106-isabella , [you]106-isabella had something in particular to tell [me]106-isabella ? "[106-isabella]

" Oh ! Yes , and so [I]77-catherine have . But here is a proof of what [I]77-catherine was saying . [My]77-catherine poor head , [I]77-catherine had quite forgot it . Well , the thing is this : [I]77-catherine have just had a letter from [John]103-john ; [you]106-isabella can guess the contents . "[77-catherine]

" No , indeed , [I]106-isabella can not . "[106-isabella]

" [[My]77-catherine sweet love]2931-my sweet love , do not be so abominably affected . What can [he]103-john write about , but [yourself]106-isabella ? [You]106-isabella know [he]103-john is over head and ears in love with [you]106-isabella . "[77-catherine]

" With _ [me]106-isabella _ , dear [Isabella]106-isabella ! "[106-isabella]

" Nay , [my]77-catherine sweetest [Catherine]77-catherine , this is being quite absurd ! Modesty , and all that , is very well in its way , but really a little common honesty is sometimes quite as becoming . [I]77-catherine have no idea of being so overstrained ! It is fishing for compliments . [His]103-john attentions were such as [a child]2932-a child must have noticed . And it was but half an hour before [he]103-john left [Bath]5-bath that [you]106-isabella gave [him]103-john the most positive encouragement . [He]103-john says so in this letter , says that [he]103-john as good as made [you]106-isabella an offer , and that [you]106-isabella received [his]103-john advances in the kindest way ; and now [he]103-john wants [me]77-catherine to urge [his]103-john suit , and say all manner of pretty things to [you]106-isabella . So it is in vain to affect ignorance . "[77-catherine]

[Catherine]77-catherine , with all the earnestness of truth , expressed [her]77-catherine astonishment at such a charge , protesting [her]77-catherine innocence of every thought of [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe s being in love with [her]77-catherine , and the consequent impossibility of [her]77-catherine having ever intended to encourage [him]122-mr. thorpe . " As to any attentions on [his]103-john side , [I]77-catherine do declare , upon [my]77-catherine honour , [I]77-catherine never was sensible of [them]2933-them for a moment except just [his]103-john asking [me]77-catherine to dance the first day of [his]103-john coming . And as to making [me]77-catherine an offer , or anything like it , there must be some unaccountable mistake . [I]77-catherine could not have misunderstood a thing of that kind , [you]106-isabella know ! And , as [I]77-catherine ever wish to be believed , [I]77-catherine solemnly protest that no syllable of such a nature ever passed between [us]2934-us . The last half hour before [he]103-john went away ! It must be all and completely a mistake for [I]77-catherine did not see [him]103-john once that whole morning . "[77-catherine]

" But _ that _ [you]106-isabella certainly did , for [you]106-isabella spent the whole morning in [[Edgar]160-edgar s Buildings]2277-edgar s buildings it was the day [[your]106-isabella father]2636-your father s consent came and [I]77-catherine am pretty sure that [you]106-isabella and [John]103-john were alone in [the parlour]993-the parlour some time before [you]106-isabella left [the house]216-the house . "[77-catherine]

" Are [you]106-isabella ? Well , if [you]106-isabella say it , it was so , [I]106-isabella dare say but for the life of [me]106-isabella , [I]106-isabella can not recollect it . [I]106-isabella _ do _ remember now being with [you]106-isabella , and seeing [him]103-john as well as [the rest]327-the rest but that [we]2940-we were ever alone for five minutes However , it is not worth arguing about , for whatever might pass on [his]103-john side , [you]106-isabella must be convinced , by [my]106-isabella having no recollection of it , that [I]106-isabella never thought , nor expected , nor wished for anything of the kind from [him]103-john . "[106-isabella] [Isabella]106-isabella was silent . " [[My]106-isabella dear friend]2944-my dear friend , [you]2944-my dear friend must not be angry with [me]106-isabella . " Yes , yes "[77-catherine] ( with a blush ) , " there are more ways than one of [our]2946-we being [sisters]411-sisters . But where am [I]77-catherine wandering to ? " [I]77-catherine certainly can not return [his]103-john affection , and as certainly never meant to encourage it . "[77-catherine]

" Since that is the case , [I]77-catherine am sure [I]77-catherine shall not tease [you]2944-my dear friend any further . [John]103-john desired [me]77-catherine to speak to [you]2944-my dear friend on the subject , and therefore [I]77-catherine have . But [I]77-catherine confess , as soon as [I]77-catherine read [his]103-john letter , [I]77-catherine thought it a very foolish , imprudent business , and not likely to promote the good of either ; for what were [you]2944-my dear friend to live upon , supposing [you]2944-my dear friend came together ? [You]2944-my dear friend have both of [you]2944-my dear friend something , to be sure , but it is not a trifle that will support [a family]2563-a family nowadays ; and after all that [romancers]2951-romancers may say , there is no doing without money . [I]77-catherine only wonder [John]103-john could think of it ; [he]103-john could not have received [my]77-catherine last . "[77-catherine]

" [You]2944-my dear friend _ do _ acquit [me]77-catherine , then , of anything wrong ? "[77-catherine]

" Oh ! " But [my]77-catherine opinion of [[your]2944-my dear friend brother]2331-your brother never did alter ; it was always the same . [You]2944-my dear friend are describing what never happened . "[77-catherine]

" [[My]413-the other dearest]2226-my dearest [Catherine]77-catherine , "[413-the other] continued [the other]413-the other without at all listening to [her]1150-her , " [I]413-the other would not for all [the world]197-the world be the means of hurrying [you]77-catherine into an engagement before [you]77-catherine knew what [you]77-catherine were about . What [I]413-the other say is , why should [a brother]750-a brother s happiness be dearer to [me]413-the other than [a friend]449-a friend s ? [Catherine]77-catherine , looking up , perceived [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney ; and [Isabella]106-isabella , earnestly fixing [her]106-isabella eye on [him]78-captain tilney as [she]106-isabella spoke , soon caught [his]78-captain tilney notice . [He]78-captain tilney approached immediately , and took the seat to which [her]106-isabella movements invited [him]78-captain tilney . [His]78-captain tilney first address made [Catherine]77-catherine start . Though spoken low , [she]77-catherine could distinguish , " What ! Always to be watched , in person or by proxy ! "[77-catherine]

" [Psha]163-psha , nonsense ! "[106-isabella] was [Isabella]106-isabella s answer in the same half whisper . " Why do [you]78-captain tilney put such things into [my]106-isabella head ? If [I]106-isabella could believe it [my]106-isabella spirit , [you]77-catherine know , is pretty independent . "[106-isabella]

" [I]77-catherine wish [your]77-catherine heart were independent . That would be enough for [me]77-catherine . "[77-catherine]

" [My]106-isabella heart , indeed ! What can [you]78-captain tilney have to do with hearts ? [[You]78-captain tilney men]2352-you men have none of [you]78-captain tilney any hearts . "[106-isabella]

" If [we]2971-we have not hearts , [we]2971-we have eyes ; and [they]2972-they give [us]2971-we torment enough . "[77-catherine]

" Do [they]2972-they ? [I]1151-i am sorry for it ; [I]1151-i am sorry [they]2972-they find anything so disagreeable in [me]1151-i . [I]1151-i will look another way .
