" Never more so ; for the edge of a blooming cheek is still in view at once too much and too little . "[106-isabella]

[Catherine]77-catherine heard all this , and quite out of countenance , could listen no longer . Amazed that [Isabella]106-isabella could endure it , and jealous for [[her]106-isabella brother]2221-her brother , [she]106-isabella rose up , and saying [she]106-isabella should join [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , proposed [their]1154-their walking . But for this [Isabella]106-isabella showed no inclination . [She]106-isabella was so amazingly tired , and it was so odious to parade about [the pump - room]364-the pump - room ; and if [she]106-isabella moved from [her]106-isabella seat [she]106-isabella should miss [[her]106-isabella sisters]1156-her sisters ; [she]106-isabella was expecting [[her]106-isabella sisters]1156-her sisters every moment ; so that [[her]106-isabella dearest]717-her dearest [Catherine]77-catherine must excuse [her]106-isabella , and must sit quietly down again . But [Catherine]77-catherine could be stubborn too ; and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen just then coming up to propose [their]1154-their returning [home]2339-home , [she]77-catherine joined [her]77-catherine and walked out of [the pump - room]364-the pump - room , leaving [Isabella]106-isabella still sitting with [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney . With much uneasiness did [she]77-catherine thus leave [them]1154-their . It seemed to [her]77-catherine that [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney was falling in love with [Isabella]106-isabella , and [Isabella]106-isabella unconsciously encouraging [him]78-captain tilney ; unconsciously it must be , for [Isabella]106-isabella s attachment to [James]108-james was as certain and well acknowledged as [her]106-isabella engagement . To doubt [her]106-isabella truth or good intentions was impossible ; and yet , during the whole of [their]1154-their conversation [her]106-isabella manner had been odd . [She]77-catherine wished [Isabella]106-isabella had talked more like [her]106-isabella usual self , and not so much about money , and had not looked so well pleased at the sight of [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney . How strange that [she]77-catherine should not perceive [his]78-captain tilney admiration ! [Catherine]77-catherine longed to give [her]106-isabella a hint of it , to put [her]106-isabella on [her]106-isabella guard , and prevent all the pain which [her]106-isabella too lively behaviour might otherwise create both for [him]78-captain tilney and [[her]106-isabella brother]2221-her brother .

The compliment of [John]103-john Thorpe s affection did not make amends for this thoughtlessness in [[his]78-captain tilney sister]2222-his sister . [She]77-catherine was almost as far from believing as from wishing it to be sincere ; for [she]77-catherine had not forgotten that [he]78-captain tilney could mistake , and [his]78-captain tilney assertion of the offer and of [her]77-catherine encouragement convinced [her]77-catherine that [his]78-captain tilney mistakes could sometimes be very egregious . In vanity , therefore , [she]77-catherine gained but little ; [her]77-catherine chief profit was in wonder . That [he]78-captain tilney should think it worth [his]78-captain tilney while to fancy [himself]78-captain tilney in love with [her]77-catherine was a matter of lively astonishment . [Isabella]106-isabella talked of [his]78-captain tilney attentions ; _ [she]106-isabella _ had never been sensible of any ; but [Isabella]106-isabella had said many things which [she]106-isabella hoped had been spoken in haste , and would never be said again ; and upon this [she]106-isabella was glad to rest altogether for present ease and comfort .

CHAPTER 19

A few days passed away , and [Catherine]77-catherine , though not allowing [herself]77-catherine to suspect [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend , could not help watching [her]106-isabella closely . The result of [her]106-isabella observations was not agreeable . [Isabella]106-isabella seemed [an altered creature]1164-an altered creature . When [she]77-catherine saw [her]106-isabella , indeed , surrounded only by [[their]1165-their immediate friends]1166-their immediate friends in [Edgar s Buildings]28-edgar s buildings or [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street , [her]106-isabella change of manners was so trifling that , had it gone no farther , it might have passed unnoticed . A something of languid indifference , or of that boasted absence of mind which [Catherine]77-catherine had never heard of before , would occasionally come across [her]77-catherine ; but had nothing worse appeared , _ that _ might only have spread a new grace and inspired a warmer interest . But when [Catherine]77-catherine saw [her]106-isabella in public , admitting [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney s attentions as readily as they were offered , and allowing [him]78-captain tilney almost an equal share with [James]108-james in [her]106-isabella notice and smiles , the alteration became too positive to be passed over . What could be meant by such unsteady conduct , what [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend could be at , was beyond [her]77-catherine comprehension . [Isabella]106-isabella could not be aware of the pain [she]106-isabella was inflicting ; but it was a degree of wilful thoughtlessness which [Catherine]77-catherine could not but resent . [James]108-james was [the sufferer]1168-the sufferer . [She]77-catherine saw [him]108-james grave and uneasy ; and however careless of [his]108-james present comfort [the woman]2517-the woman might be who had given [him]108-james [her]2517-the woman heart , to _ [her]2517-the woman _ it was always an object . For poor [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney too [she]77-catherine was greatly concerned . Though [his]78-captain tilney looks did not please [her]77-catherine , [his]78-captain tilney name was a passport to [her]77-catherine goodwill , and [she]77-catherine thought with sincere compassion of [his]78-captain tilney approaching disappointment ; for , in spite of what [she]77-catherine had believed [herself]77-catherine to overhear in [the pump - room]364-the pump - room , [his]78-captain tilney behaviour was so incompatible with a knowledge of [Isabella]106-isabella s engagement that [she]77-catherine could not , upon reflection , imagine [him]78-captain tilney aware of it . [He]78-captain tilney might be jealous of [[her]77-catherine brother]2221-her brother as [a rival]1172-a rival , but if more had seemed implied , the fault must have been in [her]77-catherine misapprehension . [She]77-catherine wished , by a gentle remonstrance , to remind [Isabella]106-isabella of [her]106-isabella situation , and make [her]106-isabella aware of this double unkindness ; but for remonstrance , either opportunity or comprehension was always against [her]77-catherine . If able to suggest a hint , [Isabella]106-isabella could never understand it . In this distress , the intended departure of [the Tilney family]1173-the tilney family became [her]106-isabella chief consolation ; [their]1173-the tilney family journey into [Gloucestershire]9-gloucestershire was to take place within a few days , and [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney s removal would at least restore peace to every heart but [his]78-captain tilney own . But [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney had at present no intention of removing ; [he]78-captain tilney was not to be of [the party to [Northanger]63-northanger]1174-the party to northanger ; [he]78-captain tilney was to continue at [Bath]5-bath . When [Catherine]77-catherine knew this , [her]77-catherine resolution was directly made . [She]77-catherine spoke to [Henry Tilney]98-henry on the subject , regretting [[his]98-henry brother]1075-his brother s evident partiality for [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe , and entreating [him]98-henry to make known [her]77-catherine prior engagement .

" [[My]98-henry brother]2282-my brother does know it , "[98-henry] was [Henry]98-henry s answer .

" Does [he]2282-my brother ? Then why does [he]2282-my brother stay [here]2128-here ? "[98-henry]

[He]98-henry made no reply , and was beginning to talk of something else ; but [she]77-catherine eagerly continued , " Why do not [you]98-henry persuade [him]2282-my brother to go away ? The longer [he]2282-my brother stays , the worse it will be for [him]2282-my brother at last . Pray advise [him]2282-my brother for [his]2282-my brother own sake , and for everybody s sake , to leave [Bath]5-bath directly . Absence will in time make [him]2282-my brother comfortable again ; but [he]2282-my brother can have no hope here , and it is only staying to be miserable . "[77-catherine]

[Henry]98-henry smiled and said , " [I]98-henry am sure [[my]98-henry brother]2282-my brother would not wish to do that . "[98-henry]

" Then [you]77-catherine will persuade [him]2282-my brother to go away ? "[77-catherine]

" Persuasion is not at command ; but pardon [me]98-henry , if [I]98-henry can not even endeavour to persuade [him]2282-my brother . [I]98-henry have [myself]98-henry told [him]2282-my brother that [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe is engaged . [He]2282-my brother knows what [he]2282-my brother is about , and must be [[his]2282-my brother own master]2976-his own master . "[98-henry]

" No , [he]2282-my brother does not know what [he]2282-my brother is about , "[77-catherine] cried [Catherine]77-catherine ; " [he]2282-my brother does not know the pain [he]2282-my brother is giving [[my]77-catherine brother]2282-my brother . Not that [James]108-james has ever told [me]77-catherine so , but [I]77-catherine am sure [he]2282-my brother is very uncomfortable . "[77-catherine]

" And are [you]77-catherine sure it is [[my]98-henry brother]2282-my brother s doing ? "[98-henry]

" Yes , very sure . "[77-catherine]

" Is it [[my]98-henry brother]2282-my brother s attentions to [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe , or [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe s admission of [them]2980-them , that gives the pain ? "[98-henry]

" Is not it the same thing ? "[77-catherine]

" [I]98-henry think [Mr. Morland]108-james would acknowledge a difference . [No man]757-no man is offended by [another man]2982-another man s admiration of [the woman [he]757-no man loves]2983-the woman he loves ; it is [the woman only who can make it a torment]2984-the woman only who can make it a torment . "[98-henry]

[Catherine]77-catherine blushed for [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend , and said , " [Isabella]106-isabella is wrong . But [I]77-catherine am sure [she]106-isabella can not mean to torment , for [she]106-isabella is very much attached to [[my]77-catherine brother]2282-my brother . [She]106-isabella has been in love with [him]2282-my brother ever since [they]2986-they first met , and while [[my]77-catherine father]2473-my father s consent was uncertain , [she]106-isabella fretted [herself]106-isabella almost into a fever . [You]313-her friend know [she]106-isabella must be attached to [him]2282-my brother . "[77-catherine]

" [I]98-henry understand : [she]106-isabella is in love with [James]108-james , and flirts with [Frederick]78-captain tilney . "[98-henry]

" Oh ! no , not flirts . [A woman in love with [one man]2942-one man]2988-a woman in love with one man can not flirt with another . "[77-catherine]

" It is probable that [she]106-isabella will neither love so well , nor flirt so well , as [she]106-isabella might do either singly . [The gentlemen]2130-the gentlemen must each give up a little . "[98-henry]

After a short pause , [Catherine]77-catherine resumed with , " Then [you]313-her friend do not believe [Isabella]106-isabella so very much attached to [[my]77-catherine brother]2282-my brother ? "[77-catherine]

" [I]98-henry can have no opinion on that subject . "[98-henry]

" But what can [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother mean ? If [he]2282-my brother knows [her]106-isabella engagement , what can [he]2282-my brother mean by [his]2282-my brother behaviour ? "[77-catherine]

" [You]77-catherine are [a very close questioner]2993-a very close questioner . "[98-henry]

" Am [I]77-catherine ? [I]77-catherine only ask what [I]77-catherine want to be told . "[77-catherine]

" But do [you]77-catherine only ask what [I]98-henry can be expected to tell ? "[98-henry]

" Yes , [I]77-catherine think so ; for [you]77-catherine must know [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother s heart . "[77-catherine]

" [[My]98-henry brother]2282-my brother s heart , as [you]77-catherine term it , on the present occasion , [I]98-henry assure [you]77-catherine [I]98-henry can only guess at . "[98-henry]

" Well ? "[77-catherine]

" Well ! Nay , if it is to be guesswork , let [us]2996-us all guess for [ourselves]2996-us . To be guided by second - hand conjecture is pitiful . [The premises]2997-the premises are before [you]77-catherine . [[My]98-henry brother]2282-my brother is a lively and perhaps sometimes [a thoughtless young man]2999-a thoughtless young man ; [he]2282-my brother has had about a week s acquaintance with [[your]77-catherine friend]2702-your friend , and [he]2282-my brother has known [her]2702-your friend engagement almost as long as [he]2282-my brother has known [her]2702-your friend . "[98-henry]

" Well , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , after some moments consideration , " _ [you]77-catherine _ may be able to guess at [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother s intentions from all this ; but [I]77-catherine am sure [I]77-catherine can not . But is not [[your]77-catherine father]2636-your father uncomfortable about it ? Does not [he]2636-your father want [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney to go away ? Sure , if [[your]77-catherine father]2636-your father were to speak to [him]2636-your father , [he]2636-your father would go . "[77-catherine]

" [[My]98-henry dear]2124-my dear [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , "[98-henry] said [Henry]98-henry , " in this amiable solicitude for [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother s comfort , may [you]77-catherine not be a little mistaken ? Are [you]77-catherine not carried a little too far ? Would [he]2636-your father thank [you]77-catherine , either on [his]2636-your father own account or [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe s , for supposing that [her]101-miss thorpe affection , or at least [her]101-miss thorpe good behaviour , is only to be secured by [her]101-miss thorpe seeing nothing of [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney ? Is [he]2636-your father safe only in solitude ? Or is [her]101-miss thorpe heart constant to [him]2636-your father only when unsolicited by [anyone else]2515-anyone else ? [He]2636-your father can not think this and [you]77-catherine may be sure that [he]2636-your father would not have [you]77-catherine think it . [I]98-henry will not say , Do not be uneasy , because [I]98-henry know that [you]77-catherine are so , at this moment ; but be as little uneasy as [you]77-catherine can . [You]77-catherine have no doubt of the mutual attachment of [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother and [[your]77-catherine friend]2702-your friend ; depend upon it , therefore , that real jealousy never can exist between [them]3009-them ; depend upon it that no disagreement between [them]3009-them can be of any duration . [Their]3009-them hearts are open to each other , as neither heart can be to [you]77-catherine ; [they]3009-them know exactly what is required and what can be borne ; and [you]77-catherine may be certain that [one]2210-one will never tease [the other]413-the other beyond what is known to be pleasant . "[98-henry]

Perceiving [her]1177-her still to look doubtful and grave , [he]1178-he added , " Though [Frederick]78-captain tilney does not leave [Bath]5-bath with [us]3012-us , [he]78-captain tilney will probably remain but a very short time , perhaps only a few days behind [us]3012-us . [His]78-captain tilney leave of absence will soon expire , and [he]78-captain tilney must return to [[his]78-captain tilney regiment]3013-his regiment . And what will then be [their]3009-them acquaintance ? [The mess - room]3014-the mess - room will drink [Isabella Thorpe]106-isabella for a fortnight , and [she]106-isabella will laugh with [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother over [poor Tilney]78-captain tilney s passion for a month . "[1178-he]

[Catherine]77-catherine would contend no longer against comfort . [She]77-catherine had resisted [its]1179-its approaches during the whole length of a speech , but it now carried [her]77-catherine captive . [Henry Tilney]98-henry must know best . [She]77-catherine blamed [herself]77-catherine for the extent of [her]77-catherine fears , and resolved never to think so seriously on the subject again .

[Her]77-catherine resolution was supported by [Isabella]106-isabella s behaviour in [their]1180-their parting interview . [The Thorpes]107-the thorpes spent the last evening of [Catherine]77-catherine s stay in [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street , and nothing passed between [the lovers]1181-the lovers to excite [her]77-catherine uneasiness , or make [her]77-catherine quit [them]1181-the lovers in apprehension . [James]108-james was in excellent spirits , and [Isabella]106-isabella most engagingly placid . [Her]77-catherine tenderness for [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend seemed rather the first feeling of [her]77-catherine heart ; but that at such a moment was allowable ; and once [she]77-catherine gave [[her]77-catherine lover]1183-her lover a flat contradiction , and once [she]77-catherine drew back [her]77-catherine hand ; but [Catherine]77-catherine remembered [Henry]98-henry s instructions , and placed it all to judicious affection . The embraces , tears , and promises of the parting fair ones may be fancied .

CHAPTER 20

[Mr.]1184-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen were sorry to lose [[their]1181-the lovers young friend]1185-their young friend , whose good humour and cheerfulness had made [her]1185-their young friend [a valuable companion]1186-a valuable companion , and in the promotion of whose enjoyment [their]1181-the lovers own had been gently increased . [Her]1185-their young friend happiness in going with [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , however , prevented [their]1181-the lovers wishing it otherwise ; and , as [they]1181-the lovers were to remain only one more week in [Bath]2155-bath [themselves]1181-the lovers , [her]1185-their young friend quitting [them]1181-the lovers now would not long be felt . [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen attended [her]1185-their young friend to [Milsom Street]15-milsom street , where [she]1185-their young friend was to breakfast , and saw [her]1185-their young friend seated with the kindest welcome among [[her]1185-their young friend new friends]1188-her new friends ; but so great was [her]1185-their young friend agitation in finding [herself]1185-their young friend as [one of [the family]457-the family]1189-one of the family , and so fearful was [she]1185-their young friend of not doing exactly what was right , and of not being able to preserve [their]1181-the lovers good opinion , that , in the embarrassment of the first five minutes , [she]1185-their young friend could almost have wished to return with [him]89-mr. allen to [Pulteney Street]7-pulteney street .

[Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney s manners and [Henry]98-henry s smile soon did away some of [her]1185-their young friend unpleasant feelings ; but still [she]1185-their young friend was far from being at ease ; nor could the incessant attentions of [the general]783-the general [himself]783-the general entirely reassure [her]1185-their young friend . Nay , perverse as it seemed , [she]1185-their young friend doubted whether [she]1185-their young friend might not have felt less , had [she]1185-their young friend been less attended to . [His]783-the general anxiety for [her]1185-their young friend comfort [his]783-the general continual solicitations that [she]1185-their young friend would eat , and [his]783-the general often - expressed fears of [her]1185-their young friend seeing nothing to [her]1185-their young friend taste though never in [her]1185-their young friend life before had [she]1185-their young friend beheld half such variety on a breakfast - table made it impossible for [her]1185-their young friend to forget for a moment that [she]1185-their young friend was [a visitor]1192-a visitor . [She]1185-their young friend felt utterly unworthy of such respect , and knew not how to reply to it . [Her]1185-their young friend tranquillity was not improved by [the general]783-the general s impatience for the appearance of [[his]783-the general eldest son]1194-his eldest son , nor by the displeasure [he]783-the general expressed at [his]783-the general laziness when [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney at last came down . [She]1185-their young friend was quite pained by the severity of [[his]1194-his eldest son father]859-his father s reproof , which seemed disproportionate to the offence ; and much was [her]1185-their young friend concern increased when [she]1185-their young friend found [herself]1185-their young friend the principal cause of the lecture , and that [his]783-the general tardiness was chiefly resented from being disrespectful to [her]1185-their young friend . This was placing [her]1185-their young friend in a very uncomfortable situation , and [she]1185-their young friend felt great compassion for [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney , without being able to hope for [his]783-the general goodwill .

[He]1194-his eldest son listened to [[his]1194-his eldest son father]859-his father in silence , and attempted not any defence , which confirmed [her]1185-their young friend in fearing that the inquietude of [his]783-the general mind , on [Isabella]106-isabella s account , might , by keeping [him]783-the general long sleepless , have been the real cause of [his]783-the general rising late . It was the first time of [her]1185-their young friend being decidedly in [his]783-the general company , and [she]1185-their young friend had hoped to be now able to form [her]1185-their young friend opinion of [him]783-the general ; but [she]1185-their young friend scarcely heard [his]783-the general voice while [[his]1194-his eldest son father]859-his father remained in [the room]308-the room ; and even afterwards , so much were [his]783-the general spirits affected , [she]1185-their young friend could distinguish nothing but these words , in a whisper to [Eleanor]145-eleanor , " How glad [I]1185-their young friend shall be when [you]145-eleanor are all off . "[1185-their young friend]

The bustle of going was not pleasant . The clock struck ten while the trunks were carrying down , and [the general]783-the general had fixed to be out of [Milsom Street]15-milsom street by that hour . [His]783-the general greatcoat , instead of being brought for [him]783-the general to put on directly , was spread out in the curricle in which [he]783-the general was to accompany [[his]783-the general son]2638-his son . The middle seat of the chaise was not drawn out , though there were [three people]1201-three people to go in [it]1202-it , and [[his]783-the general daughter s maid]1203-his daughter s maid had so crowded it with parcels that [Miss Morland]90-miss morland would not have room to sit ; and , so much was [he]783-the general influenced by this apprehension when [he]783-the general handed [her]90-miss morland in , that [she]90-miss morland had some difficulty in saving [her]90-miss morland own new writing - desk from being thrown out into [the street]447-the street . At last , however , the door was closed upon [the three females]1205-the three females , and [they]1205-the three females set off at the sober pace in which the handsome , highly fed four horses of [a gentleman]389-a gentleman usually perform a journey of thirty miles : such was the distance of [Northanger]63-northanger from [Bath]5-bath , to be now divided into two equal stages . [Catherine]77-catherine s spirits revived as [they]1205-the three females drove from the door ; for with [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney [she]77-catherine felt no restraint ; and , with the interest of [a road entirely new to [her]77-catherine]1207-a road entirely new to her , of [an abbey]1121-an abbey before , and a curricle behind , [she]77-catherine caught the last view of [Bath]5-bath without any regret , and met with every milestone before [she]77-catherine expected it . The tediousness of a two hours wait at [Petty France]64-petty france , in which there was nothing to be done but to eat without being hungry , and loiter about without anything to see , next followed and [her]77-catherine admiration of the style in which [they]1205-the three females travelled , of the fashionable chaise and four postilions handsomely liveried , rising so regularly in [their]1205-the three females stirrups , and numerous outriders properly mounted , sunk a little under this consequent inconvenience . Had [[their]1205-the three females party]635-their party been perfectly agreeable , the delay would have been nothing ; but [General Tilney]143-general tilney , though [so charming a man]1210-so charming a man , seemed always a check upon [[his]143-general tilney children]1067-his children s spirits , and scarcely anything was said but by [himself]143-general tilney ; the observation of which , with [his]143-general tilney discontent at whatever [the inn]1212-the inn afforded , and [his]143-general tilney angry impatience at [the waiters]1213-the waiters , made [Catherine]77-catherine grow every moment more in awe of [him]143-general tilney , and appeared to lengthen the two hours into four . At last , however , the order of release was given ; and much was [Catherine]77-catherine then surprised by [the general]783-the general s proposal of [her]77-catherine taking [his]783-the general place in [[his]783-the general son]2638-his son s curricle for the rest of the journey : " the day was fine , and [he]783-the general was anxious for [her]77-catherine seeing as much of [the country]224-the country as possible . "[783-the general]

The remembrance of [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen s opinion , respecting [young men]534-young men s open carriages , made [her]77-catherine blush at the mention of such a plan , and [her]77-catherine first thought was to decline it ; but [her]77-catherine second was of greater deference for [General Tilney]143-general tilney s judgment ; [he]783-the general could not propose anything improper for [her]77-catherine ; and , in the course of a few minutes , [she]77-catherine found [herself]77-catherine with [Henry]98-henry in [the curricle]1217-the curricle , as happy a being as ever existed . A very short trial convinced [her]77-catherine that a curricle was the prettiest equipage in [the world]197-the world ; the chaise and four wheeled off with some grandeur , to be sure , but it was a heavy and troublesome business , and [she]77-catherine could not easily forget its having stopped two hours at [Petty France]64-petty france . Half the time would have been enough for [the curricle]1217-the curricle , and so nimbly were the light horses disposed to move , that , had not [the general]783-the general chosen to have [[his]783-the general own carriage]1221-his own carriage lead the way , [they]534-young men could have passed [it]1221-his own carriage with ease in half a minute . But the merit of [the curricle]1217-the curricle did not all belong to the horses ; [Henry]98-henry drove so well so quietly without making any disturbance , without parading to [her]77-catherine , or swearing at [them]534-young men : so different from [the only gentleman - coachman whom it was]1223-the only gentleman - coachman whom it was in [her]77-catherine power to compare [him]98-henry with ! And then [his]98-henry hat sat so well , and the innumerable capes of [his]98-henry greatcoat looked so becomingly important ! To be driven by [him]98-henry , next to being dancing with [him]98-henry , was certainly the greatest happiness in [the world]197-the world . In addition to every other delight , [she]77-catherine had now that of listening to [her]77-catherine own praise ; of being thanked at least , on [[his]98-henry sister]2222-his sister s account , for [her]2222-his sister kindness in thus becoming [[her]2222-his sister visitor]1033-her visitor ; of hearing it ranked as real friendship , and described as creating real gratitude . [[His]98-henry sister]2222-his sister , [he]98-henry said , was uncomfortably circumstanced [she]2222-his sister had [no female companion]1228-no female companion and , in the frequent absence of [[her]2222-his sister father]188-her father , was sometimes without [any companion]1230-any companion at all .

" But how can that be ? "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine . " Are not [you]98-henry with [her]2222-his sister ? "[77-catherine]

" [Northanger]63-northanger is not more than half [[my]98-henry home]3017-my home ; [I]98-henry have an establishment at [[my]98-henry own house]3018-my own house in [Woodston]65-woodston , which is nearly twenty miles from [[my]98-henry father]2473-my father s , and some of [my]98-henry time is necessarily spent [there]336-there . "[98-henry]

" How sorry [you]98-henry must be for that ! "[77-catherine]

" [I]98-henry am always sorry to leave [Eleanor]145-eleanor . "[98-henry]

" Yes ; but besides [your]98-henry affection for [her]2222-his sister , [you]98-henry must be so fond of [the abbey]3021-the abbey ! After being used to [such a home as [the abbey]3021-the abbey]3022-such a home as the abbey , [an ordinary parsonage - house]3024-an ordinary parsonage - house must be very disagreeable . "[77-catherine]

[He]1231-he smiled , and said , " [You]98-henry have formed a very favourable idea of [the abbey]3021-the abbey . "[1231-he]

" To be sure , [I]77-catherine have . Is not it [a fine old place]3026-a fine old place , just like what one reads about ? "[77-catherine]

" And are [you]98-henry prepared to encounter all the horrors that [a building]3027-a building such as what one reads about may produce ? Have [you]98-henry a stout heart ? Nerves fit for sliding panels and tapestry ? "[1231-he]

" Oh ! yes [I]77-catherine do not think [I]77-catherine should be easily frightened , because there would be so many people in [the house]216-the house and besides , [it]216-the house has never been uninhabited and left deserted for years , and then [the family]457-the family come back to [it]216-the house unawares , without giving any notice , as generally happens . "[77-catherine]

" No , certainly . [We]457-the family shall not have to explore [our]457-the family way into [a hall]3030-a hall dimly lighted by the expiring embers of a wood fire nor be obliged to spread [our]457-the family beds on the floor of [a room]3031-a room without windows , doors , or furniture . But [you]98-henry must be aware that when [a young lady]245-a young lady is ( by whatever means ) introduced into [a dwelling of this kind]3033-a dwelling of this kind , [she]245-a young lady is always lodged apart from [the rest of [the family]457-the family]2316-the rest of the family . While [they]2316-the rest of the family snugly repair to [[their]2316-the rest of the family own end of [the house]216-the house]3036-their own end of the house , [she]245-a young lady is formally conducted by [Dorothy]164-dorothy , [the ancient housekeeper]3038-the ancient housekeeper , up a different staircase , and along [many gloomy passages]3039-many gloomy passages , into [an apartment never used since [some cousin or kin]3041-some cousin or kin died in [it]3040-an apartment never used since some cousin or kin died in it about twenty years before about twenty years before]3040-an apartment never used since some cousin or kin died in it about twenty years before . Can [you]98-henry stand such a ceremony as this ? Will not [your]98-henry mind misgive [you]98-henry when [you]98-henry find [yourself]98-henry in [this gloomy chamber too lofty and extensive for [you]98-henry , with only the feeble rays of a single lamp to take in [its]3040-an apartment never used since some cousin or kin died in it about twenty years before size [its]3040-an apartment never used since some cousin or kin died in it about twenty years before walls]3042-this gloomy chamber too lofty and extensive for you , with only the feeble rays of a single lamp to take in its size its walls hung with tapestry exhibiting figures as large as life , and the bed , of dark green stuff or purple velvet , presenting even a funereal appearance ? Will not [your]98-henry heart sink within [you]98-henry ? "[1231-he]

" Oh ! But this will not happen to [me]77-catherine , [I]77-catherine am sure . "[77-catherine]

" How fearfully will [you]98-henry examine the furniture of [[your]98-henry apartment]3043-your apartment ! And what will [you]98-henry discern ? Not tables , toilettes , wardrobes , or drawers , but on one side perhaps the remains of a broken lute , on the other a ponderous chest which no efforts can open , and over the fireplace the portrait of [some handsome warrior]3044-some handsome warrior , whose features will so incomprehensibly strike [you]98-henry , that [you]98-henry will not be able to withdraw [your]98-henry eyes from it . [Dorothy]164-dorothy , meanwhile , no less struck by [your]98-henry appearance , gazes on [you]98-henry in great agitation , and drops a few unintelligible hints . To raise [your]98-henry spirits , moreover , [she]164-dorothy gives [you]98-henry reason to suppose that [the part of [the abbey]3021-the abbey [you]98-henry inhabit]3045-the part of the abbey you inhabit is undoubtedly haunted , and informs [you]98-henry that [you]98-henry will not have a single domestic within call . With this parting cordial [she]164-dorothy curtsies off [you]98-henry listen to the sound of [her]164-dorothy receding footsteps as long as the last echo can reach [you]98-henry and when , with fainting spirits , [you]98-henry attempt to fasten [your]98-henry door , [you]98-henry discover , with increased alarm , that it has no lock . "[1231-he]

" Oh ! [Mr. Tilney]98-henry , how frightful ! This is just like a book ! But it can not really happen to [me]77-catherine . [I]77-catherine am sure [[your]98-henry housekeeper]3047-your housekeeper is not really [Dorothy]164-dorothy . Well , what then ? "[77-catherine]

" Nothing further to alarm perhaps may occur the first night . After surmounting [your]98-henry _ unconquerable _ horror of the bed , [you]98-henry will retire to rest , and get a few hours unquiet slumber . But on the second , or at farthest the _ third _ night after [your]98-henry arrival , [you]98-henry will probably have a violent storm . Peals of thunder so loud as to seem to shake the edifice to its foundation will roll round [the neighbouring mountains]3048-the neighbouring mountains and during the frightful gusts of wind which accompany it , [you]98-henry will probably think [you]98-henry discern ( for [your]98-henry lamp is not extinguished ) one part of the hanging more violently agitated than the rest . Unable of course to repress [your]98-henry curiosity in so favourable a moment for indulging it , [you]98-henry will instantly arise , and throwing [your]98-henry dressing - gown around [you]98-henry , proceed to examine this mystery . After a very short search , [you]98-henry will discover a division in the tapestry so artfully constructed as to defy the minutest inspection , and on opening it , a door will immediately appear which door , being only secured by massy bars and a padlock , [you]98-henry will , after a few efforts , succeed in opening and , with [your]98-henry lamp in [your]98-henry hand , will pass through it into [a small vaulted room]3049-a small vaulted room . "[1231-he]

" No , indeed ; [I]77-catherine should be too much frightened to do any such thing . "[77-catherine]

" What ! Not when [Dorothy]164-dorothy has given [you]98-henry to understand that there is a secret subterraneous communication between [[your]98-henry apartment]3043-your apartment and [the chapel of St. Anthony]3051-the chapel of st. anthony , scarcely two miles off ? Could [you]98-henry shrink from so simple an adventure ? No , no , [you]98-henry will proceed into [this small vaulted room]3052-this small vaulted room , and through this into several others , without perceiving anything very remarkable in either . In one perhaps there may be a dagger , in another a few drops of blood , and in a third the remains of some instrument of torture ; but there being nothing in all this out of the common way , and [your]98-henry lamp being nearly exhausted , [you]98-henry will return towards [[your]98-henry own apartment]3053-your own apartment . In repassing through [the small vaulted room]3054-the small vaulted room , however , [your]98-henry eyes will be attracted towards a large , old - fashioned cabinet of ebony and gold , which , though narrowly examining the furniture before , [you]98-henry had passed unnoticed . Impelled by an irresistible presentiment , [you]98-henry will eagerly advance to it , unlock its folding doors , and search into every drawer but for some time without discovering anything of importance perhaps nothing but a considerable hoard of diamonds . At last , however , by touching a secret spring , an inner compartment will open a roll of paper appears [you]98-henry seize it it contains many sheets of manuscript [you]98-henry hasten with the precious treasure into [[your]98-henry own chamber]3055-your own chamber , but scarcely have [you]98-henry been able to decipher Oh ! [Thou]3056-thou whomsoever [thou]3056-thou mayst be , into whose hands these memoirs of [the wretched Matilda]3057-the wretched matilda may fall when [your]98-henry lamp suddenly expires in the socket , and leaves [you]98-henry in total darkness . "[1231-he]

" Oh ! No , no do not say so . Well , go on . "[77-catherine]

But [Henry]98-henry was too much amused by the interest [he]98-henry had raised to be able to carry it farther ; [he]98-henry could no longer command solemnity either of subject or voice , and was obliged to entreat [her]1232-her to use [her]1232-her own fancy in the perusal of [Matilda]165-matilda s woes . [Catherine]1233-catherine , recollecting [herself]1233-catherine , grew ashamed of [her]1233-catherine eagerness , and began earnestly to assure [him]98-henry that [her]1233-catherine attention had been fixed without the smallest apprehension of really meeting with what [he]98-henry related . " [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , [she]95-miss tilney was sure , would never put [her]95-miss tilney into [such a chamber as [he]98-henry had described]3058-such a chamber as he had described ! [She]95-miss tilney was not at all afraid . "[1233-catherine]

As [they]1234-they drew near the end of [their]1234-they journey , [her]1233-catherine impatience for a sight of [the abbey]3021-the abbey for some time suspended by [his]98-henry conversation on subjects very different returned in full force , and every bend in [the road]2488-the road was expected with solemn awe to afford a glimpse of [its]3021-the abbey massy walls of grey stone , rising amidst a grove of ancient oaks , with the last beams of the sun playing in beautiful splendour on [its]3021-the abbey high Gothic windows . But so low did [the building]1237-the building stand , that [she]1233-catherine found [herself]1233-catherine passing through the great gates of [the lodge]1238-the lodge into [the very grounds of [Northanger]63-northanger]1239-the very grounds of northanger , without having discerned even an antique chimney .

[She]1233-catherine knew not that [she]1233-catherine had any right to be surprised , but there was a something in this mode of approach which [she]1233-catherine certainly had not expected . To pass between [lodges of a modern appearance]1240-lodges of a modern appearance , to find [herself]1233-catherine with such ease in [the very precincts of [the abbey]3021-the abbey]1241-the very precincts of the abbey , and driven so rapidly along [a smooth , level road of fine gravel]1243-a smooth , level road of fine gravel , without obstacle , alarm , or solemnity of any kind , struck [her]1233-catherine as odd and inconsistent . [She]1233-catherine was not long at leisure , however , for such considerations . A sudden scud of rain , driving full in [her]1233-catherine face , made it impossible for [her]1233-catherine to observe anything further , and fixed all [her]1233-catherine thoughts on the welfare of [her]1233-catherine new straw bonnet ; and [she]1233-catherine was actually under the abbey walls , was springing , with [Henry]98-henry s assistance , from [the carriage]559-the carriage , was beneath the shelter of [the old porch]1245-the old porch , and had even passed on to [the hall]1246-the hall , where [[her]1233-catherine friend]313-her friend and [the general]783-the general were waiting to welcome [her]1233-catherine , without feeling one awful foreboding of future misery to [herself]1233-catherine , or one moment s suspicion of any past scenes of horror being acted within [the solemn edifice]1249-the solemn edifice . The breeze had not seemed to waft the sighs of the murdered to [her]1233-catherine ; it had wafted nothing worse than a thick mizzling rain ; and having given a good shake to [her]1233-catherine habit , [she]1233-catherine was ready to be shown into [the common drawing - room]1250-the common drawing - room , and capable of considering where [she]1233-catherine was .

[An abbey]1121-an abbey ! Yes , it was delightful to be really in [an abbey]1121-an abbey ! But [she]1233-catherine doubted , as [she]1233-catherine looked round [the room]308-the room , whether anything within [her]1233-catherine observation would have given [her]1233-catherine the consciousness . The furniture was in all the profusion and elegance of modern taste . The fireplace , where [she]1233-catherine had expected the ample width and ponderous carving of former times , was contracted to a Rumford , with slabs of plain though handsome marble , and ornaments over it of the prettiest English china . The windows , to which [she]1233-catherine looked with peculiar dependence , from having heard [the general]783-the general talk of [his]783-the general preserving them in their Gothic form with reverential care , were yet less what [her]1233-catherine fancy had portrayed . To be sure , the pointed arch was preserved the form of them was Gothic they might be even casements but every pane was so large , so clear , so light ! To an imagination which had hoped for the smallest divisions , and the heaviest stone - work , for painted glass , dirt , and cobwebs , the difference was very distressing .

[The general]783-the general , perceiving how [her]1233-catherine eye was employed , began to talk of the smallness of [the room]308-the room and simplicity of the furniture , where everything , being for daily use , pretended only to comfort , etc . ; flattering [himself]783-the general , however , that there were [some apartments in [the Abbey]3021-the abbey]1257-some apartments in the abbey not unworthy [her]1233-catherine notice and was proceeding to mention the costly gilding of one in particular , when , taking out [his]783-the general watch , [he]783-the general stopped short to pronounce it with surprise within twenty minutes of five ! This seemed the word of separation , and [Catherine]77-catherine found [herself]77-catherine hurried away by [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney in such a manner as convinced [her]77-catherine that the strictest punctuality to the family hours would be expected at [Northanger]63-northanger .

Returning through [the large and lofty hall]1259-the large and lofty hall , [they]1260-they ascended a broad staircase of shining oak , which , after many flights and many landing - places , brought [them]1260-they upon [a long , wide gallery]1261-a long , wide gallery . On one side [it]1261-a long , wide gallery had a range of doors , and [it]1261-a long , wide gallery was lighted on the other by windows which [Catherine]77-catherine had only time to discover looked into [a quadrangle]1262-a quadrangle , before [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney led the way into [a chamber]1263-a chamber , and scarcely staying to hope [she]77-catherine would find [it]1263-a chamber comfortable , left [her]77-catherine with an anxious entreaty that [she]77-catherine would make as little alteration as possible in [her]77-catherine dress .

CHAPTER 21

A moment s glance was enough to satisfy [Catherine]77-catherine that [[her]77-catherine apartment]1264-her apartment was very unlike [the one which [Henry]98-henry had endeavoured to alarm [her]77-catherine by the description of]1265-the one which henry had endeavoured to alarm her by the description of . [It]1264-her apartment was by no means unreasonably large , and contained neither tapestry nor velvet . The walls were papered , the floor was carpeted ; the windows were neither less perfect nor more dim than those of [the drawing - room below]1266-the drawing - room below ; the furniture , though not of the latest fashion , was handsome and comfortable , and the air of [the room]308-the room altogether far from uncheerful . [Her]77-catherine heart instantaneously at ease on this point , [she]77-catherine resolved to lose no time in particular examination of anything , as [she]77-catherine greatly dreaded disobliging [the general]783-the general by any delay . [Her]77-catherine habit therefore was thrown off with all possible haste , and [she]77-catherine was preparing to unpin the linen package , which the chaise - seat had conveyed for [her]77-catherine immediate accommodation , when [her]77-catherine eye suddenly fell on a large high chest , standing back in a deep recess on one side of the fireplace . The sight of it made [her]77-catherine start ; and , forgetting everything else , [she]77-catherine stood gazing on it in motionless wonder , while these thoughts crossed [her]77-catherine :

" This is strange indeed ! [I]77-catherine did not expect such a sight as this ! An immense heavy chest ! What can it hold ? Why should it be placed here ? Pushed back too , as if meant to be out of sight ! [I]77-catherine will look into it cost [me]77-catherine what it may , [I]77-catherine will look into it and directly too by daylight . If [I]77-catherine stay till evening [my]77-catherine candle may go out . "[77-catherine] [She]77-catherine advanced and examined it closely : it was of cedar , curiously inlaid with some darker wood , and raised , about a foot from the ground , on a carved stand of the same . The lock was silver , though tarnished from age ; at each end were the imperfect remains of handles also of silver , broken perhaps prematurely by some strange violence ; and , on the centre of the lid , was a mysterious cipher , in the same metal . [Catherine]77-catherine bent over it intently , but without being able to distinguish anything with certainty . [She]77-catherine could not , in whatever direction [she]77-catherine took it , believe the last letter to be a _ T ; _ and yet that it should be anything else in [that house]1269-that house was a circumstance to raise no common degree of astonishment . If not originally [theirs]1270-theirs , by what strange events could it have fallen into [the Tilney family]1173-the tilney family ?

[Her]77-catherine fearful curiosity was every moment growing greater ; and seizing , with trembling hands , the hasp of the lock , [she]77-catherine resolved at all hazards to satisfy [herself]77-catherine at least as to its contents . With difficulty , for something seemed to resist [her]77-catherine efforts , [she]77-catherine raised the lid a few inches ; but at that moment a sudden knocking at the door of [the room]308-the room made [her]77-catherine , starting , quit [her]77-catherine hold , and the lid closed with alarming violence . [This ill - timed intruder]1273-this ill - timed intruder was [[Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney s maid]1274-miss tilney s maid , sent by [[her]95-miss tilney mistress]1275-her mistress to be of use to [Miss Morland]90-miss morland ; and though [Catherine]77-catherine immediately dismissed [her]1274-miss tilney s maid , it recalled [her]77-catherine to the sense of what [she]77-catherine ought to be doing , and forced [her]77-catherine , in spite of [her]77-catherine anxious desire to penetrate this mystery , to proceed in [her]77-catherine dressing without further delay . [Her]77-catherine progress was not quick , for [her]77-catherine thoughts and [her]77-catherine eyes were still bent on the object so well calculated to interest and alarm ; and though [she]77-catherine dared not waste a moment upon a second attempt , [she]77-catherine could not remain many paces from the chest . At length , however , having slipped one arm into [her]77-catherine gown , [her]77-catherine toilette seemed so nearly finished that the impatience of [her]77-catherine curiosity might safely be indulged . One moment surely might be spared ; and , so desperate should be the exertion of [her]77-catherine strength , that , unless secured by supernatural means , the lid in one moment should be thrown back . With this spirit [she]77-catherine sprang forward , and [her]77-catherine confidence did not deceive [her]77-catherine . [Her]77-catherine resolute effort threw back the lid , and gave to [her]77-catherine astonished eyes the view of a white cotton counterpane , properly folded , reposing at one end of the chest in undisputed possession !

[She]77-catherine was gazing on it with the first blush of surprise when [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , anxious for [her]95-miss tilney friend s being ready , entered [the room]308-the room , and to the rising shame of having harboured for some minutes an absurd expectation , was then added the shame of being caught in so idle a search . " That is a curious old chest , is not it ? "[95-miss tilney] said [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , as [Catherine]77-catherine hastily closed it and turned away to the glass . " It is impossible to say how many generations it has been [here]2128-here . How it came to be first put in [this room]2174-this room [I]95-miss tilney know not , but [I]95-miss tilney have not had it moved , because [I]95-miss tilney thought it might sometimes be of use in holding hats and bonnets . The worst of it is that its weight makes it difficult to open . In that corner , however , it is at least out of the way . "[95-miss tilney]

[Catherine]77-catherine had no leisure for speech , being at once blushing , tying [her]77-catherine gown , and forming wise resolutions with the most violent dispatch . [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney gently hinted [her]95-miss tilney fear of being late ; and in half a minute [they]1277-they ran [downstairs]681-downstairs together , in an alarm not wholly unfounded , for [General Tilney]143-general tilney was pacing [the drawing - room]448-the drawing - room , [his]143-general tilney watch in [his]143-general tilney hand , and having , on the very instant of [their]1277-they entering , pulled the bell with violence , ordered " Dinner to be on table _ directly ! _ "[143-general tilney]

[Catherine]77-catherine trembled at the emphasis with which [he]143-general tilney spoke , and sat pale and breathless , in a most humble mood , concerned for [[his]143-general tilney children]1067-his children , and detesting old chests ; and [the general]783-the general , recovering [his]783-the general politeness as [he]783-the general looked at [her]77-catherine , spent the rest of [his]783-the general time in scolding [[his]783-the general daughter]2444-his daughter for so foolishly hurrying [[her]77-catherine fair friend]477-her fair friend , who was absolutely out of breath from haste , when there was not the least occasion for hurry in [the world]197-the world : but [Catherine]77-catherine could not at all get over the double distress of having involved [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend in a lecture and been [a great simpleton]1286-a great simpleton [herself]77-catherine , till [they]1277-they were happily seated at the dinner - table , when [the general]783-the general s complacent smiles , and a good appetite of [her]77-catherine own , restored [her]77-catherine to peace . [The dining - parlour]1288-the dining - parlour was [a noble room]1289-a noble room , suitable in [its]1288-the dining - parlour dimensions to [a much larger drawing - room than the one in common use]1290-a much larger drawing - room than the one in common use , and fitted up in a style of luxury and expense which was almost lost on the unpractised eye of [Catherine]77-catherine , who saw little more than [its]1288-the dining - parlour spaciousness and the number of [[their]1277-they attendants]1291-their attendants . Of [the former]594-the former , [she]77-catherine spoke aloud [her]77-catherine admiration ; and [the general]783-the general , with a very gracious countenance , acknowledged that [it]1288-the dining - parlour was by no means [an ill - sized room]1294-an ill - sized room , and further confessed that , though as careless on such subjects as [most people]1295-most people , [he]783-the general did look upon [a tolerably large eating - room]1296-a tolerably large eating - room as one of the necessaries of life ; [he]783-the general supposed , however , " that [she]77-catherine must have been used to [much better - sized apartments at [Mr. Allen s]89-mr. allen]3061-much better - sized apartments at mr. allen s ? "[783-the general]

" No , indeed , "[77-catherine] was [Catherine]77-catherine s honest assurance ; " [[Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen s dining - parlour]3062-mr. allen s dining - parlour was not more than half as large , "[77-catherine] and [she]77-catherine had never seen so large [a room as this]1297-a room as this in [her]77-catherine life . [The general]783-the general s good humour increased . Why , as [he]783-the general _ had _ [such rooms]1299-such rooms , [he]783-the general thought it would be simple not to make use of [them]1299-such rooms ; but , upon [his]783-the general honour , [he]783-the general believed there might be more comfort in [rooms of only half [their]1299-such rooms size]1300-rooms of only half their size . [[Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen s house]442-mr. allen s house , [he]783-the general was sure , must be exactly of the true size for rational happiness .

The evening passed without any further disturbance , and , in the occasional absence of [General Tilney]143-general tilney , with much positive cheerfulness . It was only in [his]783-the general presence that [Catherine]77-catherine felt the smallest fatigue from [her]77-catherine journey ; and even then , even in moments of languor or restraint , a sense of general happiness preponderated , and [she]77-catherine could think of [[her]77-catherine friends]792-her friends in [Bath]5-bath without one wish of being with [them]792-her friends .

The night was stormy ; the wind had been rising at intervals the whole afternoon ; and by the time the party broke up , it blew and rained violently . [Catherine]77-catherine , as [she]77-catherine crossed [the hall]1246-the hall , listened to the tempest with sensations of awe ; and , when [she]77-catherine heard it rage round a corner of [the ancient building]1304-the ancient building and close with sudden fury a distant door , felt for the first time that [she]77-catherine was really in [an abbey]1121-an abbey . Yes , these were characteristic sounds ; they brought to [her]77-catherine recollection a countless variety of dreadful situations and horrid scenes , which [such buildings]1306-such buildings had witnessed , and such storms ushered in ; and most heartily did [she]77-catherine rejoice in the happier circumstances attending [her]77-catherine entrance within walls so solemn ! _ [She]77-catherine _ had nothing to dread from [midnight assassins]1307-midnight assassins or [drunken gallants]1308-drunken gallants . [Henry]98-henry had certainly been only in jest in what [he]98-henry had told [her]77-catherine that morning . In [a house so furnished]1309-a house so furnished , and so guarded , [she]77-catherine could have nothing to explore or to suffer , and might go to [[her]77-catherine bedroom]1310-her bedroom as securely as if [it]1310-her bedroom had been [[her]77-catherine own chamber at [Fullerton]3-fullerton]1311-her own chamber at fullerton . Thus wisely fortifying [her]77-catherine mind , as [she]77-catherine proceeded [upstairs]446-upstairs , [she]77-catherine was enabled , especially on perceiving that [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney slept only two doors from [her]77-catherine , to enter [[her]77-catherine room]1313-her room with a tolerably stout heart ; and [her]77-catherine spirits were immediately assisted by the cheerful blaze of a wood fire . " How much better is this , "[77-catherine] said [she]77-catherine , as [she]77-catherine walked to [the fender]1314-the fender " how much better to find a fire ready lit , than to have to wait shivering in the cold till all [the family]457-the family are in bed , as [so many poor girls]3064-so many poor girls have been obliged to do , and then to have [a faithful old servant]3065-a faithful old servant frightening [one]2210-one by coming in with a faggot ! How glad [I]77-catherine am that [Northanger]63-northanger is what it is ! If it had been like [some other places]3067-some other places , [I]77-catherine do not know that , in such a night as this , [I]77-catherine could have answered for [my]77-catherine courage : but now , to be sure , there is nothing to alarm [one]2210-one . "[77-catherine]

[She]77-catherine looked round [the room]308-the room . The window curtains seemed in motion . It could be nothing but the violence of the wind penetrating through the divisions of the shutters ; and [she]77-catherine stepped boldly forward , carelessly humming a tune , to assure [herself]77-catherine of its being so , peeped courageously behind each curtain , saw nothing on either low window seat to scare [her]77-catherine , and on placing a hand against the shutter , felt the strongest conviction of the wind s force . A glance at the old chest , as [she]77-catherine turned away from this examination , was not without its use ; [she]77-catherine scorned the causeless fears of [an idle fancy]1316-an idle fancy , and began with a most happy indifference to prepare [herself]77-catherine for bed . " [She]77-catherine should take [her]77-catherine time ; [she]77-catherine should not hurry [herself]77-catherine ; [she]77-catherine did not care if [she]77-catherine were [the last person up in [the house]216-the house]3069-the last person up in the house . But [she]77-catherine would not make up [her]77-catherine fire ; _ that _ would seem cowardly , as if [she]77-catherine wished for the protection of light after [she]77-catherine were in bed . "[77-catherine] The fire therefore died away , and [Catherine]77-catherine , having spent the best part of an hour in [her]77-catherine arrangements , was beginning to think of stepping into bed , when , on giving a parting glance round [the room]308-the room , [she]77-catherine was struck by the appearance of a high , old - fashioned black cabinet , which , though in a situation conspicuous enough , had never caught [her]77-catherine notice before . [Henry]98-henry s words , [his]98-henry description of the ebony cabinet which was to escape [her]77-catherine observation at first , immediately rushed across [her]77-catherine ; and though there could be nothing really in it , there was something whimsical , it was certainly a very remarkable coincidence ! [She]77-catherine took [her]77-catherine candle and looked closely at the cabinet . It was not absolutely ebony and gold ; but it was japan , black and yellow japan of the handsomest kind ; and as [she]77-catherine held [her]77-catherine candle , the yellow had very much the effect of gold . The key was in the door , and [she]77-catherine had a strange fancy to look into it ; not , however , with the smallest expectation of finding anything , but it was so very odd , after what [Henry]98-henry had said . In short , [she]77-catherine could not sleep till [she]77-catherine had examined it . So , placing the candle with great caution on a chair , [she]77-catherine seized the key with a very tremulous hand and tried to turn it ; but it resisted [her]77-catherine utmost strength . Alarmed , but not discouraged , [she]77-catherine tried it another way ; a bolt flew , and [she]77-catherine believed [herself]77-catherine successful ; but how strangely mysterious ! The door was still immovable . [She]77-catherine paused a moment in breathless wonder . The wind roared down the chimney , the rain beat in torrents against the windows , and everything seemed to speak the awfulness of [her]77-catherine situation . To retire to bed , however , unsatisfied on such a point , would be vain , since sleep must be impossible with the consciousness of a cabinet so mysteriously closed in [her]77-catherine immediate vicinity . Again , therefore , [she]77-catherine applied [herself]77-catherine to the key , and after moving it in every possible way for some instants with the determined celerity of hope s last effort , the door suddenly yielded to [her]77-catherine hand : [her]77-catherine heart leaped with exultation at such a victory , and having thrown open each folding door , the second being secured only by bolts of less wonderful construction than the lock , though in that [her]77-catherine eye could not discern anything unusual , a double range of small drawers appeared in view , with some larger drawers above and below them ; and in the centre , a small door , closed also with a lock and key , secured in all probability a cavity of importance .

[Catherine]77-catherine s heart beat quick , but [her]77-catherine courage did not fail [her]77-catherine . With a cheek flushed by hope , and an eye straining with curiosity , [her]77-catherine fingers grasped the handle of a drawer and drew it forth . It was entirely empty . With less alarm and greater eagerness [she]77-catherine seized a second , a third , a fourth ; each was equally empty . Not one was left unsearched , and in not one was anything found . Well read in the art of concealing a treasure , the possibility of false linings to the drawers did not escape [her]77-catherine , and [she]77-catherine felt round each with anxious acuteness in vain . The place in the middle alone remained now unexplored ; and though [she]77-catherine had " never from the first had the smallest idea of finding anything in any part of the cabinet , and was not in the least disappointed at [her]77-catherine ill success thus far , it would be foolish not to examine it thoroughly while [she]77-catherine was about it . "[77-catherine] It was some time however before [she]77-catherine could unfasten the door , the same difficulty occurring in the management of this inner lock as of the outer ; but at length it did open ; and not vain , as hitherto , was [her]77-catherine search ; [her]77-catherine quick eyes directly fell on a roll of paper pushed back into the further part of the cavity , apparently for concealment , and [her]77-catherine feelings at that moment were indescribable . [Her]77-catherine heart fluttered , [her]77-catherine knees trembled , and [her]77-catherine cheeks grew pale . [She]77-catherine seized , with an unsteady hand , the precious manuscript , for half a glance sufficed to ascertain written characters ; and while [she]77-catherine acknowledged with awful sensations this striking exemplification of what [Henry]98-henry had foretold , resolved instantly to peruse every line before [she]77-catherine attempted to rest .

The dimness of the light [her]77-catherine candle emitted made [her]77-catherine turn to it with alarm ; but there was no danger of its sudden extinction ; it had yet some hours to burn ; and that [she]77-catherine might not have any greater difficulty in distinguishing the writing than what its ancient date might occasion , [she]77-catherine hastily snuffed it . Alas ! It was snuffed and extinguished in one . A lamp could not have expired with more awful effect . [Catherine]77-catherine , for a few moments , was motionless with horror . It was done completely ; not a remnant of light in the wick could give hope to the rekindling breath . Darkness impenetrable and immovable filled [the room]308-the room . A violent gust of wind , rising with sudden fury , added fresh horror to the moment . [Catherine]77-catherine trembled from head to foot . In the pause which succeeded , a sound like receding footsteps and the closing of a distant door struck on [her]77-catherine affrighted ear . Human nature could support no more . A cold sweat stood on [her]77-catherine forehead , the manuscript fell from [her]77-catherine hand , and groping [her]77-catherine way to the bed , [she]77-catherine jumped hastily in , and sought some suspension of agony by creeping far underneath the clothes . To close [her]77-catherine eyes in sleep that night , [she]77-catherine felt must be entirely out of the question . With a curiosity so justly awakened , and feelings in every way so agitated , repose must be absolutely impossible . The storm too abroad so dreadful ! [She]77-catherine had not been used to feel alarm from wind , but now every blast seemed fraught with awful intelligence . The manuscript so wonderfully found , so wonderfully accomplishing the morning s prediction , how was it to be accounted for ? What could it contain ? To whom could it relate ? By what means could it have been so long concealed ? And how singularly strange that it should fall to [her]77-catherine lot to discover it ! Till [she]77-catherine had made [herself]77-catherine mistress of its contents , however , [she]77-catherine could have neither repose nor comfort ; and with the sun s first rays [she]77-catherine was determined to peruse it . But many were the tedious hours which must yet intervene . [She]77-catherine shuddered , tossed about in [her]77-catherine bed , and envied every quiet sleeper . The storm still raged , and various were the noises , more terrific even than the wind , which struck at intervals on [her]77-catherine startled ear . The very curtains of [her]77-catherine bed seemed at one moment in motion , and at another the lock of [her]77-catherine door was agitated , as if by the attempt of [somebody to enter]1319-somebody to enter . Hollow murmurs seemed to creep along [the gallery]1320-the gallery , and more than once [her]77-catherine blood was chilled by the sound of distant moans . Hour after hour passed away , and the wearied [Catherine]77-catherine had heard three proclaimed by all the clocks in [the house]216-the house before the tempest subsided or [she]77-catherine unknowingly fell fast asleep .

CHAPTER 22

[The housemaid]1322-the housemaid s folding back [her]1322-the housemaid window - shutters at eight o clock the next day was the sound which first roused [Catherine]77-catherine ; and [she]77-catherine opened [her]77-catherine eyes , wondering that they could ever have been closed , on objects of cheerfulness ; [her]1322-the housemaid fire was already burning , and a bright morning had succeeded the tempest of the night . Instantaneously , with the consciousness of existence , returned [her]77-catherine recollection of the manuscript ; and springing from the bed in the very moment of [the maid]1323-the maid s going away , [she]77-catherine eagerly collected every scattered sheet which had burst from the roll on its falling to the ground , and flew back to enjoy the luxury of their perusal on [her]77-catherine pillow . [She]77-catherine now plainly saw that [she]77-catherine must not expect a manuscript of equal length with the generality of what [she]77-catherine had shuddered over in books , for the roll , seeming to consist entirely of small disjointed sheets , was altogether but of trifling size , and much less than [she]77-catherine had supposed it to be at first .

[Her]77-catherine greedy eye glanced rapidly over a page . [She]77-catherine started at its import . Could it be possible , or did not [her]77-catherine senses play [her]77-catherine false ? An inventory of linen , in coarse and modern characters , seemed all that was before [her]77-catherine ! If the evidence of sight might be trusted , [she]77-catherine held a washing - bill in [her]77-catherine hand . [She]77-catherine seized another sheet , and saw the same articles with little variation ; a third , a fourth , and a fifth presented nothing new . Shirts , stockings , cravats , and waistcoats faced [her]77-catherine in each . [Two others , penned by the same hand]1324-two others , penned by the same hand , marked an expenditure scarcely more interesting , in letters , hair - powder , shoe - string , and breeches - ball . And the larger sheet , which had enclosed the rest , seemed by its first cramp line , " To poultice chestnut mare "[1324-two others , penned by the same hand] a farrier s bill ! Such was the collection of papers ( left perhaps , as [she]77-catherine could then suppose , by the negligence of [a servant in the place whence [she]77-catherine had taken them]1325-a servant in the place whence she had taken them ) which had filled [her]77-catherine with expectation and alarm , and robbed [her]77-catherine of half [her]77-catherine night s rest ! [She]77-catherine felt humbled to the dust . Could not the adventure of the chest have taught [her]77-catherine wisdom ? A corner of it , catching [her]77-catherine eye as [she]77-catherine lay , seemed to rise up in judgment against [her]77-catherine . Nothing could now be clearer than the absurdity of [her]77-catherine recent fancies . To suppose that a manuscript of many generations back could have remained undiscovered in [a room such as that]1326-a room such as that , so modern , so habitable ! Or that [she]77-catherine should be the first to possess the skill of unlocking a cabinet , the key of which was open to all !

How could [she]77-catherine have so imposed on [herself]77-catherine ? Heaven forbid that [Henry Tilney]98-henry should ever know [her]77-catherine folly ! And it was in a great measure [his]98-henry own doing , for had not the cabinet appeared so exactly to agree with [his]98-henry description of [her]77-catherine adventures , [she]77-catherine should never have felt the smallest curiosity about it . This was the only comfort that occurred . Impatient to get rid of those hateful evidences of [her]77-catherine folly , those detestable papers then scattered over the bed , [she]77-catherine rose directly , and folding them up as nearly as possible in the same shape as before , returned them to the same spot within the cabinet , with a very hearty wish that no untoward accident might ever bring them forward again , to disgrace [her]77-catherine even with [herself]77-catherine .

Why the locks should have been so difficult to open , however , was still something remarkable , for [she]77-catherine could now manage them with perfect ease . In this there was surely something mysterious , and [she]77-catherine indulged in the flattering suggestion for half a minute , till the possibility of the door s having been at first unlocked , and of being [herself]77-catherine its fastener , darted into [her]77-catherine head , and cost [her]77-catherine another blush .

[She]77-catherine got away as soon as [she]77-catherine could from [a room in which [her]77-catherine conduct produced such unpleasant reflections]1327-a room in which her conduct produced such unpleasant reflections , and found [her]77-catherine way with all speed to [the breakfast - parlour]1328-the breakfast - parlour , as it had been pointed out to [her]77-catherine by [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney the evening before . [Henry]98-henry was alone in [it]1328-the breakfast - parlour ; and [his]98-henry immediate hope of [her]77-catherine having been undisturbed by the tempest , with an arch reference to the character of [the building]1237-the building [they]1330-they inhabited , was rather distressing . For [the world]197-the world would [she]77-catherine not have [her]77-catherine weakness suspected , and yet , unequal to an absolute falsehood , was constrained to acknowledge that the wind had kept [her]77-catherine awake a little . " But [we]1330-they have a charming morning after it , "[77-catherine] [she]77-catherine added , desiring to get rid of the subject ; " and storms and sleeplessness are nothing when they are over . What beautiful hyacinths ! [I]77-catherine have just learnt to love a hyacinth . "[77-catherine]

" And how might [you]98-henry learn ? By accident or argument ? "[1332-the general , whose smiling compliments announced a happy state of mind]

" [[Your]98-henry sister]2195-your sister taught [me]77-catherine ; [I]77-catherine can not tell how . [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen used to take pains , year after year , to make [me]77-catherine like them ; but [I]77-catherine never could , till [I]77-catherine saw [them]1330-they the other day in [Milsom Street]15-milsom street ; [I]77-catherine am naturally indifferent about flowers . "[77-catherine]

" But now [you]98-henry love a hyacinth . So much the better . [You]98-henry have gained a new source of enjoyment , and it is well to have as many holds upon happiness as possible . Besides , a taste for flowers is always desirable in [your]98-henry sex , as a means of getting [you]98-henry out of doors , and tempting [you]98-henry to more frequent exercise than [you]98-henry would otherwise take . And though the love of a hyacinth may be rather domestic , who can tell , the sentiment once raised , but [you]98-henry may in time come to love a rose ? "[1332-the general , whose smiling compliments announced a happy state of mind]

" But [I]77-catherine do not want any such pursuit to get [me]77-catherine out of doors . [Mamma]142-mamma says [I]77-catherine am never within . "[77-catherine]

Has [[my]1332-the general , whose smiling compliments announced a happy state of mind sister]2192-my sister a pleasant mode of instruction ? "[1332-the general , whose smiling compliments announced a happy state of mind]

[Catherine]77-catherine was saved the embarrassment of attempting an answer by the entrance of [the general , whose smiling compliments announced a happy state of mind]1332-the general , whose smiling compliments announced a happy state of mind , but whose gentle hint of sympathetic early rising did not advance [her]77-catherine composure .

The elegance of the breakfast set forced itself on [Catherine]77-catherine s notice when [they]1333-they were seated at table ; and , luckily , it had been [the general]783-the general s choice . [He]783-the general was enchanted by [her]77-catherine approbation of [his]783-the general taste , confessed it to be neat and simple , thought it right to encourage the manufacture of [his]783-the general country ; and for [his]783-the general part , to [his]783-the general uncritical palate , the tea was as well flavoured from the clay of [Staffordshire]67-staffordshire , as from that of [Dresden]166-dresden or S ve . But this was quite an old set , purchased two years ago . The manufacture was much improved since that time ; [he]783-the general had seen some beautiful specimens when last in [town]2641-town , and had [he]783-the general not been perfectly without vanity of that kind , might have been tempted to order a new set . [He]783-the general trusted , however , that an opportunity might ere long occur of selecting one though not for [himself]783-the general . [Catherine]77-catherine was probably [the only one of the party who did not understand [him]783-the general]1336-the only one of the party who did not understand him .

" What say [you]145-eleanor , [Eleanor]145-eleanor ? [I]783-the general think it would be acknowledged by [the most impartial eye]3079-the most impartial eye to have many recommendations . [The house]216-the house stands among fine meadows facing [the south - east]3081-the south - east , with an excellent [kitchen - garden in the same aspect]3082-kitchen - garden in the same aspect ; the walls surrounding which [I]783-the general built and stocked [myself]783-the general about ten years ago , for the benefit of [[my]783-the general son]3083-my son . " [I]687-her companion am particularly fond of [this spot]3113-this spot , "[687-her companion] said [[her]77-catherine companion]687-her companion , with a sigh . " It was [[my]687-her companion mother]2453-my mother s favourite walk . "[687-her companion]

[Catherine]77-catherine had never heard [Mrs. Tilney]133-mrs. tilney mentioned in [the family]457-the family before , and the interest excited by this tender remembrance showed itself directly in [her]77-catherine altered countenance , and in the attentive pause with which [she]77-catherine waited for something more .

" [I]145-eleanor used to walk [here]2128-here so often with [her]133-mrs. tilney !
