"[95-miss tilney] [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney continuing silent , [she]95-miss tilney ventured to say , " [Her]133-mrs. tilney death must have been a great affliction ! "[95-miss tilney]

" A great and increasing one , "[413-the other] replied [the other]413-the other , in a low voice . " [I]95-miss tilney was only thirteen when it happened ; and though [I]95-miss tilney felt [my]95-miss tilney loss perhaps as strongly as [one so young]3118-one so young could feel it , [I]95-miss tilney did not , [I]95-miss tilney could not , then know what a loss it was . "[95-miss tilney] [She]95-miss tilney stopped for a moment , and then added , with great firmness , " [I]95-miss tilney have [no sister]3119-no sister , [you]3120-you know and though [Henry]98-henry though [[my]95-miss tilney brothers]3121-my brothers are very affectionate , and [Henry]98-henry is a great deal here , which [I]95-miss tilney am most thankful for , it is impossible for [me]95-miss tilney not to be often solitary . "[95-miss tilney]

" To be sure [you]3120-you must miss [him]98-henry very much . "[1392-the first three]

" [A mother]2687-a mother would have been always present . [A mother]2687-a mother would have been [a constant friend]3124-a constant friend ; [her]2687-a mother influence would have been beyond all other . "[95-miss tilney]

" Was [she]2687-a mother [a very charming woman]3125-a very charming woman ? Was [she]2687-a mother handsome ? Was there any picture of [her]2687-a mother in [the abbey]3021-the abbey ? And why had [she]2687-a mother been so partial to [that grove]3127-that grove ? Was it from dejection of spirits ? "[1392-the first three] were questions now eagerly poured forth ; [the first three]1392-the first three received a ready affirmative , [the two others]679-the two others were passed by ; and [Catherine]77-catherine s interest in [the deceased Mrs. Tilney]133-mrs. tilney augmented with every question , whether answered or not . Of [her]77-catherine unhappiness in marriage , [she]77-catherine felt persuaded . [The general]783-the general certainly had been [an unkind husband]1395-an unkind husband . [He]783-the general did not love [her]77-catherine walk : could [he]783-the general therefore have loved [her]77-catherine ? And besides , handsome as [he]783-the general was , there was a something in the turn of [his]783-the general features which spoke [his]783-the general not having behaved well to [her]77-catherine .

" [Her]2687-a mother picture , [I]783-the general suppose , "[783-the general] blushing at the consummate art of [her]77-catherine own question , " hangs in [[[your]783-the general father]2636-your father s room]3129-your father s room ? "[783-the general]

" No ; it was intended for [the drawing - room]448-the drawing - room ; but [[my]783-the general father]2473-my father was dissatisfied with the painting , and for some time it had no place . Soon after [her]2687-a mother death [I]783-the general obtained it for [my]783-the general own , and hung it in [[my]783-the general bed - chamber]3132-my bed - chamber where [I]783-the general shall be happy to show it [you]77-catherine ; it is very like . "[783-the general] Here was another proof . A portrait very like of [a departed wife]1396-a departed wife , not valued by [the husband]1397-the husband ! [He]1397-the husband must have been dreadfully cruel to [her]77-catherine !

[Catherine]77-catherine attempted no longer to hide from [herself]77-catherine the nature of the feelings which , in spite of all [his]1397-the husband attentions , [he]1397-the husband had previously excited ; and what had been terror and dislike before , was now absolute aversion . Yes , aversion ! [His]1397-the husband cruelty to [such a charming woman]1398-such a charming woman made [him]1397-the husband odious to [her]77-catherine . [She]77-catherine had often read of such characters , characters which [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen had been used to call unnatural and overdrawn ; but here was proof positive of the contrary .

[She]77-catherine had just settled this point when the end of the path brought them directly upon [the general]783-the general ; and in spite of all [her]77-catherine virtuous indignation , [she]77-catherine found [herself]77-catherine again obliged to walk with [him]1397-the husband , listen to [him]1397-the husband , and even to smile when [he]1397-the husband smiled . Being no longer able , however , to receive pleasure from the surrounding objects , [she]77-catherine soon began to walk with lassitude ; [the general]783-the general perceived it , and with a concern for [her]77-catherine health , which seemed to reproach [her]77-catherine for [her]77-catherine opinion of [him]1397-the husband , was most urgent for returning with [[his]783-the general daughter]2444-his daughter to [the house]216-the house . [He]783-the general would follow [them]1403-them in a quarter of an hour . Again [they]1403-them parted but [Eleanor]145-eleanor was called back in half a minute to receive a strict charge against taking [[her]145-eleanor friend]313-her friend round [the abbey]3021-the abbey till [his]1397-the husband return . This second instance of [his]1397-the husband anxiety to delay what [she]145-eleanor so much wished for struck [Catherine]77-catherine as very remarkable .

CHAPTER 23

An hour passed away before [the general]783-the general came in , spent , on the part of [[his]783-the general young guest]1407-his young guest , in no very favourable consideration of [his]783-the general character . " This lengthened absence , these solitary rambles , did not speak a mind at ease , or a conscience void of reproach . "[783-the general] At length [he]783-the general appeared ; and , whatever might have been the gloom of [his]783-the general meditations , [he]783-the general could still smile with _ [them]1408-them _ . [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , understanding in part [[her]95-miss tilney friend]313-her friend s curiosity to see [the house]216-the house , soon revived the subject ; and [[her]95-miss tilney father]188-her father being , contrary to [Catherine]77-catherine s expectations , unprovided with any pretence for further delay , beyond that of stopping five minutes to order refreshments to be in [the room]308-the room by [their]1413-they return , was at last ready to escort [them]1413-they .

[They]1413-they set forward ; and , with a grandeur of air , a dignified step , which caught the eye , but could not shake the doubts of [the well - read Catherine]1414-the well - read catherine , [he]783-the general led the way across [the hall]1246-the hall , through [the common drawing - room]1250-the common drawing - room and [one useless antechamber]1417-one useless antechamber , into [a room magnificent both in size and furniture [the real drawing - room]1419-the real drawing - room , used only with company of consequence]1418-a room magnificent both in size and furniture the real drawing - room , used only with company of consequence . It was very noble very grand very charming ! was all that [Catherine]77-catherine had to say , for [her]77-catherine indiscriminating eye scarcely discerned the colour of the satin ; and all minuteness of praise , all praise that had much meaning , was supplied by [the general]783-the general : the costliness or elegance of any room s fitting - up could be nothing to [her]77-catherine ; [she]77-catherine cared for no furniture of a more modern date than the fifteenth century . When [the general]783-the general had satisfied [his]783-the general own curiosity , in a close examination of every well - known ornament , [they]1413-they proceeded into [the library]1422-the library , [an apartment , in]1423-an apartment , in [its]1422-the library way , of equal magnificence , exhibiting a collection of books , on which [an humble man]1424-an humble man might have looked with pride . [Catherine]77-catherine heard , admired , and wondered with more genuine feeling than before gathered all that [she]77-catherine could from [this storehouse of knowledge]1425-this storehouse of knowledge , by running over the titles of half a shelf , and was ready to proceed . But [suites of apartments]1426-suites of apartments did not spring up with [her]77-catherine wishes . Large as was [the building]1237-the building , [she]77-catherine had already visited the greatest part ; though , on being told that , with the addition of [the kitchen]1428-the kitchen , [the six or seven rooms]1429-the six or seven rooms [she]77-catherine had now seen surrounded [three sides of [the court]1431-the court]1430-three sides of the court , [she]77-catherine could scarcely believe it , or overcome the suspicion of there being many chambers secreted . It was some relief , however , that [they]1413-they were to return to [the rooms in common use]1432-the rooms in common use , by passing through a few of less importance , looking into [the court]1431-the court , which , with occasional passages , not wholly unintricate , connected the different sides ; and [she]77-catherine was further soothed in [her]77-catherine progress by being told that [she]77-catherine was treading what had once been [a cloister]1434-a cloister , having traces of cells pointed out , and observing several doors that were neither opened nor explained to [her]77-catherine by finding [herself]77-catherine successively in [a billiard - room]1435-a billiard - room , and in [[the general]783-the general s private apartment]1437-the general s private apartment , without comprehending [their]1413-they connection , or being able to turn aright when [she]77-catherine left [them]1413-they ; and lastly , by passing through [a dark little room]1438-a dark little room , owning [Henry]98-henry s authority , and strewed with [his]98-henry litter of books , guns , and greatcoats .

From [the dining - room]1439-the dining - room , of which , though already seen , and always to be seen at five o clock , [the general]783-the general could not forgo the pleasure of pacing out the length , for the more certain information of [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , as to what [she]90-miss morland neither doubted nor cared for , [they]1441-they proceeded by quick communication to [the kitchen]1428-the kitchen [the ancient kitchen of [the convent]1444-the convent , rich in the massy walls and smoke of former days , and in the stoves and hot closets of the present]1443-the ancient kitchen of the convent , rich in the massy walls and smoke of former days , and in the stoves and hot closets of the present . [The general]783-the general s improving hand had not loitered [here]2128-here : every modern invention to facilitate the labour of [the cooks]1447-the cooks had been adopted within this , [[their]1447-the cooks spacious theatre]1448-their spacious theatre ; and , when the genius of [others]705-others had failed , [his]783-the general own had often produced the perfection wanted . [His]783-the general endowments of this spot alone might at any time have placed [him]783-the general high among [the benefactors of [the convent]1444-the convent]1450-the benefactors of the convent .

With the walls of [the kitchen]1428-the kitchen ended all the antiquity of [the abbey]3021-the abbey ; the fourth side of [the quadrangle]1359-the quadrangle having , on account of [its]1359-the quadrangle decaying state , been removed by [[the general]783-the general s father]1456-the general s father , and the present erected in [its]1359-the quadrangle place . All that was venerable ceased [here]2128-here . [The new building]1458-the new building was not only new , but declared itself to be so ; intended only for [offices]1459-offices , and enclosed behind by [stable - yards]1460-stable - yards , no uniformity of architecture had been thought necessary . [Catherine]77-catherine could have raved at the hand which had swept away what must have been beyond the value of all the rest , for the purposes of mere domestic economy ; and would willingly have been spared the mortification of a walk through scenes so fallen , had [the general]783-the general allowed it ; but if [he]783-the general had a vanity , it was in the arrangement of [[his]783-the general offices]1462-his offices ; and as [he]783-the general was convinced that , to a mind like [Miss Morland]90-miss morland s , a view of [the accommodations]1463-the accommodations and comforts , by which the labours of [[her]90-miss morland inferiors]1464-her inferiors were softened , must always be gratifying , [he]783-the general should make no apology for leading [her]90-miss morland on . [They]1465-they took a slight survey of all ; and [Catherine]77-catherine was impressed , beyond [her]77-catherine expectation , by [their]1465-they multiplicity and [their]1465-they convenience . The purposes for which a few shapeless pantries and a comfortless scullery were deemed sufficient at [Fullerton]3-fullerton , were here carried on in appropriate divisions , commodious and roomy . The number of [servants continually appearing]1466-servants continually appearing did not strike [her]77-catherine less than the number of [[their]1465-they offices]1467-their offices . Wherever [they]1465-they went , [some pattened girl]1468-some pattened girl stopped to curtsy , or [some footman in dishabille]1469-some footman in dishabille sneaked off . Yet this was [an abbey]1121-an abbey ! How inexpressibly different in these domestic arrangements from such as [she]77-catherine had read about from [abbeys]1123-abbeys and [castles]1122-castles , in which , though certainly larger than [Northanger]63-northanger , all the dirty work of [the house]216-the house was to be done by [two pair of female hands]1474-two pair of female hands at the utmost . How [they]1465-they could get through it all had often amazed [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen ; and , when [Catherine]77-catherine saw what was necessary [here]2128-here , [she]77-catherine began to be amazed [herself]77-catherine .

[They]1465-they returned to [the hall]1246-the hall , that the chief staircase might be ascended , and the beauty of [its]1246-the hall wood , and ornaments of rich carving might be pointed out : having gained the top , [they]1465-they turned in an opposite direction from the gallery in which [[her]77-catherine room]1313-her room lay , and shortly entered one on the same plan , but superior in length and breadth . [She]77-catherine was here shown successively into [three large bed - chambers]1478-three large bed - chambers , with [[their]1478-three large bed - chambers dressing - rooms]1479-their dressing - rooms , most completely and handsomely fitted up ; everything that money and taste could do , to give comfort and elegance to [apartments]1480-apartments , had been bestowed on these ; and , being furnished within the last five years , [they]1478-three large bed - chambers were perfect in all that would be generally pleasing , and wanting in all that could give pleasure to [Catherine]77-catherine . As [they]1465-they were surveying the last , [the general]783-the general , after slightly naming a few of [the distinguished characters by whom they had at times been honoured]1482-the distinguished characters by whom they had at times been honoured , turned with a smiling countenance to [Catherine]77-catherine , and ventured to hope that henceforward [some of [[their]1465-they earliest tenants]1484-their earliest tenants]1483-some of their earliest tenants might be " [[our]1465-they friends from [Fullerton]3-fullerton]3133-our friends from fullerton . "[1485-a man so kindly disposed towards herself , and so full of civility to all her family] [She]77-catherine felt the unexpected compliment , and deeply regretted the impossibility of thinking well of [a man so kindly disposed towards [herself]77-catherine , and so full of civility to [all [her]77-catherine family]1486-all her family]1485-a man so kindly disposed towards herself , and so full of civility to all her family .

[The gallery]1320-the gallery was terminated by folding doors , which [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , advancing , had thrown open , and passed through , and seemed on the point of doing the same by the first door to the left , in another long reach of [gallery]1488-gallery , when [the general]783-the general , coming forwards , called [her]77-catherine hastily , and , as [Catherine]77-catherine thought , rather angrily back , demanding whether [she]77-catherine were going ? And what was there more to be seen ? Had not [Miss Morland]90-miss morland already seen all that could be worth [her]95-miss tilney notice ? And did [she]95-miss tilney not suppose [[her]95-miss tilney friend]313-her friend might be glad of some refreshment after so much exercise ? [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney drew back directly , and the heavy doors were closed upon [the mortified Catherine]77-catherine , who , having seen , in a momentary glance beyond [them]1491-them , a narrower passage , more numerous openings , and symptoms of a winding staircase , believed [herself]77-catherine at last within the reach of something worth [her]77-catherine notice ; and felt , as [she]77-catherine unwillingly paced back [the gallery]1320-the gallery , that [she]77-catherine would rather be allowed to examine that end of [the house]216-the house than see all the finery of all the rest . [The general]783-the general s evident desire of preventing such an examination was an additional stimulant . Something was certainly to be concealed ; [her]77-catherine fancy , though it had trespassed lately once or twice , could not mislead [her]77-catherine here ; and what that something was , a short sentence of [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney s , as [they]1495-they followed [the general]783-the general at some distance [downstairs]681-downstairs , seemed to point out : " [I]95-miss tilney was going to take [you]77-catherine into what was [[[my]95-miss tilney mother]2453-my mother s room [the room in which [she]2453-my mother died]3136-the room in which she died]3135-my mother s room the room in which she died "[95-miss tilney] were all [her]95-miss tilney words ; but few as they were , they conveyed pages of intelligence to [Catherine]77-catherine . It was no wonder that [the general]783-the general should shrink from the sight of such objects as [that room]1499-that room must contain ; [a room in all probability never entered by [him]783-the general since the dreadful scene]1500-a room in all probability never entered by him since the dreadful scene had passed , which released [[his]783-the general suffering wife]1501-his suffering wife , and left [him]783-the general to the stings of conscience .

[She]77-catherine ventured , when next alone with [Eleanor]145-eleanor , to express [her]77-catherine wish of being permitted to see it , as well as all the rest of [that side of [the house]216-the house]1502-that side of the house ; and [Eleanor]145-eleanor promised to attend [her]77-catherine [there]336-there , whenever [they]1505-they should have a convenient hour . [Catherine]77-catherine understood [her]77-catherine : [the general]783-the general must be watched from [home]2339-home , before [that room]1499-that room could be entered . " It remains as it was , [I]77-catherine suppose ? "[77-catherine] said [she]77-catherine , in a tone of feeling .

" Yes , entirely . "[77-catherine]

" And how long ago may it be that [[your]77-catherine mother]3137-your mother died ? "[77-catherine]

" [She]3137-your mother has been dead these nine years . "[77-catherine] And nine years , [Catherine]77-catherine knew , was a trifle of time , compared with what generally elapsed after the death of [an injured wife]1509-an injured wife , before [[her]1509-an injured wife room]1313-her room was put to rights .

" [You]77-catherine were with [her]3137-your mother , [I]77-catherine suppose , to the last ? "[77-catherine]

" No , "[95-miss tilney] said [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , sighing ; " [I]95-miss tilney was unfortunately from [home]2339-home . [Her]3137-your mother illness was sudden and short ; and , before [I]95-miss tilney arrived it was all over . "[95-miss tilney]

[Catherine]77-catherine s blood ran cold with the horrid suggestions which naturally sprang from these words . Could it be possible ? Could [[Henry]98-henry s father]1066-henry s father ? And yet how many were the examples to justify even the blackest suspicions ! And , when [she]77-catherine saw [him]1066-henry s father in the evening , while [she]77-catherine worked with [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend , slowly pacing [the drawing - room]448-the drawing - room for an hour together in silent thoughtfulness , with downcast eyes and contracted brow , [she]77-catherine felt secure from all possibility of wronging [him]1066-henry s father . It was the air and attitude of [a Montoni]167-a montoni ! What could more plainly speak the gloomy workings of a mind not wholly dead to every sense of humanity , in its fearful review of past scenes of guilt ? [Unhappy man]1514-unhappy man ! And the anxiousness of [her]77-catherine spirits directed [her]77-catherine eyes towards [his]1066-henry s father figure so repeatedly , as to catch [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney s notice . " [[My]77-catherine father]2473-my father , "[77-catherine] [she]77-catherine whispered , " often walks about [the room]308-the room in this way ; it is nothing unusual . "[77-catherine]

" So much the worse ! "[77-catherine] thought [Catherine]77-catherine ; such ill - timed exercise was of a piece with the strange unseasonableness of [his]1066-henry s father morning walks , and boded nothing good .

After an evening , the little variety and seeming length of which made [her]77-catherine peculiarly sensible of [Henry]98-henry s importance among [them]1515-them , [she]77-catherine was heartily glad to be dismissed ; though it was a look from [the general]783-the general not designed for [her]77-catherine observation which sent [[his]783-the general daughter]2444-his daughter to the bell . When [the butler]1518-the butler would have lit [his]1518-the butler master s candle , however , [he]1518-the butler was forbidden . [The latter]562-the latter was not going to retire . " [I]1066-henry s father have many pamphlets to finish , "[1066-henry s father] said [he]1066-henry s father to [Catherine]77-catherine , " before [I]1066-henry s father can close [my]1066-henry s father eyes , and perhaps may be poring over the affairs of [the nation]977-the nation for hours after [you]77-catherine are asleep . Can [either of [us]3143-us]3142-either of us be more meetly employed ? _ [My]1066-henry s father _ eyes will be blinding for the good of [others]705-others , and _ [yours]77-catherine _ preparing by rest for future mischief . "[1066-henry s father]

But neither the business alleged , nor the magnificent compliment , could win [Catherine]77-catherine from thinking that some very different object must occasion so serious a delay of proper repose . To be kept up for hours , after [the family]457-the family were in bed , by stupid pamphlets was not very likely . There must be some deeper cause : something was to be done which could be done only while [the household]1521-the household slept ; and the probability that [Mrs. Tilney]133-mrs. tilney yet lived , shut up for causes unknown , and receiving from the pitiless hands of [[her]133-mrs. tilney husband]793-her husband a nightly supply of coarse food , was the conclusion which necessarily followed . Shocking as was the idea , it was at least better than a death unfairly hastened , as , in the natural course of things , [she]133-mrs. tilney must ere long be released . The suddenness of [her]133-mrs. tilney reputed illness , the absence of [[her]133-mrs. tilney daughter]272-her daughter , and probably of [[her]133-mrs. tilney other children]1524-her other children , at the time all favoured the supposition of [her]133-mrs. tilney imprisonment . Its origin jealousy perhaps , or wanton cruelty was yet to be unravelled .

In revolving these matters , while [she]77-catherine undressed , it suddenly struck [her]77-catherine as not unlikely that [she]77-catherine might that morning have passed near the very spot of [this unfortunate woman]1525-this unfortunate woman s confinement might have been within a few paces of [the cell in which [she]77-catherine languished out [her]77-catherine days]1526-the cell in which she languished out her days ; for what part of [the abbey]3021-the abbey could be more fitted for the purpose than that which yet bore the traces of monastic division ? In [the high - arched passage]1528-the high - arched passage , paved with stone , which already [she]77-catherine had trodden with peculiar awe , [she]77-catherine well remembered the doors of which [the general]783-the general had given no account . To what might not those doors lead ? In support of the plausibility of this conjecture , it further occurred to [her]77-catherine that [the forbidden gallery , in which lay [the apartments of [the unfortunate Mrs. Tilney]133-mrs. tilney]1531-the apartments of the unfortunate mrs. tilney]1530-the forbidden gallery , in which lay the apartments of the unfortunate mrs. tilney , must be , as certainly as [her]77-catherine memory could guide [her]77-catherine , exactly over [this suspected range of cells]1532-this suspected range of cells , and the staircase by the side of [those apartments of which [she]77-catherine had caught a transient glimpse , communicating by some secret means with [those cells]1534-those cells]1533-those apartments of which she had caught a transient glimpse , communicating by some secret means with those cells , might well have favoured the barbarous proceedings of [[her]77-catherine husband]793-her husband . Down that staircase [she]77-catherine had perhaps been conveyed in a state of well - prepared insensibility !

[Catherine]77-catherine sometimes started at the boldness of [her]77-catherine own surmises , and sometimes hoped or feared that [she]77-catherine had gone too far ; but they were supported by such appearances as made [their]1536-their dismissal impossible .

The side of [the quadrangle]1359-the quadrangle , in which [she]77-catherine supposed the guilty scene to be acting , being , according to [her]77-catherine belief , just opposite [her]77-catherine own , it struck [her]77-catherine that , if judiciously watched , some rays of light from [the general]783-the general s lamp might glimmer through the lower windows , as [he]783-the general passed to [the prison of [[his]783-the general wife]345-his wife]1539-the prison of his wife ; and , twice before [she]77-catherine stepped into bed , [she]77-catherine stole gently from [[her]77-catherine room]1313-her room to the corresponding window in [the gallery]1320-the gallery , to see if it appeared ; but all abroad was dark , and it must yet be too early . The various ascending noises convinced [her]77-catherine that [the servants]1543-the servants must still be up . Till midnight , [she]77-catherine supposed it would be in vain to watch ; but then , when the clock had struck twelve , and all was quiet , [she]77-catherine would , if not quite appalled by darkness , steal out and look once more . The clock struck twelve and [Catherine]77-catherine had been half an hour asleep .

CHAPTER 24

The next day afforded no opportunity for the proposed examination of [the mysterious apartments]1544-the mysterious apartments . It was Sunday , and the whole time between morning and afternoon service was required by [the general]783-the general in exercise abroad or eating cold meat at [home]2339-home ; and great as was [Catherine]77-catherine s curiosity , [her]77-catherine courage was not equal to a wish of exploring [them]1544-the mysterious apartments after dinner , either by the fading light of the sky between six and seven o clock , or by the yet more partial though stronger illumination of a treacherous lamp . The day was unmarked therefore by anything to interest [her]77-catherine imagination beyond the sight of a very elegant monument to the memory of [Mrs. Tilney]133-mrs. tilney , which immediately fronted the family pew . By that [her]77-catherine eye was instantly caught and long retained ; and the perusal of the highly strained epitaph , in which every virtue was ascribed to [her]77-catherine by [the inconsolable husband , who must have been in some way or other [her]77-catherine destroyer]1547-the inconsolable husband , who must have been in some way or other her destroyer , affected [her]77-catherine even to tears .

That [the general]783-the general , having erected such a monument , should be able to face it , was not perhaps very strange , and yet that [he]783-the general could sit so boldly collected within [its]783-the general view , maintain so elevated an air , look so fearlessly around , nay , that [he]783-the general should even enter [the church]2801-the church , seemed wonderful to [Catherine]77-catherine . Not , however , that many instances of [beings equally hardened in guilt]1550-beings equally hardened in guilt might not be produced . [She]77-catherine could remember dozens who had persevered in every possible vice , going on from crime to crime , murdering whomsoever [they]1551-they chose , without any feeling of humanity or remorse ; till a violent death or a religious retirement closed [their]1551-they black career . The erection of the monument itself could not in the smallest degree affect [her]77-catherine doubts of [Mrs. Tilney]133-mrs. tilney s actual decease . Were [she]77-catherine even to descend into [the family vault where [her]77-catherine ashes were supposed to slumber]1552-the family vault where her ashes were supposed to slumber , were [she]77-catherine to behold the coffin in which [they]1553-they were said to be enclosed what could it avail in such a case ? [Catherine]77-catherine had read too much not to be perfectly aware of the ease with which [a waxen figure]1554-a waxen figure might be introduced , and a supposititious funeral carried on .

The succeeding morning promised something better . [The general]783-the general s early walk , ill - timed as it was in every other view , was favourable [here]2128-here ; and when [she]77-catherine knew [him]783-the general to be out of [the house]216-the house , [she]77-catherine directly proposed to [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney the accomplishment of [her]77-catherine promise . [Eleanor]145-eleanor was ready to oblige [her]77-catherine ; and [Catherine]77-catherine reminding [her]77-catherine as [they]1558-they went of another promise , [their]1558-they first visit in consequence was to the portrait in [[her]77-catherine bed - chamber]1559-her bed - chamber . It represented [a very lovely woman , with a mild and pensive countenance]1560-a very lovely woman , with a mild and pensive countenance , justifying , so far , the expectations of [its new observer]1561-its new observer ; but they were not in every respect answered , for [Catherine]77-catherine had depended upon meeting with features , hair , complexion , that should be the very counterpart , the very image , if not of [Henry]98-henry s , of [Eleanor]145-eleanor s the only portraits of which [she]77-catherine had been in the habit of thinking , bearing always an equal resemblance of [mother]189-mother and [child]1563-child . A face once taken was taken for generations . But here [she]77-catherine was obliged to look and consider and study for a likeness . [She]77-catherine contemplated it , however , in spite of this drawback , with much emotion , and , but for a yet stronger interest , would have left it unwillingly .

[Her]77-catherine agitation as [they]1558-they entered [the great gallery]1564-the great gallery was too much for any endeavour at discourse ; [she]77-catherine could only look at [[her]77-catherine companion]687-her companion . [Eleanor]145-eleanor s countenance was dejected , yet sedate ; and its composure spoke [her]77-catherine inured to all the gloomy objects to which [they]1558-they were advancing . Again [she]77-catherine passed through the folding doors , again [her]77-catherine hand was upon the important lock , and [Catherine]77-catherine , hardly able to breathe , was turning to close the former with fearful caution , when the figure , [the dreaded figure of [the general]783-the general [himself]783-the general at the further end of [the gallery]1320-the gallery]1566-the dreaded figure of the general himself at the further end of the gallery , stood before [her]77-catherine ! The name of " [Eleanor]145-eleanor "[783-the general] at the same moment , in [his]783-the general loudest tone , resounded through [the building]1237-the building , giving to [[his]783-the general daughter]2444-his daughter the first intimation of [his]783-the general presence , and to [Catherine]77-catherine terror upon terror . An attempt at concealment had been [her]77-catherine first instinctive movement on perceiving [him]783-the general , yet [she]77-catherine could scarcely hope to have escaped [his]783-the general eye ; and when [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend , who with an apologizing look darted hastily by [her]77-catherine , had joined and disappeared with [him]783-the general , [she]77-catherine ran for safety to [[her]77-catherine own room]1572-her own room , and , locking [herself]77-catherine in , believed that [she]77-catherine should never have courage to go down again . [She]77-catherine remained [there]336-there at least an hour , in the greatest agitation , deeply commiserating the state of [[her]77-catherine poor friend]1574-her poor friend , and expecting a summons [herself]77-catherine from [the angry general]1575-the angry general to attend [him]783-the general in [[his]783-the general own apartment]1576-his own apartment . No summons , however , arrived ; and at last , on seeing [a carriage]672-a carriage drive up to [the abbey]3021-the abbey , [she]77-catherine was emboldened to descend and meet [him]1575-the angry general under the protection of [visitors]1579-visitors . [The breakfast - room]1338-the breakfast - room was gay with [company]2830-company ; and [she]77-catherine was named to [them]2830-company by [the general]783-the general as [the friend of [[his]783-the general daughter]2444-his daughter]1583-the friend of his daughter , in a complimentary style , which so well concealed [his]783-the general resentful ire , as to make [her]77-catherine feel secure at least of life for the present . And [Eleanor]145-eleanor , with a command of countenance which did honour to [her]145-eleanor concern for [his]1575-the angry general character , taking an early occasion of saying to [her]145-eleanor , " [[My]145-eleanor father]2473-my father only wanted [me]145-eleanor to answer a note , "[145-eleanor] [she]145-eleanor began to hope that [she]145-eleanor had either been unseen by [the general]783-the general , or that from some consideration of policy [she]145-eleanor should be allowed to suppose [herself]145-eleanor so . Upon this trust [she]145-eleanor dared still to remain in [his]1575-the angry general presence , after [the company]346-the company left [them]1587-them , and nothing occurred to disturb it .

In the course of this morning s reflections , [she]145-eleanor came to a resolution of making [her]145-eleanor next attempt on the forbidden door alone . It would be much better in every respect that [Eleanor]145-eleanor should know nothing of the matter . To involve [her]145-eleanor in the danger of a second detection , to court [her]145-eleanor into [an apartment which must wring [her]145-eleanor heart]1588-an apartment which must wring her heart , could not be [the office of [a friend]449-a friend]1589-the office of a friend . [The general]783-the general s utmost anger could not be to [herself]783-the general what it might be to [a daughter]1592-a daughter ; and , besides , [she]783-the general thought the examination itself would be more satisfactory if made without [any companion]1230-any companion . It would be impossible to explain to [Eleanor]1594-eleanor the suspicions , from which the other had , in all likelihood , been hitherto happily exempt ; nor could [she]145-eleanor therefore , in _ [her]1594-eleanor _ presence , search for those proofs of [the general]783-the general s cruelty , which however they might yet have escaped discovery , [she]145-eleanor felt confident of somewhere drawing forth , in the shape of some fragmented journal , continued to the last gasp . Of the way to [the apartment]921-the apartment [she]145-eleanor was now perfectly mistress ; and as [she]145-eleanor wished to get it over before [Henry]98-henry s return , who was expected on the morrow , there was no time to be lost . The day was bright , [her]145-eleanor courage high ; at four o clock , the sun was now two hours above the horizon , and it would be only [her]145-eleanor retiring to dress half an hour earlier than usual .

It was done ; and [Catherine]77-catherine found [herself]77-catherine alone in [the gallery]1320-the gallery before the clocks had ceased to strike . It was no time for thought ; [she]77-catherine hurried on , slipped with the least possible noise through the folding doors , and without stopping to look or breathe , rushed forward to the one in question . The lock yielded to [her]77-catherine hand , and , luckily , with no sullen sound that could alarm [a human being]1598-a human being . On tiptoe [she]77-catherine entered ; [the room]308-the room was before [her]77-catherine ; but it was some minutes before [she]77-catherine could advance another step . [She]77-catherine beheld what fixed [her]77-catherine to the spot and agitated every feature . [She]77-catherine saw [a large , well - proportioned apartment]1600-a large , well - proportioned apartment , an handsome dimity bed , arranged as unoccupied with [an housemaid]1601-an housemaid s care , a bright Bath stove , mahogany wardrobes , and neatly painted chairs , on which the warm beams of a western sun gaily poured through two sash windows ! [Catherine]77-catherine had expected to have [her]77-catherine feelings worked , and worked they were . Astonishment and doubt first seized them ; and a shortly succeeding ray of common sense added some bitter emotions of shame . [She]77-catherine could not be mistaken as to [the room]308-the room ; but how grossly mistaken in everything else ! in [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney s meaning , in [her]77-catherine own calculation ! [This apartment , to which [she]77-catherine had given a date so ancient]1603-this apartment , to which she had given a date so ancient , a position so awful , proved to be one end of what [[the general]783-the general s father]1456-the general s father had built . There were two other doors in [the chamber]1606-the chamber , leading probably into [dressing - closets]1607-dressing - closets ; but [she]77-catherine had no inclination to open either . Would the veil in which [Mrs. Tilney]133-mrs. tilney had last walked , or the volume in which [she]77-catherine had last read , remain to tell what nothing else was allowed to whisper ? No : whatever might have been [the general]783-the general s crimes , [he]783-the general had certainly too much wit to let [them]1609-them sue for detection . [She]77-catherine was sick of exploring , and desired but to be safe in [[her]77-catherine own room]1572-her own room , with [her]77-catherine own heart only privy to its folly ; and [she]77-catherine was on the point of retreating as softly as [she]77-catherine had entered , when the sound of footsteps , [she]77-catherine could hardly tell where , made [her]77-catherine pause and tremble . To be found [there]336-there , even by [a servant]674-a servant , would be unpleasant ; but by [the general]783-the general ( and [he]783-the general seemed always at hand when least wanted ) , much worse ! [She]77-catherine listened the sound had ceased ; and resolving not to lose a moment , [she]77-catherine passed through and closed the door . At that instant a door underneath was hastily opened ; [someone]1614-someone seemed with swift steps to ascend the stairs , by the head of which [she]77-catherine had yet to pass before [she]77-catherine could gain [the gallery]1320-the gallery . [She]77-catherine had no power to move . With a feeling of terror not very definable , [she]77-catherine fixed [her]77-catherine eyes on the staircase , and in a few moments it gave [Henry]98-henry to [her]77-catherine view . " [Mr. Tilney]98-henry ! "[77-catherine] [she]77-catherine exclaimed in a voice of more than common astonishment . [He]98-henry looked astonished too . " [Good God]132-god ! "[98-henry]

[Catherine]77-catherine recollected [herself]77-catherine , blushed deeply , and could say no more . [He]98-henry seemed to be looking in [her]77-catherine countenance for that explanation which [her]77-catherine lips did not afford . [She]77-catherine moved on towards [the gallery]1320-the gallery . [They]1618-i walked slowly up [the gallery]1320-the gallery . " Have [you]1617-you had any letter from [Bath]5-bath since [I]1618-i saw [you]1617-you ? "[1618-i]

[The world]197-the world , [I]1620-i believe , never saw [a better woman]3177-a better woman . But it is not often that virtue can boast an interest such as this . "[1622-she] [She]1622-she raised [her]1622-she eyes towards [him]1621-i more fully than [she]1622-she had ever done before . " [[My]1621-i mother]2453-my mother s illness , "[1621-i] [he]1621-i continued , " the seizure which ended in [her]145-eleanor death , _ was _ sudden . The malady itself , one from which [she]145-eleanor had often suffered , a bilious fever its cause therefore constitutional . On the third day , in short , as soon as [she]145-eleanor could be prevailed on , [a physician]3182-a physician attended [her]145-eleanor , [a very respectable man]192-a very respectable man , and one in whom [she]145-eleanor had always placed great confidence . Upon [his]3182-a physician opinion of [her]145-eleanor danger , [two others]3184-two others were called in the next day , and remained in almost constant attendance for four and twenty hours . On the fifth day [she]145-eleanor died . During the progress of [her]145-eleanor disorder , [Frederick]78-captain tilney and [I]1621-i ( _ [we]3185-we _ were both at [home]2339-home ) saw [her]145-eleanor repeatedly ; and from [our]3185-we own observation can bear witness to [her]145-eleanor having received every possible attention which could spring from the affection of those about [her]145-eleanor , or which [her]145-eleanor situation in life could command . [Poor Eleanor]168-poor eleanor was absent , and at such a distance as to return only to see [[her]145-eleanor mother]194-her mother in [her]145-eleanor coffin . "[1621-i]

" But [[your]77-catherine father]2636-your father , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , " was _ [he]2636-your father _ afflicted ? "[77-catherine]

" For a time , greatly so . [You]77-catherine have erred in supposing [him]2636-your father not attached to [her]145-eleanor . [He]2636-your father loved [her]145-eleanor , [I]1621-i am persuaded , as well as it was possible for [him]2636-your father to [we]3185-we have not all , [you]77-catherine know , the same tenderness of disposition and [I]1621-i will not pretend to say that while [she]145-eleanor lived , [she]145-eleanor might not often have had much to bear , but though [his]2636-your father temper injured [her]145-eleanor , [his]2636-your father judgment never did . [His]2636-your father value of [her]145-eleanor was sincere ; and , if not permanently , [he]2636-your father was truly afflicted by [her]145-eleanor death . "[1621-i]

" [I]77-catherine am very glad of it , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine ; " it would have been very shocking ! "[77-catherine]

" If [I]1621-i understand [you]77-catherine rightly , [you]77-catherine had formed a surmise of such horror as [I]1621-i have hardly words to [Dear Miss Morland]90-miss morland , consider the dreadful nature of the suspicions [you]77-catherine have entertained . What have [you]77-catherine been judging from ? Remember [the country]224-the country and the age in which [we]3190-we live . Remember that [we]3190-we are English , that [we]3190-we are [Christians]3191-christians . Consult [your]77-catherine own understanding , [your]77-catherine own sense of the probable , [your]77-catherine own observation of what is passing around [you]77-catherine . Does [our]3190-we education prepare [us]3190-we for such atrocities ? Do [our]3190-we laws connive at [them]3192-them ? Could they be perpetrated without being known , in [a country]2542-a country like this , where social and literary intercourse is on such a footing , where [every man]3194-every man is surrounded by [a neighbourhood of voluntary spies]3195-a neighbourhood of voluntary spies , and where [roads and newspapers lay everything open]3196-roads and newspapers lay everything open ? [Dearest Miss Morland]90-miss morland , what ideas have [you]90-miss morland been admitting ? "[1621-i]

[They]1623-they had reached the end of [the gallery]1320-the gallery , and with tears of shame [she]1625-she ran off to [[her]1625-she own room]1572-her own room .

CHAPTER 25

The visions of romance were over . [Catherine]77-catherine was completely awakened . [Henry]98-henry s address , short as it had been , had more thoroughly opened [her]77-catherine eyes to the extravagance of [her]77-catherine late fancies than all [their]1623-they several disappointments had done . Most grievously was [she]77-catherine humbled . Most bitterly did [she]77-catherine cry . It was not only with [herself]77-catherine that [she]77-catherine was sunk but with [Henry]98-henry . [Her]77-catherine folly , which now seemed even criminal , was all exposed to [him]98-henry , and [he]98-henry must despise [her]77-catherine forever . The liberty which [her]77-catherine imagination had dared to take with the character of [[his]98-henry father]859-his father could [he]98-henry ever forgive it ? The absurdity of [her]77-catherine curiosity and [her]77-catherine fears could they ever be forgotten ? [She]77-catherine hated [herself]77-catherine more than [she]77-catherine could express . [He]98-henry had [she]77-catherine thought [he]98-henry had , once or twice before this fatal morning , shown something like affection for [her]77-catherine . But now in short , [she]77-catherine made [herself]77-catherine as miserable as possible for about half an hour , went down when the clock struck five , with a broken heart , and could scarcely give an intelligible answer to [Eleanor]168-poor eleanor s inquiry if [she]77-catherine was well . [The formidable Henry]98-henry soon followed [her]77-catherine into [the room]308-the room , and the only difference in [his]98-henry behaviour to [her]77-catherine was that [he]98-henry paid [her]77-catherine rather more attention than usual . [Catherine]77-catherine had never wanted comfort more , and [he]98-henry looked as if [he]98-henry was aware of it .

The evening wore away with no abatement of this soothing politeness ; and [her]77-catherine spirits were gradually raised to a modest tranquillity . [She]77-catherine did not learn either to forget or defend the past ; but [she]77-catherine learned to hope that it would never transpire farther , and that it might not cost [her]77-catherine [Henry]98-henry s entire regard . [Her]77-catherine thoughts being still chiefly fixed on what [she]77-catherine had with such causeless terror felt and done , nothing could shortly be clearer than that it had been all a voluntary , self - created delusion , each trifling circumstance receiving importance from an imagination resolved on alarm , and everything forced to bend to one purpose by a mind which , before [she]77-catherine entered [the abbey]3021-the abbey , had been craving to be frightened . [She]77-catherine remembered with what feelings [she]77-catherine had prepared for a knowledge of [Northanger]63-northanger . [She]77-catherine saw that the infatuation had been created , the mischief settled , long before [her]77-catherine quitting [Bath]5-bath , and it seemed as if the whole might be traced to the influence of that sort of reading which [she]77-catherine had there indulged .

Charming as were all [Mrs. Radcliffe]125-mrs. radcliffe s works , and charming even as were the works of [all [her]77-catherine imitators]1630-all her imitators , it was not in [them]1630-all her imitators perhaps that human nature , at least in [the Midland counties of England]1631-the midland counties of england , was to be looked for . Of [the Alps]68-the alps and [Pyrenees]69-pyrenees , with [[their]1632-their pine forests]1633-their pine forests and their vices , [they]1632-their might give a faithful delineation ; and [Italy]54-italy , [Switzerland]70-switzerland , and [the south of [France]38-france]2575-the south of france might be as fruitful in horrors as they were [there represented]1635-there represented . [Catherine]77-catherine dared not doubt beyond [[her]77-catherine own country]1636-her own country , and even of that , if hard pressed , would have yielded [the northern and western extremities]1637-the northern and western extremities . But in [the central part of [England]2-england]1638-the central part of england there was surely some security for the existence even of [a wife not beloved]1639-a wife not beloved , in the laws of [the land]1640-the land , and the manners of the age . Murder was not tolerated , [servants]1641-servants were not [slaves]1642-slaves , and neither poison nor sleeping potions to be procured , like rhubarb , from [every druggist]1643-every druggist . Among [the Alps and Pyrenees]1644-the alps and pyrenees , perhaps , there were [no mixed characters]1645-no mixed characters . There , [such as were not as spotless as an angel]1646-such as were not as spotless as an angel might have the dispositions of [a fiend]1647-a fiend . But in [England]2-england it was not so ; among [the English]1648-the english , [she]77-catherine believed , in [their]1648-the english hearts and habits , there was a general though unequal mixture of good and bad . Upon this conviction , [she]77-catherine would not be surprised if even in [Henry]98-henry and [Eleanor Tilney]145-eleanor , some slight imperfection might hereafter appear ; and upon this conviction [she]77-catherine need not fear to acknowledge some actual specks in the character of [[their]1649-their father]1064-their father , who , though cleared from the grossly injurious suspicions which [she]77-catherine must ever blush to have entertained , [she]77-catherine did believe , upon serious consideration , to be not perfectly amiable .

[Her]77-catherine mind made up on these several points , and [her]77-catherine resolution formed , of always judging and acting in future with the greatest good sense , [she]77-catherine had nothing to do but to forgive [herself]77-catherine and be happier than ever ; and the lenient hand of time did much for [her]77-catherine by insensible gradations in the course of another day . [Henry]98-henry s astonishing generosity and nobleness of conduct , in never alluding in the slightest way to what had passed , was of the greatest assistance to [her]77-catherine ; and sooner than [she]77-catherine could have supposed it possible in the beginning of [her]77-catherine distress , [her]77-catherine spirits became absolutely comfortable , and capable , as heretofore , of continual improvement by anything [he]98-henry said . There were still some subjects , indeed , under which [she]77-catherine believed [they]1651-they must always tremble the mention of a chest or a cabinet , for instance and [she]77-catherine did not love the sight of japan in any shape : but even _ [she]77-catherine _ could allow that an occasional memento of past folly , however painful , might not be without use .

The anxieties of common life began soon to succeed to the alarms of romance . [Her]77-catherine desire of hearing from [Isabella]106-isabella grew every day greater . [She]77-catherine was quite impatient to know how the Bath world went on , and how [the rooms]2123-the rooms were attended ; and especially was [she]77-catherine anxious to be assured of [Isabella]106-isabella s having matched some fine netting - cotton , on which [she]106-isabella had left [her]106-isabella intent ; and of [her]106-isabella continuing on the best terms with [James]108-james . [Her]77-catherine only dependence for information of any kind was on [Isabella]106-isabella . [James]108-james had protested against writing to [her]77-catherine till [his]108-james return to [Oxford]10-oxford ; and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen had given [her]77-catherine no hopes of a letter till [she]77-catherine had got back to [Fullerton]3-fullerton . But [Isabella]106-isabella had promised and promised again ; and when [she]106-isabella promised a thing , [she]106-isabella was so scrupulous in performing it ! This made it so particularly strange !

For nine successive mornings , [Catherine]77-catherine wondered over the repetition of a disappointment , which each morning became more severe : but , on the tenth , when [she]77-catherine entered [the breakfast - room]1338-the breakfast - room , [her]77-catherine first object was a letter , held out by [Henry]98-henry s willing hand . [She]77-catherine thanked [him]98-henry as heartily as if [he]98-henry had written it [himself]98-henry . " Tis only from [James]108-james , however , "[77-catherine] as [she]77-catherine looked at the direction . [She]77-catherine opened it ; it was from [Oxford]10-oxford ; and to this purpose :

" [Dear Catherine]170-dear catherine , "[77-catherine] Though , God knows , with little inclination for writing , [I]0-i think it [my]0-i duty to tell [you]77-catherine that everything is at an end between [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe and [me]0-i . [I]0-i left [her]101-miss thorpe and Bath yesterday , never to see either again . [I]0-i shall not enter into particulars [they]1654-they would only pain [you]77-catherine more . [You]77-catherine will soon hear enough from another quarter to know where lies the blame ; and [I]0-i hope will acquit [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother of everything but the folly of too easily thinking [his]2331-your brother affection returned . Thank [God]132-god ! [I]0-i am undeceived in time ! But it is a heavy blow ! After [[my]0-i father]2473-my father s consent had been so kindly given but no more of this . [She]101-miss thorpe has made [me]0-i miserable forever ! Let [me]0-i soon hear from [you]77-catherine , dear [Catherine]170-dear catherine ; [you]77-catherine are [[my]0-i only friend]1657-my only friend ; _ [your]77-catherine _ love [I]0-i do build upon . [I]0-i wish [your]77-catherine visit at [Northanger]63-northanger may be over before [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney makes [his]78-captain tilney engagement known , or [you]77-catherine will be uncomfortably circumstanced . [Poor Thorpe]171-poor thorpe is in [town]2641-town : [I]0-i dread the sight of [him]171-poor thorpe ; [his]171-poor thorpe honest heart would feel so much . [I]0-i have written to [him]171-poor thorpe and [[my]0-i father]2473-my father . [Her]1660-her duplicity hurts [me]0-i more than all ; till the very last , if [I]0-i reasoned with [her]1660-her , [she]1660-her declared [herself]1660-her as much attached to [me]0-i as ever , and laughed at [my]0-i fears . [I]0-i am ashamed to think how long [I]0-i bore with it ; but if ever [man]752-man had reason to believe [himself]752-man loved , [I]0-i was [that man]1662-that man . [I]0-i can not understand even now what [she]1660-her would be at , for there could be no need of [my]0-i being played off to make [her]1660-her secure of [Tilney]78-captain tilney . [We]1663-we parted at last by mutual consent happy for [me]0-i had [we]1663-we never met ! [I]0-i can never expect to know [such another woman]1664-such another woman ! [Dearest Catherine]77-catherine , beware how [you]77-catherine give [your]77-catherine heart .

" Believe [me]77-catherine , "[77-catherine] & c.

[Catherine]77-catherine had not read three lines before [her]77-catherine sudden change of countenance , and short exclamations of sorrowing wonder , declared [her]77-catherine to be receiving unpleasant news ; and [Henry]98-henry , earnestly watching [her]77-catherine through the whole letter , saw plainly that it ended no better than it began . [He]98-henry was prevented , however , from even looking [his]98-henry surprise by [[his]98-henry father]859-his father s entrance . [They]1663-we went to breakfast directly ; but [Catherine]77-catherine could hardly eat anything . Tears filled [her]77-catherine eyes , and even ran down [her]77-catherine cheeks as [she]77-catherine sat . The letter was one moment in [her]77-catherine hand , then in [her]77-catherine lap , and then in [her]77-catherine pocket ; and [she]77-catherine looked as if [she]77-catherine knew not what [she]77-catherine did . [The general]783-the general , between [his]783-the general cocoa and [his]783-the general newspaper , had luckily no leisure for noticing [her]77-catherine ; but to [the other two]567-the other two [her]77-catherine distress was equally visible . As soon as [she]77-catherine dared leave the table [she]77-catherine hurried away to [[her]77-catherine own room]1572-her own room ; but [the housemaids]1669-the housemaids were busy in [it]1572-her own room , and [she]77-catherine was obliged to come down again . [She]77-catherine turned into [the drawing - room]448-the drawing - room for privacy , but [Henry]98-henry and [Eleanor]145-eleanor had likewise retreated thither , and were at that moment deep in consultation about [her]77-catherine . [She]77-catherine drew back , trying to beg [their]567-the other two pardon , but was , with gentle violence , forced to return ; and [the others]2220-the others withdrew , after [Eleanor]145-eleanor had affectionately expressed a wish of being of use or comfort to [her]77-catherine .

After half an hour s free indulgence of grief and reflection , [Catherine]77-catherine felt equal to encountering [[her]77-catherine friends]792-her friends ; but whether [she]77-catherine should make [her]77-catherine distress known to [them]567-the other two was another consideration . Perhaps , if particularly questioned , [she]77-catherine might just give an idea just distantly hint at it but not more . " That is the most unpromising circumstance , the strongest presumption against [him]78-captain tilney . " [You]98-henry think it is all for ambition , then ? And , upon [my]338-each other word , there are some things that seem very like it . " [[Your]98-henry brother]2331-your brother is certainly very much to be pitied at present ; but [we]3245-we must not , in [our]3245-we concern for [his]2331-your brother sufferings , undervalue [yours]98-henry . [You]98-henry feel , [I]98-henry suppose , that in losing [Isabella]106-isabella , [you]98-henry lose half [yourself]98-henry : [you]98-henry feel a void in [your]98-henry heart which nothing else can occupy . Society is becoming irksome ; and as for the amusements in which [you]98-henry were wo nt to share at [Bath]5-bath , the very idea of [them]3246-them without [her]106-isabella is abhorrent . [You]98-henry would not , for instance , now go to a ball for [the world]197-the world . "[77-catherine]

[Catherine]77-catherine , by some chance or other , found [her]77-catherine spirits so very much relieved by this conversation that [she]77-catherine could not regret [her]77-catherine being led on , though so unaccountably , to mention the circumstance which had produced it .

CHAPTER 26

From this time , the subject was frequently canvassed by [the three young people]1682-the three young people ; and [Catherine]77-catherine found , with some surprise , that [[her]77-catherine two young friends]1683-her two young friends were perfectly agreed in considering [Isabella]106-isabella s want of consequence and fortune as likely to throw great difficulties in the way of [her]106-isabella marrying [[their]1682-the three young people brother]1684-their brother . [Their]1682-the three young people persuasion that [the general]783-the general would , upon this ground alone , independent of the objection that might be raised against [her]106-isabella character , oppose the connection , turned [her]106-isabella feelings moreover with some alarm towards [herself]106-isabella . [She]106-isabella was as insignificant , and perhaps as portionless , as [Isabella]106-isabella ; and if [the heir of the Tilney property]1686-the heir of the tilney property had not grandeur and wealth enough in [himself]1686-the heir of the tilney property , at what point of interest were the demands of [[his]1686-the heir of the tilney property younger brother]1687-his younger brother to rest ? The very painful reflections to which this thought led could only be dispersed by a dependence on the effect of that particular partiality , which , as [she]106-isabella was given to understand by [his]783-the general words as well as [his]783-the general actions , [she]106-isabella had from the first been so fortunate as to excite in [the general]783-the general ; and by a recollection of some most generous and disinterested sentiments on the subject of money , which [she]106-isabella had more than once heard [him]783-the general utter , and which tempted [her]106-isabella to think [his]783-the general disposition in such matters misunderstood by [[his]783-the general children]1067-his children .

[They]1690-they were so fully convinced , however , that [[their]1690-they brother]1684-their brother would not have the courage to apply in person for [[his]1684-their brother father]859-his father s consent , and so repeatedly assured [her]106-isabella that [he]783-the general had never in [his]783-the general life been less likely to come to [Northanger]63-northanger than at the present time , that [she]106-isabella suffered [her]106-isabella mind to be at ease as to the necessity of any sudden removal of [her]106-isabella own . But as it was not to be supposed that [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney , whenever [he]78-captain tilney made [his]78-captain tilney application , would give [[his]78-captain tilney father]859-his father any just idea of [Isabella]106-isabella s conduct , it occurred to [her]106-isabella as highly expedient that [Henry]98-henry should lay the whole business before [him]98-henry as it really was , enabling [the general]783-the general by that means to form a cool and impartial opinion , and prepare [his]783-the general objections on a fairer ground than inequality of situations . [She]106-isabella proposed it to [him]783-the general accordingly ; but [he]783-the general did not catch at the measure so eagerly as [she]106-isabella had expected . " No , "[783-the general] said [he]783-the general , " [[my]783-the general father]2473-my father s hands need not be strengthened , and [Frederick]78-captain tilney s confession of folly need not be forestalled . [He]783-the general must tell [his]783-the general own story . "[783-the general]

" But [he]783-the general will tell only half of it . "[721-sister]

" A quarter would be enough . "[783-the general]

A day or two passed away and brought no tidings of [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney . [[His]783-the general brother]1075-his brother and [sister]721-sister knew not what to think . Sometimes it appeared to [them]1697-them as if [his]783-the general silence would be the natural result of the suspected engagement , and at others that it was wholly incompatible with it . [The general]783-the general , meanwhile , though offended every morning by [Frederick]78-captain tilney s remissness in writing , was free from any real anxiety about [him]783-the general , and had no more pressing solicitude than that of making [Miss Morland]90-miss morland s time at [Northanger]63-northanger pass pleasantly . [He]783-the general often expressed [his]783-the general uneasiness on this head , feared the sameness of [every day s society]1699-every day s society and employments would disgust [her]90-miss morland with [the place]2152-the place , wished [the Lady Frasers]174-the lady frasers had been in [the country]224-the country , talked every now and then of having a large party to dinner , and once or twice began even to calculate the number of [young dancing people]1702-young dancing people in [the neighbourhood]233-the neighbourhood . But then it was such a dead time of year , no wild - fowl , no game , and [the Lady Frasers]174-the lady frasers were not in [the country]224-the country . And it all ended , at last , in [his]783-the general telling [Henry]98-henry one morning that when [he]783-the general next went to [Woodston]65-woodston , [they]1705-they would take [him]783-the general by surprise there some day or other , and eat [their]1705-they mutton with [him]783-the general . [Henry]98-henry was greatly honoured and very happy , and [Catherine]77-catherine was quite delighted with the scheme . " And when do [you]783-the general think , [sir]2153-sir , [I]77-catherine may look forward to this pleasure ? [I]77-catherine must be at [Woodston]65-woodston on Monday to attend the parish meeting , and shall probably be obliged to stay two or three days . "[77-catherine]

" Well , well , [we]3253-we will take [our]3253-we chance some one of those days . There is no need to fix . [You]783-the general are not to put [yourself]783-the general at all out of [your]783-the general way . Whatever [you]783-the general may happen to have in [the house]216-the house will be enough . [I]77-catherine think [I]77-catherine can answer for [the young ladies]560-the young ladies making allowance for a bachelor s table . Let [me]77-catherine see ; Monday will be a busy day with [you]783-the general , [we]3253-we will not come on Monday ; and Tuesday will be a busy one with [me]77-catherine . [I]77-catherine expect [[my]77-catherine surveyor]3256-my surveyor from [Brockham]175-brockham with [his]3256-my surveyor report in the morning ; and afterwards [I]77-catherine can not in decency fail attending the club . [I]77-catherine really could not face [my]77-catherine acquaintance if [I]77-catherine stayed away now ; for , as [I]77-catherine am known to be in [the country]224-the country , it would be taken exceedingly amiss ; and it is a rule with [me]77-catherine , [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , never to give offence to [any of [[my]77-catherine neighbours]3259-my neighbours]3258-any of my neighbours , if a small sacrifice of time and attention can prevent it . [They]3259-my neighbours are [a set of very worthy men]3260-a set of very worthy men . [They]3259-my neighbours have half a buck from [Northanger]63-northanger twice a year ; and [I]77-catherine dine with [them]3259-my neighbours whenever [I]77-catherine can . Tuesday , therefore , [we]3261-we may say is out of the question . But on Wednesday , [I]77-catherine think , [Henry]98-henry , [you]98-henry may expect [us]3261-we ; and [we]3261-we shall be with [you]98-henry early , that [we]3261-we may have time to look about [us]3261-we . Two hours and three quarters will carry [us]3261-we to [Woodston]65-woodston , [I]77-catherine suppose ; [we]3261-we shall be in [the carriage]559-the carriage by ten ; so , about a quarter before one on Wednesday , [you]98-henry may look for [us]3261-we . "[77-catherine]

A ball itself could not have been more welcome to [Catherine]77-catherine than this little excursion , so strong was [her]77-catherine desire to be acquainted with [Woodston]65-woodston ; and [her]77-catherine heart was still bounding with joy when [Henry]98-henry , about an hour afterwards , came booted and greatcoated into [the room where [she]77-catherine and [Eleanor]145-eleanor were sitting]1706-the room where she and eleanor were sitting , and said , " [I]98-henry am come , [young ladies]268-young ladies , in a very moralizing strain , to observe that [our]3261-we pleasures in [this world]2645-this world are always to be paid for , and that [we]3261-we often purchase them at a great disadvantage , giving ready - monied actual happiness for a draft on the future , that may not be honoured . Witness [myself]98-henry , at this present hour . Because [I]98-henry am to hope for the satisfaction of seeing [you]77-catherine at [Woodston]65-woodston on Wednesday , which bad weather , or twenty other causes , may prevent , [I]98-henry must go away directly , two days before [I]98-henry intended it . "[98-henry]

" Go away ! "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , with a very long face . " And why ? "[77-catherine]

" Why ! How can [you]98-henry ask the question ? Because no time is to be lost in frightening [[my]98-henry old housekeeper]3265-my old housekeeper out of [her]3265-my old housekeeper wits , because [I]98-henry must go and prepare a dinner for [you]98-henry , to be sure . "[98-henry]

" Oh ! Not seriously ! "[77-catherine]

" Aye , and sadly too for [I]98-henry had much rather stay . "[98-henry]

" But how can [you]77-catherine think of such a thing , after what [the general]783-the general said ? When [he]783-the general so particularly desired [you]77-catherine not to give [yourself]77-catherine any trouble , because _ anything _ would do . "[77-catherine]

[Henry]98-henry only smiled . " [I]98-henry am sure it is quite unnecessary upon [[your]77-catherine sister]2195-your sister s account and [mine]98-henry . [You]77-catherine must know it to be so ; and [the general]783-the general made such a point of [your]77-catherine providing nothing extraordinary : besides , if [he]783-the general had not said half so much as [he]783-the general did , [he]783-the general has always such an excellent dinner at [home]2339-home , that sitting down to a middling one for one day could not signify . "[98-henry]

" [I]77-catherine wish [I]77-catherine could reason like [you]77-catherine , for [his]783-the general sake and [my]77-catherine own . Good - bye . As tomorrow is Sunday , [Eleanor]145-eleanor , [I]77-catherine shall not return . "[77-catherine]

[He]98-henry went ; and , it being at any time a much simpler operation to [Catherine]77-catherine to doubt [her]77-catherine own judgment than [Henry]98-henry s , [she]77-catherine was very soon obliged to give [him]98-henry credit for being right , however disagreeable to [her]77-catherine [his]98-henry going . But the inexplicability of [the general]783-the general s conduct dwelt much on [her]77-catherine thoughts . That [he]98-henry was very particular in [his]98-henry eating , [she]77-catherine had , by [her]77-catherine own unassisted observation , already discovered ; but why [he]98-henry should say one thing so positively , and mean another all the while , was most unaccountable ! How were [people]328-people , at that rate , to be understood ? Who but [Henry]98-henry could have been aware of what [[his]98-henry father]859-his father was at ?

From Saturday to Wednesday , however , [they]1710-they were now to be without [Henry]98-henry . This was the sad finale of every reflection : and [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney s letter would certainly come in [his]98-henry absence ; and Wednesday [she]77-catherine was very sure would be wet . The past , present , and future were all equally in gloom . [[Her]77-catherine brother]2221-her brother so unhappy , and [her]77-catherine loss in [Isabella]106-isabella so great ; and [Eleanor]145-eleanor s spirits always affected by [Henry]98-henry s absence ! What was there to interest or amuse [her]77-catherine ? [She]77-catherine was tired of [the woods]1712-the woods and [the shrubberies]3096-the shrubberies always so smooth and so dry ; and [the abbey]3021-the abbey in [itself]3021-the abbey was no more to [her]77-catherine now than [any other house]1715-any other house . The painful remembrance of the folly it had helped to nourish and perfect was the only emotion which could spring from a consideration of [the building]1237-the building . What a revolution in [her]77-catherine ideas ! [She]77-catherine , who had so longed to be in [an abbey]1121-an abbey ! Now , there was nothing so charming to [her]77-catherine imagination as the unpretending comfort of [a well - connected parsonage]1718-a well - connected parsonage , something like [Fullerton]3-fullerton , but better : [Fullerton]3-fullerton had its faults , but [Woodston]65-woodston probably had none . If [Wednesday]177-wednesday should ever come !

It did come , and exactly when it might be reasonably looked for . It came it was fine and [Catherine]1719-catherine trod on air . By ten o clock , the chaise and four conveyed [the trio]1720-the trio from [the abbey]3021-the abbey ; and , after an agreeable drive of almost twenty miles , [they]1720-the trio entered [Woodston]65-woodston , [a large and populous village]1722-a large and populous village , in [a situation not unpleasant]1723-a situation not unpleasant . [Catherine]77-catherine was ashamed to say how pretty [she]77-catherine thought it , as [the general]783-the general seemed to think an apology necessary for the flatness of [the country]224-the country , and the size of [the village]1726-the village ; but in [her]77-catherine heart [she]77-catherine preferred it to [any place [she]77-catherine had ever been at]1727-any place she had ever been at , and looked with great admiration at [every neat house above the rank of [a cottage]1729-a cottage]1728-every neat house above the rank of a cottage , and at all [the little chandler s shops which [they]1720-the trio passed]1730-the little chandler s shops which they passed . At [the further end of [the village]1726-the village]1731-the further end of the village , and tolerably disengaged from [the rest of [it]1726-the village]1733-the rest of it , stood [the parsonage]1734-the parsonage , [a new - built substantial stone house , with [its]1734-the parsonage semicircular sweep and green gates]1735-a new - built substantial stone house , with its semicircular sweep and green gates ; and , as [they]1720-the trio drove up to the door , [Henry]98-henry , with [the friends of [his]98-henry solitude]1736-the friends of his solitude , [a large Newfoundland puppy and two or three terriers]1737-a large newfoundland puppy and two or three terriers , was ready to receive and make much of them .

[Catherine]77-catherine s mind was too full , as [she]77-catherine entered [the house]216-the house , for [her]77-catherine either to observe or to say a great deal ; and , till called on by [the general]783-the general for [her]77-catherine opinion of [it]216-the house , [she]77-catherine had very little idea of [the room in which [she]77-catherine was sitting]1740-the room in which she was sitting . Upon looking round [it]1740-the room in which she was sitting then , [she]77-catherine perceived in a moment that [it]1740-the room in which she was sitting was [the most comfortable room in [the world]197-the world]1741-the most comfortable room in the world ; but [she]77-catherine was too guarded to say so , and the coldness of [her]77-catherine praise disappointed [him]783-the general .

" [We]3270-we are not calling it [a good house]3271-a good house , "[783-the general] said [he]783-the general . " [We]3270-we are not comparing it with [Fullerton]3-fullerton and [Northanger]63-northanger [we]3270-we are considering [it]1740-the room in which she was sitting as [a mere parsonage]3272-a mere parsonage , small and confined , [we]3270-we allow , but decent , perhaps , and habitable ; and altogether not inferior to the generality ; or , in other words , [I]783-the general believe there are few [country parsonages]3273-country parsonages in [England]2-england half so good . It may admit of improvement , however . Far be it from [me]783-the general to say otherwise ; and anything in reason a bow thrown out , perhaps though , between [ourselves]3270-we , if there is one thing more than another [my]783-the general aversion , it is a patched - on bow . "[783-the general]

[Catherine]77-catherine did not hear enough of this speech to understand or be pained by it ; and other subjects being studiously brought forward and supported by [Henry]98-henry , at the same time that a tray full of refreshments was introduced by [[his]783-the general servant]1743-his servant , [the general]783-the general was shortly restored to [his]783-the general complacency , and [Catherine]77-catherine to all [her]77-catherine usual ease of spirits .

[The room in question]1745-the room in question was of a commodious , well - proportioned size , and handsomely fitted up as a dining - parlour ; and on [their]1746-their quitting it to walk round [the grounds]1354-the grounds , [she]77-catherine was shown , first into [a smaller apartment]1748-a smaller apartment , belonging peculiarly to [the master of [the house]216-the house]1749-the master of the house , and made unusually tidy on the occasion ; and afterwards into what was to be [the drawing - room]448-the drawing - room , with the appearance of which , though unfurnished , [Catherine]77-catherine was delighted enough even to satisfy [the general]783-the general . It was [a prettily shaped room]1753-a prettily shaped room , the windows reaching to the ground , and the view from [them]1754-them pleasant , though only over [green meadows]1755-green meadows ; and [she]77-catherine expressed [her]77-catherine admiration at the moment with all the honest simplicity with which [she]77-catherine felt it . " Oh ! Why do not [you]783-the general fit up [this room]2174-this room , [Mr. Tilney]98-henry ? What a pity not to have [it]2174-this room fitted up ! [It]2174-this room is [the prettiest room [I]77-catherine ever saw]3275-the prettiest room i ever saw ; it is [the prettiest room in [the world]197-the world]3276-the prettiest room in the world ! "[77-catherine]

" [I]783-the general trust , "[783-the general] said [the general]783-the general , with a most satisfied smile , " that [it]2174-this room will very speedily be furnished : [it]2174-this room waits only for [a lady]629-a lady s taste ! "[783-the general]

" Well , if it was [[my]77-catherine house]3279-my house , [I]77-catherine should never sit anywhere else . Oh ! What [a sweet little cottage there]3280-a sweet little cottage there is among the trees apple trees , too ! It is [the prettiest cottage]3281-the prettiest cottage ! "[77-catherine]

" [You]783-the general like it [you]783-the general approve it as an object it is enough . [Henry]98-henry , remember that [Robinson]178-robinson is spoken to about it . [The cottage]3282-the cottage remains . "[783-the general]

Such a compliment recalled all [Catherine]77-catherine s consciousness , and silenced [her]77-catherine directly ; and , though pointedly applied to by [the general]783-the general for [her]77-catherine choice of the prevailing colour of the paper and hangings , nothing like an opinion on the subject could be drawn from [her]77-catherine .
