The influence of fresh objects and fresh air , however , was of great use in dissipating these embarrassing associations ; and , having reached the ornamental part of [the premises]2997-the premises , consisting of a walk round two sides of [a meadow]1759-a meadow , on which [Henry]98-henry s genius had begun to act about half a year ago , [she]77-catherine was sufficiently recovered to think it prettier than [any pleasure - ground [she]77-catherine had ever been in before]1760-any pleasure - ground she had ever been in before , though there was not a shrub in [it]1761-it higher than the green bench in the corner .

A saunter into [other meadows]1762-other meadows , and through [part of [the village]1726-the village]1763-part of the village , with a visit to [the stables]3153-the stables to examine some improvements , and a charming game of play with a litter of puppies just able to roll about , brought [them]1766-they to four o clock , when [Catherine]77-catherine scarcely thought it could be three . At four [they]1766-they were to dine , and at six to set off on [their]1766-they return . Never had any day passed so quickly !

[She]77-catherine could not but observe that the abundance of the dinner did not seem to create the smallest astonishment in [the general]783-the general ; nay , that [he]783-the general was even looking at the side - table for cold meat which was not there . [[His]783-the general son]2638-his son and [daughter]914-daughter s observations were of a different kind . [They]1766-they had seldom seen [him]783-the general eat so heartily at any table but [his]783-the general own , and never before known [him]783-the general so little disconcerted by the melted butter s being oiled .

At six o clock , [the general]783-the general having taken [his]783-the general coffee , [the carriage]559-the carriage again received them ; and so gratifying had been the tenor of [his]783-the general conduct throughout the whole visit , so well assured was [her]77-catherine mind on the subject of [his]783-the general expectations , that , could [she]77-catherine have felt equally confident of the wishes of [[his]783-the general son]2638-his son , [Catherine]77-catherine would have quitted [Woodston]65-woodston with little anxiety as to the How or the When [she]77-catherine might return to [it]65-woodston .

CHAPTER 27

The next morning brought the following very unexpected letter from [Isabella]106-isabella :

_ [Bath]5-bath , April _

[[My]0-i dearest]2226-my dearest [Catherine]77-catherine , [I]0-i received [your]77-catherine two kind letters with the greatest delight , and have a thousand apologies to make for not answering them sooner . [I]0-i really am quite ashamed of [my]0-i idleness ; but in this horrid place one can find time for nothing . [I]0-i have had [my]0-i pen in [my]0-i hand to begin a letter to [you]77-catherine almost every day since [you]77-catherine left [Bath]5-bath , but have always been prevented by [some silly trifler or other]1774-some silly trifler or other . Pray write to [me]0-i soon , and direct to [[my]0-i own home]2539-my own home . Thank [God]132-god , [we]1776-we leave [this vile place]1777-this vile place tomorrow . Since [you]77-catherine went away , [I]0-i have had no pleasure in it the dust is beyond anything ; and [everybody one]1778-everybody one cares for is gone . [I]0-i believe if [I]0-i could see [you]77-catherine [I]0-i should not mind the rest , for [you]77-catherine are dearer to [me]0-i than [anybody]198-anybody can conceive . [I]0-i am quite uneasy about [[your]77-catherine dear brother]2794-your dear brother , not having heard from [him]2794-your dear brother since [he]2794-your dear brother went to [Oxford]10-oxford ; and am fearful of some misunderstanding . [Your]77-catherine kind offices will set all right : [he]2794-your dear brother is [the only man [I]0-i ever did or could love]1781-the only man i ever did or could love , and [I]0-i trust [you]77-catherine will convince [him]2794-your dear brother of it . The spring fashions are partly down ; and the hats the most frightful [you]77-catherine can imagine . [I]0-i hope [you]77-catherine spend [your]77-catherine time pleasantly , but am afraid [you]77-catherine never think of [me]0-i . [I]0-i will not say all that [I]0-i could of [the family [you]77-catherine are with]1782-the family you are with , because [I]0-i would not be ungenerous , or set [you]77-catherine against those [you]77-catherine esteem ; but it is very difficult to know whom to trust , and [young men]534-young men never know [their]534-young men minds two days together . [I]0-i rejoice to say that [the young man whom , of all others]1784-the young man whom , of all others , [I]0-i particularly abhor , has left [Bath]5-bath . [You]77-catherine will know , from this description , [I]0-i must mean [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney , who , as [you]77-catherine may remember , was amazingly disposed to follow and tease [me]0-i , before [you]77-catherine went away . Afterwards [he]78-captain tilney got worse , and became quite [my]0-i shadow . [Many girls]1785-many girls might have been taken in , for never were such attentions ; but [I]0-i knew the fickle sex too well . [He]78-captain tilney went away to [[his]78-captain tilney regiment]3013-his regiment two days ago , and [I]0-i trust [I]0-i shall never be plagued with [him]78-captain tilney again . [He]78-captain tilney is [the greatest coxcomb [I]0-i ever saw]1787-the greatest coxcomb i ever saw , and amazingly disagreeable . The last two days [he]78-captain tilney was always by the side of [Charlotte Davis]179-charlotte davis : [I]0-i pitied [his]78-captain tilney taste , but took no notice of [him]78-captain tilney . The last time [we]1788-we met was in [Bath Street]72-bath street , and [I]0-i turned directly into [a shop]1789-a shop that [he]78-captain tilney might not speak to [me]0-i ; [I]0-i would not even look at [him]78-captain tilney . [He]78-captain tilney went into [the pump - room]364-the pump - room afterwards ; but [I]0-i would not have followed [him]78-captain tilney for all [the world]197-the world . Such a contrast between [him]78-captain tilney and [[your]1792-your brother]2331-your brother ! Pray send [me]0-i some news of [the latter]562-the latter [I]0-i am quite unhappy about [him]78-captain tilney ; [he]78-captain tilney seemed so uncomfortable when [he]78-captain tilney went away , with a cold , or something that affected [his]78-captain tilney spirits . [I]0-i would write to [him]78-captain tilney [myself]0-i , but have mislaid [his]78-captain tilney direction ; and , as [I]0-i hinted above , am afraid [he]78-captain tilney took something in [my]0-i conduct amiss . Pray explain everything to [his]78-captain tilney satisfaction ; or , if [he]78-captain tilney still harbours any doubt , a line from [himself]78-captain tilney to [me]0-i , or a call at [Putney]59-putney when next in [town]2641-town , might set all to rights . [I]0-i have not been to [the rooms]2123-the rooms this age , nor to the play , except going in last night with [the Hodges]1797-the hodges , for a frolic , at half price : [they]1797-the hodges teased [me]0-i into it ; and [I]0-i was determined [they]1797-the hodges should not say [I]0-i shut [myself]0-i up because [Tilney]78-captain tilney was gone . [We]1798-we happened to sit by [the Mitchells]180-the mitchells , and [they]180-the mitchells pretended to be quite surprised to see [me]0-i out . [I]0-i knew [their]180-the mitchells spite : at one time [they]180-the mitchells could not be civil to [me]0-i , but now [they]180-the mitchells are all friendship ; but [I]0-i am not such a fool as to be taken in by [them]180-the mitchells . [You]1799-you know [I]0-i have a pretty good spirit of [my]0-i own . [Anne Mitchell]181-anne mitchell had tried to put on a turban like [mine]0-i , as [I]0-i wore it the week before at the concert , but made wretched work of it it happened to become [my]0-i odd face , [I]0-i believe , at least [Tilney]78-captain tilney told [me]0-i so at the time , and said every eye was upon [me]0-i ; but [he]78-captain tilney is [the last man whose word [I]0-i would take]1800-the last man whose word i would take . [I]0-i wear nothing but purple now : [I]0-i know [I]0-i look hideous in it , but no matter it is [[your]1799-you dear]1801-your dear brother s favourite colour . Lose no time , [[my]0-i dearest]2226-my dearest , sweetest [Catherine]77-catherine , in writing to [him]78-captain tilney and to [me]0-i ,

Who ever am , etc .

Such a strain of shallow artifice could not impose even upon [Catherine]77-catherine . Its inconsistencies , contradictions , and falsehood struck [her]77-catherine from the very first . [She]77-catherine was ashamed of [Isabella]106-isabella , and ashamed of having ever loved [her]106-isabella . [Her]77-catherine professions of attachment were now as disgusting as [her]77-catherine excuses were empty , and [her]77-catherine demands impudent . " Write to [James]108-james on [her]106-isabella behalf ! No , [James]108-james should never hear [Isabella]106-isabella s name mentioned by [her]106-isabella again . "[77-catherine]

On [Henry]98-henry s arrival from [Woodston]65-woodston , [she]77-catherine made known to [him]98-henry and [Eleanor]1803-eleanor [[their]1804-their brother]1684-their brother s safety , congratulating [them]1804-their with sincerity on it , and reading aloud the most material passages of [her]77-catherine letter with strong indignation . When [she]77-catherine had finished it " So much for [Isabella]106-isabella , "[77-catherine] [she]77-catherine cried , " and for all [our]3283-our intimacy ! [She]106-isabella must think [me]77-catherine [an idiot]3284-an idiot , or [she]106-isabella could not have written so ; but perhaps this has served to make [her]106-isabella character better known to [me]77-catherine than [mine]77-catherine is to [her]106-isabella . [I]77-catherine see what [she]106-isabella has been about . [She]106-isabella is [a vain coquette]3285-a vain coquette , and [her]106-isabella tricks have not answered . [I]77-catherine do not believe [she]106-isabella had ever any regard either for [James]108-james or for [me]77-catherine , and [I]77-catherine wish [I]77-catherine had never known [her]106-isabella . "[77-catherine]

" It will soon be as if [you]77-catherine never had , "[98-henry] said [Henry]98-henry .

" There is but one thing that [I]77-catherine can not understand . [I]77-catherine see that [she]106-isabella has had designs on [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney , which have not succeeded ; but [I]77-catherine do not understand what [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney has been about all this time . Why should [he]78-captain tilney pay [her]106-isabella such attentions as to make [her]106-isabella quarrel with [[my]77-catherine brother]2282-my brother , and then fly off [himself]78-captain tilney ? "[77-catherine]

" [I]77-catherine have very little to say for [Frederick]78-captain tilney s motives , such as [I]77-catherine believe them to have been . [He]78-captain tilney has [his]78-captain tilney vanities as well as [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe , and the chief difference is , that , having a stronger head , [they]3287-they have not yet injured [himself]78-captain tilney . If the _ effect _ of [his]78-captain tilney behaviour does not justify [him]78-captain tilney with [you]98-henry , [we]3288-we had better not seek after the cause . "[77-catherine]

" Then [you]77-catherine do not suppose [he]78-captain tilney ever really cared about [her]106-isabella ? "[77-catherine]

" [I]77-catherine am persuaded that [he]78-captain tilney never did . "[77-catherine]

" And only made believe to do so for mischief s sake ? "[77-catherine]

[Henry]98-henry bowed [his]98-henry assent .

" Well , then , [I]77-catherine must say that [I]77-catherine do not like [him]78-captain tilney at all . Though it has turned out so well for [us]3288-we , [I]77-catherine do not like [him]78-captain tilney at all . As it happens , there is no great harm done , because [I]77-catherine do not think [Isabella]106-isabella has any heart to lose . But , suppose [he]78-captain tilney had made [her]106-isabella very much in love with [him]78-captain tilney ? "[77-catherine]

" But [we]3288-we must first suppose [Isabella]106-isabella to have had a heart to lose consequently to have been [a very different creature]3289-a very different creature ; and , in that case , [she]106-isabella would have met with very different treatment . "[77-catherine]

" It is very right that [you]77-catherine should stand by [[your]77-catherine brother]2331-your brother . "[77-catherine]

" And if [you]77-catherine would stand by _ [yours]77-catherine _ , [you]77-catherine would not be much distressed by the disappointment of [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe . But [your]77-catherine mind is warped by an innate principle of general integrity , and therefore not accessible to the cool reasonings of family partiality , or a desire of revenge . "[77-catherine]

[Catherine]77-catherine was complimented out of further bitterness . [Frederick]78-captain tilney could not be unpardonably guilty , while [Henry]98-henry made [himself]98-henry so agreeable . [She]77-catherine resolved on not answering [Isabella]106-isabella s letter , and tried to think no more of it .

CHAPTER 28

Soon after this , [the general]783-the general found [himself]783-the general obliged to go to [London]12-london for a week ; and [he]783-the general left [Northanger]63-northanger earnestly regretting that any necessity should rob [him]783-the general even for an hour of [Miss Morland]90-miss morland s company , and anxiously recommending the study of [her]90-miss morland comfort and amusement to [[his]783-the general children]1067-his children as [their]1067-his children chief object in [his]783-the general absence . [His]783-the general departure gave [Catherine]77-catherine the first experimental conviction that a loss may be sometimes a gain . The happiness with which [their]1808-their time now passed , every employment voluntary , every laugh indulged , every meal a scene of ease and good humour , walking where [they]1808-their liked and when [they]1808-their liked , [their]1808-their hours , pleasures , and fatigues at [their]1808-their own command , made [her]77-catherine thoroughly sensible of the restraint which [the general]783-the general s presence had imposed , and most thankfully feel [their]1808-their present release from it . Such ease and such delights made [her]77-catherine love [the place]2152-the place and [the people]1811-the people more and more every day ; and had it not been for a dread of its soon becoming expedient to leave [the one]1812-the one , and an apprehension of not being equally beloved by the other , [she]77-catherine would at each moment of each day have been perfectly happy ; but [she]77-catherine was now in the fourth week of [her]77-catherine visit ; before [the general]783-the general came [home]2339-home , the fourth week would be turned , and perhaps it might seem an intrusion if [she]77-catherine stayed much longer . This was a painful consideration whenever it occurred ; and eager to get rid of such a weight on [her]77-catherine mind , [she]77-catherine very soon resolved to speak to [Eleanor]145-eleanor about it at once , propose going away , and be guided in [her]77-catherine conduct by the manner in which [her]77-catherine proposal might be taken .

Aware that if [she]77-catherine gave [herself]77-catherine much time , [she]77-catherine might feel it difficult to bring forward so unpleasant a subject , [she]77-catherine took the first opportunity of being suddenly alone with [Eleanor]145-eleanor , and of [Eleanor]145-eleanor s being in the middle of a speech about something very different , to start forth [her]77-catherine obligation of going away very soon . [Eleanor]145-eleanor looked and declared [herself]145-eleanor much concerned . [She]145-eleanor had " hoped for the pleasure of [her]145-eleanor company for a much longer time had been misled ( perhaps by [her]145-eleanor wishes ) to suppose that a much longer visit had been promised and could not but think that if [Mr.]3291-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland were aware of the pleasure it was to [her]145-eleanor to have [her]145-eleanor [there]336-there , [they]3293-they would be too generous to hasten [her]145-eleanor return . "[77-catherine] [Catherine]77-catherine explained : " Oh ! As to _ that _ , [Papa]141-papa and [Mamma]142-mamma were in no hurry at all . As long as [she]145-eleanor was happy , [they]3293-they would always be satisfied . "[77-catherine]

" Then why , might [she]145-eleanor ask , in such a hurry [herself]145-eleanor to leave [them]3293-they ? "[77-catherine]

" Oh ! Because [she]145-eleanor had been [there]336-there so long . "[77-catherine]

" Nay , if [you]77-catherine can use such a word , [I]77-catherine can urge [you]77-catherine no farther . If [you]77-catherine think it long "[77-catherine]

" Oh ! No , [I]77-catherine do not indeed . For [my]77-catherine own pleasure , [I]77-catherine could stay with [you]77-catherine as long again . "[77-catherine] And it was directly settled that , till [she]77-catherine had , [her]77-catherine leaving [them]1815-them was not even to be thought of . In having this cause of uneasiness so pleasantly removed , the force of the other was likewise weakened . The kindness , the earnestness of [Eleanor]145-eleanor s manner in pressing [her]145-eleanor to stay , and [Henry]98-henry s gratified look on being told that [her]145-eleanor stay was determined , were such sweet proofs of [her]145-eleanor importance with [them]1815-them , as left [her]145-eleanor only just so much solicitude as [the human mind]1816-the human mind can never do comfortably without . [She]145-eleanor did almost always believe that [Henry]98-henry loved [her]145-eleanor , and quite always that [[his]98-henry father]859-his father and [sister]721-sister loved and even wished [her]145-eleanor to belong to [them]1815-them ; and believing so far , [her]145-eleanor doubts and anxieties were merely sportive irritations .

[Henry]98-henry was not able to obey [[his]98-henry father]859-his father s injunction of remaining wholly at [Northanger]63-northanger in attendance on [the ladies]320-the ladies , during [his]98-henry absence in [London]12-london , the engagements of [[his]98-henry curate]1821-his curate at [Woodston]65-woodston obliging [him]98-henry to leave [them]1815-them on Saturday for a couple of nights . [His]98-henry loss was not now what it had been while [the general]783-the general was at [home]2339-home ; it lessened [their]1815-them gaiety , but did not ruin [their]1815-them comfort ; and [the two girls]1824-the two girls agreeing in occupation , and improving in intimacy , found [themselves]1824-the two girls so well sufficient for the time to [themselves]1824-the two girls , that it was eleven o clock , rather a late hour at [the abbey]3021-the abbey , before [they]1824-the two girls quitted [the supper - room]1826-the supper - room on the day of [Henry]98-henry s departure . [They]1824-the two girls had just reached the head of the stairs when it seemed , as far as the thickness of the walls would allow [them]1824-the two girls to judge , that [a carriage]672-a carriage was driving up to the door , and the next moment confirmed the idea by the loud noise of the house - bell . After the first perturbation of surprise had passed away , in a " Good heaven ! What can be the matter ? "[427-her eldest brother] it was quickly decided by [Eleanor]145-eleanor to be [[her]145-eleanor eldest brother]427-her eldest brother , whose arrival was often as sudden , if not quite so unseasonable , and accordingly [she]145-eleanor hurried down to welcome [him]427-her eldest brother .

[Catherine]77-catherine walked on to [[her]77-catherine chamber]1829-her chamber , making up [her]77-catherine mind as well as [she]77-catherine could , to a further acquaintance with [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney , and comforting [herself]77-catherine under the unpleasant impression [his]427-her eldest brother conduct had given [her]77-catherine , and the persuasion of [his]427-her eldest brother being by far too fine [a gentleman]389-a gentleman to approve of [her]77-catherine , that at least [they]1824-the two girls should not meet under such circumstances as would make [their]1824-the two girls meeting materially painful . [She]77-catherine trusted [he]427-her eldest brother would never speak of [Miss Thorpe]101-miss thorpe ; and indeed , as [he]427-her eldest brother must by this time be ashamed of the part [he]427-her eldest brother had acted , there could be no danger of it ; and as long as all mention of Bath scenes were avoided , [she]77-catherine thought [she]77-catherine could behave to [him]427-her eldest brother very civilly . In such considerations time passed away , and it was certainly in [his]427-her eldest brother favour that [Eleanor]145-eleanor should be so glad to see [him]427-her eldest brother , and have so much to say , for half an hour was almost gone since [his]427-her eldest brother arrival , and [Eleanor]145-eleanor did not come up .

At that moment [Catherine]77-catherine thought [she]77-catherine heard [her]77-catherine step in [the gallery]1320-the gallery , and listened for its continuance ; but all was silent . Scarcely , however , had [she]77-catherine convicted [her]77-catherine fancy of error , when the noise of something moving close to [her]77-catherine door made [her]77-catherine start ; it seemed as if [someone]1614-someone was touching the very doorway and in another moment a slight motion of the lock proved that some hand must be on it . [She]77-catherine trembled a little at the idea of [anyone]2862-anyone s approaching so cautiously ; but resolving not to be again overcome by trivial appearances of alarm , or misled by a raised imagination , [she]77-catherine stepped quietly forward , and opened the door . [Eleanor]145-eleanor , and only [Eleanor]145-eleanor , stood there . [Catherine]77-catherine s spirits , however , were tranquillized but for an instant , for [Eleanor]145-eleanor s cheeks were pale , and [her]145-eleanor manner greatly agitated . Though evidently intending to come in , it seemed an effort to enter [the room]308-the room , and a still greater to speak when there . [Catherine]1835-catherine , supposing some uneasiness on [Captain Tilney]78-captain tilney s account , could only express [her]1835-catherine concern by silent attention , obliged [her]145-eleanor to be seated , rubbed [her]145-eleanor temples with lavender - water , and hung over [her]145-eleanor with affectionate solicitude . " [[My]145-eleanor dear]2124-my dear [Catherine]77-catherine , [you]77-catherine must not [you]77-catherine must not indeed "[145-eleanor] were [Eleanor]145-eleanor s first connected words . " [I]145-eleanor am quite well . This kindness distracts [me]145-eleanor [I]145-eleanor can not bear it [I]145-eleanor come to [you]77-catherine on such an errand ! "[145-eleanor]

" Errand ! To [me]77-catherine ! "[77-catherine]

" How shall [I]145-eleanor tell [you]77-catherine ! Oh ! How shall [I]145-eleanor tell [you]77-catherine ! "[145-eleanor]

A new idea now darted into [Catherine]77-catherine s mind , and turning as pale as [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend , [she]77-catherine exclaimed , " Tis [a messenger from [Woodston]65-woodston]3296-a messenger from woodston ! "[77-catherine]

" [You]77-catherine are mistaken , indeed , "[145-eleanor] returned [Eleanor]145-eleanor , looking at [her]77-catherine most compassionately ; " it is [[no one]366-no one from [Woodston]65-woodston]3298-no one from woodston . It is [[my]77-catherine father]2473-my father [himself]1837-his . "[77-catherine] [Her]77-catherine voice faltered , and [her]77-catherine eyes were turned to the ground as [she]77-catherine mentioned [his]1837-his name . [His]1837-his unlooked - for return was enough in itself to make [Catherine]77-catherine s heart sink , and for a few moments [she]77-catherine hardly supposed there were anything worse to be told . [She]77-catherine said nothing ; and [Eleanor]145-eleanor , endeavouring to collect [herself]145-eleanor and speak with firmness , but with eyes still cast down , soon went on . " [You]77-catherine are too good , [I]145-eleanor am sure , to think the worse of [me]145-eleanor for the part [I]145-eleanor am obliged to perform . [I]145-eleanor am indeed [a most unwilling messenger]3300-a most unwilling messenger . After what has so lately passed , so lately been settled between [us]3301-we how joyfully , how thankfully on [my]145-eleanor side ! as to [your]77-catherine continuing here as [I]145-eleanor hoped for many , many weeks longer , how can [I]145-eleanor tell [you]77-catherine that [your]77-catherine kindness is not to be accepted and that the happiness [[your]77-catherine company]3302-your company has hitherto given [us]3301-we is to be repaid by But [I]145-eleanor must not trust [myself]145-eleanor with words . [[My]145-eleanor dear]2124-my dear [Catherine]77-catherine , [we]3301-we are to part . [[My]145-eleanor father]2473-my father has recollected an engagement that takes [[our]3301-we whole family]3305-our whole family away on Monday . [We]3301-we are going to [Lord Longtown s]73-lord longtown s , near [Hereford]74-hereford , for a fortnight . Explanation and apology are equally impossible . [I]145-eleanor can not attempt either . "[145-eleanor]

" [[My]77-catherine dear]2124-my dear [Eleanor]145-eleanor , "[77-catherine] cried [Catherine]77-catherine , suppressing [her]77-catherine feelings as well as [she]77-catherine could , " do not be so distressed . A second engagement must give way to a first . [I]77-catherine am very , very sorry [we]3301-we are to part so soon , and so suddenly too ; but [I]77-catherine am not offended , indeed [I]77-catherine am not . [I]77-catherine can finish [my]77-catherine visit here , [you]77-catherine know , at any time ; or [I]77-catherine hope [you]77-catherine will come to [me]77-catherine . Can [you]77-catherine , when [you]77-catherine return from [this lord s]3307-this lord s , come to [Fullerton]3-fullerton ? "[77-catherine]

" It will not be in [my]145-eleanor power , [Catherine]77-catherine . "[145-eleanor]

" Come when [you]77-catherine can , then . "[77-catherine]

[Eleanor]145-eleanor made no answer ; and [Catherine]77-catherine s thoughts recurring to something more directly interesting , [she]77-catherine added , thinking aloud , " Monday so soon as Monday ; and [you]77-catherine _ all _ go . Well , [I]77-catherine am certain of [I]77-catherine shall be able to take leave , however . [I]77-catherine need not go till just before [you]77-catherine do , [you]77-catherine know . Do not be distressed , [Eleanor]145-eleanor , [I]77-catherine can go on Monday very well . [[My]77-catherine father]2473-my father and [mother]189-mother s having no notice of it is of very little consequence . [The general]783-the general will send [a servant]674-a servant with [me]77-catherine , [I]77-catherine dare say , half the way and then [I]77-catherine shall soon be at [Salisbury]8-salisbury , and then [I]77-catherine am only nine miles from [home]2339-home . "[77-catherine]

" Ah , [Catherine]77-catherine ! Were it settled so , it would be somewhat less intolerable , though in such common attentions [you]77-catherine would have received but half what [you]77-catherine ought . But how can [I]77-catherine tell [you]77-catherine ? tomorrow morning is fixed for [your]77-catherine leaving [us]3313-us , and not even the hour is left to [your]77-catherine choice ; [the very carriage]3314-the very carriage is ordered , and will be [here]2128-here at seven o clock , and [no servant]3316-no servant will be offered [you]77-catherine . "[77-catherine]

[Catherine]77-catherine sat down , breathless and speechless . " [I]77-catherine could hardly believe [my]77-catherine senses , when [I]77-catherine heard it ; and no displeasure , no resentment that [you]77-catherine can feel at this moment , however justly great , can be more than [I]77-catherine [myself]77-catherine but [I]77-catherine must not talk of what [I]77-catherine felt . Oh ! That [I]77-catherine could suggest anything in extenuation ! [Good God]132-god ! What will [[your]77-catherine father]2636-your father and [mother]189-mother say ! After courting [you]77-catherine from the protection of [real friends]3319-real friends to this almost double distance from [[your]77-catherine home]3320-your home , to have [you]77-catherine driven out of [the house]216-the house , without the considerations even of decent civility ! [Dear]3322-dear , dear [Catherine]77-catherine , in being the bearer of such a message , [I]77-catherine seem guilty [myself]77-catherine of all its insult ; yet , [I]77-catherine trust [you]77-catherine will acquit [me]77-catherine , for [you]77-catherine must have been long enough in [this house]3323-this house to see that [I]77-catherine am but [a nominal mistress of it]3324-a nominal mistress of it , that [my]77-catherine real power is nothing . "[77-catherine]

" Have [I]77-catherine offended [the general]783-the general ? "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine in a faltering voice .

" Alas ! For [my]77-catherine feelings as [a daughter]1592-a daughter , all that [I]77-catherine know , all that [I]77-catherine answer for , is that [you]77-catherine can have given [him]783-the general no just cause of offence . [He]783-the general certainly is greatly , very greatly discomposed ; [I]77-catherine have seldom seen [him]783-the general more so . [His]783-the general temper is not happy , and something has now occurred to ruffle it in an uncommon degree ; some disappointment , some vexation , which just at this moment seems important , but which [I]77-catherine can hardly suppose [you]77-catherine to have any concern in , for how is it possible ? "[77-catherine]

It was with pain that [Catherine]77-catherine could speak at all ; and it was only for [Eleanor]145-eleanor s sake that [she]77-catherine attempted it . " [I]77-catherine am sure , "[77-catherine] said [she]77-catherine , " [I]77-catherine am very sorry if [I]77-catherine have offended [him]783-the general . It was the last thing [I]77-catherine would willingly have done . But do not be unhappy , [Eleanor]145-eleanor . An engagement , [you]145-eleanor know , must be kept . [I]77-catherine am only sorry it was not recollected sooner , that [I]77-catherine might have written [home]2339-home . But it is of very little consequence . "[77-catherine]

" [I]77-catherine hope , [I]77-catherine earnestly hope , that to [your]77-catherine real safety it will be of none ; but to everything else it is of the greatest consequence : to comfort , appearance , propriety , to [[your]77-catherine family]3224-your family , to [the world]197-the world . Were [[your]77-catherine friends]3330-your friends , [the Allens]109-the allens , still in [Bath]5-bath , [you]77-catherine might go to [them]3330-your friends with comparative ease ; a few hours would take [you]77-catherine [there]336-there ; but a journey of seventy miles , to be taken post by [you]77-catherine , at [your]77-catherine age , alone , unattended ! "[77-catherine]

" Oh , the journey is nothing . Do not think about that . And if [we]1838-they are to part , a few hours sooner or later , [you]77-catherine know , makes no difference . [I]77-catherine can be ready by seven . Let [me]77-catherine be called in time . "[77-catherine] [Eleanor]145-eleanor saw that [she]145-eleanor wished to be alone ; and believing it better for each that [they]1838-they should avoid any further conversation , now left [her]145-eleanor with , " [I]145-eleanor shall see [you]77-catherine in the morning . "[145-eleanor]

[Catherine]77-catherine s swelling heart needed relief . In [Eleanor]145-eleanor s presence friendship and pride had equally restrained [her]77-catherine tears , but no sooner was [she]77-catherine gone than they burst forth in torrents . Turned from [the house]216-the house , and in such a way ! Without any reason that could justify , any apology that could atone for the abruptness , the rudeness , nay , the insolence of it . [Henry]98-henry at a distance not able even to bid [him]98-henry farewell . Every hope , every expectation from [him]98-henry suspended , at least , and who could say how long ? Who could say when [they]1838-they might meet again ? And all this by [such a man as [General Tilney]143-general tilney]1840-such a man as general tilney , so polite , so well bred , and heretofore so particularly fond of [her]77-catherine ! It was as incomprehensible as it was mortifying and grievous . From what it could arise , and where it would end , were considerations of equal perplexity and alarm . The manner in which it was done so grossly uncivil , hurrying [her]77-catherine away without any reference to [her]77-catherine own convenience , or allowing [her]77-catherine even the appearance of choice as to the time or mode of [her]77-catherine travelling ; of two days , the earliest fixed on , and of that almost the earliest hour , as if resolved to have [her]77-catherine gone before [he]98-henry was stirring in the morning , that [he]98-henry might not be obliged even to see [her]77-catherine . What could all this mean but an intentional affront ? By some means or other [she]77-catherine must have had the misfortune to offend [him]98-henry . [Eleanor]145-eleanor had wished to spare [her]77-catherine from so painful a notion , but [Catherine]77-catherine could not believe it possible that any injury or any misfortune could provoke such ill will against [a person not connected , or , at least , not supposed to be connected with it]1841-a person not connected , or , at least , not supposed to be connected with it .

Heavily passed the night . Sleep , or repose that deserved the name of sleep , was out of the question . [That room]1499-that room , in which [her]77-catherine disturbed imagination had tormented [her]77-catherine on [her]77-catherine first arrival , was again the scene of agitated spirits and unquiet slumbers . Yet how different now the source of [her]77-catherine inquietude from what it had been then how mournfully superior in reality and substance ! [Her]77-catherine anxiety had foundation in fact , [her]77-catherine fears in probability ; and with a mind so occupied in the contemplation of actual and natural evil , the solitude of [her]77-catherine situation , the darkness of [[her]77-catherine chamber]1829-her chamber , the antiquity of [the building]1237-the building , were felt and considered without the smallest emotion ; and though the wind was high , and often produced strange and sudden noises throughout [the house]216-the house , [she]77-catherine heard it all as [she]77-catherine lay awake , hour after hour , without curiosity or terror .

Soon after six [Eleanor]145-eleanor entered [[her]77-catherine room]1313-her room , eager to show attention or give assistance where it was possible ; but very little remained to be done . [Catherine]77-catherine had not loitered ; [she]77-catherine was almost dressed , and [her]77-catherine packing almost finished . The possibility of some conciliatory message from [the general]783-the general occurred to [her]77-catherine as [[his]783-the general daughter]2444-his daughter appeared . What so natural , as that anger should pass away and repentance succeed it ? And [she]77-catherine only wanted to know how far , after what had passed , an apology might properly be received by [her]77-catherine . But the knowledge would have been useless [here]2128-here ; it was not called for ; neither clemency nor dignity was put to the trial [Eleanor]145-eleanor brought no message . Very little passed between [them]1850-they on meeting ; [each]1677-each found [her]1677-each greatest safety in silence , and few and trivial were the sentences exchanged while [they]1850-they remained [upstairs]446-upstairs , [Catherine]77-catherine in busy agitation completing [her]77-catherine dress , and [Eleanor]145-eleanor with more goodwill than experience intent upon filling the trunk . When everything was done [they]1850-they left [the room]308-the room , [Catherine]77-catherine lingering only half a minute behind [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend to throw a parting glance on every well - known , cherished object , and went down to [the breakfast - parlour]1328-the breakfast - parlour , where breakfast was prepared . [She]77-catherine tried to eat , as well to save [herself]77-catherine from the pain of being urged as to make [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend comfortable ; but [she]77-catherine had no appetite , and could not swallow many mouthfuls . The contrast between this and [her]77-catherine last breakfast in [that room]1499-that room gave [her]77-catherine fresh misery , and strengthened [her]77-catherine distaste for everything before [her]77-catherine . It was not four and twenty hours ago since [they]1850-they had met [there]336-there to the same repast , but in circumstances how different ! With what cheerful ease , what happy , though false , security , had [she]77-catherine then looked around [her]77-catherine , enjoying everything present , and fearing little in future , beyond [Henry]98-henry s going to [Woodston]65-woodston for a day ! Happy , happy breakfast ! For [Henry]98-henry had been [there]336-there ; [Henry]98-henry had sat by [her]77-catherine and helped [her]77-catherine . These reflections were long indulged undisturbed by any address from [[her]77-catherine companion]687-her companion , who sat as deep in thought as [herself]77-catherine ; and the appearance of [the carriage]559-the carriage was the first thing to startle and recall them to the present moment . [Catherine]77-catherine s colour rose at the sight of it ; and the indignity with which [she]77-catherine was treated , striking at that instant on [her]77-catherine mind with peculiar force , made [her]77-catherine for a short time sensible only of resentment . [Eleanor]145-eleanor seemed now impelled into resolution and speech .

" [You]77-catherine _ must _ write to [me]145-eleanor , [Catherine]77-catherine , "[145-eleanor] [she]145-eleanor cried ; " [you]77-catherine _ must _ let [me]145-eleanor hear from [you]77-catherine as soon as possible . Till [I]145-eleanor know [you]77-catherine to be safe at [home]2339-home , [I]145-eleanor shall not have an hour s comfort . For _ one _ letter , at all risks , all hazards , [I]145-eleanor must entreat . Let [me]145-eleanor have the satisfaction of knowing that [you]77-catherine are safe at [Fullerton]3-fullerton , and have found [[your]77-catherine family]3224-your family well , and then , till [I]145-eleanor can ask for [your]77-catherine correspondence as [I]145-eleanor ought to do , [I]145-eleanor will not expect more . Direct to [me]145-eleanor at [Lord Longtown]73-lord longtown s s , and , [I]145-eleanor must ask it , under cover to [Alice]183-alice . "[145-eleanor]

" No , [Eleanor]145-eleanor , if [you]145-eleanor are not allowed to receive a letter from [me]77-catherine , [I]77-catherine am sure [I]77-catherine had better not write . There can be no doubt of [my]77-catherine getting [home]2339-home safe . "[77-catherine]

[Eleanor]145-eleanor only replied , " [I]145-eleanor can not wonder at [your]145-eleanor feelings . [I]145-eleanor will not importune [you]145-eleanor . [I]145-eleanor will trust to [your]145-eleanor own kindness of heart when [I]145-eleanor am at a distance from [you]145-eleanor . "[145-eleanor] But this , with the look of sorrow accompanying it , was enough to melt [Catherine]77-catherine s pride in a moment , and [she]77-catherine instantly said , " Oh , [Eleanor]145-eleanor , [I]77-catherine _ will _ write to [you]145-eleanor indeed . "[77-catherine]

There was yet another point which [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney was anxious to settle , though somewhat embarrassed in speaking of . It had occurred to [her]95-miss tilney that after so long an absence from [home]2339-home , [Catherine]77-catherine might not be provided with money enough for the expenses of [her]77-catherine journey , and , upon suggesting it to [her]77-catherine with most affectionate offers of accommodation , it proved to be exactly the case . [Catherine]77-catherine had never thought on the subject till that moment , but , upon examining [her]77-catherine purse , was convinced that but for this kindness of [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend , [she]77-catherine might have been turned from [the house]216-the house without even the means of getting [home]2339-home ; and the distress in which [she]77-catherine must have been thereby involved filling the minds of both , scarcely another word was said by [either]1866-either during the time of [their]1867-their remaining together . Short , however , was that time . [The carriage]559-the carriage was soon announced to be ready ; and [Catherine]77-catherine , instantly rising , a long and affectionate embrace supplied the place of language in bidding [each other]338-each other adieu ; and , as [they]1867-their entered [the hall]1246-the hall , unable to leave [the house]216-the house without some mention of [one whose name had not yet been spoken by either]1872-one whose name had not yet been spoken by either , [she]77-catherine paused a moment , and with quivering lips just made it intelligible that [she]77-catherine left " [her]77-catherine kind remembrance for [[her]77-catherine absent friend]3335-her absent friend . "[77-catherine] But with this approach to [his]1872-one whose name had not yet been spoken by either name ended all possibility of restraining [her]77-catherine feelings ; and , hiding [her]77-catherine face as well as [she]77-catherine could with [her]77-catherine handkerchief , [she]77-catherine darted across [the hall]1246-the hall , jumped into the chaise , and in a moment was driven from the door .

CHAPTER 29

[Catherine]77-catherine was too wretched to be fearful . The journey in itself had no terrors for [her]77-catherine ; and [she]77-catherine began it without either dreading its length or feeling its solitariness . Leaning back in one corner of [the carriage]559-the carriage , in a violent burst of tears , [she]77-catherine was conveyed some miles beyond the walls of [the abbey]3021-the abbey before [she]77-catherine raised [her]77-catherine head ; and [the highest point of ground within [the park]1367-the park]1876-the highest point of ground within the park was almost closed from [her]77-catherine view before [she]77-catherine was capable of turning [her]77-catherine eyes towards [it]1876-the highest point of ground within the park . Unfortunately , [the road [she]77-catherine now travelled]1878-the road she now travelled was the same which only ten days ago [she]77-catherine had so happily passed along in going to and from [Woodston]65-woodston ; and , for fourteen miles , every bitter feeling was rendered more severe by the review of objects on which [she]77-catherine had first looked under impressions so different . Every mile , as it brought [her]77-catherine nearer [Woodston]65-woodston , added to [her]77-catherine sufferings , and when within the distance of five , [she]77-catherine passed the turning which led to [it]1879-it , and thought of [Henry]98-henry , so near , yet so unconscious , [her]77-catherine grief and agitation were excessive .

The day which [she]77-catherine had spent at [that place]1880-that place had been one of the happiest of [her]77-catherine life . It was there , it was on that day , that [the general]783-the general had made use of such expressions with regard to [Henry]98-henry and [herself]77-catherine , had so spoken and so looked as to give [her]77-catherine the most positive conviction of [his]98-henry actually wishing [their]1882-their marriage . Yes , only ten days ago had [he]98-henry elated [her]77-catherine by [his]98-henry pointed regard had [he]98-henry even confused [her]77-catherine by [his]98-henry too significant reference ! And now what had [she]77-catherine done , or what had [she]77-catherine omitted to do , to merit such a change ?

The only offence against [him]98-henry of which [she]77-catherine could accuse [herself]77-catherine had been such as was scarcely possible to reach [his]98-henry knowledge . [Henry]98-henry and [her]77-catherine own heart only were privy to the shocking suspicions which [she]77-catherine had so idly entertained ; and equally safe did [she]77-catherine believe [her]77-catherine secret with each . Designedly , at least , [Henry]98-henry could not have betrayed [her]77-catherine . If , indeed , by any strange mischance [[his]98-henry father]859-his father should have gained intelligence of what [she]77-catherine had dared to think and look for , of [her]77-catherine causeless fancies and injurious examinations , [she]77-catherine could not wonder at any degree of [his]98-henry indignation . If aware of [her]77-catherine having viewed [him]98-henry as [a murderer]1884-a murderer , [she]77-catherine could not wonder at [his]98-henry even turning [her]77-catherine from [[his]98-henry house]1885-his house . But a justification so full of torture to [herself]77-catherine , [she]77-catherine trusted , would not be in [his]98-henry power .

Anxious as were all [her]77-catherine conjectures on this point , it was not , however , the one on which [she]77-catherine dwelt most . There was a thought yet nearer , a more prevailing , more impetuous concern . How [Henry]98-henry would think , and feel , and look , when [he]98-henry returned on the morrow to [Northanger]63-northanger and heard of [her]77-catherine being gone , was a question of force and interest to rise over every other , to be never ceasing , alternately irritating and soothing ; it sometimes suggested the dread of [his]98-henry calm acquiescence , and at others was answered by the sweetest confidence in [his]98-henry regret and resentment . To [the general]783-the general , of course , [he]98-henry would not dare to speak ; but to [Eleanor]1887-eleanor what might [he]98-henry not say to [Eleanor]145-eleanor about [her]1887-eleanor ?

In this unceasing recurrence of doubts and inquiries , on any one article of which [her]77-catherine mind was incapable of more than momentary repose , the hours passed away , and [her]77-catherine journey advanced much faster than [she]77-catherine looked for . The pressing anxieties of thought , which prevented [her]77-catherine from noticing anything before [her]77-catherine , when once beyond [the neighbourhood of [Woodston]65-woodston]1888-the neighbourhood of woodston , saved [her]77-catherine at the same time from watching [her]77-catherine progress ; and though no object on [the road]2488-the road could engage a moment s attention , [she]77-catherine found no stage of it tedious . From this , [she]77-catherine was preserved too by another cause , by feeling no eagerness for [her]77-catherine journey s conclusion ; for to return in such a manner to [Fullerton]3-fullerton was almost to destroy the pleasure of a meeting with those [she]77-catherine loved best , even after an absence such as [hers]77-catherine an eleven weeks absence . What had [she]77-catherine to say that would not humble [herself]77-catherine and pain [[her]77-catherine family]278-her family , that would not increase [her]77-catherine own grief by the confession of it , extend an useless resentment , and perhaps involve [the innocent]1891-the innocent with [the guilty]1892-the guilty in undistinguishing ill will ? [She]77-catherine could never do justice to [Henry]98-henry and [Eleanor]145-eleanor s merit ; [she]77-catherine felt it too strongly for expression ; and should a dislike be taken against [them]1893-them , should [they]1893-them be thought of unfavourably , on [[their]1893-them father]1064-their father s account , it would cut [her]77-catherine to the heart .

With these feelings , [she]77-catherine rather dreaded than sought for the first view of that well - known spire which would announce [[her]77-catherine within twenty miles of [home]2339-home]1895-her within twenty miles of home . Salisbury [she]77-catherine had known to be [her]77-catherine point on leaving [Northanger]63-northanger ; but after the first stage [she]77-catherine had been indebted to [the post - masters]1897-the post - masters for the names of the places which were then to conduct [her]77-catherine to it ; so great had been [her]77-catherine ignorance of [her]77-catherine route . [She]77-catherine met with nothing , however , to distress or frighten [her]77-catherine . [Her]77-catherine youth , civil manners , and liberal pay procured [her]77-catherine all the attention that [a traveller]1898-a traveller like [herself]77-catherine could require ; and stopping only to change horses , [she]77-catherine travelled on for about eleven hours without accident or alarm , and between six and seven o clock in the evening found [herself]77-catherine entering [Fullerton]3-fullerton .

[A heroine returning , at the close of [her]77-catherine career , to [[her]77-catherine native village]1900-her native village]1899-a heroine returning , at the close of her career , to her native village , in all the triumph of recovered reputation , and all the dignity of [a countess]1901-a countess , with a long train of noble relations in [[their]1902-their several phaetons]1903-their several phaetons , and three waiting - maids in a travelling chaise and four , behind [her]77-catherine , is an event on which the pen of [the contriver]1904-the contriver may well delight to dwell ; it gives credit to every conclusion , and [the author]2738-the author must share in the glory [she]77-catherine so liberally bestows . But [my]0-i affair is widely different ; [I]0-i bring back [[my]0-i heroine]762-my heroine to [[her]762-my heroine home]1907-her home in solitude and disgrace ; and no sweet elation of spirits can lead [me]0-i into minuteness . [A heroine in a hack post - chaise]1908-a heroine in a hack post - chaise is such a blow upon sentiment , as no attempt at grandeur or pathos can withstand . Swiftly therefore shall [her]77-catherine post - boy drive through [the village]1726-the village , amid the gaze of [Sunday groups]1910-sunday groups , and speedy shall be [her]77-catherine descent from it .

But , whatever might be the distress of [Catherine]77-catherine s mind , as [she]77-catherine thus advanced towards [the parsonage]1734-the parsonage , and whatever the humiliation of [[her]77-catherine biographer]1912-her biographer in relating it , [she]77-catherine was preparing enjoyment of no everyday nature for those to whom [she]77-catherine went ; first , in the appearance of [[her]77-catherine carriage]1913-her carriage and secondly , in [herself]77-catherine . The chaise of [a traveller]1898-a traveller being a rare sight in [Fullerton]3-fullerton , [the whole family]1915-the whole family were immediately at the window ; and to have it stop at the sweep - gate was a pleasure to brighten every eye and occupy every fancy a pleasure quite unlooked for by all but [the two youngest children]1916-the two youngest children , [a boy]238-a boy and [girl of six and four years old]1918-girl of six and four years old , who expected [a brother]750-a brother or sister in [every carriage]1920-every carriage . Happy the glance that first distinguished [Catherine]77-catherine ! Happy the voice that proclaimed the discovery ! But whether such happiness were the lawful property of [George]94-george or [Harriet]184-harriet could never be exactly understood .

[[Her]77-catherine father]188-her father , [mother]189-mother , [Sarah]80-sarah , [George]94-george , and [Harriet]184-harriet , all assembled at the door to welcome [her]77-catherine with affectionate eagerness , was a sight to awaken the best feelings of [Catherine]77-catherine s heart ; and in the embrace of [each]1677-each , as [she]77-catherine stepped from [the carriage]559-the carriage , [she]77-catherine found [herself]77-catherine soothed beyond anything that [she]77-catherine had believed possible . So surrounded , so caressed , [she]77-catherine was even happy ! In the joyfulness of family love everything for a short time was subdued , and the pleasure of seeing [her]77-catherine , leaving [them]1925-they at first little leisure for calm curiosity , [they]1925-they were all seated round the tea - table , which [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland had hurried for the comfort of [the poor traveller]1926-the poor traveller , whose pale and jaded looks soon caught [her]77-catherine notice , before any inquiry so direct as to demand a positive answer was addressed to [her]77-catherine .

Reluctantly , and with much hesitation , did [she]77-catherine then begin what might perhaps , at the end of half an hour , be termed , by the courtesy of [[her]77-catherine hearers]1927-her hearers , an explanation ; but scarcely , within that time , could [they]1925-they at all discover the cause , or collect the particulars , of [her]77-catherine sudden return . [They]1925-they were far from being [an irritable race]1928-an irritable race ; far from any quickness in catching , or bitterness in resenting , affronts : but here , when the whole was unfolded , was an insult not to be overlooked , nor , for the first half hour , to be easily pardoned . Without suffering any romantic alarm , in the consideration of [[their]1925-they daughter]1114-their daughter s long and lonely journey , [Mr.]1930-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland could not but feel that it might have been productive of much unpleasantness to [her]77-catherine ; that it was what [they]1925-they could never have voluntarily suffered ; and that , in forcing [her]77-catherine on such a measure , [General Tilney]143-general tilney had acted neither honourably nor feelingly neither as [a gentleman]389-a gentleman nor as [a parent]1932-a parent . Why [he]143-general tilney had done it , what could have provoked [him]143-general tilney to such a breach of hospitality , and so suddenly turned all [his]143-general tilney partial regard for [[their]1925-they daughter]1114-their daughter into actual ill will , was a matter which [they]1925-they were at least as far from divining as [Catherine]77-catherine [herself]77-catherine ; but it did not oppress [them]1925-they by any means so long ; and , after a due course of useless conjecture , that " it was a strange business , and that [he]143-general tilney must be [a very strange man]3336-a very strange man , "[1925-they] grew enough for all [their]1925-they indignation and wonder ; though [Sarah]80-sarah indeed still indulged in the sweets of incomprehensibility , exclaiming and conjecturing with youthful ardour . " [[My]194-her mother dear]2124-my dear , [you]2124-my dear give [yourself]2124-my dear a great deal of needless trouble , "[194-her mother] said [[her]77-catherine mother]194-her mother at last ; " depend upon it , it is something not at all worth understanding . "[194-her mother]

" [I]80-sarah can allow for [his]143-general tilney wishing [Catherine]77-catherine away , when [he]143-general tilney recollected this engagement , "[80-sarah] said [Sarah]80-sarah , " but why not do it civilly ? "[80-sarah]

" [I]82-mrs. morland am sorry for [the young people]1054-the young people , "[82-mrs. morland] returned [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland ; " [they]1054-the young people must have a sad time of it ; but as for anything else , it is no matter now ; [Catherine]77-catherine is safe at [home]2339-home , and [our]3340-our comfort does not depend upon [General Tilney]143-general tilney . "[77-catherine] [Catherine]77-catherine sighed . " Well , "[1935-her philosophic mother] continued [[her]77-catherine philosophic mother]1935-her philosophic mother , " [I]1935-her philosophic mother am glad [I]1935-her philosophic mother did not know of [your]77-catherine journey at the time ; but now it is all over , perhaps there is no great harm done . It is always good for [young people]2335-young people to be put upon exerting [themselves]2335-young people ; and [you]77-catherine know , [[my]1935-her philosophic mother dear]2124-my dear [Catherine]77-catherine , [you]77-catherine always were [a sad little scatter - brained creature]3343-a sad little scatter - brained creature ; but now [you]77-catherine must have been forced to have [your]77-catherine wits about [you]77-catherine , with so much changing of chaises and so forth ; and [I]1935-her philosophic mother hope it will appear that [you]77-catherine have not left anything behind [you]77-catherine in any of the pockets . "[1935-her philosophic mother]

[Catherine]77-catherine hoped so too , and tried to feel an interest in [her]77-catherine own amendment , but [her]77-catherine spirits were quite worn down ; and , to be silent and alone becoming soon [her]77-catherine only wish , [she]77-catherine readily agreed to [[her]77-catherine mother]194-her mother s next counsel of going early to bed . [[Her]77-catherine parents]1937-her parents , seeing nothing in [her]77-catherine ill looks and agitation but the natural consequence of mortified feelings , and of the unusual exertion and fatigue of such a journey , parted from [her]77-catherine without any doubt of [their]1937-her parents being soon slept away ; and though , when [they]1937-her parents all met the next morning , [her]77-catherine recovery was not equal to [their]1937-her parents hopes , [they]1937-her parents were still perfectly unsuspicious of there being any deeper evil . [They]1937-her parents never once thought of [her]77-catherine heart , which , for [the parents of [a young lady of seventeen]1939-a young lady of seventeen , just returned from [her]1939-a young lady of seventeen first excursion from [home]2339-home]1938-the parents of a young lady of seventeen , just returned from her first excursion from home , was odd enough !

As soon as breakfast was over , [she]77-catherine sat down to fulfil [her]77-catherine promise to [Miss Tilney]95-miss tilney , whose trust in the effect of time and distance on [[her]77-catherine friend]313-her friend s disposition was already justified , for already did [Catherine]77-catherine reproach [herself]77-catherine with having parted from [Eleanor]145-eleanor coldly , with having never enough valued [her]77-catherine merits or kindness , and never enough commiserated [her]77-catherine for what [she]77-catherine had been yesterday left to endure . The strength of these feelings , however , was far from assisting [her]77-catherine pen ; and never had it been harder for [her]77-catherine to write than in addressing [Eleanor Tilney]145-eleanor . To compose a letter which might at once do justice to [her]77-catherine sentiments and [her]77-catherine situation , convey gratitude without servile regret , be guarded without coldness , and honest without resentment a letter which [Eleanor]145-eleanor might not be pained by the perusal of and , above all , which [she]145-eleanor might not blush [herself]145-eleanor , if [Henry]98-henry should chance to see , was an undertaking to frighten away all [her]145-eleanor powers of performance ; and , after long thought and much perplexity , to be very brief was all that [she]145-eleanor could determine on with any confidence of safety . The money therefore which [Eleanor]145-eleanor had advanced was enclosed with little more than grateful thanks , and the thousand good wishes of [a most affectionate heart]1942-a most affectionate heart .

" This has been a strange acquaintance , "[82-mrs. morland] observed [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland , as the letter was finished ; " soon made and soon ended . [I]82-mrs. morland am sorry it happens so , for [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen thought [them]3344-them very pretty kind of [young people]2335-young people ; and [you]145-eleanor were sadly out of luck too in [[your]145-eleanor Isabella]3346-your isabella . Ah ! [Poor James]173-poor james ! Well , [we]3347-we must live and learn ; and the next new friends [you]145-eleanor make [I]82-mrs. morland hope will be better worth keeping . "[82-mrs. morland]

[Catherine]77-catherine coloured as [she]77-catherine warmly answered , " [No friend]3348-no friend can be better worth keeping than [Eleanor]145-eleanor . "[77-catherine]

" If so , [[my]82-mrs. morland dear]2124-my dear , [I]82-mrs. morland dare say [you]2124-my dear will meet again some time or other ; do not be uneasy . It is ten to one but [you]2124-my dear are thrown together again in the course of a few years ; and then what a pleasure it will be ! "[82-mrs. morland]

[Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland was not happy in [her]82-mrs. morland attempt at consolation . The hope of meeting again in the course of a few years could only put into [Catherine]77-catherine s head what might happen within that time to make a meeting dreadful to [her]77-catherine . [She]77-catherine could never forget [Henry Tilney]98-henry , or think of [him]98-henry with less tenderness than [she]77-catherine did at that moment ; but [he]98-henry might forget [her]77-catherine ; and in that case , to meet ! [Her]77-catherine eyes filled with tears as [she]77-catherine pictured [her]77-catherine acquaintance so renewed ; and [[her]77-catherine mother]194-her mother , perceiving [her]194-her mother comfortable suggestions to have had no good effect , proposed , as another expedient for restoring [her]194-her mother spirits , that [they]1944-we should call on [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen .

[The two houses]1945-the two houses were only a quarter of a mile apart ; and , as [they]1944-we walked , [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland quickly dispatched all that [she]82-mrs. morland felt on the score of [James]173-poor james s disappointment . " [We]1944-we are sorry for [him]173-poor james , "[82-mrs. morland] said [she]82-mrs. morland ; " but otherwise there is no harm done in the match going off ; for it could not be a desirable thing to have [him]173-poor james engaged to [a girl whom [we]1944-we had not the smallest acquaintance with , and who was so entirely without fortune]3350-a girl whom we had not the smallest acquaintance with , and who was so entirely without fortune ; and now , after such behaviour , [we]1944-we can not think at all well of [her]3350-a girl whom we had not the smallest acquaintance with , and who was so entirely without fortune . Just at present it comes hard to [poor James]173-poor james ; but that will not last forever ; and [I]82-mrs. morland dare say [he]173-poor james will be [a discreeter man]3351-a discreeter man all [his]173-poor james life , for the foolishness of [his]173-poor james first choice . "[82-mrs. morland]

This was just such a summary view of the affair as [Catherine]77-catherine could listen to ; another sentence might have endangered [her]77-catherine complaisance , and made [her]77-catherine reply less rational ; for soon were all [her]77-catherine thinking powers swallowed up in the reflection of [her]77-catherine own change of feelings and spirits since last [she]77-catherine had trodden [that well - known road]1946-that well - known road . It was not three months ago since , wild with joyful expectation , [she]77-catherine had there run backwards and forwards some ten times a day , with an heart light , gay , and independent ; looking forward to pleasures untasted and unalloyed , and free from the apprehension of evil as from the knowledge of it . Three months ago had seen [her]77-catherine all this ; and now , how altered [a being]1947-a being did [she]77-catherine return !

[She]77-catherine was received by [the Allens]109-the allens with all the kindness which [her]77-catherine unlooked - for appearance , acting on a steady affection , would naturally call forth ; and great was [their]109-the allens surprise , and warm [their]109-the allens displeasure , on hearing how [she]77-catherine had been treated though [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland s account of it was no inflated representation , no studied appeal to [their]109-the allens passions . " [Catherine]77-catherine took [us]109-the allens quite by surprise yesterday evening , "[77-catherine] said [she]77-catherine . " [She]77-catherine travelled all the way post by [herself]77-catherine , and knew nothing of coming till Saturday night ; for [General Tilney]143-general tilney , from some odd fancy or other , all of a sudden grew tired of having [her]77-catherine [there]336-there , and almost turned [her]77-catherine out of [the house]216-the house . Very unfriendly , certainly ; and [he]143-general tilney must be [a very odd man]3354-a very odd man ; but [we]109-the allens are so glad to have [her]77-catherine amongst [us]109-the allens again ! And it is a great comfort to find that [she]77-catherine is not a poor helpless creature , but can shift very well for [herself]77-catherine . "[77-catherine]

[Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen expressed [himself]89-mr. allen on the occasion with the reasonable resentment of [a sensible friend]1948-a sensible friend ; and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen thought [his]89-mr. allen expressions quite good enough to be immediately made use of again by [herself]91-mrs. allen . [His]89-mr. allen wonder , [his]89-mr. allen conjectures , and [his]89-mr. allen explanations became in succession [hers]91-mrs. allen , with the addition of this single remark " [I]91-mrs. allen really have not patience with [the general]783-the general "[91-mrs. allen] to fill up every accidental pause . And , " [I]91-mrs. allen really have not patience with [the general]783-the general , "[91-mrs. allen] was uttered twice after [Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen left [the room]308-the room , without any relaxation of anger , or any material digression of thought . A more considerable degree of wandering attended the third repetition ; and , after completing the fourth , [she]91-mrs. allen immediately added , " Only think , [[my]91-mrs. allen dear]2124-my dear , of [my]91-mrs. allen having got that frightful great rent in [[my]91-mrs. allen best Mechlin]3358-my best mechlin so charmingly mended , before [I]91-mrs. allen left [Bath]5-bath , that [one]2210-one can hardly see where it was . [I]91-mrs. allen must show it [you]2124-my dear some day or other . [Bath]2155-bath is [a nice place]3361-a nice place , [Catherine]77-catherine , after all . [I]91-mrs. allen assure [you]2124-my dear [I]91-mrs. allen did not above half like coming away . [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe s being there was such a comfort to [us]3362-us , was not it ? [You]2124-my dear know , [you]2124-my dear and [I]91-mrs. allen were quite forlorn at first . "[91-mrs. allen]

" Yes , but _ that _ did not last long , "[77-catherine] said [Catherine]77-catherine , [her]77-catherine eyes brightening at the recollection of what had first given spirit to [her]77-catherine existence [there]336-there .

" Very true : [we]3362-us soon met with [Mrs. Thorpe]102-mrs. thorpe , and then [we]3362-us wanted for nothing . [[My]91-mrs. allen dear]2124-my dear , do not [you]2124-my dear think these silk gloves wear very well ? " Do [I]91-mrs. allen ! Oh ! Perfectly . "[91-mrs. allen]
