[I]91-mrs. allen have a notion [you]2124-my dear danced with [him]98-henry , but am not quite sure . [I]91-mrs. allen remember [I]91-mrs. allen had [my]91-mrs. allen favourite gown on . "[91-mrs. allen]

[Catherine]77-catherine could not answer ; and , after a short trial of other subjects , [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen again returned to " [I]91-mrs. allen really have not patience with [the general]783-the general ! [Such an agreeable , worthy man as [he]783-the general seemed to be]3366-such an agreeable , worthy man as he seemed to be ! [I]91-mrs. allen do not suppose , [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland , [you]2124-my dear ever saw [a better - bred man in [your]2124-my dear life]3367-a better - bred man in your life . [[His]3367-a better - bred man in your life lodgings]3368-his lodgings were taken the very day after [he]3367-a better - bred man in your life left them , [Catherine]77-catherine . But no wonder ; [Milsom Street]15-milsom street , [you]2124-my dear know . "[91-mrs. allen]

As [they]1951-they walked [home]2339-home again , [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland endeavoured to impress on [[her]82-mrs. morland daughter]272-her daughter s mind the happiness of having [such steady well - wishers as [Mr.]1955-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen]1954-such steady well - wishers as mr. and mrs. allen , and the very little consideration which the neglect or unkindness of slight acquaintance like [the Tilneys]137-the tilneys ought to have with [her]272-her daughter , while [she]272-her daughter could preserve the good opinion and affection of [[her]272-her daughter earliest friends]1956-her earliest friends . There was a great deal of good sense in all this ; but there are some situations of the human mind in which good sense has very little power ; and [Catherine]77-catherine s feelings contradicted almost every position [[her]77-catherine mother]194-her mother advanced . It was upon the behaviour of [these very slight acquaintance]1958-these very slight acquaintance that all [her]77-catherine present happiness depended ; and while [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland was successfully confirming [her]82-mrs. morland own opinions by the justness of [her]82-mrs. morland own representations , [Catherine]77-catherine was silently reflecting that _ now _ [Henry]98-henry must have arrived at [Northanger]63-northanger ; _ now _ [he]98-henry must have heard of [her]77-catherine departure ; and _ now _ , perhaps , [they]1959-they were all setting off for [Hereford]74-hereford .

CHAPTER 30

[Catherine]77-catherine s disposition was not naturally sedentary , nor had [her]77-catherine habits been ever very industrious ; but whatever might hitherto have been [her]77-catherine defects of that sort , [[her]77-catherine mother]194-her mother could not but perceive them now to be greatly increased . [She]77-catherine could neither sit still nor employ [herself]77-catherine for ten minutes together , walking round [the garden]3108-the garden and [orchard]1372-orchard again and again , as if nothing but motion was voluntary ; and it seemed as if [she]77-catherine could even walk about [the house]216-the house rather than remain fixed for any time in [the parlour]993-the parlour . [Her]77-catherine loss of spirits was a yet greater alteration . In [her]77-catherine rambling and [her]77-catherine idleness [she]77-catherine might only be a caricature of [herself]77-catherine ; but in [her]77-catherine silence and sadness [she]77-catherine was the very reverse of all that [she]77-catherine had been before .

For two days [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland allowed it to pass even without a hint ; but when a third night s rest had neither restored [her]77-catherine cheerfulness , improved [her]77-catherine in useful activity , nor given [her]77-catherine a greater inclination for needlework , [she]82-mrs. morland could no longer refrain from the gentle reproof of , " [[My]82-mrs. morland dear]2124-my dear [Catherine]77-catherine , [I]82-mrs. morland am afraid [you]77-catherine are growing quite [a fine lady]3370-a fine lady . [I]82-mrs. morland do not know when [poor Richard]78-captain tilney s cravats would be done , if [he]78-captain tilney had [no friend]3348-no friend but [you]77-catherine . [Your]77-catherine head runs too much upon Bath ; but there is a time for everything a time for balls and plays , and a time for work . [You]77-catherine have had a long run of amusement , and now [you]77-catherine must try to be useful . "[82-mrs. morland]

[Catherine]77-catherine took up [her]77-catherine work directly , saying , in a dejected voice , that " [her]77-catherine head did not run upon [Bath]5-bath much . "[77-catherine]

" Then [you]77-catherine are fretting about [General Tilney]143-general tilney , and that is very simple of [you]77-catherine ; for ten to one whether [you]77-catherine ever see [him]143-general tilney again . [You]77-catherine should never fret about trifles . "[77-catherine] After a short silence " [I]77-catherine hope , [[my]77-catherine Catherine]2792-my catherine , [you]77-catherine are not getting out of humour with [home]2339-home because it is not so grand as [Northanger]63-northanger . That would be turning [your]77-catherine visit into an evil indeed . Wherever [you]77-catherine are [you]77-catherine should always be contented , but especially at [home]2339-home , because [there]336-there [you]77-catherine must spend the most of [your]77-catherine time . [I]77-catherine did not quite like , at breakfast , to hear [you]77-catherine talk so much about the French bread at [Northanger]63-northanger . "[77-catherine]

" [I]77-catherine am sure [I]77-catherine do not care about the bread . It is all the same to [me]77-catherine what [I]77-catherine eat . "[77-catherine]

" There is a very clever essay in one of the books [upstairs]446-upstairs upon much such a subject , about [young girls that have been spoilt for home by great acquaintance The Mirror]3377-young girls that have been spoilt for home by great acquaintance the mirror , [I]77-catherine think . [I]77-catherine will look it out for [you]77-catherine some day or other , because [I]77-catherine am sure it will do [you]77-catherine good . "[77-catherine]

[Catherine]77-catherine said no more , and , with an endeavour to do right , applied to [her]77-catherine work ; but , after a few minutes , sunk again , without knowing it [herself]77-catherine , into languor and listlessness , moving [herself]77-catherine in [her]77-catherine chair , from the irritation of weariness , much oftener than [she]77-catherine moved [her]77-catherine needle . [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland watched the progress of this relapse ; and seeing , in [[her]82-mrs. morland daughter]272-her daughter s absent and dissatisfied look , the full proof of that repining spirit to which [she]82-mrs. morland had now begun to attribute [her]82-mrs. morland want of cheerfulness , hastily left [the room]308-the room to fetch the book in question , anxious to lose no time in attacking so dreadful a malady . It was some time before [she]82-mrs. morland could find what [she]82-mrs. morland looked for ; and other family matters occurring to detain [her]82-mrs. morland , a quarter of an hour had elapsed ere [she]82-mrs. morland returned [downstairs]681-downstairs with the volume from which so much was hoped . [Her]82-mrs. morland avocations above having shut out all noise but what [she]82-mrs. morland created [herself]82-mrs. morland , [she]82-mrs. morland knew not that [a visitor]1192-a visitor had arrived within the last few minutes , till , on entering [the room]308-the room , the first object [she]82-mrs. morland beheld was [a young man whom [she]82-mrs. morland had never seen before]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before . With a look of much respect , [he]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before immediately rose , and being introduced to [her]82-mrs. morland by [[her]82-mrs. morland conscious daughter]1971-her conscious daughter as " [Mr. Henry Tilney]98-henry , "[1970-a young man whom she had never seen before] with the embarrassment of real sensibility began to apologize for [his]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before appearance [there]336-there , acknowledging that after what had passed [he]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before had little right to expect a welcome at [Fullerton]3-fullerton , and stating [his]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before impatience to be assured of [Miss Morland]90-miss morland s having reached [[her]90-miss morland home]1907-her home in safety , as the cause of [his]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before intrusion . [He]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before did not address [himself]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before to [an uncandid judge or a resentful heart]1974-an uncandid judge or a resentful heart . Far from comprehending [him]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before or [[his]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before sister]2222-his sister in [[their]1976-their father]1064-their father s misconduct , [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland had been always kindly disposed towards [each]1677-each , and instantly , pleased by [his]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before appearance , received [him]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before with the simple professions of unaffected benevolence ; thanking [him]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before for such an attention to [[her]82-mrs. morland daughter]272-her daughter , assuring [him]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before that [the friends of [[her]82-mrs. morland children]221-her children]1980-the friends of her children were always welcome [there]336-there , and entreating [him]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before to say not another word of the past .

[He]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before was not ill - inclined to obey this request , for , though [his]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before heart was greatly relieved by such unlooked - for mildness , it was not just at that moment in [his]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before power to say anything to the purpose . Returning in silence to [his]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before seat , therefore , [he]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before remained for some minutes most civilly answering all [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland s common remarks about the weather and [roads]1983-roads . [Catherine]1984-catherine meanwhile [the anxious , agitated , happy , feverish Catherine]1985-the anxious , agitated , happy , feverish catherine said not a word ; but [her]1984-catherine glowing cheek and brightened eye made [[her]1984-catherine mother]194-her mother trust that this good - natured visit would at least set [her]194-her mother heart at ease for a time , and gladly therefore did [she]194-her mother lay aside the first volume of The Mirror for a future hour .

Desirous of [Mr. Morland]108-james s assistance , as well in giving encouragement , as in finding conversation for [[her]82-mrs. morland guest]2839-her guest , whose embarrassment on [[his]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before father]859-his father s account [she]82-mrs. morland earnestly pitied , [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland had very early dispatched [one of [the children]1990-the children]1989-one of the children to summon [him]1970-a young man whom she had never seen before ; but [Mr. Morland]108-james was from [home]2339-home and being thus without any support , at the end of a quarter of an hour [she]82-mrs. morland had nothing to say . After a couple of minutes unbroken silence , [Henry]98-henry , turning to [Catherine]77-catherine for the first time since [[her]1984-catherine mother]194-her mother s entrance , asked [her]77-catherine , with sudden alacrity , if [Mr.]1993-mr. and [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen were now at [Fullerton]3-fullerton ? And on developing , from amidst all [her]77-catherine perplexity of words in reply , the meaning , which one short syllable would have given , immediately expressed [his]98-henry intention of paying [his]98-henry respects to [them]1994-they , and , with a rising colour , asked [her]77-catherine if [she]77-catherine would have the goodness to show [him]98-henry the way . " [You]98-henry may see [the house]216-the house from this window , [sir]2153-sir , "[80-sarah] was information on [Sarah]80-sarah s side , which produced only a bow of acknowledgment from [the gentleman]387-the gentleman , and a silencing nod from [[her]1984-catherine mother]194-her mother ; for [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland , thinking it probable , as a secondary consideration in [his]98-henry wish of waiting on [[their]1994-they worthy neighbours]1997-their worthy neighbours , that [he]98-henry might have some explanation to give of [[his]98-henry father]859-his father s behaviour , which it must be more pleasant for [him]98-henry to communicate only to [Catherine]77-catherine , would not on any account prevent [her]77-catherine accompanying [him]98-henry . [They]1994-they began [their]1994-they walk , and [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland was not entirely mistaken in [his]98-henry object in wishing it . Some explanation on [[his]98-henry father]859-his father s account [he]98-henry had to give ; but [his]98-henry first purpose was to explain [himself]98-henry , and before [they]1994-they reached [[Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen s grounds]2000-mr. allen s grounds [he]98-henry had done it so well that [Catherine]77-catherine did not think it could ever be repeated too often . [She]77-catherine was assured of [his]98-henry affection ; and that heart in return was solicited , which , perhaps , [they]1994-they pretty equally knew was already entirely [his]98-henry own ; for , though [Henry]98-henry was now sincerely attached to [her]77-catherine , though [he]98-henry felt and delighted in all the excellencies of [her]77-catherine character and truly loved [her]77-catherine society , [I]0-i must confess that [his]98-henry affection originated in nothing better than gratitude , or , in other words , that a persuasion of [her]77-catherine partiality for [him]98-henry had been the only cause of giving [her]77-catherine a serious thought . It is a new circumstance in romance , [I]0-i acknowledge , and dreadfully derogatory of [an heroine]187-an heroine s dignity ; but if it be as new in common life , the credit of a wild imagination will at least be all [my]0-i own .

A very short visit to [Mrs. Allen]91-mrs. allen , in which [Henry]98-henry talked at random , without sense or connection , and [Catherine]77-catherine , rapt in the contemplation of [her]77-catherine own unutterable happiness , scarcely opened [her]77-catherine lips , dismissed them to the ecstasies of [another t te- -t te]2002-another t te- -t te ; and before it was suffered to close , [she]77-catherine was enabled to judge how far [he]98-henry was sanctioned by parental authority in [his]98-henry present application . On [his]98-henry return from [Woodston]65-woodston , two days before , [he]98-henry had been met near [the abbey]3021-the abbey by [[his]98-henry impatient father]2004-his impatient father , hastily informed in angry terms of [Miss Morland]90-miss morland s departure , and ordered to think of [her]90-miss morland no more .

Such was the permission upon which [he]98-henry had now offered [her]90-miss morland [his]98-henry hand . [The affrighted Catherine]77-catherine , amidst all the terrors of expectation , as [she]77-catherine listened to this account , could not but rejoice in the kind caution with which [Henry]98-henry had saved [her]77-catherine from the necessity of a conscientious rejection , by engaging [her]77-catherine faith before [he]98-henry mentioned the subject ; and as [he]98-henry proceeded to give the particulars , and explain the motives of [[his]98-henry father]859-his father s conduct , [her]77-catherine feelings soon hardened into even a triumphant delight . [The general]783-the general had had nothing to accuse [her]77-catherine of , nothing to lay to [her]77-catherine charge , but [her]77-catherine being the involuntary , unconscious object of a deception which [his]783-the general pride could not pardon , and which [a better pride]2007-a better pride would have been ashamed to own . [She]77-catherine was guilty only of being less rich than [he]783-the general had supposed [her]77-catherine to be . Under a mistaken persuasion of [her]77-catherine possessions and claims , [he]783-the general had courted [her]77-catherine acquaintance in [Bath]5-bath , solicited [her]77-catherine company at [Northanger]63-northanger , and designed [her]77-catherine for [[his]783-the general daughter - in - law]2008-his daughter - in - law . On discovering [his]783-the general error , to turn [her]77-catherine from [the house]216-the house seemed the best , though to [his]783-the general feelings an inadequate proof of [his]783-the general resentment towards [herself]77-catherine , and [his]783-the general contempt of [[her]77-catherine family]278-her family .

[John Thorpe]103-john had first misled [him]783-the general . [The general]783-the general , perceiving [[his]783-the general son]2638-his son one night at [the theatre]2151-the theatre to be paying considerable attention to [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , had accidentally inquired of [Thorpe]103-john if [he]783-the general knew more of [her]77-catherine than [her]77-catherine name . [Thorpe]103-john , most happy to be on speaking terms with [a man of General Tilney]2014-a man of general tilney s importance , had been joyfully and proudly communicative ; and being at that time not only in daily expectation of [Morland]90-miss morland s engaging [Isabella]106-isabella , but likewise pretty well resolved upon marrying [Catherine]77-catherine [himself]783-the general , [his]103-john vanity induced [him]103-john to represent [the family]457-the family as yet more wealthy than [his]103-john vanity and avarice had made [him]103-john believe [them]2016-them . With whomsoever [he]103-john was , or was likely to be connected , [his]103-john own consequence always required that [theirs]2017-theirs should be great , and as [his]103-john intimacy with any acquaintance grew , so regularly grew [their]2017-theirs fortune . The expectations of [[his]103-john friend]557-his friend [Morland]90-miss morland , therefore , from the first overrated , had ever since [his]103-john introduction to [Isabella]106-isabella been gradually increasing ; and by merely adding twice as much for the grandeur of the moment , by doubling what [he]103-john chose to think the amount of [Mr. Morland]108-james s preferment , trebling [his]103-john private fortune , bestowing [a rich aunt]2019-a rich aunt , and sinking half [the children]1990-the children , [he]103-john was able to represent [the whole family]1915-the whole family to [the general]783-the general in a most respectable light . For [Catherine]77-catherine , however , the peculiar object of [the general]783-the general s curiosity , and [his]783-the general own speculations , [he]783-the general had yet something more in reserve , and the ten or fifteen thousand pounds which [[her]77-catherine father]188-her father could give [her]77-catherine would be a pretty addition to [[Mr. Allen]89-mr. allen s estate]2025-mr. allen s estate . [Her]77-catherine intimacy there had made [him]783-the general seriously determine on [her]77-catherine being handsomely legacied hereafter ; and to speak of [her]77-catherine therefore as [the almost acknowledged future heiress of [Fullerton]3-fullerton]2026-the almost acknowledged future heiress of fullerton naturally followed . Upon such intelligence [the general]783-the general had proceeded ; for never had it occurred to [him]783-the general to doubt [its]783-the general authority . [Thorpe]106-isabella s interest in [the family]457-the family , by [[his]783-the general sister]2222-his sister s approaching connection with [one of [[its]457-the family members]2031-its members]2030-one of its members , and [his]783-the general own views on another ( circumstances of which [he]783-the general boasted with almost equal openness ) , seemed sufficient vouchers for [his]783-the general truth ; and to these were added the absolute facts of [the Allens]109-the allens being wealthy and childless , of [Miss Morland]90-miss morland s being under [their]109-the allens care , and as soon as [his]783-the general acquaintance allowed [him]783-the general to judge of [their]109-the allens treating [her]90-miss morland with parental kindness . [His]783-the general resolution was soon formed . Already had [he]783-the general discerned a liking towards [Miss Morland]90-miss morland in the countenance of [[his]783-the general son]2638-his son ; and thankful for [Mr. Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe s communication , [he]783-the general almost instantly determined to spare no pains in weakening [his]783-the general boasted interest and ruining [his]783-the general dearest hopes . [Catherine]77-catherine [herself]77-catherine could not be more ignorant at the time of all this , than [[his]783-the general own children]2033-his own children . [Henry]98-henry and [Eleanor]145-eleanor , perceiving nothing in [her]77-catherine situation likely to engage [[their]109-the allens father]1064-their father s particular respect , had seen with astonishment the suddenness , continuance , and extent of [his]783-the general attention ; and though latterly , from some hints which had accompanied an almost positive command to [[his]783-the general son]2638-his son of doing everything in [his]783-the general power to attach [her]77-catherine , [Henry]98-henry was convinced of [[his]98-henry father]859-his father s believing it to be an advantageous connection , it was not till the late explanation at [Northanger]63-northanger that [they]109-the allens had the smallest idea of the false calculations which had hurried [him]783-the general on . That they were false , [the general]783-the general had learnt from [the very person who had suggested [them]109-the allens , from [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe [himself]122-mr. thorpe , whom [he]122-mr. thorpe had chanced to meet again in [town]2641-town]2038-the very person who had suggested them , from thorpe himself , whom he had chanced to meet again in town , and who , under the influence of exactly opposite feelings , irritated by [Catherine]77-catherine s refusal , and yet more by the failure of a very recent endeavour to accomplish a reconciliation between [Morland]90-miss morland and [Isabella]106-isabella , convinced that [they]109-the allens were separated forever , and spurning a friendship which could be no longer serviceable , hastened to contradict all that [he]783-the general had said before to the advantage of [the Morlands]79-the morlands confessed [himself]783-the general to have been totally mistaken in [his]783-the general opinion of [their]109-the allens circumstances and character , misled by the rhodomontade of [[his]783-the general friend]557-his friend to believe [[his]783-the general father]859-his father [a man of substance and credit]2042-a man of substance and credit , whereas the transactions of the two or three last weeks proved [him]783-the general to be neither ; for after coming eagerly forward on the first overture of a marriage between [the families]2043-the families , with the most liberal proposals , [he]783-the general had , on being brought to the point by the shrewdness of [the relator]2044-the relator , been constrained to acknowledge [himself]783-the general incapable of giving [the young people]1054-the young people even a decent support . [They]109-the allens were , in fact , [a necessitous family]2046-a necessitous family ; numerous , too , almost beyond example ; by no means respected in [[their]109-the allens own neighbourhood]2047-their own neighbourhood , as [he]783-the general had lately had particular opportunities of discovering ; aiming at a style of life which [their]109-the allens fortune could not warrant ; seeking to better [themselves]109-the allens by wealthy connections ; [a forward , bragging , scheming race]2048-a forward , bragging , scheming race .

[The terrified general]2049-the terrified general pronounced the name of [Allen]89-mr. allen with an inquiring look ; and here too [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe had learnt [his]122-mr. thorpe error . [The Allens]109-the allens , [he]783-the general believed , had lived near [them]109-the allens too long , and [he]783-the general knew [the young man on whom [the Fullerton estate]2051-the fullerton estate]2050-the young man on whom the fullerton estate must devolve . [The general]783-the general needed no more . Enraged with [almost everybody in [the world]197-the world]2053-almost everybody in the world but [himself]783-the general , [he]783-the general set out the next day for [the abbey]3021-the abbey , where [his]783-the general performances have been seen .

[I]0-i leave it to [[my]0-i reader]2056-my reader s sagacity to determine how much of all this it was possible for [Henry]98-henry to communicate at this time to [Catherine]77-catherine , how much of it [he]98-henry could have learnt from [[his]98-henry father]859-his father , in what points [his]98-henry own conjectures might assist [him]98-henry , and what portion must yet remain to be told in a letter from [James]108-james . [I]0-i have united for [their]2058-their ease what [they]2058-their must divide for [mine]0-i . [Catherine]77-catherine , at any rate , heard enough to feel that in suspecting [General Tilney]143-general tilney of either murdering or shutting up [[his]143-general tilney wife]345-his wife , [she]77-catherine had scarcely sinned against [his]143-general tilney character , or magnified [his]143-general tilney cruelty .

[Henry]98-henry , in having such things to relate of [[his]98-henry father]859-his father , was almost as pitiable as in [their]2058-their first avowal to [himself]98-henry . [He]98-henry blushed for the narrow - minded counsel which [he]98-henry was obliged to expose . The conversation between [them]2058-their at [Northanger]63-northanger had been of the most unfriendly kind . [Henry]98-henry s indignation on hearing how [Catherine]77-catherine had been treated , on comprehending [[his]98-henry father]859-his father s views , and being ordered to acquiesce in them , had been open and bold . [The general]783-the general , accustomed on every ordinary occasion to give the law in [[his]783-the general family]430-his family , prepared for no reluctance but of feeling , no opposing desire that should dare to clothe itself in words , could ill brook the opposition of [[his]783-the general son]2638-his son , steady as the sanction of reason and the dictate of conscience could make it . But , in such a cause , [his]783-the general anger , though it must shock , could not intimidate [Henry]98-henry , who was sustained in [his]98-henry purpose by a conviction of its justice . [He]98-henry felt [himself]98-henry bound as much in honour as in affection to [Miss Morland]90-miss morland , and believing that heart to be [his]98-henry own which [he]98-henry had been directed to gain , no unworthy retraction of a tacit consent , no reversing decree of unjustifiable anger , could shake [his]98-henry fidelity , or influence the resolutions it prompted .

[He]98-henry steadily refused to accompany [[his]98-henry father]859-his father into [Herefordshire]75-herefordshire , an engagement formed almost at the moment to promote the dismissal of [Catherine]77-catherine , and as steadily declared [his]98-henry intention of offering [her]77-catherine [his]98-henry hand . [The general]783-the general was furious in [his]783-the general anger , and [they]2067-they parted in dreadful disagreement . [Henry]98-henry , in an agitation of mind which many solitary hours were required to compose , had returned almost instantly to [Woodston]65-woodston , and , on the afternoon of the following day , had begun [his]98-henry journey to [Fullerton]3-fullerton .

CHAPTER 31

[Mr.]2068-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland s surprise on being applied to by [Mr. Tilney]98-henry for [their]2069-their consent to [his]98-henry marrying [[their]2069-their daughter]1114-their daughter was , for a few minutes , considerable , it having never entered [their]2069-their heads to suspect an attachment on either side ; but as nothing , after all , could be more natural than [Catherine]77-catherine s being beloved , [they]2069-their soon learnt to consider it with only the happy agitation of gratified pride , and , as far as [they]2069-their alone were concerned , had not a single objection to start . [His]98-henry pleasing manners and good sense were self - evident recommendations ; and having never heard evil of [him]98-henry , it was not [their]2069-their way to suppose any evil could be told . [Goodwill]185-goodwill supplying the place of experience , [his]98-henry character needed no attestation . " [Catherine]77-catherine would make [a sad , heedless young housekeeper]3380-a sad , heedless young housekeeper to be sure , "[194-her mother] was [[her]77-catherine mother]194-her mother s foreboding remark ; but quick was the consolation of there being nothing like practice .

There was but one obstacle , in short , to be mentioned ; but till that one was removed , it must be impossible for [them]2069-their to sanction the engagement . [Their]2069-their tempers were mild , but [their]2069-their principles were steady , and while [[his]98-henry parent]2072-his parent so expressly forbade the connection , [they]2069-their could not allow [themselves]2069-their to encourage it . That [the general]783-the general should come forward to solicit the alliance , or that [he]783-the general should even very heartily approve it , [they]2069-their were not refined enough to make any parading stipulation ; but the decent appearance of consent must be yielded , and that once obtained and [their]2069-their own hearts made [them]2069-their trust that it could not be very long denied [their]2069-their willing approbation was instantly to follow . [His]98-henry _ consent _ was all that [they]2069-their wished for . [They]2069-their were no more inclined than entitled to demand [his]98-henry _ money _ . Of a very considerable fortune , [[his]98-henry son]2638-his son was , by marriage settlements , eventually secure ; [his]98-henry present income was an income of independence and comfort , and under every pecuniary view , it was a match beyond the claims of [[their]2069-their daughter]1114-their daughter .

[The young people]1054-the young people could not be surprised at a decision like this . [They]1054-the young people felt and [they]1054-the young people deplored but [they]1054-the young people could not resent it ; and [they]1054-the young people parted , endeavouring to hope that such a change in [the general]783-the general , as [each]1677-each believed almost impossible , might speedily take place , to unite [them]1054-the young people again in the fullness of privileged affection . [Henry]98-henry returned to what was now [[his]98-henry only home]2079-his only home , to watch over [[his]98-henry young plantations]2080-his young plantations , and extend [his]98-henry improvements for [her]1114-their daughter sake , to whose share in them [he]98-henry looked anxiously forward ; and [Catherine]77-catherine remained at [Fullerton]3-fullerton to cry . Whether the torments of absence were softened by a clandestine correspondence , let [us]2081-us not inquire . [Mr.]2082-mr. and [Mrs. Morland]82-mrs. morland never did [they]2083-they had been too kind to exact any promise ; and whenever [Catherine]77-catherine received a letter , as , at that time , happened pretty often , [they]2083-they always looked another way .

The anxiety , which in this state of [their]2083-they attachment must be the portion of [Henry]98-henry and [Catherine]77-catherine , and of [all who loved either , as to its final event]2084-all who loved either , as to its final event , can hardly extend , [I]0-i fear , to the bosom of [[my]0-i readers]2085-my readers , who will see in the tell - tale compression of the pages before [them]2085-my readers , that [we]2081-us are all hastening together to perfect felicity . The means by which [their]2083-they early marriage was effected can be the only doubt : what probable circumstance could work upon a temper like [the general]783-the general s ? The circumstance which chiefly availed was the marriage of [[his]98-henry daughter]2444-his daughter with [a man of fortune and consequence]2088-a man of fortune and consequence , which took place in the course of the summer an accession of dignity that threw [him]98-henry into a fit of good humour , from which [he]98-henry did not recover till after [Eleanor]145-eleanor had obtained [his]98-henry forgiveness of [Henry]98-henry , and [his]98-henry permission for [him]98-henry " to be [a fool]2662-a fool if [he]98-henry liked it ! "[98-henry]

The marriage of [Eleanor Tilney]145-eleanor , [her]145-eleanor removal from all the evils of [such a home as [Northanger]63-northanger]2089-such a home as northanger had been made by [Henry]98-henry s banishment , to [the home of [her]145-eleanor choice]2090-the home of her choice and [the man of [her]145-eleanor choice]2091-the man of her choice , is an event which [I]0-i expect to give general satisfaction among all [her]145-eleanor acquaintance . [My]0-i own joy on the occasion is very sincere . [I]0-i know [no one more entitled , by unpretending merit , or better prepared by habitual suffering , to receive and enjoy felicity]2092-no one more entitled , by unpretending merit , or better prepared by habitual suffering , to receive and enjoy felicity . [Her]145-eleanor partiality for [this gentleman]2093-this gentleman was not of recent origin ; and [he]2093-this gentleman had been long withheld only by inferiority of situation from addressing [her]145-eleanor . [His]2093-this gentleman unexpected accession to title and fortune had removed all [his]2093-this gentleman difficulties ; and never had [the general]783-the general loved [[his]783-the general daughter]2444-his daughter so well in all [her]2444-his daughter hours of companionship , utility , and patient endurance as when [he]783-the general first hailed [her]2444-his daughter " [[Your]2444-his daughter Ladyship]3382-your ladyship ! "[783-the general] [[Her]145-eleanor husband]793-her husband was really deserving of [her]145-eleanor ; independent of [his]793-her husband peerage , [his]793-her husband wealth , and [his]793-her husband attachment , being to a precision [the most charming young man in [the world]197-the world]2097-the most charming young man in the world . Any further definition of [his]793-her husband merits must be unnecessary ; [the most charming young man in [the world]197-the world]2097-the most charming young man in the world is instantly before the imagination of [us]2101-us all . Concerning [the one in question]2102-the one in question , therefore , [I]0-i have only to add aware that the rules of composition forbid the introduction of [a character not connected with [my]0-i fable]2103-a character not connected with my fable that this was [the very gentleman whose negligent servant left behind [him]793-her husband that collection of washing - bills , resulting from a long visit at [Northanger]63-northanger , by which [[my]0-i heroine]762-my heroine was involved in one of [her]762-my heroine most alarming adventures]2104-the very gentleman whose negligent servant left behind him that collection of washing - bills , resulting from a long visit at northanger , by which my heroine was involved in one of her most alarming adventures .

The influence of [the viscount and viscountess]2106-the viscount and viscountess in [[their]2106-the viscount and viscountess brother]1684-their brother s behalf was assisted by that right understanding of [Mr. Morland]108-james s circumstances which , as soon as [the general]783-the general would allow [himself]783-the general to be informed , [they]2106-the viscount and viscountess were qualified to give . It taught [him]783-the general that [he]783-the general had been scarcely more misled by [Thorpe]122-mr. thorpe s first boast of the family wealth than by [his]783-the general subsequent malicious overthrow of [it]2109-it ; that in no sense of the word were [they]2106-the viscount and viscountess necessitous or poor , and that [Catherine]77-catherine would have three thousand pounds . This was so material an amendment of [his]783-the general late expectations that it greatly contributed to smooth the descent of [his]783-the general pride ; and by no means without its effect was the private intelligence , which [he]783-the general was at some pains to procure , that [the Fullerton estate]2051-the fullerton estate , being entirely at the disposal of [its present proprietor]2111-its present proprietor , was consequently open to every greedy speculation .

On the strength of this , [the general]783-the general , soon after [Eleanor]145-eleanor s marriage , permitted [[his]783-the general son]2638-his son to return to [Northanger]63-northanger , and thence made [him]2638-his son the bearer of [his]783-the general consent , very courteously worded in a page full of empty professions to [Mr. Morland]108-james . The event which it authorized soon followed : [Henry]98-henry and [Catherine]77-catherine were married , the bells rang , and [everybody]326-everybody smiled ; and , as this took place within a twelvemonth from the first day of [their]2106-the viscount and viscountess meeting , it will not appear , after all the dreadful delays occasioned by [the general]783-the general s cruelty , that [they]2106-the viscount and viscountess were essentially hurt by it . To begin perfect happiness at the respective ages of twenty - six and eighteen is to do pretty well ; and professing [myself]0-i moreover convinced that [the general]783-the general s unjust interference , so far from being really injurious to [their]2106-the viscount and viscountess felicity , was perhaps rather conducive to it , by improving [their]2106-the viscount and viscountess knowledge of [each other]338-each other , and adding strength to [their]2106-the viscount and viscountess attachment , [I]0-i leave it to be settled , by whomsoever it may concern , whether the tendency of this work be altogether to recommend parental tyranny , or reward filial disobedience .
